query: Draft an Operating Agreement for a [state] LLC detailing ownership percentages, voting rights, member roles, capital contributions, and governance structure.

api1.updated_html:
OPERATING AGREEMENT OF [LLC Name], A [State] LIMITED LIABILITY COMPANY

This Operating Agreement (the "Agreement") is made and entered into as of this [Effective Date] (the "Effective Date"), by and among the undersigned individuals, collectively referred to herein as the "Members" or individually as a "Member," who are the initial members of [LLC Name], a limited liability company organized under the laws of the State of [State] (the "Company").

This Agreement is executed to establish the terms and conditions governing the operations, management, and governance of the Company, including but not limited to the respective rights, duties, and obligations of the Members, their ownership percentages, capital contributions, allocations of profits and losses, distributions, voting rights, and procedures for the admission of new members, withdrawal of existing members, and dissolution of the Company, all in accordance with the provisions of the [State] Limited Liability Company Act, [State Statute Citation, e.g., Title 12, Article 2 of the Colorado Revised Statutes] (the "Act").

The Members, by their execution of this Agreement, hereby agree to be bound by its terms and conditions, superseding any prior agreements or understandings, whether written or oral, relating to the subject matter hereof, and acknowledge that this Agreement constitutes the sole and entire agreement among them with respect to the Company.

1. Definitions

For the purposes of this Operating Agreement, the following terms shall have the meanings ascribed to them below, unless the context clearly indicates otherwise:

"Act" shall mean the [State] Limited Liability Company Act, as amended from time to time, or any successor statute thereto.

"Agreement" or "Operating Agreement" shall mean this Operating Agreement, as originally executed and as it may be amended, restated, or supplemented from time to time.

"Capital Account" shall mean, with respect to each Member, an account maintained in accordance with the provisions of Section 704(b) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended, and the Treasury Regulations promulgated thereunder. Each Member's Capital Account shall be credited with the amount of money and the fair market value of any property contributed by such Member to the Company, and debited by the amount of money and the fair market value of any property distributed to such Member by the Company, and further adjusted for allocations of profits, losses, income, gain, deductions, and credits as provided herein.

"Capital Contribution" shall mean any cash, property, or services contributed by a Member to the Company as set forth in Schedule A, or any additional contributions made by a Member pursuant to the terms of this Agreement.

"Company" or "LLC" shall mean [LLC Name], a limited liability company organized and existing under the laws of the State of [State].

"Distributions" shall mean cash or other property distributed by the Company to its Members in their capacity as Members, including distributions of Net Cash Flow, liquidation proceeds, and other distributions as provided in this Agreement.

"Member" or "Members" shall mean each Person executing this Agreement as a Member, and any other Person who may hereafter be admitted as a Member of the Company in accordance with the terms of this Agreement and the Act, each in their capacity as a member of the Company.

2. Formation and Duration

2.1. Formation. The Company, [LLC Name], was duly formed as a limited liability company under the provisions of the [State] Limited Liability Company Act (the “Act”), by the filing of its Articles of Organization with the Secretary of State of [State] on [Formation Date]. This Operating Agreement (the “Agreement”) is entered into by and among the Members identified herein, effective as of [Effective Date] (the “Effective Date”), and supersedes all prior agreements and understandings, whether written or oral, relating to the Company.

2.2. Name. The name of the Company is [LLC Name]. The Company may conduct business under other names as permitted by applicable law and approved by the Members in accordance with this Agreement.

2.3. Principal Office. The principal office of the Company shall be located at [Principal Office Address], or such other location as the Members may determine from time to time.

2.4. Duration. The Company shall have perpetual existence unless sooner dissolved and terminated in accordance with the provisions of Article [X. Dissolution] of this Agreement or as otherwise provided by the Act. The existence of the Company as a legal entity shall continue until cancellation of its Articles of Organization in accordance with the Act.

3. Members and Membership Interests

The initial Members of [LLC Name] (the "Company") and their respective Membership Interests, expressed as a percentage of the total ownership of the Company, are set forth in Exhibit A attached hereto and incorporated herein by reference. Each Member's Membership Interest represents their undivided share of the capital, profits, losses, and distributions of the Company, as well as their voting rights and other rights and obligations as specified in this Operating Agreement. The aggregate Membership Interests of all Members shall at all times equal one hundred percent (100%).

Membership Interests shall be deemed personal property for all purposes and shall not entitle any Member to any right to partition or severance of any Company property. No Member shall have the right to demand or receive any distribution in kind from the Company. The admission of any new Member or the transfer of any Membership Interest shall be strictly governed by the provisions of Article [Relevant Article Number, e.g., 8] of this Agreement, and any purported admission or transfer not in compliance therewith shall be null and void.

The Company shall maintain an accurate record of all Members and their respective Membership Interests, which record shall be updated promptly upon any change in membership or ownership percentages in accordance with the terms of this Agreement. This record, along with Exhibit A, shall constitute the definitive statement of the Members' ownership in the Company.

4. Capital Contributions

Each Member shall contribute to the capital of [LLC Name] the amount of cash, property, or services as set forth opposite their name in Exhibit A, "Schedule of Members and Capital Contributions," attached hereto and incorporated by reference. The value assigned to any non-cash contribution shall be the fair market value as agreed upon by all Members at the time of contribution. These initial contributions shall be deemed fully paid and non-assessable as of the [Effective Date].

Except as expressly provided in this Operating Agreement, no Member shall be required to make any additional capital contributions to [LLC Name] beyond their initial contribution. No Member shall have any personal liability for the debts, obligations, or liabilities of [LLC Name] solely by reason of being a Member, except to the extent of their capital contributions and any distributions wrongfully received.

Should the Members unanimously determine that additional capital is required for the operations or expansion of [LLC Name], they may, by a unanimous vote of all Members, call for additional capital contributions. Any such call shall specify the amount required, the purpose, and the terms and conditions for such contributions. Members shall have the right, but not the obligation, to contribute their pro rata share of such additional capital based on their then-current Percentage Interests.

If any Member fails to contribute their pro rata share of an authorized additional capital contribution, the other Members may elect to contribute the deficit amount. In such an event, the Percentage Interests of the Members shall be recomputed to reflect the new capital contributions, and the Percentage Interest of the non-contributing Member shall be diluted accordingly, in a manner that equitably reflects the new capital structure, or as otherwise agreed upon by the contributing Members.

No Member shall be entitled to the return of their capital contributions, nor to interest on their capital contributions, except upon the dissolution and winding up of [LLC Name] or as otherwise expressly provided in this Operating Agreement. The capital accounts of the Members shall be maintained in accordance with Treasury Regulations Section 1.704-1(b)(2)(iv).

5. Allocations and Distributions

5.1. **Allocation of Net Profits and Net Losses.** For federal income tax purposes and for purposes of maintaining the Capital Accounts of the Members, Net Profits and Net Losses of the Company for each fiscal year shall be allocated among the Members pro rata in proportion to their respective Percentage Interests. All allocations shall be made in accordance with Section 704(b) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (the "Code"), and the Treasury Regulations promulgated thereunder, including, without limitation, the "minimum gain chargeback" and "qualified income offset" provisions thereof.

5.2. **Maintenance of Capital Accounts.** A separate Capital Account shall be maintained for each Member in accordance with Treasury Regulation Section 1.704-1(b)(2)(iv). Each Member's Capital Account shall be increased by (a) the amount of money contributed by such Member to the Company, (b) the fair market value of property contributed by such Member to the Company (net of liabilities assumed or taken subject to by the Company), and (c) allocations of Net Profits and other items of income and gain to such Member. Each Member's Capital Account shall be decreased by (x) the amount of money distributed to such Member by the Company, (y) the fair market value of property distributed to such Member by the Company (net of liabilities assumed or taken subject to by such Member), and (z) allocations of Net Losses and other items of deduction and loss to such Member.

5.3. **Distributions of Distributable Cash.** Subject to the provisions of Section 5.4 and any limitations imposed by applicable law, the Manager shall, from time to time, but not less frequently than quarterly, distribute to the Members all "Distributable Cash" (as defined below) in proportion to their respective Percentage Interests. "Distributable Cash" shall mean all cash funds of the Company, from whatever source derived, in excess of the amount determined by the Manager to be necessary for the payment of all current and anticipated Company expenses, including, without limitation, operating expenses, debt service, capital expenditures, and reasonable reserves for future operations and contingencies.

5.4. **Tax Distributions.** Notwithstanding any other provision of this Agreement, to the extent the Company has taxable income, the Company shall make mandatory distributions to each Member sufficient to cover such Member's federal, state, and local income tax liabilities attributable to the Member's share of the Company's taxable income. Such distributions shall be made no later than [Ten (10) Days] prior to the due date for estimated tax payments for individuals and corporations, or such other date as is necessary to ensure Members have funds to pay their tax obligations. The amount of such tax distributions shall be calculated based on the highest combined marginal federal, [State], and local income tax rates applicable to an individual or corporate resident of [State], taking into account the character of the income (e.g., ordinary income, capital gains), and shall be treated as an advance against future distributions of Distributable Cash.

6. Management Structure and Member Roles

The Company shall be a Member-Managed Limited Liability Company. Subject to the specific provisions of this Operating Agreement, all Members shall have the right to participate in the management and control of the Company's business and affairs. Each Member shall have the authority to bind the Company in matters pertaining to the ordinary course of its business, provided such actions are consistent with the terms of this Agreement and any resolutions duly adopted by the Members.

Notwithstanding the general Member-management structure, certain Members may be assigned specific functional roles or responsibilities to facilitate the efficient operation of the Company. For instance, [Member A] may be designated as the "Managing Member," primarily responsible for overseeing the Company's financial administration, banking relationships, and compliance with regulatory requirements. Similarly, [Member B] may be designated as the "Operations Lead," responsible for day-to-day operational management, client relations, and project execution. The specific duties and scope of authority for any such designated role shall be defined by a separate written resolution or addendum approved by a [Majority/Unanimous] vote of all Members.

No single Member, regardless of any designated role, shall have the authority to incur debt exceeding [Amount in USD], sell or encumber substantially all of the Company's assets, or enter into any contract or agreement outside the ordinary course of business without the prior written consent of a [Supermajority/All] of the Members. All Members, in their capacity as managers, shall owe fiduciary duties of loyalty and care to the Company and its Members, requiring them to act in good faith and in the best interests of the Company.

7. Voting Rights and Member Meetings

Unless otherwise expressly provided in this Operating Agreement, each Member shall be entitled to one vote for each one percent (1%) of Percentage Interest held by such Member in the Company. All decisions of the Members regarding the ordinary course of business of the Company shall require the affirmative vote of Members holding a simple majority of the Percentage Interests. However, certain extraordinary actions, including but not limited to, amending this Operating Agreement, dissolving the Company, admitting new Members, or selling all or substantially all of the Company's assets, shall require the affirmative vote of Members holding at least two-thirds (2/3) of the Percentage Interests.

An annual meeting of the Members shall be held on or about [Date of Annual Meeting] of each year, or at such other time as may be agreed upon by the Members, for the purpose of reviewing the Company's performance and addressing any other matters requiring Member approval. Special meetings of the Members may be called by any Member holding at least twenty-five percent (25%) of the Percentage Interests, upon not less than ten (10) nor more than sixty (60) days' prior written notice to all other Members, stating the purpose or purposes for which the meeting is called.

A quorum for any meeting of the Members shall consist of Members holding at least a majority of the Percentage Interests. If a quorum is not present at any meeting, the meeting may be adjourned from time to time by the Members present, and no further notice of the adjourned meeting need be given other than by announcement at the meeting. Any action required or permitted to be taken at a meeting of the Members may be taken without a meeting if a consent in writing, setting forth the action so taken, is signed by all of the Members entitled to vote with respect to the subject matter thereof. Such written consent shall have the same force and effect as a unanimous vote of the Members.

8. Transfers of Membership Interests

8.1. General Restriction. No Member shall sell, assign, transfer, encumber, or otherwise dispose of all or any part of their Membership Interest in [LLC Name] (hereinafter, "Membership Interest") to any Person (as defined herein) without the express prior written consent of all other Members, or a supermajority of Members holding at least [Percentage]% of the aggregate Membership Interests, as determined by a vote in accordance with Section [Voting Rights Section Number] of this Agreement, except as expressly provided otherwise in this Section 8. Any purported transfer in violation of this Section 8 shall be null and void ab initio and shall not be recognized by [LLC Name] or its Members.

8.2. Right of First Refusal. Before any Member (the "Transferring Member") may sell, assign, or otherwise transfer their Membership Interest to a third party (a "Proposed Transferee"), the Transferring Member shall first offer such Membership Interest to [LLC Name] and then, if declined by the LLC, to the remaining Members (the "Non-Transferring Members") on the same terms and conditions as offered to the Proposed Transferee. The Transferring Member shall provide written notice (the "Transfer Notice") to the LLC and all Non-Transferring Members, specifying in detail the terms, conditions, and identity of the Proposed Transferee. The LLC shall have [Number] days from receipt of the Transfer Notice to elect to purchase all, but not less than all, of the Membership Interest. If the LLC declines or fails to exercise its option within said period, the Non-Transferring Members shall have an additional [Number] days to collectively or individually elect to purchase all, but not less than all, of the Membership Interest on the same terms. Any purchase hereunder shall be completed within [Number] days of the exercise of the option, with payment in cash or other mutually agreed-upon consideration.

8.3. Conditions to Permitted Transfer. Any permitted transfer of a Membership Interest, whether pursuant to Section 8.2 or otherwise, shall be subject to the following conditions precedent: (a) the Proposed Transferee shall execute a joinder agreement, in a form satisfactory to [LLC Name], agreeing to be bound by all terms and conditions of this Operating Agreement, as if an original signatory hereto; (b) the Transferring Member shall provide an opinion of counsel, satisfactory in form and substance to the Non-Transferring Members, confirming that such transfer will not violate any applicable federal or [State] securities laws; and (c) the transfer shall not cause [LLC Name] to be treated as a "publicly traded partnership" within the meaning of Section 7704 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended. The Transferring Member shall bear all costs and expenses associated with satisfying these conditions.

8.4. Permitted Exceptions. Notwithstanding the foregoing restrictions, a Member may transfer all or a portion of their Membership Interest to (a) an immediate family member (spouse, child, parent, sibling), (b) a trust established solely for the benefit of the Member or immediate family members, or (c) an entity wholly owned by the Member or immediate family members, provided that in each such instance, the transferee agrees in writing to be bound by all provisions of this Agreement and the transfer is for bona fide estate planning purposes and not for value. Such transfers shall require prior written notice to the LLC and Non-Transferring Members but shall not be subject to the Right of First Refusal in Section 8.2, though they remain subject to the conditions of Section 8.3(a) and (c).

8.5. Indemnification. The Transferring Member shall indemnify and hold harmless [LLC Name] and the Non-Transferring Members from and against any and all costs, damages, liabilities, and expenses, including reasonable attorneys' fees, incurred as a result of any transfer or purported transfer of a Membership Interest not in strict compliance with the terms of this Section 8, or as a result of any breach by the Transferring Member of their obligations hereunder.

9. Confidentiality

Each Member acknowledges that during the course of their involvement with [LLC Name], they may obtain or have access to confidential, proprietary, and trade secret information concerning the business, operations, finances, strategies, customers, and other Members of [LLC Name] (collectively, "Confidential Information"). Confidential Information shall include, but not be limited to, financial statements, business plans, marketing strategies, customer lists, vendor information, operational procedures, intellectual property, and any other non-public information, whether written, oral, or electronic, that is designated as confidential or would reasonably be understood to be confidential given the nature of the information and the circumstances of disclosure. Each Member agrees to hold all Confidential Information in strict confidence and shall not, directly or indirectly, disclose, publish, or disseminate any Confidential Information to any third party, nor use any Confidential Information for any purpose other than for the benefit of [LLC Name] or as specifically authorized by this Agreement or by the unanimous written consent of the Members. This obligation of confidentiality shall survive the withdrawal or termination of a Member's interest in [LLC Name] and shall remain in full force and effect indefinitely. The foregoing obligations shall not apply to information that (a) is or becomes publicly known through no fault of the receiving Member, (b) is rightfully received by the receiving Member from a third party without restriction on disclosure, (c) is independently developed by the receiving Member without use of or reference to the Confidential Information, or (d) is required to be disclosed by law, regulation, or court order, provided that the disclosing Member provides prompt notice to [LLC Name] to allow for protective measures.

10. Intellectual Property

The Limited Liability Company (the "LLC") shall be the sole and exclusive owner of all intellectual property (IP) developed, conceived, created, or acquired by the LLC, its Members, managers, employees, or agents in the course of the LLC's business or with the use of the LLC's resources, including but not limited to, patents, copyrights, trademarks, trade secrets, designs, software, business methods, and know-how. Each Member hereby irrevocably assigns, and agrees to assign, to [LLC Name] all right, title, and interest in and to any and all IP created, developed, or conceived by such Member, either individually or jointly with others, within the scope of their duties or engagement with the LLC, or that relates to the business of the LLC, during the term of their membership or engagement with the LLC.

Members shall promptly disclose to the LLC any such IP and execute all documents and take all actions reasonably requested by the LLC to perfect the LLC's ownership of such IP. Members further agree that any pre-existing IP contributed by a Member to the LLC's operations shall be deemed licensed to the LLC on a perpetual, irrevocable, worldwide, royalty-free, sublicensable, and transferable basis for the purpose of conducting the LLC's business, unless otherwise expressly agreed in writing between the contributing Member and the LLC. This provision shall survive the termination of any Member's association with the LLC. Members shall not use the LLC's IP for any purpose other than for the benefit of the LLC, nor shall they disclose any confidential or proprietary information of the LLC to any third party without prior written consent of the Managers or a majority of the Members, as applicable.

11. Warranties

Each Member hereby represents, warrants, and covenants to the Company and to each other Member, as of the [Effective Date] and continuously thereafter for the duration of their membership, that:

(a) Such Member has the full power, authority, and legal capacity to execute and deliver this Operating Agreement and to perform all of its obligations hereunder. This Operating Agreement constitutes a valid and legally binding obligation of such Member, enforceable against such Member in accordance with its terms, except as enforceability may be limited by applicable bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization, moratorium, or other similar laws affecting creditors' rights generally, and by general principles of equity.

(b) The execution, delivery, and performance by such Member of this Operating Agreement do not and will not violate, conflict with, or result in a breach of any provision of, or constitute a default under, any agreement, instrument, judgment, order, decree, or other restriction to which such Member is a party or by which such Member is bound, nor will it violate any law, rule, or regulation applicable to such Member.

(c) All information, including but not limited to financial and personal information, provided by such Member to the Company or other Members in connection with the formation of the Company, the execution of this Operating Agreement, or any subsequent capital contribution or transaction, is true, accurate, and complete in all material respects and does not omit any material fact necessary to make the statements made not misleading.

(d) Such Member is not insolvent and has not filed, nor is subject to, any bankruptcy, reorganization, receivership, or similar proceeding under any federal or state law, and no such proceeding is pending or, to the best of such Member's knowledge, threatened against such Member.

(e) If such Member is an entity, it is duly organized, validly existing, and in good standing under the laws of its jurisdiction of organization, and has all necessary corporate or other organizational power and authority to own its properties and to carry on its business as now conducted.

12. Indemnification

To the fullest extent permitted by the laws of the State of [State], [LLC Name] (the "Company") shall indemnify and hold harmless each Member, Manager, Officer, employee, and agent of the Company (each, an "Indemnified Party") from and against any and all losses, damages, liabilities, costs, expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees), judgments, fines, and amounts paid in settlement actually and reasonably incurred by such Indemnified Party in connection with any threatened, pending, or completed action, suit, or proceeding, whether civil, criminal, administrative, or investigative, arising from any act or omission performed or omitted by such Indemnified Party in good faith and in a manner reasonably believed to be in the best interests of the Company, and within the scope of the authority conferred by this Operating Agreement.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, no Indemnified Party shall be indemnified for any losses, damages, liabilities, costs, or expenses arising from such Indemnified Party's gross negligence, willful misconduct, fraud, or material breach of any provision of this Operating Agreement or any fiduciary duty owed to the Company or its Members. The Company may, in its sole discretion, advance expenses incurred by an Indemnified Party in defending any such action, suit, or proceeding, provided that such Indemnified Party undertakes to repay such advances if it is ultimately determined that the Indemnified Party is not entitled to indemnification.

The rights to indemnification and advancement of expenses provided herein shall not be deemed exclusive of any other rights to which any Indemnified Party may be entitled under any statute, agreement, vote of Members, or otherwise, and shall continue as to an Indemnified Party who has ceased to be a Member, Manager, Officer, employee, or agent and shall inure to the benefit of the heirs, executors, and administrators of such a person.

13. Limitation of Liability

To the fullest extent permitted by the [State] Revised Uniform Limited Liability Company Act, as amended from time to time, and any other applicable law, no Member or Manager of [LLC Name] shall be liable to the Company or to any other Member for any loss, damage, or claim incurred by reason of any act or omission performed or omitted by such Member or Manager in good faith on behalf of the Company and in a manner reasonably believed to be within the scope of authority conferred by this Operating Agreement, except for any such loss, damage, or claim arising out of the Member's or Manager's gross negligence, willful misconduct, fraud, or a knowing violation of law. This limitation of liability shall not affect the liability of any Member or Manager for their own capital contributions or for the return of distributions made in violation of applicable law. All debts, obligations, and liabilities of the Company, whether arising in contract, tort, or otherwise, shall be solely the debts, obligations, and liabilities of the Company, and no Member or Manager shall be obligated personally for any such debt, obligation, or liability of the Company solely by reason of being a Member or Manager of the Company.

14. Dissolution and Liquidation

Upon the occurrence of any event causing the dissolution of [LLC Name] as provided by the [State] Revised Uniform Limited Liability Company Act, as amended (the "Act"), or as otherwise expressly agreed upon by the Members in writing, the business of [LLC Name] shall be wound up and liquidated. Such events of dissolution shall include, but not be limited to, the unanimous written consent of all Members, the entry of a judicial decree of dissolution, or the occurrence of any other event specified in the Act as requiring the dissolution of a limited liability company.

Upon dissolution, the Members shall immediately proceed to wind up the affairs of [LLC Name]. A liquidating trustee, who may be one or more of the Members or a third party appointed by the affirmative vote of Members holding a majority of the then-current Percentage Interests, shall be appointed to oversee the liquidation process. The liquidating trustee shall be responsible for collecting all assets of [LLC Name], paying or making provision for the payment of all debts and liabilities of [LLC Name], and distributing the remaining assets in the following order of priority:

  1. First, to creditors of [LLC Name], including Members who are creditors, to the extent permitted by law, in satisfaction of liabilities of [LLC Name], whether by payment or by establishment of reserves, other than liabilities for distributions to Members.
  2. Second, to Members for the return of their Capital Contributions, pro rata in accordance with their respective unreturned Capital Contributions.
  3. Third, to Members in proportion to their respective Percentage Interests.

The winding up shall be completed as soon as reasonably practicable. In no event shall any Member be personally liable for the debts or obligations of [LLC Name] during or after the liquidation process, except to the extent of their Capital Contributions and any undistributed profits. The provisions of this Section 14 shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of [State], specifically the Act.

15. Governing Law

This Operating Agreement and all rights and obligations of the Members and the Company hereunder shall be governed by, construed, and enforced in accordance with the internal laws of the State of [State of Formation], without regard to its conflict of laws principles that would require the application of the laws of a different jurisdiction. The parties hereto irrevocably consent to the exclusive jurisdiction and venue of the state and federal courts located in [County, State of Formation] for any action, suit, or proceeding arising out of or relating to this Agreement. Each party waives any objection to the laying of venue of any such action, suit, or proceeding in such courts and irrevocably waives any right to plead or claim that any such action, suit, or proceeding brought in any such court has been brought in an inconvenient forum.

16. Dispute Resolution

Any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Operating Agreement, including without limitation the formation, interpretation, breach, termination, or validity thereof, or the relationships established hereunder, shall first be subject to good faith negotiation between the Members involved for a period of not less than thirty (30) days from the date one Member provides written notice of the dispute to the other(s). If the dispute cannot be resolved through negotiation, the Members agree to submit the dispute to non-binding mediation administered by a mutually agreed-upon mediator or, failing agreement, by a reputable mediation service in [State], in accordance with its then-current Commercial Mediation Procedures. The costs of mediation shall be borne equally by the Members involved in the dispute.

If the dispute is not resolved through mediation within sixty (60) days after the commencement of mediation, or such other period as the Members may agree in writing, the dispute shall be finally and exclusively resolved by binding arbitration administered by the American Arbitration Association ("AAA") in accordance with its Commercial Arbitration Rules, and judgment on the award rendered by the arbitrator(s) may be entered in any court having jurisdiction thereof. The arbitration shall be conducted by a single arbitrator, unless the amount in controversy exceeds [Threshold Amount, e.g., $1,000,000], in which case three (3) arbitrators shall be appointed. The seat of the arbitration shall be [City, State], and the language of the arbitration shall be English. The arbitrator(s) shall have the authority to grant any remedy or relief that a court in [State] could grant, including, but not limited to, injunctive relief and specific performance. The prevailing party in any arbitration or other legal proceeding arising out of this Agreement shall be entitled to recover its reasonable attorneys' fees and costs.

Signatures

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the undersigned Members, intending to be legally bound, have executed this Operating Agreement as of the Effective Date first written above, thereby acknowledging their full understanding, acceptance, and agreement to all terms, conditions, rights, and obligations set forth herein. Each signatory represents and warrants that they have the full legal capacity and authority to enter into this Agreement and bind themselves to its terms.

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have executed this Operating Agreement on the dates set forth below:

FOR [LLC Name], a [State] Limited Liability Company:

_________________________________________
By: [Printed Name of Authorized Signatory]
Title: [Title of Authorized Signatory, e.g., Managing Member]
Date: ___________________________________

MEMBERS:

_________________________________________
[Printed Name of Member 1]
Title: Member
Date: ___________________________________

_________________________________________
[Printed Name of Member 2]
Title: Member
Date: ___________________________________

_________________________________________
[Printed Name of Member 3]
Title: Member
Date: ___________________________________

[Add additional signature blocks as necessary for all Members]

api2.updated_html:
OPERATING AGREEMENT OF [LLC NAME], LLC

This Operating Agreement (this "Agreement") of [LLC NAME], LLC (the "Company") is entered into as of this [Day] day of [Month], [Year], by and among the undersigned individuals, who are the initial Members of the Company (collectively, the "Members" and individually, a "Member"). This Agreement sets forth the rights, duties, and obligations of the Members concerning the Company's business and affairs, including but not limited to, the management, operation, and dissolution of the Company, as well as the respective ownership interests and financial rights of each Member.

The Company was formed as a limited liability company under the laws of the State of [State] by the filing of its Articles of Organization with the [State] Secretary of State on [Date of Filing]. This Agreement is intended to govern the internal affairs of the Company and the conduct of its business, superseding any prior agreements or understandings, whether written or oral, relating to the Company. All Members hereby agree to be bound by the terms and conditions set forth herein, acknowledging their full understanding of the implications of this legally binding document.

ARTICLE I: DEFINITIONS

For purposes of this Agreement, the following terms shall have the meanings set forth below, unless the context clearly indicates otherwise. "Capital Contribution" means the total amount of cash, property, or services contributed by a Member to the Company as set forth in Article III. "Company" means [LLC NAME], LLC, a limited liability company organized under the laws of the State of [State]. "Manager" means a person or persons designated by the Members to manage the Company's business and affairs, if the Company is manager-managed. "Member" means each person or entity who is a signatory to this Agreement or who is hereafter admitted as a member of the Company in accordance with the terms hereof. "Membership Interest" means a Member's share of the profits and losses of the Company and the right to receive distributions of the Company's assets, as well as the right to vote on matters as provided herein. "Operating Agreement" means this document, as it may be amended from time to time.

These definitions are crucial for interpreting the rights and obligations detailed throughout this Agreement, ensuring clarity and consistency in its application. Any term not specifically defined herein shall be interpreted in accordance with the applicable provisions of the [State] Limited Liability Company Act, as amended from time to time. The consistent application of these defined terms is essential for the proper governance and operation of the Company, preventing ambiguity in legal and financial matters.

ARTICLE II: FORMATION AND PURPOSE

The Company was organized on [Date of Filing] by filing Articles of Organization with the Secretary of State of the State of [State] pursuant to the [State] Limited Liability Company Act. The name of the Company is [LLC NAME], LLC, and its principal place of business shall be located at [Company Address] or such other location as the Members may determine from time to time. The registered agent for service of process is [Registered Agent Name] located at [Registered Agent Address].

The purpose of the Company is to engage in [Describe Business Purpose, e.g., "any lawful act or activity for which a limited liability company may be organized under the laws of the State of [State], including but not limited to [Specific Business Activities, e.g., real estate investment, software development, consulting services]"]. The Company shall have all powers necessary or convenient to effectuate its purposes, including the power to acquire, own, and dispose of real and personal property, enter into contracts, and incur indebtedness, all in furtherance of its stated business objectives.

ARTICLE III: CAPITAL CONTRIBUTIONS

Each Member shall make an initial Capital Contribution to the Company as set forth in Schedule A attached hereto, which Schedule A shall be incorporated herein by reference. Such contributions may consist of cash, property, or services, as agreed upon by all Members. The fair market value of any non-cash contribution shall be determined by mutual agreement of all Members at the time of contribution, and such valuation shall be binding upon all Members for purposes of this Agreement.

No Member shall be required to make any additional Capital Contributions to the Company beyond their initial contribution, unless otherwise agreed upon in writing by all Members. In the event additional Capital Contributions are deemed necessary for the Company's operations, the Members shall vote on such necessity, and any approved additional contributions shall be made pro rata based on each Member's then-current Membership Interest, unless otherwise unanimously agreed. Failure of a Member to make an approved additional Capital Contribution may result in dilution of their Membership Interest or other remedies as determined by the non-defaulting Members.

ARTICLE IV: MEMBERSHIP INTERESTS AND OWNERSHIP PERCENTAGES

Each Member's Membership Interest in the Company shall be expressed as a percentage, representing their share of the Company's profits, losses, and distributions. The initial Membership Interests of the Members shall be as set forth in Schedule A. These percentages shall be adjusted periodically to reflect any additional Capital Contributions, withdrawals, or transfers of Membership Interests made in accordance with this Agreement, ensuring that the aggregate of all Membership Interests always equals one hundred percent (100%).

The allocation of profits and losses for tax purposes shall be made in proportion to each Member's Membership Interest, unless otherwise required by applicable tax laws or regulations. Any adjustments to a Member's Capital Account, whether due to contributions, distributions, or allocations of profits and losses, shall be maintained in accordance with Treasury Regulations Section 1.704-1(b)(2)(iv). No Member shall have the right to demand or receive property other than cash in return for their Capital Contribution, except as specifically provided in this Agreement.

ARTICLE V: DISTRIBUTIONS

Distributions of the Company's available cash or other assets shall be made to the Members at such times and in such amounts as the Members or Manager(s) may determine, subject to the availability of funds and the Company's financial obligations. All distributions shall be made to the Members pro rata in accordance with their respective Membership Interests, unless otherwise unanimously agreed upon by all Members. No distribution shall be made if, after giving effect to the distribution, the Company would not be able to pay its debts as they become due in the usual course of business, or the Company's total assets would be less than the sum of its total liabilities.

The Members acknowledge that the timing and amount of distributions are discretionary and dependent on the Company's financial performance, cash flow, and strategic needs. The Company shall maintain appropriate reserves for working capital, contingencies, and future business expansion as deemed necessary by the Members or Manager(s). Any amounts withheld from distribution for such purposes shall be clearly documented and communicated to all Members, ensuring transparency in financial management.

ARTICLE VI: MANAGEMENT AND GOVERNANCE

The Company shall be [Member-managed / Manager-managed]. If Member-managed, all Members shall have the authority to participate in the management and control of the Company's business and affairs. If Manager-managed, the Company shall be managed by one or more Managers, who may or may not be Members, as elected by the Members. The initial Manager(s) shall be [Name(s) of Manager(s)], who shall serve until their successors are elected or appointed.

Decisions regarding the ordinary course of business shall require the approval of a [Simple Majority / Supermajority / All] of the Membership Interests. Major decisions, including but not limited to, amendments to this Agreement, admission of new Members, dissolution of the Company, sale of all or substantially all of the Company's assets, or incurring indebtedness above [Threshold Amount], shall require the unanimous written consent of all Members. Regular meetings of the Members/Managers shall be held at least [Frequency, e.g., quarterly], with proper notice given to all participants, to discuss the Company's operations, financial performance, and future strategies.

ARTICLE VII: INDEMNIFICATION

To the fullest extent permitted by the laws of the State of [State], the Company shall indemnify and hold harmless each Member, Manager, officer, or employee (each, an "Indemnified Party") from and against any and all claims, demands, liabilities, costs, expenses, damages, and losses (including reasonable attorneys' fees and expenses) incurred by such Indemnified Party by reason of any act or omission performed or omitted by such Indemnified Party in good faith and in a manner reasonably believed to be within the scope of authority conferred by this Agreement, provided such act or omission does not constitute gross negligence, willful misconduct, or a knowing violation of law.

The right to indemnification provided herein shall include the right to be paid by the Company the expenses incurred in defending any proceeding in advance of its final disposition, provided that the Indemnified Party undertakes to repay such amount if it is ultimately determined that the Indemnified Party is not entitled to be indemnified by the Company. This indemnification shall not be exclusive of any other rights to which an Indemnified Party may be entitled under any statute, agreement, or otherwise, and shall continue as to an Indemnified Party who has ceased to be a Member, Manager, officer, or employee.

ARTICLE VIII: CONFIDENTIALITY

Each Member acknowledges that during the course of their involvement with the Company, they may acquire or have access to confidential and proprietary information concerning the Company's business, operations, financial affairs, trade secrets, customer lists, and strategic plans (collectively, "Confidential Information"). Each Member agrees to hold all Confidential Information in strict confidence and not to disclose, disseminate, or use such information for any purpose other than for the benefit of the Company, without the prior written consent of the Company.

This confidentiality obligation shall survive the termination of a Member's association with the Company for a period of [Number] years following such termination. Excluded from "Confidential Information" is information that is generally available to the public, becomes known to a Member from a third party not bound by a confidentiality agreement, or is required to be disclosed by law. In the event of a breach or threatened breach of this Article, the Company shall be entitled to seek injunctive relief, in addition to any other remedies available at law or in equity, without the necessity of posting a bond.

ARTICLE IX: INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY

All intellectual property, including but not limited to, patents, trademarks, copyrights, trade secrets, and proprietary information, developed, conceived, or reduced to practice by any Member or employee in the course of their duties for the Company or with the use of Company resources, shall be the sole and exclusive property of the Company. Each Member agrees to promptly disclose to the Company any such intellectual property and to execute any and all documents necessary to assign full ownership rights to the Company.

In the event any Member contributes existing intellectual property to the Company as part of their Capital Contribution or otherwise, such Member warrants that they have all necessary rights to grant the Company a perpetual, irrevocable, worldwide, royalty-free, non-exclusive license (or assignment, as applicable) to use, reproduce, modify, distribute, and sublicense such intellectual property for the Company's business purposes. The Members further agree to cooperate fully with the Company in obtaining and enforcing any intellectual property rights worldwide.

ARTICLE X: LIMITATION OF LIABILITY

The liability of each Member for the debts, obligations, or liabilities of the Company shall be limited solely to the amount of their Capital Contribution and their share of any undistributed profits, as provided by the [State] Limited Liability Company Act. No Member shall be personally liable for any debts, obligations, or liabilities of the Company beyond their Capital Contribution, except as expressly provided by law or as otherwise agreed in writing by such Member.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, nothing in this Agreement shall protect any Member from liability for their own gross negligence, willful misconduct, fraud, or breach of fiduciary duty. This limitation of liability is intended to afford the Members the maximum protection available under the laws of the State of [State] for limited liability companies, ensuring that their personal assets are shielded from the Company's obligations.

ARTICLE XI: TERMINATION

The Company shall have perpetual existence unless dissolved earlier in accordance with the provisions of this Article. The Company shall be dissolved upon the unanimous written consent of all Members, or upon the occurrence of any event that makes it unlawful or impossible to carry on the business of the Company as determined by a court of competent jurisdiction. The death, resignation, expulsion, bankruptcy, or dissolution of any Member shall not, in and of itself, cause the dissolution of the Company, and the Company shall continue its existence unless otherwise determined by the remaining Members.

Upon dissolution, the Company shall immediately commence winding up its affairs. The assets of the Company shall be liquidated, and the proceeds shall be applied and distributed in the following order: (a) to the payment of all debts and liabilities of the Company, including expenses of liquidation; (b) to the establishment of any reserves deemed necessary by the Members for contingent liabilities; and (c) to the Members in proportion to their positive Capital Account balances, after taking into account all allocations and distributions. A final statement of account shall be prepared and furnished to all Members.

ARTICLE XII: GOVERNING LAW AND DISPUTE RESOLUTION

This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the internal laws of the State of [State], without regard to its conflict of laws principles. Any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement, or the breach, termination, or validity thereof, shall first be subjected to good faith negotiation between the parties involved. If the dispute cannot be resolved through negotiation within [Number] days, the parties agree to attempt to resolve the dispute through mediation.

Should mediation fail to resolve the dispute within [Number] days of the first mediation session, then the dispute shall be submitted to binding arbitration in [City, State] in accordance with the rules of the American Arbitration Association then in effect. The arbitration award shall be final and binding upon the parties, and judgment thereon may be entered in any court having jurisdiction thereof. Each party shall bear its own costs and attorneys' fees in connection with any such arbitration, unless the arbitrator determines otherwise.

ARTICLE XIII: MISCELLANEOUS PROVISIONS

**13.1 Entire Agreement.** This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement among the Members with respect to the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior agreements and understandings, both written and oral, between the Members with respect to such subject matter. No oral representations, inducements, promises, or agreements, or otherwise, between the Members not embodied herein, shall be of any force or effect.

**13.2 Amendments.** This Agreement may be amended or modified only by a written instrument executed by all Members. Any amendment or modification must clearly state the intention to amend this Agreement and be signed by all parties to be legally binding. No waiver of any provision of this Agreement shall be effective unless in writing and signed by the party against whom the waiver is sought to be enforced.

**13.3 Severability.** If any provision of this Agreement is held to be invalid or unenforceable for any reason, the remaining provisions shall continue to be valid and enforceable. If a court of competent jurisdiction finds that any provision of this Agreement is invalid or unenforceable, but that by limiting such provision it would become valid and enforceable, then such provision shall be deemed to be written, construed, and enforced as so limited.

**13.4 Notices.** All notices, requests, demands, and other communications required or permitted hereunder shall be in writing and shall be deemed to have been duly given when delivered personally, sent by recognized overnight courier, or sent by certified or registered mail, return receipt requested, postage prepaid, to the addresses of the Members as set forth in Schedule A, or to such other address as any party may designate by notice to the others.

**13.5 Counterparts.** This Agreement may be executed in one or more counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument. Facsimile or electronic signatures shall be deemed original for all purposes.

SIGNATURES

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the undersigned Members have executed this Operating Agreement as of the date first above written.

___________________________________

[Member 1 Name]

Member

___________________________________

[Member 2 Name]

Member

___________________________________

[Member 3 Name, if applicable]

Member

___________________________________

[Member 4 Name, if applicable]

Member

SCHEDULE A: CAPITAL CONTRIBUTIONS AND MEMBERSHIP INTERESTS

This Schedule A is incorporated by reference into the Operating Agreement of [LLC NAME], LLC, dated [Day] day of [Month], [Year].

Member Name Initial Capital Contribution Membership Interest (%)

query: Draft a Shareholders' Agreement for a corporation specifying share classes, board structure, voting rights, and exit terms.

api1.updated_html:
SHAREHOLDERS' AGREEMENT

This Shareholders' Agreement (the "Agreement") is made and entered into as of this [Effective Date], by and among [Corporation Name], a corporation duly incorporated under the laws of [Jurisdiction of Incorporation] with its registered office at [Corporation Address] (the "Corporation"), and each of the individuals and/or entities listed in Schedule A attached hereto, collectively referred to as the "Shareholders" and individually as a "Shareholder".

WHEREAS, the Shareholders are the beneficial and/or registered owners of all the issued and outstanding shares in the capital of the Corporation, holding various classes and numbers of shares as more fully described in Schedule B hereto;

WHEREAS, the parties desire to set forth their respective rights, duties, and obligations concerning the ownership, management, and operation of the Corporation, including but not limited to provisions governing share classes, board structure, voting rights, restrictions on transfer of shares, and exit mechanisms, to ensure the orderly and effective governance of the Corporation and to protect the interests of all Shareholders;

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and agreements contained herein, and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the parties hereto agree as follows:

1. Definitions

For the purposes of this Shareholders' Agreement (the "Agreement"), the following terms shall have the meanings ascribed to them below, unless the context clearly indicates otherwise:

"Agreement" means this Shareholders' Agreement, including all schedules and appendices attached hereto, as may be amended, restated, or supplemented from time to time in accordance with its terms.

"Corporation" or "Company" means [Full Legal Name of Corporation], a corporation duly organized and existing under the laws of [Jurisdiction of Incorporation], and its successors and permitted assigns.

"Shares" means all shares of the capital stock of the Corporation, including without limitation, Common Shares, Preferred Shares, and any other class or series of shares, whether now outstanding or hereafter issued, and any securities convertible into or exchangeable for such shares, or any options, warrants, or other rights to acquire such shares.

"Shareholder" means any person or entity holding Shares in the Corporation and who is a party to this Agreement, as listed in Schedule A hereto, and any permitted transferee or assignee of such Shares who becomes bound by the terms of this Agreement.

"Board of Directors" or "Board" means the duly constituted board of directors of the Corporation, as established and governed by the Corporation's Articles of Incorporation, Bylaws, and this Agreement.

"Effective Date" means [Effective Date], the date upon which this Agreement becomes effective and binding upon all parties hereto.

"Exit Event" means any transaction or series of transactions resulting in the sale of all or substantially all of the assets of the Corporation, a merger, amalgamation, or consolidation of the Corporation with another entity where the Shareholders immediately prior to such transaction do not hold a majority of the voting power of the surviving entity, or an initial public offering of the Corporation's Shares on a recognized stock exchange.

2. Confidentiality

Each Shareholder (the "Receiving Party") acknowledges that in connection with this Agreement and their relationship with [Corporation Name] (the "Corporation") and other Shareholders (the "Disclosing Parties"), they may obtain or have access to confidential and proprietary information, including but not limited to, trade secrets, financial data, business plans, customer lists, marketing strategies, product development information, intellectual property, and other non-public information concerning the business and operations of the Corporation or the Disclosing Parties (collectively, "Confidential Information"). The Receiving Party agrees to maintain the strict confidentiality of all such Confidential Information and shall not, directly or indirectly, use, disclose, or permit the disclosure of any Confidential Information to any third party for any purpose whatsoever, except as expressly permitted by this Agreement or with the prior written consent of the Disclosing Party or the Corporation.

The obligation of confidentiality shall not apply to information that (a) is or becomes publicly available through no fault of the Receiving Party; (b) was rightfully in the possession of the Receiving Party prior to its disclosure by the Disclosing Party or the Corporation; (c) is independently developed by the Receiving Party without use of or reference to the Confidential Information; or (d) is required to be disclosed by law, regulation, or court order, provided that the Receiving Party gives prompt written notice to the Disclosing Party or the Corporation prior to such disclosure to allow them to seek a protective order or other appropriate remedy. Each Shareholder further agrees to take all reasonable measures to protect the secrecy of and avoid disclosure or unauthorized use of Confidential Information, exercising at least the same degree of care as they use to protect their own confidential information of a similar nature, but in no event less than reasonable care. These confidentiality obligations shall survive the termination of this Agreement for any reason.

3. Warranties

Each Shareholder hereby represents and warrants to the Corporation and to each other Shareholder, as of the Effective Date and throughout the term of this Agreement, that:

(a) Such Shareholder has the full legal capacity, power, and authority to execute and deliver this Agreement and to perform its obligations hereunder, and the execution, delivery, and performance of this Agreement have been duly authorized by all necessary corporate or other organizational action on the part of such Shareholder.

(b) This Agreement constitutes a legal, valid, and binding obligation of such Shareholder, enforceable against it in accordance with its terms, subject to applicable bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization, moratorium, or other laws affecting creditors' rights generally and to general principles of equity.

(c) The execution, delivery, and performance by such Shareholder of this Agreement do not and will not violate or conflict with any provision of its organizational documents, any agreement, instrument, judgment, order, or decree to which such Shareholder is a party or by which it is bound, or any applicable law, rule, or regulation.

(d) All shares of the Corporation held by such Shareholder are, and will remain, duly authorized, validly issued, fully paid, and non-assessable, and are held free and clear of any liens, encumbrances, pledges, security interests, options, charges, or adverse claims, except as expressly contemplated by this Agreement or as disclosed in writing to the Corporation and other Shareholders prior to the Effective Date.

(e) All information provided by such Shareholder to the Corporation or other Shareholders in connection with this Agreement is true, accurate, and complete in all material respects and does not omit any material fact necessary to make the statements contained therein not misleading.

4. Indemnification

Each Shareholder (the "Indemnifying Party") shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless the Company, the other Shareholders, and their respective officers, directors, employees, agents, successors, and assigns (each, an "Indemnified Party") from and against any and all losses, damages, liabilities, deficiencies, claims, actions, judgments, settlements, interest, awards, penalties, fines, costs, or expenses of whatever kind, including reasonable attorneys' fees, incurred by the Indemnified Party, arising out of or resulting from any breach by the Indemnifying Party of any representation, warranty, covenant, or agreement contained in this Agreement. This indemnification obligation shall not apply to the extent that any such loss arises out of or results from the gross negligence or willful misconduct of the Indemnified Party.

In the event of any claim for which an Indemnified Party seeks indemnification hereunder, the Indemnified Party shall give prompt written notice to the Indemnifying Party of such claim; provided, however, that the failure to give prompt notice shall not relieve the Indemnifying Party of its obligations hereunder, except to the extent that such failure materially prejudices the Indemnifying Party. The Indemnifying Party shall have the right, at its sole expense, to assume the defense of any third-party claim with counsel reasonably satisfactory to the Indemnified Party within [Number] days after receipt of notice of such claim. If the Indemnifying Party fails to assume such defense, the Indemnified Party may defend the claim in such manner as it may deem appropriate, and the Indemnifying Party shall be liable for all costs and expenses incurred in connection therewith.

The indemnification obligations set forth in this Section 4 shall survive the termination of this Agreement and the transfer of any Shares for a period of [Number] years from the date of such termination or transfer, or, if longer, for the applicable statute of limitations period, ensuring that all claims arising prior to such expiration are fully addressed.

5. Limitation of Liability

Except as expressly provided otherwise in this Agreement, no Shareholder, nor any of their respective directors, officers, employees, or agents (collectively, "Related Parties"), shall be liable to any other Shareholder or to the Corporation for any loss, damage, or expense arising from any act or omission in connection with this Agreement or the business of the Corporation, provided such act or omission was made in good faith and in the belief that such act or omission was in the best interests of the Corporation and its Shareholders, and did not constitute gross negligence, willful misconduct, fraud, or a material breach of this Agreement or any fiduciary duty owed by such Shareholder or Related Party.

Notwithstanding anything to the contrary herein, in no event shall any Shareholder or their Related Parties be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, punitive, exemplary, or consequential damages, including, without limitation, loss of profits, loss of revenue, loss of business opportunity, or loss of goodwill, arising out of or in connection with this Agreement or the operations of [Corporation Name], regardless of the form of action, whether in contract, tort (including negligence), strict liability, or otherwise, even if such Shareholder or Related Party has been advised of the possibility of such damages. The aggregate liability of any Shareholder and their Related Parties under this Agreement for any and all claims, losses, or damages arising out of or in connection with this Agreement shall be limited to the aggregate value of the shares held by such Shareholder in [Corporation Name] as of the date of the claim, excluding any liability for gross negligence, willful misconduct, fraud, or breach of fiduciary duty.

6. Termination

This Agreement shall terminate and be of no further force or effect upon the earliest to occur of the following events, unless otherwise expressly provided herein:

(a) The unanimous written agreement of all Shareholders then party to this Agreement, clearly expressing their mutual intent to terminate this Agreement, duly executed by each such Shareholder;

(b) The dissolution, winding-up, or bankruptcy of the Corporation, [Corporation Name], in accordance with the applicable corporate laws of [Jurisdiction of Incorporation], provided that all assets have been distributed and the Corporation has ceased to exist as a legal entity;

(c) The completion of a Qualified Public Offering (as defined in Section [Relevant Section Number, e.g., 9.3 - Exit Provisions]) of the Corporation's shares on a recognized stock exchange, provided that all shares held by the Shareholders party to this Agreement have been sold or converted into publicly traded securities in connection with such offering;

(d) The completion of a Change of Control Transaction (as defined in Section [Relevant Section Number, e.g., 9.4 - Exit Provisions]) where all shares held by the Shareholders party to this Agreement are acquired by a third party or parties not previously party to this Agreement, and such acquisition results in the complete divestiture of all original Shareholder interests.

Notwithstanding the foregoing termination events, the provisions of Section [e.g., 10. Confidentiality], Section [e.g., 11. Indemnification], Section [e.g., 12. Governing Law], and Section [e.g., 13. Dispute Resolution] shall survive any termination of this Agreement and remain in full force and effect indefinitely or for the period specified therein, as applicable. Upon termination, the parties shall be released from their obligations hereunder, save for any obligations or liabilities that accrued prior to the effective date of termination.

7. Governing Law

This Agreement and any dispute or claim arising out of or in connection with it or its subject matter or formation (including non-contractual disputes or claims) shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the internal laws of the State of [Governing State/Country], without giving effect to any choice or conflict of law provision or rule (whether of the State of [Governing State/Country] or any other jurisdiction) that would cause the application of the laws of any jurisdiction other than the State of [Governing State/Country]. The parties irrevocably agree that the federal and state courts located in [Governing Jurisdiction] shall have exclusive jurisdiction to settle any dispute or claim arising out of or in connection with this Agreement or its subject matter or formation (including non-contractual disputes or claims).

Each party hereby waives any objection to venue in such courts and irrevocably consents to the jurisdiction of any such court in any such action or proceeding and to the service of process by mail. The parties acknowledge and agree that this choice of law and forum is reasonable and fair, and that they will not assert any defense of forum non conveniens or similar defense in any action or proceeding brought in such courts.

8. Dispute Resolution

Any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement, or the breach, termination, or invalidity thereof, shall first be subject to good faith negotiation between the Parties. A Party shall provide written notice of the dispute to the other Parties, and the Parties shall endeavor to resolve the dispute amicably within thirty (30) days of such notice.

If the Parties are unable to resolve the dispute through negotiation within the aforementioned thirty (30) day period, the Parties agree to endeavor to resolve the dispute through non-binding mediation. The mediation shall be administered by [Mediation Institution, e.g., JAMS or the American Arbitration Association (AAA)] in accordance with its then-current Mediation Rules. The mediation shall take place in [City, State, Country], and the costs of the mediation shall be borne equally by the Parties, unless otherwise mutually agreed in writing.

Should mediation fail to resolve the dispute within sixty (60) days of the commencement of mediation, or if one Party declines to participate in mediation, the dispute shall be finally resolved by binding arbitration. The arbitration shall be administered by [Arbitration Institution, e.g., the International Chamber of Commerce (ICC) or AAA] in accordance with its [Specific Arbitration Rules, e.g., Rules of Arbitration or Commercial Arbitration Rules] then in effect.

The arbitration shall be conducted by [one/three] arbitrator(s) appointed in accordance with the said Rules. The seat of the arbitration shall be [City, State, Country], and the language of the arbitration shall be [Language, e.g., English]. The award rendered by the arbitrator(s) shall be final and binding upon the Parties, and judgment thereon may be entered in any court having jurisdiction thereof. The Parties hereby waive any right to appeal the arbitration award, to the extent permitted by law.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, nothing in this Section 8 shall prevent any Party from seeking immediate injunctive or equitable relief in any court of competent jurisdiction for matters involving intellectual property rights, confidentiality obligations, or the enforcement of any judgment or award, where such relief is necessary to prevent irreparable harm and where monetary damages alone would be an insufficient remedy.

The Parties agree that all arbitration proceedings and awards shall be kept confidential, except as required by law or as necessary for the enforcement of the award. The prevailing Party in any arbitration or judicial proceeding arising out of or relating to this Agreement shall be entitled to recover its reasonable attorneys' fees and costs (including, without limitation, expert witness fees and arbitration/court costs) from the non-prevailing Party.

9. Signatures

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties hereto, intending to be legally bound, have duly executed this Shareholders' Agreement as of the Effective Date first written above. Each signatory warrants and represents that they possess the full power and authority to enter into this Agreement and to bind the entity or individual for whom they are signing to the terms and conditions contained herein. This Agreement may be executed in any number of counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument, and it shall become effective when each Party has executed at least one counterpart.

[Party A Name/Shareholder Name]

By: ___________________________________

Name: [Authorized Signatory Name for Party A]

Title: [Title of Signatory for Party A]

Date: ___________________________________

[Party B Name/Shareholder Name]

By: ___________________________________

Name: [Authorized Signatory Name for Party B]

Title: [Title of Signatory for Party B]

Date: ___________________________________

[The Corporation Name]

By: ___________________________________

Name: [Authorized Signatory Name for Corporation]

Title: [Title of Signatory for Corporation]

Date: ___________________________________

WITNESSES (Optional, but recommended for certain jurisdictions):

Signed in the presence of:

___________________________________

Name: [Witness Name 1]

Address: [Witness Address 1]

___________________________________

Address: [Witness Address 2]
