Upon the termination or expiration of this Agreement or any SOW for any reason: (a) [Party B] shall cease all services under the terminated SOW or Agreement; (b) each Party shall promptly return to the other Party all Confidential Information and proprietary materials of the other Party in its possession or control; (c) [Party A] shall pay [Party B] for all services properly rendered and expenses properly incurred up to the effective date of termination, in accordance with the terms of this Agreement and any applicable SOW; and (d) any provisions of this Agreement which by their nature are intended to survive termination, including but not limited to Sections 6 (Intellectual Property), 7 (Confidentiality), 8 (Representations and Warranties), 9 (Indemnification), 11 (Limitation of Liability), 12 (Governing Law), and 13 (Dispute Resolution), shall survive such termination or expiration. Termination of this Agreement or any SOW shall not relieve either Party of any obligations accrued prior to the effective date of termination.

11. Governing Law

This Master Services Agreement and all matters arising out of or relating to this Agreement, including, without limitation, its validity, interpretation, construction, performance, and enforcement, shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the internal laws of the State of [Governing Law State], without giving effect to any choice or conflict of law provision or rule (whether of the State of [Governing Law State] or any other jurisdiction) that would cause the application of the laws of any jurisdiction other than the State of [Governing Law State]. The parties hereto agree that any action or proceeding arising out of or relating to this Agreement shall be brought exclusively in the federal or state courts located in [Governing Jurisdiction], and each party irrevocably consents to the jurisdiction of such courts in any such action or proceeding and waives any objection to the laying of venue in such courts. This choice of law and forum clause is intended to be comprehensive and to govern all aspects of any dispute arising under this Agreement, ensuring predictability and consistency in the resolution of any legal matters.

12. Dispute Resolution

Any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Master Services Agreement, including the breach, termination, or validity thereof, shall first be subject to good-faith negotiations between the Parties. The Party asserting the dispute shall provide written notice to the other Party, detailing the nature of the dispute. The Parties shall endeavor to resolve the dispute through direct negotiation for a period of not less than thirty (30) days from the date of such notice.

If the Parties are unable to resolve the dispute through negotiation within the aforementioned period, either Party may, by written notice to the other, elect to submit the dispute to binding arbitration. The arbitration shall be conducted in accordance with the [Arbitration Rules, e.g., JAMS Comprehensive Arbitration Rules and Procedures] then in effect, by a single arbitrator agreed upon by both Parties. If the Parties cannot agree on an arbitrator within fifteen (15) days of the election to arbitrate, an arbitrator shall be appointed by [Arbitration Administrator, e.g., JAMS] in accordance with its rules. The arbitration shall take place in [Arbitration Location, e.g., City, State], [Governing Law Country].

The decision of the arbitrator shall be final and binding upon both Parties, and judgment on the award rendered by the arbitrator may be entered in any court having jurisdiction thereof. The costs of the arbitration, including the arbitrator's fees, shall be borne equally by the Parties, provided that each Party shall bear its own attorneys' fees and costs unless otherwise determined by the arbitrator. Notwithstanding the foregoing, either Party may seek injunctive or other equitable relief in any court of competent jurisdiction to prevent the actual or threatened infringement, misappropriation, or violation of its intellectual property rights or other proprietary rights, or for other urgent circumstances where monetary damages would not be an adequate remedy.

This Agreement and any disputes arising out of or related to it shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of [Governing Law State], [Governing Law Country], without regard to its conflict of laws principles.

13. Signatures

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties hereto have executed this Master Services Agreement as of the Effective Date first written above, through their duly authorized representatives, each acknowledging their full understanding and acceptance of all terms, conditions, and covenants contained herein, and intending to be legally bound by its provisions. The individuals signing below represent and warrant that they have the full legal authority to bind the respective entity on whose behalf they are signing to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, thereby affirming the enforceability of this Agreement against their respective entities.

FOR [Consulting Firm Name]:

____________________________________
By: [Authorized Signatory Name]
Title: [Authorized Signatory Title]
Date: [Date of Signature]

FOR [Client Company Name]:

____________________________________
By: [Authorized Signatory Name]
Title: [Authorized Signatory Title]
Date: [Date of Signature]
api1.summary: The Master Services Agreement has been successfully drafted, covering all necessary aspects including scope of services, fees, intellectual property, and liability terms.

api2.updated_html:
MASTER SERVICES AGREEMENT

This Master Services Agreement ("Agreement") is entered into as of this [Day] day of [Month], [Year] ("Effective Date"), by and between the parties identified below:

[Client Legal Name], a [Client Entity Type] organized and existing under the laws of [Client Jurisdiction], with its principal place of business located at [Client Address] (hereinafter referred to as "Client").

[Consulting Firm Legal Name], a [Consultant Entity Type] organized and existing under the laws of [Consultant Jurisdiction], with its principal place of business located at [Consultant Address] (hereinafter referred to as "Consultant").

Client and Consultant are hereinafter collectively referred to as the "Parties" and individually as a "Party."

WHEREAS, Client desires to engage Consultant to provide certain professional services, and Consultant is willing to provide such services, all in accordance with the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement and any Statement(s) of Work ("SOW") executed hereunder.

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and agreements contained herein, and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the Parties agree as follows:

1. DEFINITIONS

1.1. "Services" shall mean the professional consulting, advisory, development, or other services to be provided by Consultant to Client as specifically described in an SOW. The precise nature, scope, deliverables, and timelines for such Services will be detailed in individual SOWs, which shall be incorporated by reference into this Agreement upon execution by both Parties.

The Services may encompass a broad range of activities, including but not limited to strategic planning, technical implementation, project management, training, and ongoing support, as mutually agreed upon. Any modifications or additions to the scope of Services must be documented through a written amendment to the relevant SOW or a new SOW, duly signed by authorized representatives of both Parties, ensuring clear communication and mutual understanding of evolving requirements.

1.2. "Statement of Work" or "SOW" shall mean a written document, executed by both Parties, that specifies the particular Services to be performed by Consultant for Client under this Agreement. Each SOW will detail, at a minimum, the specific scope of work, deliverables, timelines, milestones, payment terms, and any specific assumptions or dependencies related to that particular engagement.

Upon execution, each SOW shall become an integral part of this Agreement, subject to all terms and conditions herein. In the event of any conflict or inconsistency between the terms of this Agreement and the terms of an SOW, the terms of this Agreement shall prevail unless the SOW explicitly states its intent to supersede a specific provision of this Agreement for that particular SOW.

1.3. "Confidential Information" shall mean any non-public information, whether commercial, financial, technical, operational, or otherwise, disclosed by one Party (the "Disclosing Party") to the other Party (the "Receiving Party"), whether orally, visually, in writing, or by any other means, that is designated as confidential or that, by its nature, would reasonably be understood to be confidential. This includes, but is not limited to, trade secrets, business plans, client lists, pricing, intellectual property, and proprietary software.

Confidential Information does not include information that (a) is or becomes publicly available through no fault of the Receiving Party; (b) was known to the Receiving Party prior to its disclosure by the Disclosing Party without breach of any confidentiality obligation; (c) is rightfully obtained by the Receiving Party from a third party without restriction on disclosure; or (d) is independently developed by the Receiving Party without use of or reference to the Disclosing Party's Confidential Information.

1.4. "Intellectual Property Rights" shall mean all industrial and intellectual property rights throughout the world, whether registered or unregistered, including, but not limited to, copyrights, patents, trademarks, service marks, trade names, design rights, rights in databases, know-how, trade secrets, and all rights or forms of protection of a similar nature or having equivalent effect anywhere in the world.

These rights encompass all applications for, and renewals or extensions of, such rights and all similar or equivalent rights or forms of protection existing anywhere in the world. This definition specifically includes any and all works, inventions, discoveries, improvements, data, software, designs, processes, and other materials created or conceived during the performance of the Services.

2. TERM

This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall continue in full force and effect for an initial term of [Number] ([e.g., one (1)]) year, unless terminated earlier in accordance with the provisions of Section 10 ("Termination").

Following the initial term, this Agreement shall automatically renew for successive [Number]-year periods, unless either Party provides written notice of its intent not to renew at least [Number] ([e.g., ninety (90)]) days prior to the end of the then-current term. The terms and conditions of this Agreement, including any amendments, shall apply to all renewed terms.

3. SCOPE OF SERVICES

Consultant shall provide Services to Client as described in individual SOWs executed by both Parties from time to time. Each SOW will define the specific tasks, deliverables, milestones, timelines, and any other relevant details pertaining to a particular project or engagement. No Services shall be performed or payments due unless a valid SOW has been duly executed.

The Parties acknowledge that the scope of Services may evolve during the course of an engagement. Any changes to the scope of Services, including additions, deletions, or modifications, must be mutually agreed upon in writing through a formal change order or an amendment to the relevant SOW, specifying the impact on timelines, deliverables, and fees. Consultant is not obligated to perform any services outside the scope defined in an executed SOW or approved change order.

4. FEES AND PAYMENT TERMS

Client agrees to pay Consultant the fees specified in each SOW for the Services rendered. Unless otherwise stipulated in an SOW, all fees shall be invoiced by Consultant on a [e.g., monthly] basis for Services performed during the preceding period, or upon completion of specified milestones or deliverables as outlined in the SOW. Invoices shall be submitted to Client's designated billing contact.

All invoices are due and payable within [Number] ([e.g., thirty (30)]) days from the invoice date. Payments not received by the due date shall accrue interest at the rate of [e.g., one and one-half percent (1.5%)] per month or the maximum rate permitted by law, whichever is less, from the due date until paid in full. Client shall also reimburse Consultant for all reasonable and pre-approved out-of-pocket expenses incurred in connection with the performance of the Services, provided such expenses are supported by appropriate documentation.

5. CONFIDENTIALITY

The Receiving Party agrees to maintain the confidentiality of the Disclosing Party's Confidential Information with the same degree of care that it uses to protect its own confidential information of a similar nature, but in no event less than reasonable care. The Receiving Party shall not use the Disclosing Party's Confidential Information for any purpose other than for the performance of its obligations under this Agreement and the applicable SOW, nor shall it disclose such information to any third party without the Disclosing Party's prior written consent.

The obligations of confidentiality shall survive the termination or expiration of this Agreement for a period of [Number] ([e.g., five (5)]) years, or indefinitely for trade secrets. The Receiving Party may disclose Confidential Information if required by law or a court order, provided that it gives the Disclosing Party prompt prior written notice of such requirement (unless prohibited by law) to allow the Disclosing Party to seek a protective order or other appropriate remedy.

6. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY

Unless otherwise expressly agreed in a specific SOW, all Intellectual Property Rights in any work product, deliverables, or materials created, developed, or provided by Consultant specifically for Client under an SOW (the "Deliverables") shall be owned by Client upon full payment of all fees due for such Deliverables. Consultant hereby assigns, and agrees to assign, all right, title, and interest in and to such Deliverables to Client.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, Consultant retains all Intellectual Property Rights in its pre-existing materials, methodologies, tools, software, and general know-how ("Consultant Background IP") used in performing the Services. Consultant grants Client a non-exclusive, perpetual, worldwide, royalty-free license to use, reproduce, and modify the Consultant Background IP solely to the extent necessary for Client to utilize the Deliverables for its internal business purposes.

7. WARRANTIES

Consultant warrants that the Services will be performed in a professional and workmanlike manner, in accordance with generally accepted industry standards and practices. Consultant further warrants that it has the necessary expertise, resources, and personnel to perform the Services and that the Services will comply with all applicable laws and regulations. This warranty shall extend for a period of [Number] ([e.g., ninety (90)]) days from the completion of the relevant Services or delivery of the applicable Deliverable.

Client warrants that it will provide timely access to all necessary information, resources, and personnel required for Consultant to perform the Services. Client also warrants that any materials or information provided by Client to Consultant for use in the Services do not infringe upon the Intellectual Property Rights of any third party. EXCEPT AS EXPRESSLY PROVIDED IN THIS AGREEMENT, CONSULTANT MAKES NO OTHER WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, ANY IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY OR FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.

8. INDEMNIFICATION

Each Party (the "Indemnifying Party") shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless the other Party, its affiliates, officers, directors, employees, and agents (the "Indemnified Party") from and against any and all claims, losses, damages, liabilities, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees) arising out of or relating to: (a) any breach by the Indemnifying Party of its representations, warranties, or covenants under this Agreement; or (b) any gross negligence or willful misconduct of the Indemnifying Party in connection with the performance of this Agreement.

Specifically, Consultant shall indemnify Client against any third-party claims alleging that the Deliverables, as provided by Consultant and used in accordance with this Agreement, infringe any valid Intellectual Property Right of a third party. Client shall indemnify Consultant against any third-party claims arising from Client's materials or instructions provided to Consultant that result in infringement of a third party's Intellectual Property Rights. The Indemnified Party shall provide prompt written notice of any claim and cooperate with the Indemnifying Party in the defense thereof.

9. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY

TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW, IN NO EVENT SHALL EITHER PARTY BE LIABLE TO THE OTHER PARTY FOR ANY INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, CONSEQUENTIAL, PUNITIVE, OR EXEMPLARY DAMAGES, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO, DAMAGES FOR LOSS OF PROFITS, REVENUES, GOODWILL, DATA, OR USE, INCURRED BY THE OTHER PARTY OR ANY THIRD PARTY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION IN CONTRACT OR TORT, EVEN IF THE OTHER PARTY HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES.

THE TOTAL AGGREGATE LIABILITY OF CONSULTANT TO CLIENT FOR ALL CLAIMS ARISING OUT OF OR RELATING TO THIS AGREEMENT OR ANY SOW, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, TORT, OR OTHERWISE, SHALL NOT EXCEED THE TOTAL FEES PAID BY CLIENT TO CONSULTANT UNDER THE APPLICABLE SOW DURING THE TWELVE (12) MONTHS IMMEDIATELY PRECEDING THE EVENT GIVING RISE TO THE LIABILITY. THIS LIMITATION OF LIABILITY SHALL NOT APPLY TO LIABILITY ARISING FROM A PARTY'S INDEMNIFICATION OBLIGATIONS, GROSS NEGLIGENCE, WILLFUL MISCONDUCT, OR BREACH OF CONFIDENTIALITY OBLIGATIONS.

10. TERMINATION

10.1. Termination for Convenience. Either Party may terminate this Agreement or any SOW for convenience upon providing [Number] ([e.g., sixty (60)]) days' prior written notice to the other Party. In the event of termination for convenience by Client, Client shall pay Consultant for all Services performed and expenses incurred up to the effective date of termination, plus any non-cancelable commitments made by Consultant in reliance on the SOW.

10.2. Termination for Cause. Either Party may terminate this Agreement or any SOW immediately upon written notice if the other Party materially breaches any provision of this Agreement or an SOW and fails to cure such breach within [Number] ([e.g., thirty (30)]) days after receiving written notice thereof. Material breaches include, but are not limited to, non-payment of undisputed fees, breach of confidentiality obligations, or repeated failure to meet performance obligations.

10.3. Effect of Termination. Upon termination or expiration of this Agreement or any SOW, Client shall promptly pay all outstanding fees and expenses due to Consultant for Services rendered up to the effective date of termination. Each Party shall return or destroy all Confidential Information of the other Party in its possession, except for copies required for legal or archival purposes. Sections 1, 5, 6, 8, 9, 10.3, 11, and 12 shall survive any termination or expiration of this Agreement.

11. GOVERNING LAW

This Agreement and any SOWs hereunder shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the [State/Country], without regard to its conflict of laws principles. The Parties expressly agree that the United Nations Convention on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods shall not apply to this Agreement.

Any legal action or proceeding arising under this Agreement shall be brought exclusively in the federal or state courts located in [City, State/Country], and the Parties hereby consent to the personal jurisdiction and venue therein. This choice of law and forum is intended to be exclusive and binding on both Parties for the resolution of any disputes.

12. DISPUTE RESOLUTION

The Parties agree to first attempt to resolve any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement or any SOW through good faith negotiations between senior management representatives of both Parties. If the dispute cannot be resolved through negotiation within [Number] ([e.g., thirty (30)]) days, the Parties agree to pursue non-binding mediation facilitated by a mutually agreed-upon mediator in [City, State/Country].

If mediation is unsuccessful, any unresolved dispute shall be finally settled by binding arbitration administered by [Arbitration Association, e.g., the American Arbitration Association (AAA)] in accordance with its Commercial Arbitration Rules, and judgment on the award rendered by the arbitrator(s) may be entered in any court having jurisdiction thereof. The arbitration shall be conducted in [City, State/Country], and the language of the arbitration shall be English. The costs of arbitration, including reasonable attorneys' fees, shall be borne by the non-prevailing Party.

13. MISCELLANEOUS

13.1. Entire Agreement. This Agreement, together with all executed SOWs, constitutes the entire agreement between the Parties with respect to the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior and contemporaneous agreements, proposals, negotiations, and discussions, whether oral or written, between the Parties. No modification, amendment, or waiver of any provision of this Agreement shall be effective unless in writing and signed by duly authorized representatives of both Parties.

13.2. Severability. If any provision of this Agreement is held by a court of competent jurisdiction to be invalid, illegal, or unenforceable, such provision shall be modified to the minimum extent necessary to make it valid, legal, and enforceable, and the remaining provisions of this Agreement shall remain in full force and effect. The Parties shall endeavor to replace the invalid or unenforceable provision with a valid and enforceable provision that most closely reflects the original intent of the Parties.

13.3. Assignment. Neither Party may assign or transfer this Agreement or any of its rights or obligations hereunder, whether by operation of law or otherwise, without the prior written consent of the other Party, which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld or delayed. Notwithstanding the foregoing, either Party may assign this Agreement in its entirety to an affiliate or in connection with a merger, acquisition, corporate reorganization, or sale of all or substantially all of its assets, provided the assignee agrees in writing to be bound by the terms of this Agreement.

13.4. Notices. All notices, requests, consents, and other communications required or permitted under this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be deemed to have been duly given when delivered personally, sent by certified or registered mail (return receipt requested, postage prepaid), or sent by recognized overnight courier service, to the addresses set forth below or to such other address as either Party may designate by written notice to the other Party.

To Client:
[Client Legal Name]
Attention: [Client Contact Person]
[Client Address]
Email: [Client Email]

To Consultant:
[Consulting Firm Legal Name]
Attention: [Consultant Contact Person]
[Consultant Address]
Email: [Consultant Email]

13.5. Independent Contractors. The relationship between Client and Consultant is that of independent contractors. Nothing in this Agreement shall be construed to create a partnership, joint venture, agency, or employment relationship between the Parties. Neither Party has any authority to bind the other Party to any third party or to incur any obligations on behalf of the other Party. Consultant shall be solely responsible for the payment of all taxes, benefits, and other costs related to its employees and operations.

13.6. Force Majeure. Neither Party shall be liable for any delay or failure to perform its obligations under this Agreement (excluding payment obligations) due to causes beyond its reasonable control, including, but not limited to, acts of God, war, terrorism, riots, embargoes, acts of civil or military authorities, fire, floods, accidents, epidemics, pandemics, or strikes ("Force Majeure Event"). The Party affected by a Force Majeure Event shall promptly notify the other Party and use reasonable efforts to mitigate the effects of the event.

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties have executed this Master Services Agreement as of the Effective Date first written above.

CLIENT:

___________________________________

By: [Authorized Signatory Name]

Title: [Authorized Signatory Title]

Date: _____________________________

CONSULTANT:

___________________________________

By: [Authorized Signatory Name]

Title: [Authorized Signatory Title]

Date: _____________________________

query: Draft a Statement of Work under an existing MSA for a web development project, including deliverables, timelines, milestones, and fees.

api1.updated_html:
Statement of Work for [Web Development Project Name]

This Statement of Work (hereinafter referred to as "SOW") is entered into and effective as of [Effective Date] (the "Effective Date"), by and between [Client Name], a [Client Entity Type] with its principal place of business located at [Client Address] ("Client"), and [Service Provider Name], a [Service Provider Entity Type] with its principal place of business located at [Service Provider Address] ("Service Provider").

This SOW is issued pursuant to and incorporates by reference the terms and conditions of the Master Services Agreement previously executed by and between the Client and the Service Provider on [Master Services Agreement Date] (the "MSA"). In the event of any conflict or inconsistency between the terms of this SOW and the MSA, the terms of the MSA shall prevail, unless this SOW explicitly states an intent to supersede a specific provision of the MSA, in which case this SOW shall govern solely for the scope of services defined herein.

The purpose of this SOW is to define the specific scope of services, deliverables, timelines, milestones, and associated fees for the web development project identified as "[Web Development Project Name]," which falls under the broader framework established by the MSA. This document outlines the mutual understanding and agreement regarding the performance of the specified services by the Service Provider for the Client.

Both parties acknowledge and agree that this SOW, once executed by authorized representatives of both the Client and the Service Provider, shall constitute a binding agreement for the services described herein, subject to all terms and conditions of the governing MSA.

1. Definitions

For the purposes of this Statement of Work ("SOW"), unless otherwise expressly defined herein or the context clearly requires otherwise, the following capitalized terms shall have the meanings ascribed to them below. Terms not defined herein shall have the meanings ascribed to them in the Master Services Agreement between [Party A] and [Party B] dated [MSA Effective Date] (the "MSA").

"Deliverables" means all tangible and intangible products, materials, software, documentation, designs, code, content, and other items required to be delivered by [Party B] to [Party A] as specified in Section [X.X] of this SOW, including but not limited to the completed website, databases, source code, user manuals, and any associated intellectual property developed hereunder.

"Effective Date" means [Effective Date], the date upon which this SOW is duly executed by authorized representatives of both [Party A] and [Party B], and thereby becomes legally binding upon both parties.

"Fees" means the total compensation payable by [Party A] to [Party B] for the full and satisfactory performance of the Services and the delivery of all Deliverables, as detailed in the payment schedule outlined in Section [Y.Y] of this SOW.

"Milestone" means a specific, measurable, and verifiable stage of completion within the Project, as outlined in the Project Timeline in Section [Z.Z] of this SOW, the achievement of which may trigger specific payments, reviews, or other obligations as specified herein.

"Project" means the entire web development undertaking described in this SOW, encompassing the Services, Deliverables, timelines, and associated activities aimed at achieving the objectives and scope set forth herein.

"Services" means the specific web development, design, coding, testing, deployment, and related activities to be performed by [Party B] for [Party A] as detailed in Section [A.A] of this SOW, in strict accordance with the terms and conditions of this SOW and the overarching MSA.

2. Project Scope & Objectives

This section details the specific scope and objectives of the web development project to be undertaken by [Party B] for [Party A], effective as of [Effective Date], pursuant to the terms and conditions set forth in the Master Services Agreement dated [MSA Date]. The primary objective of this Statement of Work is the design, development, and deployment of a comprehensive and fully functional website, hereinafter referred to as the "Project Website," for [Party A], accessible at [Website Domain Name, if known]. The Project Website aims to achieve [briefly state primary project goals, e.g., enhance online presence, facilitate e-commerce, provide information to target audience, streamline internal processes], thereby supporting [Party A]'s strategic objectives.

The scope of work encompasses all necessary phases from initial concept and requirements gathering, through design, development, testing, and final deployment. Key objectives include, but are not limited to, the creation of a user-friendly interface, robust backend functionality, secure data handling, and optimized performance across various devices and browsers. The Project Website shall incorporate [mention key features, e.g., content management system, user authentication, payment gateway integration, interactive forms, search functionality] and adhere to industry best practices for web development, security, and accessibility standards. Any services, features, or functionalities not explicitly detailed within this Statement of Work or its attached exhibits are deemed outside the current scope and may require a separate change order or amendment to this SOW.

3. Deliverables

[Party A] shall provide, and [Party B] shall accept, the following specific deliverables (collectively, the "Deliverables") in accordance with the timelines and milestones set forth in Section 4 of this Statement of Work and the overarching Master Services Agreement between the Parties, effective as of [Effective Date]. The Deliverables for the [Project Name] Web Development Project shall include, but not be limited to: (a) a comprehensive Project Plan and Discovery Document detailing the project scope, technical specifications, and architectural design; (b) approved User Interface (UI) wireframes, mockups, and User Experience (UX) prototypes for all key pages and functionalities; (c) a fully developed, tested, and responsive website, compliant with the functional and non-functional requirements outlined in Appendix A, encompassing front-end and back-end development, database integration, and Content Management System (CMS) implementation; (d) comprehensive Quality Assurance (QA) and User Acceptance Testing (UAT) reports demonstrating the functionality and stability of the developed solution; (e) all source code, intellectual property, and necessary licenses pertaining to the custom developed components; (f) detailed technical documentation, including system architecture, API documentation, and deployment guides, along with user manuals for content management and administration; and (g) successful deployment of the website to the agreed-upon production environment. All Deliverables are subject to [Party B]'s formal acceptance criteria as further specified herein and in Appendix B.

4. Milestones & Timeline

The Parties agree to the following milestones and timeline for the completion of the Web Development Project, commencing on the [Effective Date] of this Statement of Work. All dates specified herein are target dates and are subject to reasonable adjustment only upon mutual written agreement of both Parties, provided such adjustments are necessitated by unforeseen circumstances, force majeure events, or duly approved changes in scope.

4.1. Project Kick-off & Discovery Phase: To be completed within [Number] business days from the [Effective Date]. This phase includes initial stakeholder meetings, comprehensive requirements gathering, and the finalization of the detailed project scope document and technical specifications.

4.2. Design & Prototype Phase: To be completed by [Date for Design Completion]. This phase encompasses the creation of wireframes, user interface (UI) mock-ups, user experience (UX) flows, and a functional prototype for [Party A]'s review and approval. [Party A] shall have [Number] business days from receipt of deliverables in this phase to provide consolidated feedback or formal approval.

4.3. Development & Integration Phase: To be completed by [Date for Development Completion]. This phase involves the coding, database setup, and integration of all agreed-upon functionalities and features as detailed in Section 3 (Deliverables) and the approved technical specifications.

4.4. Testing & Quality Assurance Phase: To be completed by [Date for Testing Completion]. This phase includes comprehensive internal testing by [Party B] (including unit, integration, and system testing) followed by User Acceptance Testing (UAT) conducted by [Party A]. [Party A] shall have [Number] business days for UAT from the date the UAT environment is made available by [Party B].

4.5. Deployment & Launch Phase: To be completed by [Final Delivery Date]. Upon successful completion of all prior phases, resolution of UAT defects, and final written approval by [Party A], the developed website will be deployed to the designated production environment, making it publicly accessible.

Timely completion of each milestone is strictly contingent upon [Party A]'s prompt provision of necessary information, content, access credentials, feedback, and approvals as reasonably requested by [Party B]. Any delays caused by [Party A]'s failure to meet its obligations hereunder may result in a corresponding adjustment to the project timeline, without penalty to [Party B], and may incur additional costs as per the change order process outlined in the Master Services Agreement between the Parties.

5. Fees & Payment Terms

For the full and satisfactory performance of all services and delivery of all Deliverables as set forth in this Statement of Work, [Client Name] (hereinafter "Client") shall pay [Service Provider Name] (hereinafter "Service Provider") a total fixed fee of [Total Project Fee] [Currency]. This fixed fee encompasses all costs associated with the development, testing, and deployment of the Web Development Project as detailed herein, excluding any out-of-scope services, change requests, or third-party licensing fees explicitly agreed upon in writing by both Parties through a formal change order process.

Payment shall be made by Client to Service Provider according to the following schedule:

  • [Percentage/Amount] ([Currency]) upon execution of this Statement of Work.
  • [Percentage/Amount] ([Currency]) upon completion and Client acceptance of Milestone 1: [Milestone 1 Description].
  • [Percentage/Amount] ([Currency]) upon completion and Client acceptance of Milestone 2: [Milestone 2 Description].
  • [Percentage/Amount] ([Currency]) upon final completion and Client acceptance of all Deliverables and the entire Web Development Project.

All invoices issued by Service Provider shall be due and payable by Client within [Number] ([e.g., thirty (30)]) days from the invoice date. Payments shall be made via [Payment Method, e.g., bank transfer] to the account specified by Service Provider. Any amounts not paid when due shall accrue interest at the rate of [Interest Rate, e.g., one and one-half percent (1.5%)] per month or the maximum rate permitted by applicable law, whichever is less, calculated from the due date until the date of full payment. Service Provider reserves the right to suspend services and withhold Deliverables if payments are not received by the due date, without prejudice to any other rights or remedies available to Service Provider under this SOW or the Master Services Agreement.

All fees are exclusive of applicable taxes, including but not limited to sales tax, value-added tax (VAT), or similar taxes, which shall be borne by the Client in addition to the stated fees, unless Client provides a valid tax exemption certificate acceptable to Service Provider. In the event of a payment dispute, Client shall notify Service Provider in writing within [Number] days of receipt of the invoice, clearly detailing the disputed amount and reasons for the dispute. Undisputed amounts remain due and payable as per the schedule, and any dispute shall not relieve Client of its obligation to pay undisputed amounts.

6. Roles & Responsibilities

Both parties acknowledge and agree to fulfill their respective roles and responsibilities as outlined herein to ensure the successful and timely completion of the Web Development Project. [Service Provider Name] shall be primarily responsible for the design, development, testing, and deployment of the web application deliverables as detailed in Section 4 (Deliverables) and Section 5 (Milestones & Timelines) of this Statement of Work. This includes, but is not limited to, writing code, conducting quality assurance, addressing identified bugs, and providing all necessary technical documentation. [Client Name] shall be primarily responsible for providing timely access to all necessary information, content (including text, images, and branding assets), personnel, and systems required by [Service Provider Name] for the execution of the project. Furthermore, [Client Name] shall ensure prompt review and approval of all submitted deliverables within the agreed-upon review periods, typically [Number] business days, and make timely payments as stipulated in Section 7 (Fees & Payment Schedule). Any delay by either party in fulfilling its responsibilities may necessitate a mutually agreed-upon adjustment to the project timeline and/or scope.

7. Acceptance Criteria

For each Deliverable specified in Section 3 (Deliverables) of this Statement of Work, [Party A] shall submit the Deliverable to [Party B] for review and acceptance. Upon receipt of a Deliverable, [Party B] shall have a period of [Acceptance Period, e.g., five (5) business days] to review and test the Deliverable against the mutually agreed-upon specifications, functional requirements, technical documentation, and any specific criteria outlined in the relevant Deliverable description within this SOW or its appendices. Testing shall occur in the designated [Testing Environment] using the [Acceptance Test Plan], if applicable.

If a Deliverable substantially conforms to the specifications, [Party B] shall provide written notice of acceptance to [Party A] within the Acceptance Period. If a Deliverable does not substantially conform, [Party B] shall provide written notice of rejection to [Party A] within the Acceptance Period, detailing the specific non-conformities and the reasons for rejection. [Party A] shall then have a period of [Cure Period, e.g., ten (10) business days] to correct the identified non-conformities and resubmit the Deliverable for re-evaluation, which shall be subject to a new Acceptance Period of [Re-evaluation Acceptance Period, e.g., three (3) business days].

If [Party B] fails to provide written notice of either acceptance or rejection within the specified Acceptance Period (or re-evaluation Acceptance Period, as applicable), the Deliverable shall be deemed accepted by [Party B] on the last day of that period. Acceptance of a Deliverable does not waive [Party B]'s rights regarding any latent defects, breaches of warranties, or non-conformities that could not reasonably have been discovered during the Acceptance Period through diligent inspection and testing.

8. Change Management

Any proposed changes to the scope of work, deliverables, timelines, or fees outlined in this Statement of Work (SOW) must be formally submitted by either [Client Name] (hereinafter "Client") or [Service Provider Name] (hereinafter "Service Provider") as a written Change Request. Such Change Request shall describe the proposed change, the reasons for it, and its anticipated impact on the Project's scope, schedule, and cost. Upon receipt of a Change Request, the receiving Party shall review it and respond within [Number] business days, indicating acceptance, rejection, or a request for further clarification or negotiation. No change shall be deemed effective or binding unless and until both Parties execute a formal written Change Order or SOW amendment, which shall explicitly reference this SOW and detail the agreed-upon modifications. Unless otherwise agreed in writing, any work performed by Service Provider outside the scope of this SOW, but pursuant to an approved Change Order, shall be billed at Service Provider's standard hourly rates for such services, in addition to the fees specified herein. Failure to follow this change management process shall render any purported changes null and void, and neither Party shall be obligated to perform or acknowledge such unauthorized modifications.

9. Intellectual Property

Unless otherwise explicitly stated herein or in the Master Services Agreement (the "MSA") dated [MSA Date] between [Client Name] ("Client") and [Developer Name] ("Developer"), all Intellectual Property Rights (including, but not limited to, copyrights, patents, trade secrets, and trademarks) in and to the Deliverables (as defined in Section 4 herein) specifically created by Developer for Client under this Statement of Work ("SOW") shall, upon full and final payment of all Fees due hereunder, be exclusively owned by Client. Developer hereby assigns, and agrees to assign, to Client all right, title, and interest in and to such Deliverables. Developer shall execute any further documents reasonably requested by Client to perfect Client's ownership of such Intellectual Property Rights.

Developer retains all Intellectual Property Rights in and to any of its pre-existing intellectual property, tools, methodologies, libraries, frameworks, or components ("Developer Background IP") that are incorporated into or necessary for the use of the Deliverables. Developer hereby grants to Client a perpetual, irrevocable, worldwide, non-exclusive, royalty-free license to use, reproduce, modify, display, perform, and distribute such Developer Background IP solely as incorporated into or necessary for the operation of the Deliverables for Client's internal business purposes. Client retains all Intellectual Property Rights in and to any materials, content, data, or intellectual property provided by Client to Developer for the purpose of this SOW.

Developer warrants that the Deliverables, as provided to Client, will not infringe upon the intellectual property rights of any third party, provided that such infringement is not caused by Client's misuse of the Deliverables or incorporation of Client's own infringing materials. The provisions of this Section 9 shall survive the termination or expiration of this SOW and the MSA.

10. Confidentiality

Both [Client Name] and [Developer Name] acknowledge that in the course of performing services under this Statement of Work ("SOW"), they may have access to and become privy to Confidential Information of the other party. For the purposes of this SOW, "Confidential Information" shall mean any and all non-public information, data, trade secrets, business plans, financial information, intellectual property (including, but not limited to, source code, object code, design documents, specifications, user interfaces, algorithms, and methodologies related to the Web Development Project), client lists, marketing strategies, technical information, and pricing, whether disclosed orally, visually, in writing, or by any other means, and whether or not marked as "confidential."

Each party agrees to hold the other party's Confidential Information in strict confidence and to take all reasonable precautions to protect such Confidential Information, including, but not limited to, using at least the same degree of care as it uses to protect its own highly sensitive proprietary information. Neither party shall, without the prior written consent of the disclosing party, disclose, publish, or disseminate the Confidential Information to any third party, nor use the Confidential Information for any purpose other than for the performance of its obligations or exercise of its rights under this SOW and the Master Services Agreement.

The obligations of confidentiality set forth herein shall not apply to information that: (a) is or becomes publicly known through no fault of the receiving party; (b) is rightfully received by the receiving party from a third party without restriction on disclosure; (c) is independently developed by the receiving party without use of or reference to the disclosing party's Confidential Information; (d) is required to be disclosed by law, regulation, or court order, provided that the receiving party gives prompt written notice to the disclosing party to allow the disclosing party to seek a protective order or other appropriate remedy, and discloses only that portion of the Confidential Information that it is legally compelled to disclose.

Upon the termination or expiration of this SOW or the Master Services Agreement, or at any time upon the disclosing party's written request, the receiving party shall, at the disclosing party's option, promptly return or destroy all Confidential Information (including all copies thereof) belonging to the disclosing party and certify such return or destruction in writing. The confidentiality obligations set forth in this Section 10 shall survive the termination or expiration of this SOW and the Master Services Agreement for a period of [Number] years, or indefinitely for information constituting a trade secret under applicable law.

11. Warranties

[Party B] (the "Developer") warrants and represents that it has the full power and authority to enter into this Statement of Work and perform the Services contemplated herein, and that its execution and performance of this Statement of Work will not violate any agreement to which it is a party or by which it is bound. Developer further warrants that the Services will be performed in a professional and workmanlike manner, consistent with industry standards and best practices, and in compliance with all applicable laws and regulations.

Developer warrants that all Deliverables provided under this Statement of Work, including but not limited to the developed website code, content, and functionalities, will conform in all material respects to the specifications set forth in Section 4 ("Deliverables") and Section 5 ("Timelines and Milestones"). Developer further warrants that the Deliverables will be free from material defects in materials and workmanship for a period of [Warranty Period, e.g., ninety (90) days] following Acceptance (as defined in Section 6). During this warranty period, Developer shall, at its own expense, promptly correct any non-conformities or defects reported by [Party A] in writing.

Developer warrants that all Deliverables, and the use thereof by [Party A] as contemplated by this Statement of Work, will not infringe upon or misappropriate any patent, copyright, trademark, trade secret, or other intellectual property or proprietary rights of any third party. Developer also warrants that the Deliverables, when delivered to [Party A], will be free of viruses, worms, Trojan horses, time bombs, or any other malicious code or disabling devices.

EXCEPT AS EXPRESSLY SET FORTH IN THIS SECTION 11, DEVELOPER MAKES NO OTHER WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, ANY IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, OR NON-INFRINGEMENT, ALL OF WHICH ARE HEREBY EXPRESSLY DISCLAIMED TO THE FULLEST EXTENT PERMITTED BY LAW. THE SOLE AND EXCLUSIVE REMEDY FOR BREACH OF ANY WARRANTY SET FORTH HEREIN SHALL BE THE CORRECTION OF THE NON-CONFORMING DELIVERABLES OR SERVICES AS DESCRIBED ABOVE.

12. Indemnification

Each Party (the "Indemnifying Party") shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless the other Party (the "Indemnified Party"), its officers, directors, employees, agents, and affiliates from and against any and all claims, liabilities, damages, losses, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees and litigation costs) arising out of or in connection with:

(a) Any material breach by the Indemnifying Party of its representations, warranties, or covenants set forth in this Statement of Work or the Master Service Agreement between [Party A] and [Party B] dated [Effective Date of MSA];

(b) Any gross negligence or willful misconduct of the Indemnifying Party or its personnel in the performance of its obligations under this Statement of Work;

(c) For [Party B] (Developer), any claim that the Deliverables provided by [Party B] under this Statement of Work, excluding any Client-provided materials, content, or specifications, infringe upon any third-party intellectual property rights (including patents, copyrights, trademarks, or trade secrets), provided [Party B] is given prompt written notice of such claim and sole control of the defense and settlement thereof;

(d) For [Party A] (Client), any claim arising from [Party B]'s use of materials, content, data, or instructions specifically provided by [Party A] to [Party B] for incorporation into the Deliverables, which infringe upon any third-party intellectual property rights or violate any applicable laws or regulations.

The Indemnified Party shall provide prompt written notice to the Indemnifying Party of any claim for which indemnification is sought and shall cooperate fully with the Indemnifying Party in the defense and settlement of such claim. The Indemnifying Party shall have the sole right to control the defense and settlement of any such claim, provided that any settlement that imposes an obligation on the Indemnified Party or admits liability on its part shall require the Indemnified Party's prior written consent, which shall not be unreasonably withheld. This indemnification obligation shall survive the termination or expiration of this Statement of Work.

13. Limitation of Liability

EXCEPT FOR DAMAGES ARISING FROM GROSS NEGLIGENCE, WILLFUL MISCONDUCT, BREACH OF CONFIDENTIALITY OBLIGATIONS, OR INFRINGEMENT OF INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS, NEITHER [Party A] NOR [Party B] SHALL BE LIABLE TO THE OTHER PARTY OR ANY THIRD PARTY FOR ANY INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, CONSEQUENTIAL, SPECIAL, PUNITIVE, OR EXEMPLARY DAMAGES, INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, LOSS OF PROFITS, REVENUE, DATA, OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION, ARISING OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THIS STATEMENT OF WORK OR THE SERVICES PROVIDED HEREUNDER, REGARDLESS OF THE FORM OF ACTION, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE), STRICT LIABILITY, OR OTHERWISE, EVEN IF SUCH PARTY HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES.

FURTHERMORE, IN NO EVENT SHALL THE TOTAL AGGREGATE LIABILITY OF EITHER PARTY FOR ANY AND ALL CLAIMS, LOSSES, OR DAMAGES ARISING OUT OF OR RELATING TO THIS STATEMENT OF WORK EXCEED THE TOTAL FEES PAID OR PAYABLE BY [Party A] TO [Party B] UNDER THIS STATEMENT OF WORK FOR THE SIX (6) MONTHS IMMEDIATELY PRECEDING THE DATE ON WHICH THE CLAIM AROSE. This limitation of liability shall apply to the fullest extent permitted by applicable law and shall survive the termination or expiration of this Statement of Work. The limitations set forth in this Section 13 are a fundamental element of the basis of the bargain between the Parties and reflect an agreed-upon allocation of risk. This clause supplements, but does not supersede, any similar provisions concerning limitation of liability contained within the Master Service Agreement between the Parties, and in the event of any conflict, the more restrictive limitation shall apply.

14. Term & Termination

This Statement of Work ("SOW") shall commence on the SOW Effective Date, [SOW Effective Date], and shall continue until the completion and acceptance of all Deliverables as defined herein, or until earlier terminated in accordance with the provisions of this SOW or the Master Services Agreement ("MSA") between [Client Name] and [Service Provider Name] dated [MSA Effective Date].

In addition to any termination rights set forth in the MSA, either Party may terminate this SOW immediately upon written notice to the other Party if the other Party commits a material breach of any term or condition of this SOW and fails to cure such breach within [Number] calendar days after receiving written notice thereof. Material breaches of this SOW by [Service Provider Name] shall include, but not be limited to, failure to meet critical milestones as specified in Section [Milestones Section Number] without reasonable justification or failure to deliver a substantial portion of the Deliverables as specified in Section [Deliverables Section Number]. Material breaches by [Client Name] shall include, but not be limited to, failure to make timely payments as specified in Section [Fees Section Number] or failure to provide necessary approvals or information as required for [Service Provider Name] to perform its obligations.

This SOW may be terminated for convenience by [Client Name] upon [Number] days' prior written notice to [Service Provider Name]. In the event of such termination for convenience, [Client Name] shall pay [Service Provider Name] for all Services performed and Deliverables partially completed up to the effective date of termination, calculated on a pro-rata basis based on the agreed-upon fees and milestones set forth in Section [Fees Section Number], plus any reasonable and documented out-of-pocket expenses incurred by [Service Provider Name] in connection with this SOW prior to the termination date that are not otherwise reimbursed. [Service Provider Name] shall provide an itemized invoice for such services and expenses within [Number] days of the termination notice.

Upon termination or expiration of this SOW for any reason, the provisions of Sections [e.g., Intellectual Property Section Number], [Confidentiality Section Number], [Payment Obligations Section Number] (for accrued but unpaid fees), and this Section 14 (Term & Termination) shall survive. Upon the effective date of termination, [Service Provider Name] shall cease all work on the Services and Deliverables under this SOW and shall promptly return to [Client Name] all Confidential Information and property of [Client Name] in its possession or control. [Client Name] shall make all payments due to [Service Provider Name] as of the termination date in accordance with the terms of this SOW and the MSA.

15. Governing Law

This Statement of Work, and any disputes or claims arising out of or in connection with it or its subject matter or formation (including non-contractual disputes or claims), shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the substantive laws of [Governing Jurisdiction], without regard to its conflict of law principles. The Parties irrevocably agree that the courts located within [Governing Jurisdiction] shall have exclusive jurisdiction to settle any dispute or claim that arises out of or in connection with this Statement of Work or its subject matter or formation (including non-contractual disputes or claims). Each Party hereby irrevocably waives, to the fullest extent permitted by applicable law, any and all right to trial by jury in any legal proceeding arising out of or relating to this Statement of Work or the transactions contemplated hereby. Furthermore, the Parties acknowledge and agree that the application of the United Nations Convention on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods is expressly excluded from this Statement of Work.

16. Dispute Resolution

Any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Statement of Work, including the breach, termination, or validity thereof, shall first be subject to good faith negotiation between the Parties. The Party asserting the dispute shall provide written notice to the other Party, detailing the nature of the dispute. The Parties shall then endeavor to resolve the dispute through direct negotiation between their respective authorized representatives within thirty (30) days of such notice.

If the Parties are unable to resolve the dispute through negotiation within the specified period, then, at the written request of either Party, the dispute shall be submitted to binding arbitration administered by [Arbitration Association Name, e.g., American Arbitration Association (AAA)] in accordance with its [Arbitration Rules, e.g., Commercial Arbitration Rules] then in effect. The arbitration shall be conducted by a single arbitrator mutually agreed upon by the Parties, or if no agreement is reached, appointed by the [Arbitration Association Name]. The arbitration shall take place in [Arbitration Location], and the language of the arbitration shall be English.

The decision of the arbitrator shall be final and binding upon both Parties, and judgment on the award rendered by the arbitrator may be entered in any court having jurisdiction thereof. Each Party shall bear its own costs and attorneys' fees incurred in connection with the arbitration, and the fees and expenses of the arbitrator shall be shared equally by the Parties, unless the arbitrator determines that a different allocation is appropriate. Notwithstanding the foregoing, either Party may seek injunctive or other equitable relief in any court of competent jurisdiction to prevent the actual or threatened infringement, misappropriation, or violation of its copyrights, trademarks, trade secrets, patents, or other intellectual property rights, without the necessity of posting a bond or proving actual damages.

17. Signatures

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties hereto have executed this Statement of Work as of the Effective Date, acknowledging their full understanding and agreement to all terms and conditions contained herein. Each signatory below represents and warrants that they are duly authorized to execute this Statement of Work on behalf of their respective entity and to legally bind that entity to its terms. This Statement of Work, upon execution, shall be incorporated by reference into the Master Services Agreement previously entered into by the Parties and shall be governed by the terms and conditions thereof, unless explicitly superseded herein.

FOR [Client Company Name]:

____________________________________
By: [Authorized Signatory Name]
Title: [Authorized Signatory Title]
Date: [Date of Signature]

FOR [Service Provider Company Name]:

____________________________________

Title: [Authorized Signatory Title]
Date: [Date of Signature]
api1.summary: The Statement of Work for your web development project under the existing MSA has been successfully drafted. It includes detailed sections on deliverables, timelines, milestones, and associated fees. Please review the document for specific details.

api2.updated_html:
STATEMENT OF WORK

This Statement of Work ("SOW") is entered into effective as of [Effective Date of SOW], by and between:

[Client Full Legal Name], a [Client Legal Entity Type] organized under the laws of [Client Jurisdiction], with its principal place of business at [Client Address] ("Client").

AND

[Service Provider Full Legal Name], a [Service Provider Legal Entity Type] organized under the laws of [Service Provider Jurisdiction], with its principal place of business at [Service Provider Address] ("Service Provider").

This SOW is issued pursuant to the terms and conditions of the Master Services Agreement between Client and Service Provider dated [Date of Master Services Agreement] (the "MSA"). All terms and conditions of the MSA are hereby incorporated by reference into this SOW, and in the event of any conflict or inconsistency between the terms of this SOW and the MSA, the terms of the MSA shall prevail, unless this SOW explicitly states an intent to supersede a specific provision of the MSA for the purposes of this SOW only.

1. Project Overview and Scope

This SOW outlines the scope of work for the development of a [Type of Website, e.g., corporate marketing website, e-commerce platform, web application] for Client (the "Project"). The Project aims to [briefly state the primary objective, e.g., enhance online presence, streamline customer interactions, facilitate online sales]. The Service Provider shall perform the services and deliver the deliverables as specified herein, adhering to the highest industry standards and best practices for web development.

The scope of this Project specifically includes [e.g., UI/UX design, front-end development, back-end development, content management system integration, third-party API integrations, testing, deployment, and initial training]. Any services or deliverables not explicitly described within this SOW, including but not limited to ongoing maintenance, content creation, or advanced SEO optimization beyond initial setup, are considered out of scope and will require a separate change order or SOW.

2. Deliverables

Service Provider shall deliver the following items ("Deliverables") to Client in accordance with the timelines and milestones set forth in Section 3:

  • 2.1. UI/UX Design Package: This includes wireframes, mockups, and a final design prototype for all key pages and user flows, reflecting Client's branding guidelines and user experience objectives. Client's approval of this package is a prerequisite for proceeding to development phases, and any significant changes requested after approval may be subject to a change order.
  • 2.2. Front-End Development: Fully functional and responsive web pages developed using [e.g., HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript frameworks like React/Angular/Vue], compatible with major web browsers [list browsers, e.g., Chrome, Firefox, Edge, Safari (latest two versions)]. This includes all interactive elements and client-side logic as per the approved UI/UX design.
  • 2.3. Back-End Development: Robust server-side logic and database integration using [e.g., Node.js, Python/Django, PHP/Laravel, Ruby on Rails] to support all specified functionalities, including user authentication, data storage, and API endpoints. This also encompasses the setup of the chosen Content Management System (CMS), such as [e.g., WordPress, Drupal, Strapi].
  • 2.4. Testing and Quality Assurance: Comprehensive testing, including functional testing, cross-browser compatibility testing, performance testing, and security vulnerability scanning, to ensure the Deliverables meet the agreed-upon specifications and quality standards. A detailed bug report and resolution log will be provided to Client prior to final deployment.
  • 2.5. Deployment and Go-Live Support: Deployment of the final web application to Client's designated hosting environment [specify hosting type/provider if known, e.g., AWS, Azure, shared hosting] and provision of initial post-launch support for a period of [e.g., 2 weeks] to address critical issues arising immediately after launch.

3. Timelines and Milestones

The Project shall commence on [Project Start Date] and is anticipated to be completed by [Project End Date], subject to Client's timely provision of necessary inputs and approvals. The following milestones and associated target dates are established for the Project:

  • Milestone 1: UI/UX Design Approval - Target Date: [Date for Milestone 1]. Deliverable: Final UI/UX Design Package.
  • Milestone 2: Front-End Development Completion - Target Date: [Date for Milestone 2]. Deliverable: Staging environment with completed front-end.
  • Milestone 3: Back-End Development & Integration Completion - Target Date: [Date for Milestone 3]. Deliverable: Staging environment with integrated front-end and back-end.
  • Milestone 4: User Acceptance Testing (UAT) & Bug Fixing - Target Date: [Date for Milestone 4]. Deliverable: UAT sign-off by Client.
  • Milestone 5: Final Deployment & Go-Live - Target Date: [Date for Milestone 5]. Deliverable: Live website.

Delays caused by Client's failure to provide timely feedback, content, or approvals as reasonably requested by Service Provider may result in adjustments to the Project timeline and, if significant, may necessitate a change order. Service Provider shall promptly notify Client of any anticipated delays and propose revised timelines for Client's review and approval. Any material deviation from these timelines by Service Provider without prior Client approval shall be communicated immediately, along with a proposed mitigation plan.

4. Fees and Payment Terms

Client shall pay Service Provider a total fixed fee of [Total Project Fee Amount in Currency, e.g., $XX,XXX.00 USD] for the successful completion of all Deliverables and Services outlined in this SOW. This fixed fee is inclusive of all Service Provider's costs, expenses, and charges related to the Project, unless explicitly stated otherwise in this SOW.

Payment shall be made by Client to Service Provider according to the following schedule, contingent upon the successful completion and Client's acceptance of the corresponding milestone Deliverables: [e.g., 25% upon SOW signing; 25% upon Milestone 1 completion; 25% upon Milestone 3 completion; 25% upon Milestone 5 completion]. Invoices will be submitted upon milestone completion and are due net [e.g., thirty (30)] days from the invoice date. Late payments shall accrue interest at the rate of [e.g., 1.5%] per month or the maximum rate permitted by law, whichever is less.

5. Client Responsibilities

Client acknowledges and agrees that its timely cooperation and provision of information are essential for the successful execution of the Project. Client shall designate a primary point of contact for the Project who will be responsible for providing timely feedback, approvals, and necessary content, including text, images, and other digital assets, in a format specified by Service Provider. Client shall ensure that all provided content is accurate, complete, and free from any third-party intellectual property claims or encumbrances.

Client is responsible for providing access to all necessary systems, accounts, and information, including but not limited to hosting credentials, domain registrar access, and any third-party API keys, as reasonably required by Service Provider to perform the services. Any delays or additional work incurred by Service Provider due to Client's failure to fulfill these responsibilities in a timely manner may result in an adjustment to the Project timeline and/or additional fees, subject to a formal change order process as outlined in Section 6.

6. Change Management

Any changes to the scope of work, Deliverables, or timelines outlined in this SOW must be formally documented and mutually agreed upon by both Parties through a written Change Order. A Change Order shall describe the proposed changes, their impact on the Project scope, Deliverables, timelines, and fees, and shall be signed by authorized representatives of both Client and Service Provider before implementation.

Requests for changes may be initiated by either Party. Upon receipt of a change request, Service Provider shall provide Client with an assessment of the impact of the proposed change within [e.g., five (5)] business days. No work on the proposed changes shall commence until a formal Change Order has been executed. Minor clarifications or adjustments that do not alter the core scope, Deliverables, or fees may be handled through documented email correspondence between the designated project managers.

7. Confidentiality

Both Parties acknowledge that in the course of performing their obligations under this SOW, they may have access to or be exposed to confidential and proprietary information belonging to the other Party. "Confidential Information" shall include, but not be limited to, business plans, financial information, customer lists, technical data, product designs, and any other information designated as confidential or which, by its nature, would reasonably be understood to be confidential. Each Party agrees to maintain the confidentiality of the other Party's Confidential Information and to use it solely for the purpose of fulfilling its obligations under this SOW and the MSA.

The receiving Party shall not disclose, reproduce, or transmit the Confidential Information to any third party without the prior written consent of the disclosing Party, except to its employees, agents, or subcontractors who have a need to know such information for the performance of this SOW and are bound by confidentiality obligations no less stringent than those contained herein. This obligation of confidentiality shall survive the termination or expiration of this SOW and the MSA for a period of [e.g., five (5)] years, or indefinitely for trade secrets, and shall not apply to information that is publicly available, independently developed, or required to be disclosed by law.

8. Intellectual Property

Unless otherwise specified in the MSA, upon full and final payment of all fees due under this SOW, Service Provider hereby assigns to Client all right, title, and interest in and to all Intellectual Property Rights (including, but not limited to, copyrights, trademarks, and trade secrets) in the Deliverables created specifically for Client under this SOW, excluding any pre-existing Service Provider tools, methodologies, or third-party components incorporated therein. Service Provider shall execute any documents reasonably requested by Client to perfect such assignment.

Service Provider retains all Intellectual Property Rights in its pre-existing tools, methodologies, and general know-how used in the development of the Deliverables, and grants Client a perpetual, non-exclusive, worldwide, royalty-free license to use such pre-existing materials solely as necessary for the operation and maintenance of the Deliverables. Client shall not reverse engineer, decompile, or disassemble any such pre-existing Service Provider materials. Both parties warrant that their respective contributions to the Project will not infringe upon the intellectual property rights of any third party.

9. Warranties

Service Provider warrants that the services performed under this SOW will be performed in a professional and workmanlike manner, in accordance with generally accepted industry standards and practices. Service Provider further warrants that the Deliverables will substantially conform to the specifications set forth in this SOW and will be free from material defects in design and functionality for a period of [e.g., ninety (90)] days following the date of final acceptance by Client. This warranty does not cover issues arising from Client's misuse, modification, or unauthorized alteration of the Deliverables, or from third-party software or hardware not provided by Service Provider.

In the event of a breach of the foregoing warranty during the warranty period, Service Provider's sole obligation and Client's exclusive remedy shall be for Service Provider to use commercially reasonable efforts to correct the non-conforming Deliverables or re-perform the services at no additional charge to Client. If Service Provider is unable to correct the non-conformity within a reasonable time, Client may, at its option, terminate the affected portion of this SOW and receive a refund of fees paid for the non-conforming Deliverables or services. EXCEPT AS EXPRESSLY SET FORTH IN THIS SOW, SERVICE PROVIDER MAKES NO OTHER WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING WITHOUT LIMITATION, ANY IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, OR NON-INFRINGEMENT.

10. Indemnification

Each Party (the "Indemnifying Party") shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless the other Party (the "Indemnified Party"), its officers, directors, employees, and agents from and against any and all claims, liabilities, damages, losses, and expenses, including reasonable attorneys' fees and costs, arising out of or in connection with any third-party claim alleging that the Indemnifying Party's performance under this SOW or its Deliverables infringe upon any patent, copyright, trademark, or trade secret of any third party, or that arise from the Indemnifying Party's gross negligence or willful misconduct.

The Indemnified Party shall provide prompt written notice of any such claim to the Indemnifying Party and shall provide reasonable cooperation to the Indemnifying Party in the defense of such claim, at the Indemnifying Party's expense. The Indemnifying Party shall have sole control over the defense and settlement of any such claim; provided, however, that the Indemnifying Party shall not settle any claim that imposes any obligation or liability on the Indemnified Party without the Indemnified Party's prior written consent, which shall not be unreasonably withheld.

11. Limitation of Liability

TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW, IN NO EVENT SHALL EITHER PARTY BE LIABLE TO THE OTHER PARTY OR ANY THIRD PARTY FOR ANY INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, CONSEQUENTIAL, PUNITIVE, OR EXEMPLARY DAMAGES, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO, DAMAGES FOR LOSS OF PROFITS, REVENUE, DATA, OR USE, INCURRED BY THE OTHER PARTY OR ANY THIRD PARTY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION IN CONTRACT OR TORT, EVEN IF SUCH PARTY HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES. THIS LIMITATION APPLIES REGARDLESS OF THE CAUSE OF ACTION, INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE.

NOTWITHSTANDING ANYTHING TO THE CONTRARY CONTAINED HEREIN, EACH PARTY'S TOTAL CUMULATIVE LIABILITY TO THE OTHER PARTY FOR ANY AND ALL CLAIMS ARISING OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THIS SOW, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE), OR OTHERWISE, SHALL NOT EXCEED THE TOTAL FEES PAID BY CLIENT TO SERVICE PROVIDER UNDER THIS SOW. THE FOREGOING LIMITATIONS SHALL NOT APPLY TO LIABILITY ARISING FROM BREACHES OF CONFIDENTIALITY, INDEMNIFICATION OBLIGATIONS, OR WILLFUL MISCONDUCT OR GROSS NEGLIGENCE OF A PARTY. THE LIMITATIONS SET FORTH IN THIS SECTION ARE FUNDAMENTAL ELEMENTS OF THE BASIS OF THE BARGAIN BETWEEN THE PARTIES.

12. Term and Termination

This SOW shall commence on the Effective Date and shall remain in effect until the completion of all Deliverables and Services described herein and the full payment of all fees, unless earlier terminated in accordance with the provisions of the MSA. The MSA's provisions regarding termination for cause, convenience, or insolvency shall apply to this SOW. Upon termination of this SOW, Client shall pay Service Provider for all services rendered and Deliverables completed up to the effective date of termination, on a pro-rata basis based on the progress of the Project as mutually agreed or reasonably determined by Service Provider.

In the event of termination, Service Provider shall promptly deliver to Client all work product, Deliverables, and Confidential Information in its possession or control, whether completed or in progress, for which Client has paid. The provisions of Sections 7 (Confidentiality), 8 (Intellectual Property), 9 (Warranties), 10 (Indemnification), 11 (Limitation of Liability), 13 (Governing Law), 14 (Dispute Resolution), and 15 (Entire Agreement / Relationship to MSA) shall survive any termination or expiration of this SOW.

13. Governing Law

This SOW shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of [Governing Jurisdiction], without regard to its conflict of laws principles. This choice of law is consistent with the governing law clause set forth in the MSA, ensuring uniformity in the legal framework applicable to the contractual relationship between the Parties.

The Parties expressly agree that the United Nations Convention on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods shall not apply to this SOW. Any dispute, claim, or controversy arising out of or relating to this SOW, including the determination of the scope or applicability of this SOW to arbitrate, shall be determined in accordance with the dispute resolution provisions outlined in the MSA.

14. Dispute Resolution

Any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this SOW, or the breach, termination, or invalidity thereof, shall be resolved in accordance with the dispute resolution procedures set forth in the MSA. This typically involves an initial period of good faith negotiation between senior management of both Parties, followed by mediation, and then, if necessary, binding arbitration or litigation in the agreed-upon jurisdiction.

The Parties agree to continue performing their respective obligations under this SOW during the pendency of any dispute resolution process, to the extent such obligations are not directly affected by the dispute. The prevailing Party in any legal action or arbitration arising from this SOW shall be entitled to recover its reasonable attorneys' fees and costs incurred in connection with such action or arbitration.

15. Entire Agreement / Relationship to MSA

This SOW, together with the MSA and any duly executed Change Orders, constitutes the entire agreement between the Parties with respect to the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior and contemporaneous understandings, agreements, representations, and warranties, both written and oral, with respect to such subject matter. In the event of any conflict or inconsistency between the terms of this SOW and the MSA, the terms of the MSA shall control and govern, unless this SOW specifically states that it is intended to supersede a particular provision of the MSA for the purposes of this SOW only.

No modification, amendment, or waiver of any provision of this SOW shall be effective unless in writing and signed by authorized representatives of both Parties. The headings in this SOW are for convenience of reference only and shall not affect its interpretation. Each Party acknowledges that it has had the opportunity to review this SOW with legal counsel of its choice.

16. Signatures

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties have executed this Statement of Work as of the Effective Date first written above.

[Client Full Legal Name]

By: ___________________________

Name: [Client Authorized Signatory Name]

Title: [Client Authorized Signatory Title]

Date: ___________________________

[Service Provider Full Legal Name]
