query: Draft a Sales Agreement for the sale of [product/service] to a client, including pricing, delivery terms, warranties, and payment schedule.

api1.updated_html:
SALES AGREEMENT

This Sales Agreement (hereinafter referred to as the "Agreement") is entered into and made effective as of [Effective Date] (the "Effective Date"), by and between [Seller Name], a corporation duly organized and existing under the laws of [Seller Jurisdiction], with its principal place of business located at [Seller Address] (hereinafter referred to as "Seller"), and [Buyer Name], a [Buyer Entity Type, e.g., corporation, individual] duly organized and existing under the laws of [Buyer Jurisdiction], with its principal place of business located at [Buyer Address] (hereinafter referred to as "Buyer").

WHEREAS, Seller is engaged in the business of manufacturing, distributing, and selling [Product/Service Description]; and

WHEREAS, Buyer desires to purchase from Seller, and Seller desires to sell to Buyer, certain [Product/Service Description] (hereinafter referred to as the "Goods" or "Services") under the terms and conditions hereinafter set forth;

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and promises contained herein, and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the parties agree as follows:

Definitions

For the purposes of this Sales Agreement, the following terms shall have the meanings ascribed to them below, unless the context clearly indicates otherwise:

"Agreement" refers to this Sales Agreement, including all its schedules, exhibits, and any amendments thereto, entered into between the Seller and the Buyer.

"Seller" means [Seller's Full Legal Name], a [State of Incorporation/Jurisdiction] [Type of Entity, e.g., corporation, LLC] with its principal place of business located at [Seller's Address], and its successors and assigns.

"Buyer" means [Client's Full Legal Name], a [State of Incorporation/Jurisdiction] [Type of Entity, e.g., corporation, individual] with its principal place of business/residence located at [Client's Address], and its permitted successors and assigns.

"Product(s)/Service(s)" means the [Product/Service Name(s)] and/or services specifically described in Schedule A attached hereto, including all components, accessories, documentation, and any related deliverables or services provided by the Seller under this Agreement.

"Effective Date" means [Effective Date], the date on which this Agreement becomes legally binding upon both the Seller and the Buyer.

"Purchase Price" means the total monetary consideration payable by the Buyer to the Seller for the Product(s)/Service(s) as set forth in Section [X] (Pricing and Payment) of this Agreement.

"Delivery Date(s)" means the date(s) on which the Product(s) are to be delivered to the Buyer, or the Service(s) are to commence or be completed, as specified in Schedule B (Delivery Terms) or as otherwise agreed upon in writing by the Parties.

"Warranty Period" means the duration during which the Seller provides warranties for the Product(s)/Service(s) as detailed in Section [Y] (Warranties) of this Agreement, commencing from the respective Delivery Date.

1. Term and Termination

This Sales Agreement (the "Agreement") shall commence on the [Effective Date] and shall continue in full force and effect until all obligations hereunder have been fully performed by both [Party A] and [Party B], unless terminated earlier in accordance with the provisions set forth herein. Either party may terminate this Agreement for convenience by providing [Notice Period] days' prior written notice to the other party; provided, however, that any such termination shall not relieve either party of any obligations accrued prior to the effective date of termination, including but not limited to payment obligations for products/services delivered or expenses incurred up to the termination date. Furthermore, either party may terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice to the other party if the other party commits a material breach of any term or condition of this Agreement and fails to cure such breach within [Cure Period] days after receiving written notice of the breach. Upon termination of this Agreement for any reason, [Party B] shall promptly pay [Party A] all outstanding amounts due for products/services rendered or expenses incurred up to the effective date of termination. Clauses relating to warranties, limitation of liability, intellectual property, confidentiality, and governing law shall survive the termination or expiration of this Agreement.

2. Payment Terms

The total purchase price for the [Product/Service] shall be [Product/Service Price] [Currency], payable by [Party B] to [Party A] in accordance with the following schedule and terms. A non-refundable initial deposit of [Deposit Amount] [Currency] shall be due upon the signing of this Agreement. The remaining balance of [Remaining Balance Amount] [Currency] shall be due and payable in full no later than [Payment Due Date] or upon delivery of the [Product/Service], whichever occurs first. All payments shall be made via [Specify Payment Method, e.g., wire transfer to Party A's designated bank account, certified check], and funds must be cleared on or before the due date. Any amounts not paid when due shall accrue interest at the rate of [Interest Rate]% per annum, compounded monthly, or the maximum rate permitted by law, whichever is less, from the due date until paid in full. [Party B] shall be responsible for all applicable sales, use, excise, and other taxes, duties, or charges imposed by any governmental authority in connection with the sale of the [Product/Service], excluding taxes on [Party A]'s income.

3. Confidentiality

Both [Seller Name] (hereinafter referred to as "Seller") and [Buyer Name] (hereinafter referred to as "Buyer") acknowledge that during the course of fulfilling this Sales Agreement, each party may disclose to the other certain proprietary or confidential information. "Confidential Information" shall include, but not be limited to, all non-public information, whether oral, written, or visual, concerning a party's business, products, services, financial data, pricing strategies, customer lists, technical data, trade secrets, marketing plans, and any other information designated as confidential or which, by its nature or the circumstances of its disclosure, would reasonably be understood to be confidential.

The receiving party agrees to use the disclosing party's Confidential Information solely for the purpose of performing its obligations or exercising its rights under this Agreement and for no other purpose whatsoever. The receiving party shall maintain the Confidential Information in strict confidence, using at least the same degree of care as it uses to protect its own confidential information of a similar nature, but in no event less than a reasonable degree of care. The receiving party shall not, without the prior written consent of the disclosing party, disclose or permit the disclosure of any Confidential Information to any third party, except to its employees, agents, or subcontractors who have a legitimate "need to know" such information for the purposes of this Agreement and who are bound by confidentiality obligations no less protective than those set forth herein.

The obligations of confidentiality set forth herein shall not apply to information that: (a) is or becomes publicly known through no fault of the receiving party; (b) was rightfully known to the receiving party, without restriction, prior to disclosure by the disclosing party; (c) is independently developed by the receiving party without use of or reference to the disclosing party's Confidential Information; (d) is rightfully obtained by the receiving party from a third party without restriction on disclosure; or (e) is required to be disclosed by law, regulation, or court order, provided that the receiving party provides prompt written notice to the disclosing party of such requirement prior to disclosure, if legally permissible, to allow the disclosing party to seek a protective order or other appropriate remedy.

Upon termination or expiration of this Agreement, or at any time upon the disclosing party's written request, the receiving party shall promptly return to the disclosing party or destroy all Confidential Information (including all copies thereof) in its possession or control, and, upon request, certify in writing its compliance with this obligation. The confidentiality obligations set forth in this Section 3 shall survive the termination or expiration of this Agreement for a period of five (5) years, except for trade secrets, which shall remain confidential indefinitely.

4. Intellectual Property

4.1. All intellectual property rights, including but not limited to patents, copyrights, trademarks, trade secrets, and any other proprietary rights, embodied in or associated with the [Product/Service] provided under this Agreement, shall remain the sole and exclusive property of [Seller] or its licensors. This Agreement does not convey any ownership interest in such intellectual property to [Buyer].

4.2. Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, and upon full payment of the purchase price, [Seller] grants [Buyer] a non-exclusive, non-transferable, revocable license to use the [Product/Service] solely for its internal business operations and for the specific purpose for which it was acquired. [Buyer] shall not, directly or indirectly, reverse engineer, decompile, disassemble, modify, adapt, reproduce, distribute, sell, lease, sublicense, or create derivative works based on the [Product/Service] or any part thereof, except as expressly permitted herein or by applicable law.

4.3. [Seller] warrants that the [Product/Service], as delivered and used in accordance with the terms of this Agreement, will not infringe upon the intellectual property rights of any third party. [Seller] shall defend, indemnify, and hold harmless [Buyer] from and against any claims, damages, liabilities, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees) arising out of any third-party claim that the [Product/Service] infringes any intellectual property rights, provided that [Buyer] promptly notifies [Seller] of the claim, grants [Seller] sole control of the defense and settlement, and provides reasonable assistance.

4.4. [Buyer] shall indemnify and hold harmless [Seller] from and against any claims, damages, liabilities, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees) arising out of [Buyer]'s misuse, unauthorized modification, or breach of the intellectual property provisions set forth in this Section 4.

5. Warranties

[Seller] warrants that, for a period of [warranty period, e.g., twelve (12) months] from the date of delivery, the [product/service] will be free from material defects in workmanship and materials and will conform in all material respects to the specifications set forth in Exhibit A (if applicable) or as otherwise agreed upon in writing. This express warranty is extended solely to [Buyer] and is not transferable. [Seller]'s sole obligation and [Buyer]'s exclusive remedy for breach of this warranty shall be, at [Seller]'s option, to repair or replace the non-conforming [product/service] or part thereof, or to refund the purchase price for the non-conforming portion. [Buyer] must provide written notice of any alleged defect within [number] days of discovery of the defect and allow [Seller] a reasonable opportunity to inspect the [product/service].

This warranty does not cover defects or damages resulting from: (a) improper installation, maintenance, or operation by [Buyer] or third parties; (b) modifications or repairs not authorized or performed by [Seller]; (c) misuse, abuse, neglect, or accident; (d) normal wear and tear; (e) acts of God; or (f) any other cause not attributable to a defect in materials or workmanship. Furthermore, this warranty does not cover [specific exclusions, e.g., consumable parts, software bugs in third-party software, damage from power surges].

EXCEPT FOR THE EXPRESS WARRANTY SET FORTH ABOVE, [SELLER] MAKES NO OTHER WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, WITH RESPECT TO THE [PRODUCT/SERVICE], INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, ANY IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, NON-INFRINGEMENT, OR ARISING FROM COURSE OF DEALING, USAGE, OR TRADE PRACTICE. TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW, ALL SUCH OTHER WARRANTIES ARE HEREBY EXPRESSLY DISCLAIMED BY [SELLER].

6. Indemnification and Limitation of Liability

6.1 Indemnification. Each Party (the "Indemnifying Party") shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless the other Party, its affiliates, and their respective officers, directors, employees, and agents (collectively, the "Indemnified Parties") from and against any and all losses, damages, liabilities, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees) arising out of or in connection with: (a) any breach by the Indemnifying Party of any of its representations, warranties, or covenants set forth in this Agreement; (b) any gross negligence or willful misconduct of the Indemnifying Party; or (c) any third-party claim alleging that the [Product/Service] supplied by [Seller] infringes or misappropriates any intellectual property rights of a third party, provided that [Seller] is promptly notified of any such claim and is given sole control over the defense and settlement thereof. The Indemnified Party shall provide reasonable cooperation to the Indemnifying Party in the defense of any such claim.

6.2 Limitation of Liability. EXCEPT FOR OBLIGATIONS UNDER SECTION 6.1 (INDEMNIFICATION), BREACHES OF CONFIDENTIALITY, OR GROSS NEGLIGENCE OR WILLFUL MISCONDUCT, NEITHER PARTY SHALL BE LIABLE TO THE OTHER PARTY FOR ANY INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, CONSEQUENTIAL, SPECIAL, PUNITIVE, OR EXEMPLARY DAMAGES (INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, DAMAGES FOR LOSS OF BUSINESS, LOSS OF PROFITS, BUSINESS INTERRUPTION, LOSS OF DATA, OR LOSS OF GOODWILL) ARISING OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THIS AGREEMENT, REGARDLESS OF THE FORM OF ACTION, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE), STRICT LIABILITY, OR OTHERWISE, EVEN IF SUCH PARTY HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES. IN NO EVENT SHALL EITHER PARTY'S TOTAL AGGREGATE LIABILITY ARISING OUT OF OR RELATED TO THIS AGREEMENT EXCEED THE TOTAL AMOUNT PAID OR PAYABLE BY [Buyer] TO [Seller] UNDER THIS AGREEMENT FOR THE [Product/Service] IN THE TWELVE (12) MONTHS IMMEDIATELY PRECEDING THE EVENT GIVING RISE TO THE CLAIM. THE FOREGOING LIMITATIONS SHALL APPLY NOTWITHSTANDING ANY FAILURE OF ESSENTIAL PURPOSE OF ANY LIMITED REMEDY.

7. Governing Law and Dispute Resolution

This Agreement and any disputes or claims arising out of or in connection with it or its subject matter or formation (including non-contractual disputes or claims) shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of [Governing Jurisdiction], without regard to its conflict of laws principles. Any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement, or the breach, termination, or invalidity thereof, shall first be attempted to be resolved amicably through good faith negotiations between [Party A] and [Client Name]. If the parties are unable to resolve the dispute within thirty (30) days of the initial notification of the dispute, either party may submit the dispute to binding arbitration. The arbitration shall be conducted in accordance with the [Arbitration Rules, e.g., Commercial Arbitration Rules of the American Arbitration Association] then in effect, by a single arbitrator appointed in accordance with said rules. The seat of the arbitration shall be [Arbitration Location], and the language of the arbitration shall be English. The decision of the arbitrator shall be final and binding upon both parties, and judgment on the award rendered by the arbitrator may be entered in any court having jurisdiction thereof. The parties hereby waive any right to a jury trial in any proceeding arising out of or related to this Agreement.

Signatures

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties hereto have executed this Sales Agreement as of the Effective Date first written above, acknowledging their full understanding and acceptance of all terms and conditions contained herein. Each signatory warrants that they have the requisite authority to enter into this Agreement on behalf of their respective entity, thereby binding such entity to the covenants and obligations set forth herein. This Agreement may be executed in counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument.

FOR THE SELLER:

[Seller Company Name]

By: ___________________________________

Name: [Seller Signatory Name]

Title: [Seller Signatory Title]

Date: ___________________________________

FOR THE BUYER:

[Buyer Company Name]

By: ___________________________________

Name: [Buyer Signatory Name]

Title: [Buyer Signatory Title]

Date: ___________________________________

api2.updated_html:
SALES AGREEMENT

PARTIES

This Sales Agreement ("Agreement") is made and entered into as of [Date of Agreement] ("Effective Date"), by and between:

[Seller Company Name], a [State/Country] corporation, with its principal place of business at [Seller Address] ("Seller").

[Client Company Name], a [State/Country] corporation, with its principal place of business at [Client Address] ("Buyer").

RECITALS

WHEREAS, Seller is engaged in the business of manufacturing, distributing, and selling [brief description of Seller's business, e.g., high-quality industrial components];

WHEREAS, Buyer desires to purchase, and Seller desires to sell, certain [product/service type] as more fully described herein, subject to the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement.

1. DEFINITIONS

For the purposes of this Agreement, "Products" shall mean the [specific product/service name, e.g., "Model X Industrial Pump"] and any related accessories, components, or services explicitly listed in Schedule A attached hereto and incorporated by reference. This definition encompasses all specifications, quantities, and configurations as mutually agreed upon in writing by both Parties.

"Confidential Information" refers to any non-public information, whether commercial, financial, technical, or otherwise, disclosed by one Party (the "Disclosing Party") to the other Party (the "Receiving Party") in connection with this Agreement, identified as confidential or which, by the nature of the circumstances surrounding disclosure, ought to be treated as confidential. This includes, but is not limited to, pricing strategies, product designs, customer lists, and proprietary software.

2. SCOPE OF AGREEMENT AND PRODUCTS/SERVICES

Seller agrees to sell and Buyer agrees to purchase the [Product/Service Name] ("Products") as specified in detail in Schedule A, which includes, but is not limited to, quantity, model numbers, and any specific customizations or service levels. This Agreement exclusively governs the sale and purchase of these Products and any incidental services directly related to their delivery or installation, as explicitly outlined.

Any modifications, additions, or deviations from the Products or services described in Schedule A must be mutually agreed upon in writing by both Parties and may result in adjustments to the pricing, delivery schedule, and other terms. No oral representations or understandings shall be binding unless formally incorporated into this Agreement via a written amendment signed by authorized representatives of both Seller and Buyer.

3. PRICING AND PAYMENT TERMS

The total purchase price for the Products shall be [Total Amount in Words] ([Total Amount in Figures]), as detailed in Schedule A. This price is exclusive of any applicable sales, use, excise, value-added, or similar taxes, duties, or charges, which shall be the sole responsibility of the Buyer. All prices are quoted in [Currency, e.g., United States Dollars] unless otherwise specified.

Payment shall be made according to the following schedule: [e.g., 50% upon signing this Agreement, and the remaining 50% upon delivery and acceptance of the Products]. All payments must be made via [Payment Method, e.g., wire transfer] to the account designated by Seller. Any payments not received by the due date shall accrue interest at the rate of [Interest Rate, e.g., 1.5%] per month or the maximum rate permitted by law, whichever is less, calculated from the due date until the date of full payment.

4. DELIVERY AND ACCEPTANCE

Seller shall deliver the Products to Buyer's designated location at [Delivery Address] on or before [Delivery Date]. Delivery shall be made [Delivery Method, e.g., FOB Seller's facility], and title and risk of loss shall pass to Buyer upon [e.g., shipment from Seller's facility]. Buyer is responsible for all shipping costs, insurance, and import duties unless otherwise agreed in writing.

Buyer shall have [Number] business days following delivery to inspect the Products for conformity with Schedule A and notify Seller in writing of any non-conformities, defects, or shortages ("Defects"). Failure to provide such written notice within this period shall constitute acceptance of the Products. If Defects are reported, Seller shall, at its sole discretion, either replace the non-conforming Products or issue a credit for the purchase price of such Products.

5. WARRANTIES

Seller warrants that for a period of [Number] months from the date of delivery, the Products will be free from defects in material and workmanship and will conform substantially to the specifications set forth in Schedule A. This warranty is exclusive and in lieu of all other warranties, whether express or implied, including, but not limited to, any implied warranties of merchantability or fitness for a particular purpose.

This warranty does not cover defects or damage resulting from improper installation, misuse, abuse, unauthorized modification, or normal wear and tear. Buyer's sole and exclusive remedy for any breach of this warranty shall be, at Seller's option, the repair or replacement of the defective Products, or a refund of the purchase price for the defective Products. Buyer must return the defective Products to Seller, freight prepaid, for evaluation.

6. CONFIDENTIALITY

Each Party acknowledges that in the course of performing this Agreement, it may obtain or have access to Confidential Information of the other Party. The Receiving Party agrees to maintain the strict confidentiality of all such Confidential Information and to use it solely for the purpose of fulfilling its obligations under this Agreement. The Receiving Party shall not disclose, reproduce, or distribute the Disclosing Party's Confidential Information to any third party without the Disclosing Party's prior written consent.

The obligations of confidentiality shall survive the termination or expiration of this Agreement for a period of [Number] years. These obligations shall not apply to information that (a) is or becomes publicly available through no fault of the Receiving Party; (b) was known to the Receiving Party prior to its disclosure by the Disclosing Party; (c) is independently developed by the Receiving Party without use of or reference to the Disclosing Party's Confidential Information; or (d) is required to be disclosed by law or court order, provided the Receiving Party gives prompt notice to the Disclosing Party.

7. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY

All intellectual property rights, including but not limited to copyrights, patents, trademarks, and trade secrets, in and to the Products, including all designs, specifications, and documentation, are and shall remain the sole and exclusive property of the Seller. Nothing in this Agreement shall be construed as granting Buyer any license or right to use Seller’s intellectual property, except as strictly necessary for the normal operation and use of the purchased Products.

Buyer agrees not to reverse engineer, decompile, disassemble, or otherwise attempt to derive the source code, design, or underlying structure of the Products. Buyer further agrees not to copy, modify, or create derivative works based on the Products or any part thereof. Any intellectual property developed by Buyer during the use of the Products that incorporates Seller's intellectual property shall be assigned to Seller.

8. INDEMNIFICATION

Buyer agrees to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Seller, its affiliates, and their respective officers, directors, employees, and agents from and against any and all claims, liabilities, damages, losses, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees) arising out of or in connection with Buyer's (a) use of the Products in a manner not authorized by this Agreement or the Product documentation; (b) negligence or willful misconduct; or (c) breach of any term of this Agreement.

Seller agrees to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Buyer, its affiliates, and their respective officers, directors, employees, and agents from and against any and all claims, liabilities, damages, losses, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees) arising out of or in connection with any third-party claim that the Products, as delivered by Seller, infringe any valid patent, copyright, or trademark of such third party, provided Buyer promptly notifies Seller of such claim and cooperates in its defense.

9. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY

IN NO EVENT SHALL SELLER BE LIABLE FOR ANY INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, CONSEQUENTIAL, OR PUNITIVE DAMAGES, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO LOSS OF PROFITS, REVENUE, DATA, OR USE, INCURRED BY BUYER OR ANY THIRD PARTY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION IN CONTRACT OR TORT, EVEN IF SELLER HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES. THIS LIMITATION APPLIES REGARDLESS OF THE LEGAL THEORY UNDER WHICH SUCH DAMAGES ARE SOUGHT.

SELLER'S TOTAL AGGREGATE LIABILITY ARISING OUT OF OR RELATED TO THIS AGREEMENT, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, TORT, OR OTHERWISE, SHALL IN NO EVENT EXCEED THE TOTAL AMOUNT PAID BY BUYER TO SELLER FOR THE PRODUCTS GIVING RISE TO THE CLAIM. THE FOREGOING LIMITATIONS SHALL APPLY TO THE FULLEST EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW.

10. TERM AND TERMINATION

This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall remain in full force and effect until the completion of all obligations hereunder, unless terminated earlier in accordance with the provisions herein. Either Party may terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice if the other Party materially breaches any of its obligations under this Agreement and fails to cure such breach within [Number] days after receiving written notice thereof.

Upon termination of this Agreement for any reason, Buyer shall immediately pay to Seller all outstanding amounts due for Products delivered or services rendered prior to the effective date of termination. Termination shall not relieve either Party of any obligations or liabilities incurred prior to the effective date of termination, nor shall it affect any rights or remedies which have accrued to either Party prior to termination.

11. GOVERNING LAW

This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of [State, e.g., Delaware], without regard to its conflict of laws principles. The United Nations Convention on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods shall not apply to this Agreement.

12. DISPUTE RESOLUTION

Any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement, or the breach, termination, or invalidity thereof, shall first be attempted to be resolved through good faith negotiations between the Parties. If the dispute cannot be resolved through negotiation within [Number] days, the Parties agree to submit the dispute to binding arbitration administered by [Arbitration Association, e.g., the American Arbitration Association] in accordance with its Commercial Arbitration Rules.

The arbitration shall take place in [City, State], and the award rendered by the arbitrator(s) shall be final and binding upon both Parties, and judgment may be entered thereon in any court having jurisdiction thereof. Each Party shall bear its own costs and attorneys' fees incurred in connection with the arbitration, unless otherwise determined by the arbitrator(s).

SIGNATURES

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties have executed this Sales Agreement as of the Effective Date first written above.

SELLER:

 

____________________________________

By: [Authorized Signatory Name]

Title: [Authorized Signatory Title]

Date: ______________________________

BUYER:

 

____________________________________

By: [Authorized Signatory Name]

Title: [Authorized Signatory Title]

Date: ______________________________

SCHEDULE A - PRODUCTS/SERVICES AND PRICING

1. Products/Services:

[Detailed list of products/services, including quantity, model numbers, specifications, and any customizations. E.g.,]

  • Item 1: [Product Name/Service Description] - Quantity: [Number] - Unit Price: [Amount]
  • Item 2: [Product Name/Service Description] - Quantity: [Number] - Unit Price: [Amount]
  • [Add more items as needed]

2. Total Price: [Total Amount in Figures] ([Total Amount in Words])

3. Payment Schedule:

  • [e.g., 50% down payment due on Effective Date: [Amount]]
  • [e.g., Remaining 50% due upon delivery and acceptance: [Amount]]

4. Delivery Details:

Target Delivery Date: [Delivery Date]

Delivery Location: [Delivery Address]

Shipping Method: [e.g., Ground Freight, Air Cargo]

query: Draft a Service Level Agreement for a SaaS company defining uptime guarantees, support response times, and penalties for non-compliance.

api1.updated_html:
SERVICE LEVEL AGREEMENT

This Service Level Agreement ("SLA" or "Agreement") is entered into on this [Effective Date], by and between [SaaS Provider Name], a corporation duly organized and existing under the laws of [Jurisdiction of SaaS Provider], with its principal place of business located at [Address of SaaS Provider] ("Provider"), and [Customer Name], a [Legal Entity Type, e.g., corporation, individual] duly organized and existing under the laws of [Jurisdiction of Customer], with its principal place of business located at [Address of Customer] ("Customer"). This Agreement supplements and is incorporated by reference into the Master Service Agreement or Terms of Service previously executed or agreed upon by the Parties, establishing the specific terms and conditions governing the availability, performance, and support of the Provider's Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) offerings, including defined uptime guarantees, support response times, and the remedies or penalties applicable in the event of non-compliance with the service levels herein.

1. Definitions

For the purposes of this Service Level Agreement (hereinafter referred to as "SLA"), the following terms shall have the meanings ascribed to them below:

"Service(s)" refers to the specific software-as-a-service application(s) and related functionalities provided by [SaaS Provider Name] to [Customer Name] as detailed in the primary Service Agreement between the parties.

"Uptime" or "Service Availability" means the percentage of total time during a given calendar month that the core functionalities of the Services are operational and accessible to [Customer Name], excluding periods of Scheduled Maintenance or Force Majeure Events.

"Downtime" means any period during which the core functionalities of the Services are unavailable or inaccessible to [Customer Name] due to a failure attributable to [SaaS Provider Name]'s infrastructure or software, excluding Scheduled Maintenance, Customer-side issues, or Force Majeure Events.

"Support Request" means a formal communication initiated by [Customer Name] through the designated channels (e.g., support portal, email) to report an issue, incident, or request technical assistance regarding the Services.

"Response Time" refers to the maximum period, measured from the time a Support Request is logged by [Customer Name] in accordance with the specified procedures, within which [SaaS Provider Name] will acknowledge receipt of the Support Request and begin diagnostic efforts.

"Service Credit" means the monetary credit, calculated as a percentage of the monthly recurring fees for the affected Services, that [SaaS Provider Name] may provide to [Customer Name] as the sole and exclusive remedy for [SaaS Provider Name]'s failure to meet the guaranteed Service Levels as set forth herein.

"Scheduled Maintenance" refers to planned periods of time, communicated in advance by [SaaS Provider Name] to [Customer Name], during which the Services may be temporarily unavailable for updates, upgrades, or routine maintenance. Such periods are excluded from Downtime calculations.

2. Term

This Service Level Agreement ("SLA") shall commence on the [Effective Date] ("Effective Date") and shall remain in full force and effect for an initial period of [Initial Term, e.g., twelve (12) months] from the Effective Date (the "Initial Term"). Following the Initial Term, this SLA shall automatically renew for successive additional periods of [Renewal Term, e.g., one (1) year] each (each, a "Renewal Term"), unless either Party provides written notice of its intent not to renew to the other Party at least [Notice Period, e.g., ninety (90) days] prior to the end of the then-current Initial Term or Renewal Term, as applicable. Such notice must be delivered in accordance with the notice provisions set forth in Section [X. Notices] of the underlying Service Agreement between [Party A] and [Party B]. The Initial Term and any subsequent Renewal Terms are collectively referred to herein as the "Term." Notwithstanding any termination or expiration of this SLA, certain obligations and rights as specified in the underlying Service Agreement, including but not limited to confidentiality and payment obligations, shall survive such termination or expiration.

3. Service Level Objectives

[Party A] commits to providing the [Service] to [Party B] in accordance with the following Service Level Objectives (SLOs). These SLOs represent the minimum performance standards for the [Service] and are subject to the terms and conditions outlined in this Service Level Agreement.

3.1 Uptime Guarantee: [Party A] guarantees a Monthly Uptime Percentage of 99.9% for the core [Service] platform. The Monthly Uptime Percentage is calculated as the total number of minutes in a given calendar month minus the total number of minutes of Downtime suffered in the same calendar month, divided by the total number of minutes in the same calendar month. Downtime is defined as periods when the [Service] is unavailable to [Party B] for reasons other than Scheduled Maintenance, Force Majeure events, or issues attributable to [Party B]'s infrastructure or third-party services not under [Party A]'s direct control. Scheduled Maintenance will be communicated to [Party B] at least [Number] hours in advance and will typically occur during off-peak hours.

3.2 Support Response Times: [Party A] commits to the following initial response times for support requests submitted through its designated support channels, categorized by severity:

  • Critical (Severity 1): Complete service outage impacting all users – Response within [Number] hour.
  • High (Severity 2): Significant feature degradation or intermittent service unavailability impacting multiple users – Response within [Number] hours.
  • Medium (Severity 3): Minor feature degradation or non-critical issues impacting a single user – Response within [Number] business hours.
  • Low (Severity 4): General inquiries, feature requests, or documentation questions – Response within [Number] business days.
These response times apply during [Party A]'s standard business hours, [Time Range] [Time Zone], [Days of Week]. For Critical (Severity 1) issues, [Party A] will endeavor to provide 24/7 initial response.

3.3 Data Backup and Recovery: [Party A] shall perform daily backups of [Party B]'s data stored within the [Service] platform. In the event of data loss attributable to [Party A]'s negligence or system failure, [Party A] commits to restoring [Party B]'s data from the most recent available backup within [Number] hours of identifying the issue, to the extent commercially reasonable and technically feasible.

3.4 Monitoring and Reporting: [Party A] utilizes industry-standard monitoring tools to track the performance and availability of the [Service]. Upon request, and no more frequently than once per calendar month, [Party A] will provide [Party B] with a report detailing the Monthly Uptime Percentage for the preceding month, along with a summary of any major incidents and their resolution.

4. Service Credits and Remedies

4.1. **Entitlement to Service Credits.** If [SaaS Provider] fails to meet the Uptime Guarantee set forth in Section 2 or the Support Response Time commitments set forth in Section 3 of this Service Level Agreement ("SLA"), [Customer] shall be entitled to receive Service Credits as its sole and exclusive remedy, subject to the terms and conditions outlined herein. Service Credits represent a percentage of the [Customer]'s Monthly Subscription Fee for the affected Service during the calendar month in which the SLA breach occurred.

4.2. **Calculation of Service Credits.** The amount of Service Credits shall be determined based on the severity and duration of the non-compliance, as follows:

  • For Uptime Guarantee breaches: If the Monthly Uptime Percentage falls below the guaranteed threshold, Service Credits will be calculated as [Service Credit Percentage]% of the Monthly Subscription Fee for each percentage point (or fraction thereof) the Uptime Percentage falls below the guarantee, up to a maximum.
  • For Support Response Time breaches: If the average response time for critical support tickets exceeds the guaranteed threshold for a calendar month, Service Credits may be awarded at a fixed percentage, e.g., [Fixed Support Credit Percentage]% of the Monthly Subscription Fee, or based on a tiered structure for repeated or severe breaches.

4.3. **Maximum Service Credits.** The maximum aggregate Service Credits issued to [Customer] for all SLA breaches in any single calendar month shall not exceed [Maximum Service Credit Percentage]% of the Monthly Subscription Fee for that month. Service Credits are non-transferable and cannot be exchanged for cash.

4.4. **Claim Process.** To claim Service Credits, [Customer] must submit a written request to [SaaS Provider] within [Service Credit Claim Period] days following the end of the calendar month in which the SLA breach occurred. The request must include sufficient detail to validate the breach, including, but not limited to, the dates and times of the incident(s), affected services, and a description of the impact. Failure to submit a timely and adequately detailed claim will result in forfeiture of the right to receive Service Credits for that incident.

4.5. **Issuance and Application of Service Credits.** Upon validation of a legitimate SLA breach claim by [SaaS Provider], the applicable Service Credits will be applied to [Customer]'s subsequent invoice(s) for the Service, typically within [Service Credit Issuance Period] days of validation. Service Credits will only be applied against future payments for the Service and will not result in a refund or cash payment to [Customer].

4.6. **Sole and Exclusive Remedy.** NOTWITHSTANDING ANYTHING TO THE CONTRARY IN THIS AGREEMENT, THE SERVICE CREDITS PROVIDED FOR IN THIS SECTION 4 CONSTITUTE [CUSTOMER]'S SOLE AND EXCLUSIVE REMEDY, AND [SAAS PROVIDER]'S SOLE AND EXCLUSIVE LIABILITY, FOR ANY FAILURE BY [SAAS PROVIDER] TO MEET THE UPTIME GUARANTEE OR SUPPORT RESPONSE TIME COMMITMENTS SET FORTH IN THIS AGREEMENT.

4.7. **Exclusions.** Service Credits shall not be issued for performance issues or unavailability of the Service (i) caused by factors outside of [SaaS Provider]'s reasonable control, including, without limitation, any force majeure event or Internet access or related problems beyond the demarcation point of the Service; (ii) that resulted from any actions or inactions of [Customer] or any third party; (iii) that resulted from [Customer]'s equipment, software, or other technology and/or third-party equipment, software, or other technology (other than third-party equipment within [SaaS Provider]'s direct control); (iv) during scheduled maintenance windows as notified by [SaaS Provider] in accordance with Section [Relevant Section Number, e.g., 5.2] of this SLA; or (v) arising from [Customer]'s breach of the main service agreement.

5. Payment Terms

[Customer Name] shall pay [SaaS Provider Name] all fees for the services provided under the Subscription Agreement and this Service Level Agreement ("SLA") in accordance with the payment schedule outlined in the Subscription Agreement. Invoices will be issued [monthly/annually] in advance of the service period, commencing from the [Effective Date].

All undisputed invoices are due and payable within [Number] ([e.g., thirty (30)]) days from the invoice date. Payments shall be made in [Currency, e.g., United States Dollars (USD)] via [specified payment method, e.g., electronic funds transfer (EFT) or credit card], as specified by [SaaS Provider Name] in the invoice.

Any amounts not paid when due shall accrue interest at the rate of [Percentage, e.g., one and one-half percent (1.5%)] per month or the maximum rate permitted by law, whichever is lower, from the due date until paid. [SaaS Provider Name] reserves the right to suspend or terminate services, including access to the SaaS platform, for any undisputed amounts that remain unpaid for more than [Number] ([e.g., sixty (60)]) days past the due date, following [Number] ([e.g., five (5)]) business days' written notice to [Customer Name].

All fees are exclusive of any applicable taxes, duties, or government charges, including but not limited to value-added tax (VAT), sales tax, and withholding tax, which shall be the sole responsibility of [Customer Name]. [SaaS Provider Name] will invoice [Customer Name] for such taxes where legally required, and [Customer Name] agrees to pay such taxes unless a valid tax exemption certificate is provided to [SaaS Provider Name] prior to invoicing.

6. Confidentiality

6.1. For the purposes of this Service Level Agreement (the "SLA"), "Confidential Information" shall mean any and all non-public, proprietary, or confidential information disclosed by one Party (the "Disclosing Party") to the other Party (the "Receiving Party"), whether orally, in writing, or by observation, that is designated as confidential or that, by its nature, would reasonably be understood to be confidential. This includes, but is not limited to, trade secrets, business plans, financial data, customer lists, technical information, software architecture, performance metrics, security procedures, pricing strategies, marketing plans, and the terms and conditions of this SLA.

6.2. The Receiving Party agrees to maintain the Confidential Information in strict confidence and to use it solely for the purpose of fulfilling its obligations under this SLA. The Receiving Party shall not disclose, disseminate, or otherwise make available any Confidential Information to any third party without the prior written consent of the Disclosing Party, except as expressly permitted herein.

6.3. The Receiving Party may disclose Confidential Information only to those of its employees, officers, directors, agents, or subcontractors who have a legitimate "need to know" such information for the purpose of performing the Receiving Party's obligations under this SLA, provided that such individuals are bound by confidentiality obligations at least as stringent as those contained herein and the Receiving Party remains responsible for any breach by such individuals.

6.4. The obligations of confidentiality set forth in this Section 6 shall not apply to information that: (a) is or becomes publicly available through no fault of the Receiving Party; (b) was rightfully in the Receiving Party's possession prior to disclosure by the Disclosing Party; (c) is independently developed by the Receiving Party without use of or reference to the Disclosing Party's Confidential Information; (d) is rightfully obtained by the Receiving Party from a third party without restriction on disclosure; or (e) is required to be disclosed by law, regulation, or court order, provided that the Receiving Party provides prompt written notice to the Disclosing Party to allow the Disclosing Party to seek a protective order or other appropriate remedy.

6.5. Upon the termination or expiration of this SLA, or upon the Disclosing Party's earlier written request, the Receiving Party shall promptly return to the Disclosing Party or destroy all tangible and electronic copies of the Confidential Information, including all notes, extracts, or other reproductions, and shall certify in writing to the Disclosing Party that all such Confidential Information has been returned or destroyed.

6.6. The confidentiality obligations set forth in this Section 6 shall survive the termination or expiration of this SLA for a period of five (5) years from the [Effective Date], or indefinitely for information constituting a trade secret under applicable law.

7. Intellectual Property

All intellectual property rights, including but not limited to copyrights, patents, trademarks, trade secrets, and other proprietary rights, in and to the [SaaS Platform Name] (the "Platform"), its underlying software, technology, algorithms, documentation, and any modifications, enhancements, or derivative works thereof, are and shall remain the exclusive property of [Service Provider Name] or its licensors. This Service Level Agreement (SLA) does not convey any ownership interest in or to the Platform to [Customer Name], but rather grants a limited, revocable, non-exclusive, non-transferable right of use as set forth in the Master Service Agreement between the Parties, solely for [Customer Name]'s internal business operations.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, [Customer Name] retains all intellectual property rights in and to all data, information, content, and materials provided by [Customer Name] or its authorized users and uploaded, transmitted, or processed through the Platform ("Customer Data"). [Customer Name] grants [Service Provider Name] a limited, non-exclusive, royalty-free, worldwide license to use, reproduce, modify, and display the Customer Data solely for the purpose of providing the services hereunder, maintaining the Platform, and fulfilling its obligations under this SLA and the Master Service Agreement. This license shall terminate upon the expiration or termination of the Master Service Agreement.

Except for the express licenses granted herein, neither Party shall acquire any right, title, or interest in or to the intellectual property of the other Party. [Customer Name] shall not, directly or indirectly, reverse engineer, decompile, disassemble, or otherwise attempt to discover the source code, object code, or underlying structure, ideas, or algorithms of the Platform, or access the Platform to build a competitive product or service. Any feedback, suggestions, or improvements provided by [Customer Name] regarding the Platform may be used by [Service Provider Name] without any obligation or compensation to [Customer Name], and [Service Provider Name] shall own all intellectual property rights in such improvements.

8. Warranties

[SaaS Provider] warrants that the Services provided under this Service Level Agreement will be performed in a professional and workmanlike manner, consistent with generally accepted industry standards applicable to the provision of similar SaaS services. [SaaS Provider] further warrants that the Services, when used in accordance with the documentation provided, will substantially conform to the functional specifications and performance metrics set forth in this Agreement, including, without limitation, the Uptime Guarantee specified in Section [X. Uptime Guarantee] and the Support Response Times detailed in Section [Y. Support Services].

EXCEPT AS EXPRESSLY PROVIDED IN THIS SECTION 8 AND SECTION [X. Uptime Guarantee], [SaaS Provider] MAKES NO OTHER WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, STATUTORY OR OTHERWISE, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, NON-INFRINGEMENT, OR THOSE ARISING FROM A COURSE OF DEALING OR USAGE OF TRADE. [SaaS Provider] DOES NOT WARRANT THAT THE SERVICES WILL BE UNINTERRUPTED, ERROR-FREE, OR COMPLETELY SECURE, OR THAT ALL DEFECTS WILL BE CORRECTED.

The sole and exclusive remedy for any breach of the warranties set forth in this Section 8 shall be the service credits and other remedies expressly provided in Section [Z. Penalties for Non-Compliance] of this Agreement, subject to the limitations of liability set forth in Section [L. Limitation of Liability].

9. Indemnification

Each Party (the "Indemnifying Party") shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless the other Party (the "Indemnified Party") and its officers, directors, employees, and agents from and against any and all claims, losses, damages, liabilities, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees and court costs) arising out of or relating to:

(a) A material breach by the Indemnifying Party of any of its representations, warranties, or covenants set forth in this Service Level Agreement or the underlying Master Service Agreement;

(b) The gross negligence or willful misconduct of the Indemnifying Party in the performance of its obligations under this Service Level Agreement;

(c) For [SaaS Provider] as the Indemnifying Party: Any claim by a third party that the Services, as provided by [SaaS Provider] and used by [Customer] in accordance with this Agreement, infringe upon any intellectual property right of that third party; provided, however, that [SaaS Provider] shall have no obligation to indemnify [Customer] to the extent any such claim arises from (i) modifications to the Services by anyone other than [SaaS Provider], (ii) the combination of the Services with other products, services, or processes not provided or approved by [SaaS Provider], or (iii) [Customer]'s continued use of the Services after being notified of an alleged infringement or after [SaaS Provider] has provided a modified version of the Services designed to avoid the alleged infringement.

(d) For [Customer] as the Indemnifying Party: Any claim by a third party arising from [Customer]'s data, content, or materials uploaded, processed, or transmitted via the Services, or [Customer]'s unauthorized use of the Services.

The Indemnified Party shall provide prompt written notice of any such claim to the Indemnifying Party. The Indemnifying Party shall have sole control of the defense and all negotiations for the settlement of any such claim, provided that the Indemnified Party may participate in such defense at its own expense. The Indemnified Party shall provide reasonable assistance to the Indemnifying Party in the defense of such claim.

10. Limitation of Liability

NOTWITHSTANDING ANYTHING TO THE CONTRARY IN THIS SERVICE LEVEL AGREEMENT OR THE MASTER SERVICES AGREEMENT, EXCEPT FOR OBLIGATIONS TO PAY FEES, INDEMNIFICATION OBLIGATIONS, OR BREACHES OF CONFIDENTIALITY, NEITHER [SaaS Provider Name] NOR ITS AFFILIATES, OFFICERS, EMPLOYEES, AGENTS, SUPPLIERS, OR LICENSORS SHALL BE LIABLE FOR ANY INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, CONSEQUENTIAL, SPECIAL, PUNITIVE, OR EXEMPLARY DAMAGES, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO, DAMAGES FOR LOST PROFITS, LOST REVENUES, LOST DATA, BUSINESS INTERRUPTION, OR LOSS OF GOODWILL, ARISING OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THIS SERVICE LEVEL AGREEMENT OR THE PROVISION OR USE OF THE SAAS SERVICES, WHETHER BASED ON CONTRACT, TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE), STRICT LIABILITY, OR OTHERWISE, EVEN IF ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES.

IN NO EVENT SHALL THE TOTAL AGGREGATE LIABILITY OF [SaaS Provider Name] AND ITS AFFILIATES, OFFICERS, EMPLOYEES, AGENTS, SUPPLIERS, AND LICENSORS ARISING OUT OF OR RELATED TO THIS SERVICE LEVEL AGREEMENT EXCEED THE TOTAL FEES PAID BY [Customer Name] TO [SaaS Provider Name] FOR THE SAAS SERVICES DURING THE TWELVE (12) MONTHS IMMEDIATELY PRECEDING THE EVENT GIVING RISE TO THE CLAIM. THIS LIMITATION SHALL APPLY CUMULATIVELY FOR ALL CLAIMS AND SHALL NOT BE INCREASED BY THE EXISTENCE OF MORE THAN ONE INCIDENT OR CLAIM.

THE LIMITATIONS SET FORTH IN THIS SECTION ARE FUNDAMENTAL ELEMENTS OF THE BASIS OF THE BARGAIN BETWEEN [SaaS Provider Name] AND [Customer Name] AND REFLECT A FAIR ALLOCATION OF RISK BETWEEN THE PARTIES. THE SAAS SERVICES WOULD NOT BE PROVIDED WITHOUT SUCH LIMITATIONS. THIS SECTION SHALL APPLY TO THE FULLEST EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW.

11. Termination

This Service Level Agreement ("SLA") may be terminated under the following conditions, without prejudice to any other rights or remedies available to the parties:

11.1 Termination for Material Breach: Either [Party A] (the "Service Provider") or [Party B] (the "Customer") may terminate this SLA immediately upon written notice to the other party if the other party commits a material breach of any provision of this SLA and fails to cure such breach within [Number of Days] days after receiving written notice thereof. For the avoidance of doubt, a material breach by [Party A] shall include, but not be limited to, persistent and repeated failures to meet the Uptime Guarantee as defined in Section 3, or consistent non-compliance with the Support Response Times as defined in Section 4, where such failures are not adequately remedied through the application of Service Credits or other agreed-upon remedies, thereby fundamentally undermining the purpose of this SLA.

11.2 Termination by [Party B] for Persistent Non-Compliance: Notwithstanding Section 11.1, [Party B] may terminate this SLA and the underlying Master Service Agreement by providing [Number of Days] days' written notice to [Party A] if [Party A] fails to meet the Uptime Guarantee for [Number] consecutive months, or if the aggregate Service Credits issued to [Party B] exceed [Percentage]% of the monthly recurring service fees for [Number] consecutive months, indicating a systemic failure to provide the services at the agreed-upon quality levels which significantly impacts [Party B]'s operations.

11.3 Termination for Insolvency: Either party may terminate this SLA immediately upon written notice to the other party if the other party becomes insolvent, files for bankruptcy, makes an assignment for the benefit of creditors, or a receiver is appointed over any of its assets, or if any similar event occurs which materially impairs the other party's ability to perform its obligations hereunder.

11.4 Effect of Termination: Upon termination of this SLA for any reason, all rights and obligations of the parties hereunder shall cease, except for those provisions which by their nature are intended to survive termination (e.g., confidentiality, limitation of liability, and payment obligations accrued prior to termination). [Party A] shall have no further obligation to provide the services or support under this SLA, and [Party B] shall pay all outstanding fees and charges accrued up to the effective date of termination. Termination of this SLA shall not relieve either party of any obligations incurred prior to the effective date of termination.

12. Governing Law

This Service Level Agreement, and all matters arising out of or relating to this Agreement, including but not limited to its interpretation, validity, performance, and enforcement, shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the internal laws of the [Governing Jurisdiction], without giving effect to any choice or conflict of law provision or rule (whether of the [Governing Jurisdiction] or any other jurisdiction) that would cause the application of laws of any jurisdiction other than those of the [Governing Jurisdiction]. The Parties irrevocably agree that any legal action or proceeding arising out of or relating to this Agreement shall be brought exclusively in the federal or state courts located in [Governing Jurisdiction], and each Party irrevocably submits to the exclusive jurisdiction of such courts in any such action or proceeding. Each Party waives any objection to venue in such courts and any claim that such forum is an inconvenient forum.

13. Dispute Resolution

Any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Service Level Agreement (SLA), including its formation, interpretation, breach, termination, or validity, shall first be subject to good faith negotiations between [Party A] and [Party B]. The parties agree to use their best efforts to resolve any such dispute amicably.

If the parties are unable to resolve the dispute through negotiation within thirty (30) days of one party providing written notice of the dispute to the other, either party may escalate the matter to senior management representatives of both [Party A] and [Party B] for further discussion and resolution.

Should the dispute remain unresolved after an additional thirty (30) days following escalation, or such other period as the parties may mutually agree in writing, the parties irrevocably agree that any such dispute shall be finally settled by binding arbitration. The arbitration shall be administered by [Arbitration Institution Name], in accordance with its [Arbitration Rules] then in effect.

The arbitration shall be conducted by a single arbitrator appointed in accordance with the said rules. The seat of the arbitration shall be [Arbitration Location], and the language of the arbitration shall be English. The decision of the arbitrator shall be final and binding upon both parties, and judgment on the award rendered by the arbitrator may be entered in any court having jurisdiction thereof.

Each party shall bear its own costs and attorneys' fees, and the costs of the arbitration shall be borne equally by the parties, unless otherwise determined by the arbitrator based on the circumstances of the dispute. The parties agree that the arbitration proceedings and all information exchanged during the arbitration, including any settlement offers, shall be kept confidential, except as required by law.

This SLA and any disputes arising out of or in connection with it shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of [Governing Law Jurisdiction], without regard to its conflict of laws principles.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, nothing in this Section 13 shall prevent either party from seeking injunctive or other equitable relief from a court of competent jurisdiction to prevent the actual or threatened infringement, misappropriation, or violation of its copyrights, trademarks, trade secrets, patents, or other intellectual property rights.

14. Signatures

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties hereto have executed this Service Level Agreement as of the Effective Date, acknowledging their full understanding and acceptance of all terms, conditions, and obligations contained herein. Each signatory represents and warrants that they are duly authorized to execute this Agreement on behalf of their respective entity and to bind such entity to the terms and conditions hereof. This Agreement may be executed in counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument.

FOR THE SERVICE PROVIDER:

___________________________________
By: [Authorized Signatory Name]
Title: [Authorized Signatory Title]
[SaaS Company Name]
Date: [Date of Service Provider Signature]

FOR THE CUSTOMER:

___________________________________
By: [Authorized Signatory Name]
Title: [Authorized Signatory Title]
[Customer Company Name]
Date: [Date of Customer Signature]
api1.summary: The Service Level Agreement for your SaaS company has been successfully drafted, outlining uptime guarantees, support response times, and penalties for non-compliance.

api2.updated_html:
SERVICE LEVEL AGREEMENT

PARTIES

This Service Level Agreement ("SLA") is entered into by and between [SaaS Company Name], a corporation duly organized and existing under the laws of [State/Country of Incorporation], with its principal place of business at [SaaS Company Address] ("Service Provider"). The Service Provider offers cloud-based software-as-a-service solutions designed to [briefly describe service purpose, e.g., streamline project management and team collaboration], accessible via its proprietary platform.

AND

[Customer Company Name], a corporation duly organized and existing under the laws of [State/Country of Incorporation], with its principal place of business at [Customer Company Address] ("Customer"). The Customer desires to utilize the Service Provider's SaaS platform to support its business operations, specifically for [briefly describe customer's use case, e.g., enhancing internal communication and data management efficiency], and acknowledges the terms and conditions set forth herein.

1. DEFINITIONS

The following capitalized terms shall have the meanings set forth below for the purpose of this Agreement. These definitions are crucial for understanding the scope of obligations and entitlements, ensuring both parties have a clear and unambiguous interpretation of the service commitments and performance metrics detailed throughout this document. Any terms not expressly defined herein shall retain their common industry meaning.

"Service" refers to the specific software-as-a-service solution provided by the Service Provider to the Customer, as detailed in the Master Service Agreement or Order Form, including all associated features, functionalities, and any related documentation. This encompasses the core application, underlying infrastructure, and any supplementary services explicitly included in the Customer's subscription plan, excluding any third-party integrations or services not directly controlled by the Service Provider. "Uptime" signifies the percentage of time during a given calendar month that the Service is operational and accessible to the Customer, excluding periods of Scheduled Maintenance. "Downtime" means any period during which the Service is unavailable to the Customer, preventing access to or use of the core functionalities, excluding Scheduled Maintenance. "Scheduled Maintenance" refers to planned periods of Service unavailability for upgrades, updates, or routine maintenance, for which the Service Provider provides prior notice to the Customer. "Response Time" is the elapsed time from when a Customer submits a support request to when the Service Provider's support team acknowledges receipt of the request and begins active investigation. "Resolution Time" is the elapsed time from when a Customer submits a support request to when the Service Provider resolves the issue, providing a workaround or a permanent fix. "Service Credits" are monetary credits applied to future invoices, issued to the Customer as compensation for the Service Provider's failure to meet the Service Levels defined herein.

2. TERM

This SLA shall commence on the Effective Date of the Master Service Agreement or the initial Order Form, whichever is earlier, and shall remain in full force and effect for the entire duration of the Customer's subscription to the Service, including any renewal terms. The obligations and commitments outlined in this document are intrinsically linked to the active subscription period, ensuring continuous service quality assurances throughout the Customer's engagement with the Service Provider's platform.

Unless otherwise specified in the Master Service Agreement, this SLA will automatically renew for successive periods equal to the initial subscription term, provided the underlying Service subscription also renews. Either party may elect not to renew this SLA by providing written notice to the other party at least [Number] days prior to the expiration of the then-current term. Termination of the underlying Service Agreement will automatically terminate this SLA.

3. SERVICE AVAILABILITY (UPTIME GUARANTEES)

The Service Provider guarantees an Uptime of ninety-nine point nine percent (99.9%) for the Service during each calendar month ("Uptime Guarantee"). This guarantee applies to the core functionality of the Service and excludes any unavailability caused by factors beyond the Service Provider's reasonable control, such as force majeure events, Customer's internet connectivity issues, or third-party service failures not directly integrated or managed by the Service Provider. The calculation of Uptime shall be based on the Service Provider's internal monitoring systems, which are designed to accurately track Service availability from multiple global locations.

Downtime for the purpose of this Uptime Guarantee calculation specifically excludes periods of Scheduled Maintenance, which will be communicated to the Customer at least [Number] hours in advance. The Service Provider commits to scheduling such maintenance during off-peak hours, typically [Specify Time Window, e.g., 1:00 AM - 5:00 AM PST], to minimize disruption to the Customer's operations. In the event of any unscheduled Downtime, the Service Provider will use commercially reasonable efforts to restore the Service as quickly as possible and will provide status updates to the Customer through [Specify Communication Channel, e.g., status page, email notifications].

4. SUPPORT RESPONSE TIMES

The Service Provider commits to the following initial Response Times for support requests submitted by the Customer through the designated support channels (e.g., online portal, email). These times represent the maximum period within which the Service Provider will acknowledge the request and begin active investigation, categorized by the severity of the reported issue. The Customer is responsible for accurately categorizing the severity of their requests to ensure appropriate prioritization and response.

  • Critical (Service Unusable): Response Time within 1 hour, 24x7.
  • High (Major Functionality Impaired): Response Time within 4 hours, during business hours (9 AM - 5 PM, Monday - Friday, [Time Zone]).
  • Medium (Minor Functionality Impaired): Response Time within 8 business hours.
  • Low (General Inquiry/Feature Request): Response Time within 24 business hours.
The Service Provider will also strive to provide a Resolution Time for each issue, though specific resolution times may vary depending on the complexity of the problem. Regular updates on the status of open tickets will be provided to the Customer at intervals appropriate to the severity level, ensuring transparency throughout the resolution process.

5. SERVICE CREDITS (PENALTIES FOR NON-COMPLIANCE)

If the Service Provider fails to meet the Uptime Guarantee in any given calendar month, the Customer shall be eligible to receive Service Credits, calculated as a percentage of the monthly subscription fees for the affected Service. These Service Credits represent the Customer's sole and exclusive remedy for any failure by the Service Provider to meet the Uptime Guarantee. The maximum aggregate Service Credits issued in any single calendar month shall not exceed [Percentage, e.g., 10%] of the total monthly fees payable by the Customer for the affected Service.

To claim Service Credits, the Customer must submit a written request to the Service Provider within [Number, e.g., 30] days of the end of the month in which the Uptime Guarantee was not met, providing reasonable detail regarding the claimed Downtime. Service Credits will be applied against future invoices for the Service and are non-refundable and non-transferable. Service Credits will not be issued if the Downtime was due to factors outside the Service Provider's control, Customer's breach of the Agreement, or Customer's failure to utilize the Service in accordance with the documentation.

6. CONFIDENTIALITY

Each party acknowledges that in the performance of this Agreement, it may have access to or be exposed to confidential and proprietary information belonging to the other party ("Confidential Information"). Confidential Information includes, but is not limited to, trade secrets, business plans, financial data, customer lists, technical data, product designs, and any other information designated as confidential or which, by its nature, would reasonably be understood to be confidential. Both parties agree to maintain the strict confidentiality of such information and to use it solely for the purpose of fulfilling their obligations under this Agreement.

Neither party shall disclose, reproduce, or distribute the other party's Confidential Information to any third party without the prior written consent of the disclosing party, except as required by law or to its employees, agents, or subcontractors who have a legitimate need to know such information for the performance of this Agreement and are bound by confidentiality obligations at least as stringent as those contained herein. The obligations of confidentiality shall survive the termination or expiration of this Agreement for a period of [Number] years.

7. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY

All intellectual property rights, including copyrights, patents, trademarks, and trade secrets, in and to the Service, including its underlying software, platform, documentation, and any improvements or modifications thereto, are and shall remain the exclusive property of the Service Provider. This Agreement grants the Customer a limited, non-exclusive, non-transferable, revocable license to access and use the Service solely for its internal business operations during the Term, in accordance with the terms of the Master Service Agreement and this SLA. No ownership rights are transferred to the Customer under this Agreement.

The Customer retains all intellectual property rights in and to any data, information, or content uploaded, submitted, or otherwise provided by the Customer to the Service ("Customer Data"). The Customer grants the Service Provider a limited, non-exclusive, royalty-free license to use, process, and display the Customer Data solely for the purpose of providing and improving the Service to the Customer and as otherwise permitted by the Master Service Agreement. This license does not grant the Service Provider any ownership rights over Customer Data, and the Service Provider commits to handling Customer Data in accordance with its privacy policy and applicable data protection laws.

8. WARRANTIES

The Service Provider warrants that the Service will perform substantially in accordance with the specifications set forth in the documentation provided to the Customer and that it will use commercially reasonable efforts to provide the Service in a professional and workmanlike manner. The Service Provider further warrants that it has the necessary rights and licenses to provide the Service as contemplated by this Agreement. This warranty is subject to the Customer's proper use of the Service and does not cover issues arising from Customer's modifications, third-party software, or misuse of the Service.

EXCEPT AS EXPRESSLY PROVIDED IN THIS SECTION, THE SERVICE PROVIDER MAKES NO WARRANTIES OF ANY KIND, WHETHER EXPRESS, IMPLIED, STATUTORY, OR OTHERWISE, AND SPECIFICALLY DISCLAIMS ALL IMPLIED WARRANTIES, INCLUDING ANY WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, OR NON-INFRINGEMENT. THE SERVICE IS PROVIDED "AS IS" AND "AS AVAILABLE." The Customer warrants that it has the necessary rights to provide Customer Data to the Service Provider and that its use of the Service will comply with all applicable laws and regulations.

9. INDEMNIFICATION

The Service Provider shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless the Customer, its officers, directors, employees, and agents from and against any and all claims, damages, liabilities, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees) arising out of any third-party claim that the Service, as provided by the Service Provider and used in accordance with this Agreement, infringes or misappropriates any valid patent, copyright, trademark, or trade secret of such third party. This indemnification obligation is conditioned upon the Customer promptly notifying the Service Provider of any such claim, providing the Service Provider with sole control over the defense and settlement of the claim, and providing reasonable assistance at the Service Provider's expense.

The Customer shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless the Service Provider, its officers, directors, employees, and agents from and against any and all claims, damages, liabilities, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees) arising out of any third-party claim relating to Customer Data, including claims that Customer Data infringes or misappropriates any third party's intellectual property rights or violates any applicable laws or regulations, or claims arising from the Customer's breach of its obligations under this Agreement. The indemnifying party's obligations under this Section are contingent upon the indemnified party providing prompt written notice of any claim and cooperating in the defense.

10. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY

TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW, IN NO EVENT SHALL EITHER PARTY BE LIABLE FOR ANY INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, CONSEQUENTIAL, PUNITIVE, OR EXEMPLARY DAMAGES, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO DAMAGES FOR LOSS OF PROFITS, GOODWILL, USE, DATA, OR OTHER INTANGIBLE LOSSES (EVEN IF SUCH PARTY HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES), ARISING OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THIS AGREEMENT OR THE USE OR INABILITY TO USE THE SERVICE. THIS LIMITATION APPLIES REGARDLESS OF THE LEGAL THEORY, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE), STRICT LIABILITY, OR OTHERWISE.

NOTWITHSTANDING ANYTHING TO THE CONTRARY IN THIS AGREEMENT, THE TOTAL CUMULATIVE LIABILITY OF THE SERVICE PROVIDER TO THE CUSTOMER FOR ANY AND ALL CLAIMS ARISING OUT OF OR RELATING TO THIS AGREEMENT OR THE SERVICE, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, TORT, OR OTHERWISE, SHALL NOT EXCEED THE TOTAL FEES PAID BY THE CUSTOMER TO THE SERVICE PROVIDER FOR THE SERVICE DURING THE TWELVE (12) MONTHS IMMEDIATELY PRECEDING THE EVENT GIVING RISE TO THE CLAIM. THIS LIMITATION OF LIABILITY SHALL NOT APPLY TO LIABILITY ARISING FROM GROSS NEGLIGENCE, WILLFUL MISCONDUCT, FRAUD, OR BREACH OF CONFIDENTIALITY OBLIGATIONS BY EITHER PARTY.

11. TERMINATION

This SLA may be terminated by either party upon written notice if the other party materially breaches any provision of this SLA or the Master Service Agreement and fails to cure such breach within [Number, e.g., 30] days after receiving written notice thereof. A material breach includes, but is not limited to, non-payment of fees by the Customer or persistent failure to meet the Uptime Guarantee by the Service Provider. Termination of the Master Service Agreement will automatically result in the termination of this SLA.

Upon termination of this SLA for any reason, the Service Provider's obligation to provide the Service and the associated service levels shall cease immediately. The Customer shall pay all outstanding fees for services rendered up to the effective date of termination. Within [Number] days following termination, the Service Provider will, upon Customer's request, make Customer Data available for download in a standard format for a limited period, after which it will be securely deleted in accordance with the Service Provider's data retention policy.

12. GOVERNING LAW

This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of [State, e.g., Delaware], without regard to its conflict of laws principles. This choice of law ensures consistency and predictability in legal interpretation and enforcement, providing a clear framework for dispute resolution and contractual obligations for both parties involved in this Service Level Agreement.

13. DISPUTE RESOLUTION

Any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement, or the breach, termination, or validity thereof, shall first be subject to good faith negotiations between the parties. If the parties are unable to resolve the dispute through negotiation within [Number, e.g., 30] days, either party may elect to initiate mediation. The mediation shall be conducted by a mutually agreed-upon mediator in [City, State], with the costs of mediation shared equally by the parties.

If the dispute is not resolved through mediation within [Number, e.g., 60] days, or if either party declines mediation, the dispute shall be finally settled by binding arbitration in accordance with the rules of the American Arbitration Association (AAA) by a single arbitrator appointed in accordance with said rules. The arbitration shall take place in [City, State], and the judgment on the award rendered by the arbitrator may be entered in any court having jurisdiction thereof. This arbitration clause does not preclude either party from seeking injunctive relief in a court of competent jurisdiction for urgent matters.

SIGNATURES

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties hereto have executed this Service Level Agreement as of the Effective Date.

SERVICE PROVIDER:

 

____________________________________

By: [Authorized Signatory Name]

Title: [Authorized Signatory Title]

Date: [Date]

CUSTOMER:

 

____________________________________

By: [Authorized Signatory Name]

Title: [Authorized Signatory Title]

Date: [Date]
