query: Draft a Proposal Agreement outlining project scope, pricing, deliverables, and expiration date of the offer for [service].

api1.updated_html:
PROPOSAL AGREEMENT FOR [SERVICE]

This Proposal Agreement (the "Agreement") is made and entered into as of [Effective Date] (the "Effective Date"), by and between [Proposer Legal Name], a [Proposer Entity Type] organized and existing under the laws of [Proposer Jurisdiction], with its principal place of business located at [Proposer Address] ("Proposer"), and [Client Legal Name], a [Client Entity Type] organized and existing under the laws of [Client Jurisdiction], with its principal place of business located at [Client Address] ("Client").

This Agreement formally outlines the comprehensive terms and conditions under which Proposer shall provide the specified [service] services (the "Services") to Client. It meticulously details the project scope, the agreed-upon pricing structure, the defined deliverables, and the stipulated timeline for completion, ensuring clarity and mutual understanding between both parties.

This document constitutes a binding offer from Proposer to Client, valid until the Expiration Date explicitly stated within this Agreement. Upon formal acceptance by the Client, as evidenced by a duly authorized signature, this Proposal Agreement shall transform into a legally enforceable contract, governing the entire engagement and all aspects related to the provision of the aforementioned Services, thereby establishing the rights and obligations of both Proposer and Client.

1. Definitions

For the purposes of this Proposal Agreement, the following terms shall have the meanings ascribed to them below, unless the context clearly indicates otherwise:

1.1. "Agreement" or "Proposal Agreement" refers to this entire document, including all its sections, schedules, and appendices, which outlines the terms and conditions under which [Party A] proposes to provide the [Service] to [Party B].

1.2. "Client" or "[Party B]" refers to the entity or individual identified as [Party B] in the introductory section of this Agreement, who is considering or accepting the proposal for the [Service] from [Party A].

1.3. "Service Provider" or "[Party A]" refers to the entity or individual identified as [Party A] in the introductory section of this Agreement, who is offering to provide the [Service] as detailed herein.

1.4. "Effective Date" means the date upon which this Proposal Agreement is fully executed by both [Party A] and [Party B], or the date specified as [Effective Date] if later, whichever applies.

1.5. "Services" or "Project" refers to the specific tasks, activities, and work to be performed by [Party A] for [Party B], as comprehensively described in Section [X. Project Scope] of this Agreement, specifically pertaining to the [Service].

1.6. "Deliverables" means the tangible or intangible outputs, results, or products that [Party A] is obligated to provide to [Party B] upon completion of the Services, as further detailed in Section [Y. Deliverables] of this Agreement.

1.7. "Pricing" or "Fees" refers to the total monetary compensation or other consideration payable by [Party B] to [Party A] for the provision of the Services and Deliverables, as specified in Section [Z. Pricing and Payment Terms] of this Agreement.

1.8. "Expiration Date" means the date, [Expiration Date], after which this Proposal Agreement, including all its terms, conditions, and pricing, shall become null and void and of no further effect, unless formally accepted by [Party B] in writing prior to this date.

2. Term

This Proposal Agreement (the "Proposal") shall become effective upon the date of its issuance, referred to as the "Effective Date," which is [Effective Date]. This Proposal, including all terms, conditions, pricing, and deliverables outlined herein, shall remain valid and open for acceptance by [Client Name] for a period of [Number] calendar days from the Effective Date, specifically until [Expiration Date], unless otherwise extended in writing by [Service Provider Name]. Should [Client Name] not formally accept this Proposal within this specified period by executing a counter-signed copy or providing written confirmation of acceptance, this Proposal shall automatically expire and become null and void, with no further obligation or liability on the part of either party.

Upon formal acceptance of this Proposal by [Client Name] within the aforementioned validity period, the terms and conditions herein shall constitute a binding contract for the provision of [service]. The term of the resulting project engagement shall commence upon such acceptance and shall continue until all deliverables outlined in Section 3 ("Deliverables") have been fully provided, all payments due under Section 4 ("Pricing and Payment Terms") have been received by [Service Provider Name], or until earlier termination in accordance with any termination clauses that may be subsequently agreed upon in a definitive service agreement or statement of work.

3. Payment Terms

The total compensation payable by [Client Name] to [Consultant Name] for the comprehensive services outlined in Section 2 ("Project Scope and Deliverables") of this Agreement shall be [Total Project Fee] [Currency]. This fee is exclusive of any applicable taxes, duties, or levies, which shall be the sole responsibility of [Client Name] unless otherwise explicitly stated herein.

Payment shall be rendered according to the following schedule: [Payment Schedule, e.g., "an initial payment of 50% ([Initial Payment Amount] [Currency]) upon the Effective Date of this Agreement, with the remaining 50% ([Final Payment Amount] [Currency]) due upon the successful completion and acceptance of all deliverables as defined in Section 2"]. All invoices issued by [Consultant Name] shall be payable within [Number] days from the date of issuance.

In the event that any payment is not received by [Consultant Name] on or before its stipulated due date, [Client Name] shall be subject to a late payment charge calculated at the rate of [Late Payment Interest Rate]% per month, or the maximum rate permitted by applicable law, whichever is less, on the overdue balance, compounded monthly, commencing from the original due date until the date of full payment.

Furthermore, [Consultant Name] reserves the right, at its sole discretion and without prejudice to any other rights or remedies available, to suspend all services and deliverables under this Agreement until all outstanding payments, including any accrued late payment charges, are received in full. Such suspension shall not relieve [Client Name] of its payment obligations.

All payments shall be made in [Currency] via [Payment Method, e.g., bank transfer to the account specified by [Consultant Name]]. Any bank charges or fees associated with the payment transfer shall be borne by [Client Name].

4. Confidentiality

Both parties, [Party A] (the "Proposer") and [Party B] (the "Client"), acknowledge that during the course of discussions and negotiations related to this Proposal Agreement, they may exchange or have access to certain non-public, proprietary, or sensitive information concerning the other party's business, operations, technology, financial data, customer lists, or strategies (collectively, "Confidential Information"). Each party agrees to treat all such Confidential Information as strictly confidential and to use it solely for the purpose of evaluating and potentially entering into a definitive service agreement based on this Proposal. Neither party shall disclose, reproduce, or otherwise make available any Confidential Information to any third party without the prior written consent of the disclosing party, except as may be required by law or to its employees, agents, or professional advisors who have a legitimate need to know such information for the purposes of this Proposal and who are bound by confidentiality obligations no less stringent than those contained herein. The obligations of confidentiality hereunder shall survive the expiration or termination of this Proposal Agreement for a period of five (5) years, or indefinitely for trade secrets. Upon the termination or expiration of this Proposal Agreement, or upon the disclosing party's request, the receiving party shall promptly return or destroy all copies of Confidential Information received from the disclosing party, and certify such destruction in writing.

5. Intellectual Property

Unless otherwise explicitly stated in this Proposal Agreement or any subsequent Statement of Work, all intellectual property rights, including but not limited to copyrights, trademarks, trade secrets, patents, and other proprietary rights, in and to the deliverables, work product, and any other materials specifically created by [Service Provider Name] for [Client Name] under this Agreement (collectively, "Project Deliverables") shall, upon full and final payment of all fees due hereunder, be exclusively owned by [Client Name]. This includes all source code, object code, designs, graphics, text, and documentation associated with the [Project Name] project.

[Service Provider Name] retains all intellectual property rights in any pre-existing materials, tools, methodologies, software, or components developed independently of this Agreement and used or incorporated into the performance of the [service] for [Client Name] ("Service Provider Background IP"). [Service Provider Name] grants [Client Name] a non-exclusive, perpetual, worldwide, royalty-free, irrevocable license to use, reproduce, modify, and display the Service Provider Background IP solely to the extent necessary for [Client Name] to utilize, operate, and enjoy the full functionality of the Project Deliverables. This license does not grant [Client Name] the right to sublicense, distribute, or otherwise exploit the Service Provider Background IP independently of the Project Deliverables.

[Service Provider Name] warrants that the Project Deliverables, to the best of its knowledge and belief, will not infringe upon the intellectual property rights of any third party. [Client Name] agrees to provide prompt notice to [Service Provider Name] of any claim of infringement related to the Project Deliverables. [Service Provider Name] may, at its sole discretion, use the Project Deliverables for its portfolio, marketing, and promotional purposes, provided such use does not disclose any confidential information of [Client Name] or compromise the security or proprietary nature of [Client Name]'s operations.

6. Warranties

[Service Provider] warrants that the [Service] provided under this Proposal Agreement shall be performed in a professional and workmanlike manner, in accordance with generally accepted industry standards and practices applicable to the provision of such services. [Service Provider] further warrants that all personnel assigned to perform the [Service] are suitably qualified, trained, and experienced to execute their respective tasks.

Any deliverables, if applicable, resulting from the [Service] shall substantially conform to the specifications and descriptions outlined in Section 3 (Deliverables) of this Agreement. [Service Provider] warrants that, to the best of its knowledge, the [Service] and any deliverables provided will not infringe upon any valid copyright, patent, trade secret, or other proprietary rights of any third party.

[Client] warrants that it has the full power and authority to enter into this Agreement and to perform its obligations hereunder. [Client] further warrants that it will provide timely access to necessary information, resources, and personnel as reasonably required by [Service Provider] to perform the [Service] and that all information provided by [Client] to [Service Provider] will be accurate and complete in all material respects.

EXCEPT AS EXPRESSLY STATED IN THIS SECTION, [SERVICE PROVIDER] DISCLAIMS ALL OTHER WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, AND ANY WARRANTIES ARISING FROM COURSE OF DEALING, USAGE, OR TRADE PRACTICE. No oral or written information or advice given by [Service Provider] or its authorized representatives shall create a warranty or in any way increase the scope of the warranties provided herein.

7. Indemnification

[Party A] (the "Service Provider") shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless [Party B] (the "Client") and its officers, directors, employees, agents, successors, and assigns from and against any and all claims, demands, liabilities, losses, damages, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees and litigation expenses) arising out of or in connection with: (a) any breach by [Party A] of any representation, warranty, or covenant contained in this Proposal Agreement; (b) any act or omission of [Party A], its employees, subcontractors, or agents, constituting negligence, gross negligence, or willful misconduct in the performance of the [Service] described herein; or (c) any claim that the [Service] or any part thereof, as delivered by [Party A], infringes upon, violates, or misappropriates the intellectual property rights of any third party.

[Party B] shall provide [Party A] with prompt written notice of any such claim, demand, or suit and shall cooperate with [Party A] in the defense thereof. [Party A] shall have sole control over the defense and settlement of any such claim, provided that [Party A] shall not settle any claim in a manner that imposes any obligation or liability on [Party B] without [Party B]'s prior written consent, which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld or delayed. This indemnification obligation shall survive the termination or expiration of this Proposal Agreement.

8. Limitation of Liability

NOTWITHSTANDING ANY OTHER PROVISION OF THIS AGREEMENT, NEITHER [Party A] NOR [Party B] SHALL BE LIABLE FOR ANY INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, CONSEQUENTIAL, SPECIAL, PUNITIVE, OR EXEMPLARY DAMAGES, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO, DAMAGES FOR LOSS OF PROFITS, REVENUE, GOODWILL, DATA, OR USE, INCURRED BY THE OTHER PARTY OR ANY THIRD PARTY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION IN CONTRACT OR TORT, ARISING OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THIS AGREEMENT OR THE [Service] PROVIDED HEREUNDER, EVEN IF ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES.

FURTHERMORE, IN NO EVENT SHALL THE TOTAL CUMULATIVE LIABILITY OF [Party A] FOR ANY AND ALL CLAIMS, LOSSES, OR DAMAGES ARISING OUT OF OR RELATING TO THIS AGREEMENT OR THE [Service] PROVIDED, REGARDLESS OF THE FORM OF ACTION, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, TORT, OR OTHERWISE, EXCEED THE TOTAL FEES PAID OR PAYABLE BY [Party B] TO [Party A] UNDER THIS AGREEMENT FOR THE SPECIFIC [Service] GIVING RISE TO THE CLAIM DURING THE TWELVE (12) MONTHS IMMEDIATELY PRECEDING THE EVENT GIVING RISE TO THE CLAIM. THE FOREGOING LIMITATION SHALL NOT APPLY TO LIABILITY ARISING FROM [Party A]'s GROSS NEGLIGENCE, WILLFUL MISCONDUCT, FRAUD, OR BREACH OF ITS CONFIDENTIALITY OR INDEMNIFICATION OBLIGATIONS AS EXPRESSLY STATED IN THIS AGREEMENT. THE LIMITATIONS SET FORTH IN THIS SECTION ARE FUNDAMENTAL ELEMENTS OF THE BASIS OF THE BARGAIN BETWEEN THE PARTIES AND REFLECT AN AGREED-UPON ALLOCATION OF RISK, WITHOUT WHICH [Party A] WOULD NOT ENTER INTO THIS AGREEMENT.

9. Termination

This Proposal Agreement, and any resultant legally binding agreement formed upon its acceptance, may be terminated under the following conditions:

9.1. Expiration of Offer: This Proposal Agreement, as an offer, shall automatically terminate and become null and void if not formally accepted by [Party B] through a signed counter-signature or other mutually agreed-upon method of acceptance, and received by [Party A] on or before [Expiration Date] at 5:00 PM [Time Zone]. Upon such expiration, neither party shall have any further obligations or liabilities hereunder with respect to the proposed [Service].

9.2. Termination for Material Breach: Either [Party A] or [Party B] (the "Non-Breaching Party") may terminate any resultant agreement formed from the acceptance of this Proposal Agreement immediately by providing written notice to the other party (the "Breaching Party") if the Breaching Party commits a material breach of any of its obligations, covenants, or representations under this Agreement and fails to cure such breach within [Number] days after receiving written notice thereof from the Non-Breaching Party. A material breach shall include, but not be limited to, non-payment of undisputed fees when due, failure to deliver agreed-upon deliverables, or violation of confidentiality provisions.

9.3. Termination for Insolvency: Either party may terminate any resultant agreement formed from the acceptance of this Proposal Agreement immediately upon written notice if the other party (a) becomes insolvent or generally fails to pay its debts as they become due; (b) files a petition for bankruptcy, reorganization, or similar relief, or has such a petition filed against it that is not dismissed within sixty (60) days; (c) makes an assignment for the benefit of creditors; or (d) ceases to conduct business in the ordinary course.

9.4. Effect of Termination: Upon the effective date of termination of any resultant agreement, (a) [Party B] shall immediately pay [Party A] all outstanding fees and expenses for services rendered and deliverables provided up to the termination date; (b) each party shall promptly return to the other all Confidential Information and proprietary materials belonging to the other party; and (c) all rights and obligations of the parties under this Agreement shall cease, except for those provisions which, by their nature, are intended to survive termination, including but not limited to Sections pertaining to Confidentiality, Intellectual Property, Limitation of Liability, Indemnification, and Governing Law.
api1.summary: The proposal agreement has been successfully drafted, detailing the project scope, pricing, deliverables, and the expiration date of the offer for the specified service.

api2.updated_html:
PROPOSAL AGREEMENT

This Proposal Agreement (the "Agreement") is made and entered into as of this [Effective Date, e.g., 1st day of January, 2024] (the "Effective Date"), by and between:

[Company Name], a company duly organized and existing under the laws of [State/Country of Incorporation], with its principal place of business located at [Company Address] (hereinafter referred to as "Service Provider").

AND

[Client Name], a [Client Type, e.g., corporation/individual] duly organized and existing under the laws of [State/Country of Incorporation/Residence], with its principal place of business/residence located at [Client Address] (hereinafter referred to as "Client").

1. Project Scope and Services

Service Provider proposes to render comprehensive [Service Name, e.g., Digital Marketing Strategy and Implementation Services] to the Client, as detailed herein. This encompasses an initial strategic consultation phase, development of a tailored marketing plan, execution of agreed-upon campaigns across specified channels (e.g., SEO, SEM, social media, content marketing), and ongoing performance monitoring and optimization. The scope is specifically designed to achieve [Client's primary objective, e.g., increased online visibility and lead generation] within the agreed timeframe.

The Services explicitly include, but are not limited to, [Specific service component 1, e.g., conducting a comprehensive keyword research and competitive analysis], [Specific service component 2, e.g., creating and managing paid advertising campaigns on Google Ads and Facebook], and [Specific service component 3, e.g., developing and publishing 4 blog posts per month]. Any work falling outside of this defined scope, or requiring additional resources beyond those contemplated in this Agreement, shall be subject to a separate written change order mutually agreed upon by both parties, which may incur additional fees.

2. Deliverables

In consideration for the Services provided, Service Provider shall furnish the Client with the following specific deliverables ("Deliverables"): [Specific Deliverable 1, e.g., a comprehensive Digital Marketing Strategy Document outlining objectives, target audience, channels, and KPIs], [Specific Deliverable 2, e.g., monthly performance reports detailing campaign metrics, progress against KPIs, and strategic recommendations], and [Specific Deliverable 3, e.g., access to a shared project management platform for real-time updates and communication]. Each Deliverable shall be provided in a professional format suitable for Client's review and use.

All Deliverables shall be submitted to the Client for review and approval according to the timeline outlined in Section 5. Client shall have [Number] business days to review and provide feedback on each Deliverable. Should Client fail to provide feedback within this period, the Deliverable shall be deemed approved. Revisions requested by the Client that fall within the original scope will be completed by the Service Provider without additional charge, but excessive revisions or those stemming from a change in Client's requirements may be subject to additional fees as mutually agreed.

3. Pricing and Payment Terms

The total fixed price for the Services and Deliverables outlined in this Agreement shall be [Total Price in Words] ([Total Price in Numbers, e.g., $X,XXX.00] USD). This price is all-inclusive of Service Provider's fees and standard operational expenses directly related to the project. Any third-party costs, such as advertising spend, stock photography licenses, or premium software subscriptions, will be separately invoiced to the Client and require prior written approval from the Client before expenditure.

Payment shall be made by the Client to the Service Provider according to the following schedule: [Payment Schedule/Milestones, e.g., 50% ($X,XXX.00) upon signing of this Agreement; 25% ($X,XXX.00) upon completion of the Digital Marketing Strategy Document; and the remaining 25% ($X,XXX.00) upon final delivery of all Deliverables]. Invoices will be issued by Service Provider and are due within [Number, e.g., fifteen (15)] days of receipt. Late payments may accrue interest at the rate of [Percentage, e.g., one and a half percent (1.5%)] per month, or the maximum rate permitted by law, whichever is less.

4. Term and Expiration of Offer

This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall remain in full force and effect until the completion of all Services and Deliverables, or until terminated earlier in accordance with the provisions of Section 11. The offer set forth in this Proposal Agreement, including all pricing, scope, and terms, is valid for a period of [Number, e.g., thirty (30)] days from the Effective Date. To accept this offer, Client must execute this Agreement and return a signed copy to Service Provider by [Offer Expiration Date, e.g., February 1, 2024].

Should the Client fail to execute and return this Agreement by the specified Offer Expiration Date, this proposal shall be deemed withdrawn and null and void, with no further obligation or liability on the part of the Service Provider. Any subsequent engagement between the parties for similar services would require a new proposal and negotiation of terms. Service Provider reserves the right to modify or withdraw this offer at any time prior to its acceptance by the Client.

5. Confidentiality

Both parties acknowledge that during the course of this Agreement, they may obtain confidential information concerning the other party's business, including but not limited to, trade secrets, business plans, financial data, customer lists, and technical information. Each party agrees to maintain the strictest confidentiality of such information, using the same degree of care that it uses to protect its own confidential information of a similar nature, but in no event less than reasonable care. This obligation of confidentiality shall survive the termination of this Agreement for a period of [Number, e.g., three (3)] years.

Confidential Information does not include information that (a) is or becomes publicly available through no fault of the receiving party; (b) was already in the receiving party's possession prior to disclosure by the disclosing party, as evidenced by written records; (c) is independently developed by the receiving party without use of or reference to the disclosing party's Confidential Information; or (d) is rightfully obtained by the receiving party from a third party without restriction on disclosure. Neither party shall disclose, reproduce, or use the other party's Confidential Information for any purpose other than as necessary to perform its obligations under this Agreement.

6. Governing Law

This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of [Governing Jurisdiction, e.g., the State of Delaware], without regard to its conflict of laws principles. The parties expressly agree that the United Nations Convention on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods shall not apply to this Agreement.

Any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement, or the breach, termination, or invalidity thereof, shall be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the state and federal courts located in [City, State of Governing Jurisdiction, e.g., Wilmington, Delaware]. Each party hereby irrevocably consents to the personal jurisdiction of such courts and waives any objection to the laying of venue in such courts.

Signatures

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have executed this Proposal Agreement as of the Effective Date first written above.

SERVICE PROVIDER:

___________________________________

By: [Authorized Signatory Name]

Title: [Authorized Signatory Title]

Date: ______________________________

CLIENT:

___________________________________

By: [Authorized Signatory Name]

Title: [Authorized Signatory Title]

Date: ______________________________

query: Draft a Vendor Agreement for a [product/material] supplier detailing delivery schedules, payment terms, quality standards, and termination.

api1.updated_html:
VENDOR AGREEMENT

This Vendor Agreement (the "Agreement") is made and entered into as of this [Effective Date], by and between [Client Name], a [Client Legal Structure, e.g., corporation] organized and existing under the laws of [Client Jurisdiction], with its principal place of business located at [Client Address] ("Client"), and [Vendor Name], a [Vendor Legal Structure, e.g., limited liability company] organized and existing under the laws of [Vendor Jurisdiction], with its principal place of business located at [Vendor Address] ("Vendor").

WHEREAS, Client desires to procure and Vendor desires to supply certain [product/material] (the "Goods") in accordance with the terms and conditions set forth herein; and

WHEREAS, this Agreement establishes the comprehensive framework governing the supply relationship, including but not limited to, detailed delivery schedules, precise payment terms, stringent quality standards, and clear provisions for the termination of this Agreement, ensuring mutual understanding and enforceability between the parties.

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and promises contained herein, and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the parties agree as follows:

1. Definitions

For the purposes of this Vendor Agreement, the following terms shall have the meanings ascribed to them below, unless the context clearly indicates otherwise:

"Agreement" refers to this Vendor Agreement, including all its recitals, clauses, schedules, and any duly executed amendments or addenda thereto.

"Vendor" shall mean [Vendor Legal Name], a [State/Country of Incorporation] corporation with its principal place of business at [Vendor Address], and its successors and permitted assigns, being the party responsible for supplying the Products/Materials to the Client.

"Client" shall mean [Client Legal Name], a [State/Country of Incorporation] corporation with its principal place of business at [Client Address], and its successors and permitted assigns, being the party purchasing the Products/Materials from the Vendor.

"Products/Materials" shall collectively refer to the [Specify Product/Material Type, e.g., raw chemicals, finished goods, specific components] and any other goods or items specifically described in any Purchase Order issued by the Client and accepted by the Vendor under the terms of this Agreement.

"Order" or "Purchase Order" means a written or electronically transmitted request for Products/Materials issued by the Client to the Vendor, specifying quantities, delivery dates, prices, and other relevant terms, which, upon acceptance by the Vendor, becomes a binding commitment under this Agreement.

"Effective Date" means [Effective Date], the date upon which this Agreement becomes legally binding and effective between the Vendor and the Client.

"Confidential Information" means any non-public information, whether commercial, financial, technical, operational, or otherwise, disclosed by one party (the "Disclosing Party") to the other party (the "Receiving Party") in connection with this Agreement, whether in written, oral, electronic, or any other form, and which is marked as confidential or which, by its nature, would reasonably be understood to be confidential.

2. Term

This Agreement shall commence on the [Effective Date] (the "Effective Date") and shall continue in full force and effect for an initial period of [Initial Term, e.g., one (1) year] from the Effective Date (the "Initial Term"). Following the expiration of the Initial Term, this Agreement shall automatically renew for successive additional periods of [Renewal Term, e.g., one (1) year] each (each, a "Renewal Term"), unless either Party provides written notice of its intent not to renew to the other Party at least [Number, e.g., sixty (60)] days prior to the expiration of the then-current Initial Term or Renewal Term, as applicable. Notwithstanding the foregoing, this Agreement may be terminated earlier by either Party in accordance with the provisions of Section 10 (Termination) of this Agreement. The Initial Term and any subsequent Renewal Terms shall collectively be referred to as the "Term" of this Agreement.

3. Product/Material Supply, Delivery, and Acceptance

3.1. **Supply Obligation:** [Vendor Name] hereby agrees to supply and deliver to [Buyer Name] the [Product/Material] as specified in detail within Appendix A (Product Specifications) and in strict accordance with the quantities, quality standards, and other terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement. All [Product/Material] supplied shall be new, of merchantable quality, fit for the purpose intended, and free from defects in material and workmanship.

3.2. **Delivery Schedules and Location:** Deliveries of the [Product/Material] shall be made strictly in accordance with the delivery schedules outlined in Appendix B (Delivery Schedule) or as otherwise mutually agreed upon in writing by both Parties. Time is of the essence for all deliveries under this Agreement. All deliveries shall be made to [Delivery Location] or such other location as [Buyer Name] may designate in writing, utilizing appropriate packaging and shipping methods to prevent damage or deterioration during transit. [Vendor Name] shall bear all costs associated with packaging, shipping, and insurance until acceptance by [Buyer Name].

3.3. **Risk of Loss:** Risk of loss or damage to the [Product/Material] shall transfer from [Vendor Name] to [Buyer Name] only upon successful delivery, inspection, and formal acceptance by [Buyer Name] at the designated delivery location. Prior to acceptance, [Vendor Name] shall bear all risk of loss or damage.

3.4. **Inspection and Acceptance:** [Buyer Name] shall have a period of [Acceptance Period] business days from the date of delivery to inspect the [Product/Material] for conformity with the specifications, quality standards, quantities, and other requirements set forth in this Agreement. [Buyer Name] may, at its sole discretion, reject any [Product/Material] that does not conform to the agreed-upon standards, is damaged, or is otherwise non-compliant with the terms of this Agreement.

3.5. **Non-Conforming Goods:** In the event of rejection, [Buyer Name] shall notify [Vendor Name] in writing, specifying the nature of the non-conformity. [Vendor Name] shall, at [Buyer Name]'s option, either promptly replace the non-conforming [Product/Material] at no additional cost to [Buyer Name] within [Replacement Period] business days or issue a full credit for the rejected items. [Vendor Name] shall be responsible for the cost of retrieving and disposing of any rejected [Product/Material] and any associated shipping costs.

3.6. **Documentation:** [Vendor Name] shall provide all necessary shipping documentation, including but not limited to, packing slips, bills of lading, certificates of origin, and certificates of analysis (if applicable), with each delivery. Failure to provide complete and accurate documentation may result in delayed acceptance or rejection of the delivery.

4. Quality Standards and Inspection

4.1. The Vendor warrants that all [Product/Material] supplied under this Agreement shall strictly conform to the specifications, drawings, samples, and other descriptions set forth in the attached Exhibit B, "Product Specifications Document" (hereinafter, the "[Specifications Document]"), and shall be free from defects in material, workmanship, and design, and fit for the purpose intended by [Party A]. The Vendor further warrants that all [Product/Material] shall comply with all applicable laws, regulations, and industry standards in effect at the time of delivery, including but not limited to those pertaining to safety, environmental protection, and quality management systems.

4.2. [Party A] or its designated agents shall have the right to inspect and test the [Product/Material] at any reasonable time and location, including at the Vendor's premises during manufacturing, and upon delivery at [Party A]'s designated receiving location. Such inspection shall not relieve the Vendor of its responsibility for supplying conforming [Product/Material] and shall not be deemed acceptance of the [Product/Material] if defects are subsequently discovered.

4.3. Upon delivery, [Party A] shall have a period of [Inspection Period] business days from the date of receipt to inspect the [Product/Material] for conformance with the [Specifications Document] and to notify the Vendor in writing of any defects, non-conformities, or discrepancies. Failure to provide such notice within the specified [Inspection Period] shall constitute acceptance of the [Product/Material], except for latent defects not reasonably discoverable during the initial inspection, which may be notified within a reasonable time after discovery, but in no event later than [Latent Defect Notification Period] days after delivery.

4.4. In the event of any non-conforming [Product/Material], [Party A] may, at its sole discretion, reject the entire shipment, require the Vendor to repair or replace the non-conforming [Product/Material] at the Vendor's sole expense, or accept the non-conforming [Product/Material] with an equitable price reduction. The Vendor shall, within [Remedy Period] business days of receiving notice of non-conformity, remedy such non-conformity to [Party A]'s satisfaction. All costs associated with the return, repair, replacement, and re-delivery of non-conforming [Product/Material], including transportation, handling fees, and any costs incurred by [Party A] due to such non-conformity, shall be borne solely by the Vendor.

5. Payment Terms

5.1 Invoicing: [Party B] (the "Vendor") shall submit detailed invoices to [Party A] (the "Purchaser") for all [product/material] supplied in accordance with the delivery schedules outlined in Section 3 of this Agreement. Invoices shall be submitted [e.g., monthly, upon delivery, bi-weekly] and shall include, at a minimum, the quantity of [product/material] supplied, the agreed-upon unit price, the total amount due, the invoice number, and the date of supply. All invoices must be accurate and comply with all applicable legal and tax requirements.

5.2 Payment Due Date: All undisputed invoices submitted by [Party B] shall be due and payable by [Party A] within [number of days, e.g., thirty (30)] calendar days from the date of [Party A]'s receipt of a valid and accurate invoice. Payments shall be made in [currency, e.g., United States Dollars (USD)] unless otherwise mutually agreed upon in writing by both Parties.

5.3 Payment Method: Payments shall be made via [e.g., electronic funds transfer (EFT) or wire transfer] to the bank account designated by [Party B] in writing, details of which shall be provided by [Party B] to [Party A] prior to the first payment. [Party B] shall be solely responsible for any bank charges, fees, or foreign exchange costs associated with receiving payments.

5.4 Late Payments: In the event that [Party A] fails to make payment on any undisputed invoice by the due date, [Party A] shall pay interest on the overdue amount at a rate of [e.g., one percent (1%)] per month, or the maximum rate permitted by applicable law, whichever is lower, calculated from the due date until the date of full payment. Such interest shall not prejudice [Party B]'s other rights or remedies under this Agreement or at law, including the right to suspend further deliveries.

5.5 Invoice Disputes: If [Party A] disputes any portion of an invoice, [Party A] shall notify [Party B] in writing within [e.g., five (5)] business days of receipt of the invoice, clearly stating the disputed amount and the specific reasons for the dispute, along with any supporting documentation. [Party A] shall pay the undisputed portion of the invoice in accordance with the payment terms herein. The Parties shall promptly engage in good faith discussions to resolve any disputed amounts within [e.g., ten (10)] business days of the dispute notification.

5.6 Taxes: Unless otherwise specified, all prices quoted by [Party B] are exclusive of any applicable sales, use, value-added, goods and services, or similar taxes, duties, or levies. [Party A] shall be responsible for all such taxes, duties, and levies imposed by governmental authorities in connection with the purchase of the [product/material], provided that [Party B] provides a valid tax invoice where required by law. If [Party A] is exempt from any such taxes, [Party A] shall provide [Party B] with a valid tax exemption certificate.

6. Warranties

[Vendor] hereby warrants and represents to [Buyer] that, for a period of [e.g., twelve (12) months] from the date of delivery, all [Product/Material] supplied under this Agreement shall: (a) be free from defects in material, workmanship, and design; (b) conform strictly to all specifications, drawings, samples, and other requirements agreed upon by the parties; (c) be fit for the purposes for which they are intended and for which [Buyer] has informed [Vendor] they will be used; (d) be manufactured, packaged, labeled, and delivered in strict compliance with all applicable federal, state, and local laws, regulations, and industry standards, including but not limited to environmental, health, and safety regulations; (e) be free and clear of all liens, encumbrances, and security interests, and [Vendor] shall have good and marketable title thereto; and (f) not infringe upon any patent, copyright, trademark, trade secret, or other intellectual property rights of any third party.

In the event of any breach of the foregoing warranties, [Vendor] shall, at its sole cost and expense, promptly repair or replace the non-conforming [Product/Material] or, at [Buyer]'s option, refund the purchase price paid for such non-conforming [Product/Material]. All warranties shall survive inspection, acceptance, and payment by [Buyer], and the termination or expiration of this Agreement. The remedies provided herein are cumulative and in addition to any other remedies available to [Buyer] at law or in equity.

7. Indemnification

[Vendor] (hereinafter referred to as the "Indemnifying Party") shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless [Purchaser] (hereinafter referred to as the "Indemnified Party") and its affiliates, officers, directors, employees, agents, successors, and assigns from and against any and all claims, demands, liabilities, losses, damages, costs, and expenses, including, without limitation, reasonable attorneys' fees, court costs, and settlement amounts (collectively, "Losses"), arising out of or in connection with:

  • Any breach by the Indemnifying Party of any representation, warranty, covenant, or obligation set forth in this Agreement;
  • Any actual or alleged infringement, misappropriation, or violation of any intellectual property rights (including patents, copyrights, trademarks, and trade secrets) of any third party by the [Specific Product/Material] supplied by the Indemnifying Party or by the Indemnifying Party's manufacturing, packaging, or delivery processes;
  • Any negligence, gross negligence, or willful misconduct of the Indemnifying Party or its employees, agents, or subcontractors in the performance of its obligations under this Agreement;
  • Any non-compliance by the Indemnifying Party with applicable laws, regulations, or industry standards related to the manufacture, labeling, packaging, handling, or delivery of the [Specific Product/Material]; or
  • Any product liability claim, personal injury, death, or property damage arising directly or indirectly from the [Specific Product/Material] supplied by the Indemnifying Party, except to the extent caused by the gross negligence or willful misconduct of the Indemnified Party.

The Indemnified Party shall provide the Indemnifying Party with prompt written notice of any claim for which indemnification is sought; however, failure to provide such notice shall not relieve the Indemnifying Party of its obligations hereunder, except to the extent that such failure materially prejudices the Indemnifying Party's ability to defend the claim. The Indemnifying Party shall have the sole right to defend, negotiate, and settle any such claim, provided that the Indemnifying Party shall not settle any claim in a manner that imposes any liability or obligation on the Indemnified Party without the Indemnified Party's prior written consent, which shall not be unreasonably withheld. The Indemnified Party shall provide reasonable cooperation to the Indemnifying Party, at the Indemnifying Party's expense, in connection with the defense of any such claim. This indemnification obligation shall survive the termination or expiration of this Agreement.

8. Limitation of Liability

Neither [Party A] nor [Party B] shall be liable to the other party for any indirect, incidental, consequential, special, punitive, or exemplary damages, including but not limited to, damages for lost profits, lost revenue, lost data, loss of goodwill, or business interruption, arising out of or in connection with this Agreement or the supply of the [product/material], even if such party has been advised of the possibility of such damages. This exclusion applies regardless of the form of action, whether in contract, tort (including negligence), strict liability, or otherwise, and even if any limited remedy provided herein fails of its essential purpose.

Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained herein, the total aggregate liability of either [Party A] or [Party B] to the other for any and all claims, damages, or losses arising out of or in connection with this Agreement, whether in contract, tort (including negligence), or otherwise, shall in no event exceed the total amount paid or payable by [Party A] to [Party B] under this Agreement for the [product/material] during the twelve (12) month period immediately preceding the event giving rise to the claim. This limitation shall not apply to liabilities arising from a party's gross negligence, willful misconduct, or breach of confidentiality obligations under this Agreement.

The parties acknowledge that the limitations of liability set forth in this Section 8 are a fundamental element of the basis of the bargain between the parties and reflect an allocation of risk between the parties, and that [Party A] would not enter into this Agreement without such limitations. These limitations shall apply to the fullest extent permitted by applicable law.

9. Termination

This Agreement may be terminated under the following conditions:

9.1 Termination for Material Breach: Either [Party A] or [Party B] may terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice to the other party if the other party commits a material breach of any of its obligations under this Agreement and fails to cure such breach within [Number] days after receiving written notice thereof. A material breach shall include, but not be limited to, persistent failure to meet agreed-upon delivery schedules, consistent failure to adhere to specified quality standards for the [product/material], non-payment of undisputed invoices beyond the stipulated payment terms, or any other significant non-compliance with the terms herein that substantially defeats the purpose of this Agreement.

9.2 Termination for Insolvency: Either party may terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice to the other party if the other party becomes insolvent, files a petition for bankruptcy, has a receiver appointed over its assets, makes an assignment for the benefit of creditors, or ceases to conduct business in the ordinary course.

9.3 Termination for Convenience: [Party A] may terminate this Agreement for convenience, without cause, by providing [Party B] with at least [Number] days' prior written notice. In the event of such termination, [Party A] shall pay [Party B] for all [product/material] delivered and services rendered up to the effective date of termination, and any reasonable, documented, non-cancelable costs incurred by [Party B] specifically in anticipation of fulfilling orders placed by [Party A] prior to the notice of termination, provided [Party B] takes all reasonable steps to mitigate such costs and provides supporting documentation within [Number] days of the termination notice.

9.4 Effect of Termination: Upon the effective date of termination, all rights and obligations of the parties under this Agreement shall cease, except for those obligations that expressly survive termination, including but not limited to, confidentiality obligations (Section [X]), indemnification (Section [Y]), and payment obligations for [product/material] delivered or services rendered prior to the termination date. [Party B] shall immediately cease all production and delivery of [product/material] and return all Confidential Information and property of [Party A] in its possession or control within [Number] days of the termination effective date.

9.5 Accrued Rights: Termination of this Agreement shall not affect any rights or obligations of the parties that have accrued prior to the effective date of termination.

10. Governing Law and Dispute Resolution

This Agreement and any dispute or claim arising out of or in connection with it or its subject matter or formation (including non-contractual disputes or claims) shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of [Governing Law State], without regard to its conflict of laws principles. The parties irrevocably agree that the courts of [Governing Law State] shall have exclusive jurisdiction to settle any dispute or claim arising out of or in connection with this Agreement or its subject matter or formation, provided however, that the parties shall first attempt to resolve any such dispute through good faith negotiation.

Should negotiation fail, the parties agree to first attempt to resolve the dispute through non-binding mediation administered by [Mediation Service Provider, e.g., American Arbitration Association (AAA)] under its Commercial Mediation Procedures, before resorting to arbitration. If the dispute is not resolved through mediation within [Number] days of the commencement of mediation, or if one party declines to participate in mediation, then the dispute shall be finally settled by binding arbitration administered by [Arbitration Service Provider, e.g., AAA] in accordance with its Commercial Arbitration Rules. The arbitration shall take place in [Arbitration Location], [Governing Law State], and the language of the arbitration shall be English. The award rendered by the arbitrator(s) shall be final and binding upon both parties, and judgment on the award may be entered in any court having jurisdiction thereof.

Signatures

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties hereto have executed this Vendor Agreement as of the Effective Date first written above, acknowledging their full understanding and acceptance of all terms, conditions, and covenants contained herein. Each signatory warrants that they are duly authorized to execute this Agreement on behalf of their respective entity, thereby binding that entity to the obligations and responsibilities set forth.

FOR [CLIENT COMPANY NAME]:

___________________________________

By: [Authorized Signatory Name]

Title: [Authorized Signatory Title]

Date: _____________________________

FOR [VENDOR NAME]:

___________________________________

By: [Authorized Signatory Name]

Title: [Authorized Signatory Title]

Date: _____________________________

WITNESSES:

___________________________________

Witness Name (for [CLIENT COMPANY NAME])

Date: _____________________________

___________________________________

Witness Name (for [VENDOR NAME])

Date: _____________________________
api1.summary: The vendor agreement for the supplier has been successfully drafted, covering all necessary aspects including delivery schedules, payment terms, quality standards, and termination clauses.

api2.updated_html:
VENDOR AGREEMENT

This Vendor Agreement ("Agreement") is made and entered into as of this [Day] day of [Month], [Year] (the "Effective Date"), by and between:

[BUYER LEGAL NAME], a [State of Incorporation] corporation, with its principal place of business located at [Buyer Full Address] ("Buyer").

AND

[SUPPLIER LEGAL NAME], a [State of Incorporation] corporation, with its principal place of business located at [Supplier Full Address] ("Supplier").

Buyer and Supplier are hereinafter collectively referred to as the "Parties" and individually as a "Party."

RECITALS

WHEREAS, Buyer desires to purchase [specific product/material, e.g., "raw materials for manufacturing," "finished consumer goods," "specialized components"] (the "Products") from Supplier, and Supplier is willing to sell and supply such Products to Buyer, subject to the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement.

WHEREAS, the Parties intend for this Agreement to establish a comprehensive framework governing the ongoing supply relationship, including but not limited to, product specifications, delivery logistics, quality assurance protocols, payment obligations, and mechanisms for dispute resolution, ensuring a clear understanding of each Party's rights and responsibilities throughout the term of this engagement.

1. DEFINITIONS

For the purposes of this Agreement, the following terms shall have the meanings ascribed to them below: "Products" means the [specific product/material type, e.g., "widgets," "steel sheets," "electronic components"] and any other goods or materials specified in a Purchase Order issued by Buyer and accepted by Supplier under the terms of this Agreement. This definition encompasses all variations, configurations, and quantities of such goods, including any associated documentation, packaging, or accessories, as may be detailed in the specifications attached hereto as Exhibit A or referenced in individual Purchase Orders.

"Purchase Order" or "PO" means a written order issued by Buyer to Supplier for the procurement of Products, which shall, at a minimum, specify the type, quantity, price, requested delivery date, and delivery location of the Products. Each Purchase Order, upon acceptance by Supplier, shall become a binding contract incorporating the terms of this Agreement by reference, and no additional or different terms or conditions contained in any Purchase Order or other communication shall be binding upon Buyer unless expressly agreed to in writing by an authorized representative of Buyer.

2. SCOPE OF AGREEMENT AND PRODUCT SUPPLY

This Agreement sets forth the exclusive terms and conditions under which Supplier shall supply, and Buyer shall purchase, the Products. Supplier agrees to use its best efforts to meet Buyer's requirements for the Products, including but not limited to, maintaining sufficient inventory levels, production capacity, and logistical capabilities to fulfill all accepted Purchase Orders in a timely and efficient manner. This commitment extends to ensuring the continuous availability of specified raw materials and components necessary for the manufacture or procurement of the Products.

The Parties acknowledge that specific details regarding Product specifications, pricing, and delivery schedules will be further elaborated in individual Purchase Orders issued by Buyer and accepted by Supplier. However, in the event of any conflict or inconsistency between the terms of this Agreement and any Purchase Order, the terms of this Agreement shall prevail, unless the Purchase Order explicitly states an intent to supersede a specific provision of this Agreement and is signed by authorized representatives of both Parties.

3. PURCHASE ORDERS

Buyer shall issue Purchase Orders to Supplier for the Products it wishes to procure. Each Purchase Order shall be deemed an offer by Buyer to purchase Products in accordance with the terms of this Agreement. Supplier shall accept or reject a Purchase Order within [Number] business days of receipt. Failure by Supplier to respond within this timeframe shall be deemed an acceptance of the Purchase Order. Accepted Purchase Orders shall be binding on both Parties, subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement.

Any modifications to an accepted Purchase Order must be mutually agreed upon in writing by both Parties. Buyer reserves the right to cancel any Purchase Order, in whole or in part, without penalty, prior to Supplier's acceptance. If Buyer cancels an accepted Purchase Order, Buyer shall be liable only for Supplier's direct, documented costs incurred specifically for the canceled portion of the order prior to the cancellation notice, provided Supplier takes all reasonable steps to mitigate such costs.

4. DELIVERY SCHEDULES

Supplier shall deliver the Products to the destination specified in each Purchase Order by the requested delivery date ("Delivery Date"). Time is of the essence for all deliveries under this Agreement. Supplier shall provide Buyer with a confirmed delivery schedule within [Number] business days of accepting a Purchase Order, including estimated shipping dates and tracking information where applicable. Supplier shall notify Buyer immediately of any actual or potential delays in delivery, providing a revised delivery schedule and the reasons for the delay.

In the event of any delay attributable to Supplier, Buyer reserves the right, in addition to any other remedies available at law or in equity, to: (a) cancel the affected Purchase Order without penalty; (b) procure substitute Products from an alternative source and charge Supplier for any excess costs incurred; or (c) require Supplier to expedite shipment at Supplier's sole expense. Risk of loss and title to the Products shall pass to Buyer upon delivery to the specified destination and Buyer's acceptance of the Products, following inspection in accordance with Section 5.

5. QUALITY STANDARDS AND INSPECTION

Supplier warrants that all Products supplied hereunder shall strictly conform to the specifications, drawings, samples, and quality standards (collectively, "Quality Standards") set forth in Exhibit A or otherwise agreed upon in writing by the Parties. Products shall be new, of the highest quality, free from defects in material and workmanship, and fit for the purpose for which they are intended. Supplier shall implement and maintain a robust quality control system to ensure compliance with all Quality Standards and shall provide Buyer with access to relevant quality documentation upon request.

Buyer shall have the right to inspect all Products upon delivery or at any reasonable time thereafter. Buyer may reject any Products that do not conform to the Quality Standards or are otherwise defective. Buyer shall notify Supplier of any non-conforming Products within [Number] business days of discovery. Supplier shall, at Buyer's option and at Supplier's sole expense, promptly replace or repair any rejected Products. If replacement or repair is not commercially practicable or timely, Buyer may return the non-conforming Products to Supplier for a full refund, or Buyer may, at its option, repair or rework the Products and charge Supplier for all associated costs.

6. PAYMENT TERMS

Buyer shall pay Supplier for Products delivered and accepted in accordance with the prices set forth in the applicable Purchase Order. Supplier shall submit invoices to Buyer upon delivery and acceptance of the Products. Each invoice shall reference the corresponding Purchase Order number and include a detailed description of the Products, quantity, unit price, and total amount due. Buyer shall pay undisputed invoices within [Number] days from the date of Buyer's receipt of a correct invoice.

All payments shall be made in [Currency, e.g., United States Dollars] via [Payment Method, e.g., electronic funds transfer]. Buyer reserves the right to offset any amounts owed by Supplier to Buyer against any amounts payable by Buyer to Supplier under this Agreement or any other agreement between the Parties. In the event of a disputed invoice, Buyer shall pay the undisputed portion and the Parties shall work in good faith to resolve the disputed amount within [Number] days. Late payments, if not disputed in good faith, may be subject to interest at the rate of [Percentage]% per annum or the maximum rate permitted by law, whichever is lower, calculated from the due date until the date of payment.

7. PRICING

The prices for the Products shall be as set forth in Exhibit B, or as otherwise mutually agreed upon in writing in individual Purchase Orders. Unless otherwise specified, all prices are firm and fixed for a period of [Number] months from the Effective Date and include all costs for materials, labor, overhead, packaging, insurance, and freight to the Buyer's designated delivery location. Supplier shall not increase prices without Buyer's prior written consent.

Any proposed price adjustments by Supplier must be submitted to Buyer in writing at least [Number] days prior to the effective date of such adjustment, accompanied by detailed justification. Buyer reserves the right to renegotiate prices or seek alternative suppliers if proposed price increases are deemed unacceptable. All prices are exclusive of any applicable sales, use, excise, or similar taxes, which shall be separately stated on invoices and borne by Buyer, unless Buyer provides a valid exemption certificate.

8. WARRANTIES

Supplier warrants that for a period of [Number] months from the date of acceptance by Buyer, all Products supplied under this Agreement will be (a) free from defects in design, material, and workmanship; (b) conform strictly to all specifications, drawings, samples, and other requirements provided by Buyer; (c) be new and of merchantable quality; (d) be fit for the particular purpose for which they are intended, as communicated by Buyer to Supplier; and (e) be free and clear of all liens, encumbrances, and claims. These warranties are cumulative and in addition to any other warranties provided by law.

In the event of a breach of any warranty, Supplier shall, at its sole expense and at Buyer's option, promptly repair or replace the non-conforming Products or refund the purchase price for the non-conforming Products. Supplier shall bear all costs associated with the return of non-conforming Products and the shipment of repaired or replacement Products. The foregoing remedies are in addition to, and not in lieu of, any other remedies available to Buyer at law or in equity, including but not limited to, damages for breach of contract.

9. CONFIDENTIALITY

During the course of this Agreement, each Party ("Receiving Party") may receive or have access to confidential and proprietary information ("Confidential Information") of the other Party ("Disclosing Party"), including but not limited to, technical, business, financial, and operational information, product designs, specifications, pricing, customer lists, and business strategies. The Receiving Party agrees to maintain the strictest confidentiality of all Confidential Information, using at least the same degree of care as it uses to protect its own similar information, but no less than a reasonable degree of care.

The Receiving Party shall not disclose, reproduce, or use the Disclosing Party's Confidential Information for any purpose other than for the performance of its obligations under this Agreement. Access to Confidential Information shall be restricted to employees, agents, and subcontractors who have a need to know such information for the purpose of fulfilling the Receiving Party's obligations hereunder and who are bound by confidentiality obligations at least as stringent as those set forth herein. This obligation of confidentiality shall survive the termination or expiration of this Agreement for a period of [Number] years.

10. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY

All intellectual property rights, including but not limited to, patents, copyrights, trademarks, trade secrets, and industrial designs, existing prior to the Effective Date and owned by a Party shall remain the sole property of that Party. Any intellectual property developed by Supplier specifically for Buyer in the course of performing this Agreement, and for which Buyer has paid, shall be the sole and exclusive property of Buyer upon creation, and Supplier hereby assigns all rights, title, and interest in such intellectual property to Buyer.

Supplier warrants that the Products supplied hereunder, and Buyer's use thereof, do not and will not infringe upon any intellectual property rights of any third party. Supplier shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Buyer, its affiliates, and their respective officers, directors, employees, and agents from and against any and all claims, damages, liabilities, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees) arising from or relating to any actual or alleged infringement of any patent, copyright, trademark, trade secret, or other intellectual property right by the Products or Buyer's use thereof.

11. INDEMNIFICATION

Supplier shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Buyer, its affiliates, and their respective officers, directors, employees, and agents from and against any and all claims, damages, liabilities, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees) arising out of or in connection with: (a) any breach by Supplier of its representations, warranties, or covenants under this Agreement; (b) any death, injury, or property damage caused by the Products supplied by Supplier; (c) any negligent or willful act or omission of Supplier or its employees, agents, or subcontractors in connection with this Agreement; or (d) any claim that the Products infringe or misappropriate any third-party intellectual property rights.

Buyer shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Supplier, its affiliates, and their respective officers, directors, employees, and agents from and against any and all claims, damages, liabilities, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees) arising out of or in connection with: (a) any breach by Buyer of its representations, warranties, or covenants under this Agreement; or (b) any negligent or willful act or omission of Buyer or its employees, agents, or subcontractors in connection with this Agreement, provided that such claims do not arise from the Supplier's breach of its obligations or defective Products.

12. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY

EXCEPT FOR OBLIGATIONS UNDER SECTIONS 8 (WARRANTIES) AND 11 (INDEMNIFICATION), IN NO EVENT SHALL EITHER PARTY BE LIABLE TO THE OTHER PARTY FOR ANY INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, CONSEQUENTIAL, SPECIAL, PUNITIVE, OR EXEMPLARY DAMAGES, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO, LOSS OF PROFITS, REVENUE, DATA, OR USE, INCURRED BY THE OTHER PARTY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION IN CONTRACT OR TORT, EVEN IF SUCH PARTY HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES.

NOTWITHSTANDING ANYTHING TO THE CONTRARY IN THIS AGREEMENT, EXCEPT FOR OBLIGATIONS UNDER SECTIONS 8 (WARRANTIES) AND 11 (INDEMNIFICATION), EACH PARTY'S TOTAL AGGREGATE LIABILITY ARISING OUT OF OR RELATED TO THIS AGREEMENT, REGARDLESS OF THE FORM OF ACTION, SHALL NOT EXCEED THE TOTAL AMOUNT PAID OR PAYABLE BY BUYER TO SUPPLIER UNDER THIS AGREEMENT DURING THE TWELVE (12) MONTHS IMMEDIATELY PRECEDING THE EVENT GIVING RISE TO THE CLAIM. THE LIMITATIONS SET FORTH IN THIS SECTION SHALL APPLY EVEN IF THE REMEDIES PROVIDED HEREIN FAIL OF THEIR ESSENTIAL PURPOSE.

13. TERM AND TERMINATION

This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall continue for an initial term of [Number] years ("Initial Term"), unless terminated earlier in accordance with the provisions of this Section. Thereafter, this Agreement shall automatically renew for successive [Number]-year periods (each, a "Renewal Term"), unless either Party provides written notice of non-renewal to the other Party at least [Number] days prior to the expiration of the then-current term.

Either Party may terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice if the other Party: (a) materially breaches any provision of this Agreement and fails to cure such breach within [Number] days after receiving written notice thereof; (b) becomes insolvent, files for bankruptcy, or has a receiver appointed; or (c) ceases to conduct its business in the ordinary course. Buyer may also terminate this Agreement for convenience, in whole or in part, upon [Number] days' prior written notice to Supplier, in which case Buyer shall pay Supplier for Products delivered and accepted prior to the effective date of termination and for Supplier's reasonable, documented, and unavoidable costs directly attributable to such termination.

14. FORCE MAJEURE

Neither Party shall be liable for any delay or failure to perform its obligations under this Agreement (excluding payment obligations) if such delay or failure is caused by events beyond its reasonable control, including but not limited to, acts of God, war, terrorism, riots, embargoes, fires, floods, earthquakes, epidemics, pandemics, or other natural disasters, strikes, or governmental actions (a "Force Majeure Event"). The Party affected by a Force Majeure Event shall promptly notify the other Party in writing of the occurrence of such event and its expected duration.

The Party affected by the Force Majeure Event shall use commercially reasonable efforts to mitigate the effects of the event and to resume performance as soon as practicable. If a Force Majeure Event continues for a period exceeding [Number] days, either Party may terminate the affected Purchase Order or this Agreement upon written notice without liability, except for payment for Products delivered and accepted prior to the Force Majeure Event.

15. GOVERNING LAW

This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of [State, e.g., Delaware], without regard to its conflict of laws principles. The Parties expressly exclude the application of the United Nations Convention on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods.

Any legal action or proceeding arising out of or relating to this Agreement shall be brought exclusively in the federal or state courts located in [County, State, e.g., New Castle County, Delaware], and the Parties hereby irrevocably consent to the personal jurisdiction and venue of such courts. Each Party waives any objection to the laying of venue in such courts and agrees not to plead or claim that any such action or proceeding brought in any such court has been brought in an inconvenient forum.

16. DISPUTE RESOLUTION

In the event of any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement, or the breach, termination, or invalidity thereof ("Dispute"), the Parties agree to first attempt to resolve the Dispute through good faith negotiations between their respective senior management. Either Party may initiate such negotiations by providing written notice to the other Party, and the Parties shall meet within [Number] days of such notice to attempt to resolve the Dispute.

If the Dispute cannot be resolved through negotiation within [Number] days, the Parties agree to submit the Dispute to non-binding mediation administered by [Arbitration/Mediation Service, e.g., the American Arbitration Association] in accordance with its then-current Commercial Mediation Procedures. The costs of mediation shall be shared equally by the Parties. If mediation fails to resolve the Dispute within [Number] days, either Party may pursue any remedies available to it at law or in equity, subject to the governing law and venue provisions of this Agreement.

17. MISCELLANEOUS

This Agreement, including any Exhibits attached hereto, constitutes the entire agreement between the Parties with respect to the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior and contemporaneous agreements, understandings, negotiations, and discussions, whether oral or written, of the Parties. No modification, amendment, or waiver of any provision of this Agreement shall be effective unless in writing and signed by authorized representatives of both Parties.

No waiver by either Party of any breach or default hereunder shall be deemed a waiver of any subsequent breach or default. If any provision of this Agreement is found by a court of competent jurisdiction to be invalid, illegal, or unenforceable, such provision shall be modified to the minimum extent necessary to make it valid, legal, and enforceable, and the remaining provisions of this Agreement shall remain in full force and effect.

Neither Party may assign or transfer any of its rights or obligations under this Agreement without the prior written consent of the other Party, which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld, conditioned, or delayed. Notwithstanding the foregoing, either Party may assign this Agreement in its entirety to an affiliate or to a successor in interest in connection with a merger, acquisition, or sale of all or substantially all of its assets, provided the assignee agrees in writing to be bound by all terms and conditions of this Agreement.

All notices, requests, consents, claims, demands, waivers, and other communications hereunder shall be in writing and addressed to the Parties at their respective addresses set forth above (or to such other address that may be designated by a Party from time to time in accordance with this Section). Notices shall be deemed effective upon (a) personal delivery; (b) the next business day after deposit with a nationally recognized overnight courier service (e.g., FedEx or UPS); or (c) three (3) business days after mailing by certified or registered mail, return receipt requested, postage prepaid.

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties have executed this Agreement as of the Effective Date first written above.
