query: Draft a Distribution Agreement for third-party resellers of our software product, covering licensing, pricing, territories, and support obligations.

api1.updated_html:
DISTRIBUTION AGREEMENT

This Distribution Agreement (the "Agreement") is made and entered into as of this [Effective Date] (the "Effective Date"), by and between [Party A Legal Name], a corporation duly organized and existing under the laws of [Party A Jurisdiction], with its principal place of business located at [Party A Address] ("Licensor"), and [Party B Legal Name], a corporation duly organized and existing under the laws of [Party B Jurisdiction], with its principal place of business located at [Party B Address] ("Distributor").

WHEREAS, Licensor is the sole and exclusive owner of certain proprietary software products, including but not limited to [Software Product Name(s)], and associated intellectual property rights (the "Software");

WHEREAS, Distributor possesses expertise and resources in marketing, selling, and distributing software products within specified territories;

WHEREAS, Licensor desires to appoint Distributor, and Distributor desires to accept such appointment, as a non-exclusive reseller of the Software to third-party end-users within the agreed-upon territories, subject to the terms and conditions hereinafter set forth;

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and promises contained herein and other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the parties agree as follows:

1. Definitions

For the purposes of this Distribution Agreement, the following terms shall have the meanings ascribed to them below, unless the context clearly indicates otherwise:

1.1. "Agreement" means this Distribution Agreement, including all its recitals, schedules, exhibits, and appendices, as may be amended, supplemented, or restated from time to time in accordance with its terms.

1.2. "Effective Date" means [Effective Date], the date upon which this Agreement becomes legally binding and effective between the Parties.

1.3. "Software Product(s)" means the proprietary software product(s) developed and owned by [Party A], specifically identified as [List of Software Products, e.g., "XYZ Software Suite v. 2.0"], including all current and future versions, updates, upgrades, enhancements, modules, documentation, and any related materials provided by [Party A] for distribution under this Agreement.

1.4. "Distributor" or "Reseller" means [Party B], a corporation duly organized and existing under the laws of [Party B's Jurisdiction], with its principal place of business at [Party B's Address], which is authorized by this Agreement to market, distribute, and resell the Software Product(s) to End-Users within the Territory.

1.5. "End-User" means any individual, entity, or organization that acquires a license to use the Software Product(s) for its own internal business operations or personal use, and not for further resale, distribution, or sublicensing, and who enters into a direct license agreement with either the Distributor or [Party A] for such use.

1.6. "Territory" means the specific geographical region(s) where the Distributor is authorized to market, promote, distribute, and sell the Software Product(s), as more fully described in Schedule A attached hereto. Any sales or marketing activities outside of the defined Territory are strictly prohibited unless expressly authorized in writing by [Party A].

1.7. "Confidential Information" means all non-public information, whether commercial, financial, technical, operational, or otherwise, disclosed by one Party (the "Disclosing Party") to the other Party (the "Receiving Party") in connection with this Agreement, whether disclosed orally, in writing, or by any other means, including but not limited to, trade secrets, business plans, customer lists, pricing strategies, marketing plans, product roadmaps, software code, and technical specifications. Confidential Information shall not include information that (a) is or becomes publicly available through no fault of the Receiving Party; (b) was known to the Receiving Party prior to disclosure by the Disclosing Party without breach of any confidentiality obligation; (c) is independently developed by the Receiving Party without use of or reference to the Disclosing Party's Confidential Information; or (d) is rightfully obtained by the Receiving Party from a third party without restriction on disclosure.

2. Term

This Distribution Agreement ("Agreement") shall commence on the Effective Date, which is defined as [Effective Date], and shall continue in full force and effect for an initial term of [Initial Term] years ("Initial Term"), unless terminated earlier in accordance with the provisions herein. Following the expiration of the Initial Term, this Agreement shall automatically renew for successive additional terms of [Renewal Term] years each ("Renewal Term"), unless either Party provides written notice of its intent not to renew to the other Party at least [Notice Period] days prior to the expiration of the then-current term. Any such non-renewal notice must be delivered in writing to the designated contact person of the other Party as specified in Section 15 (Notices). The termination or non-renewal of this Agreement shall not relieve either Party of any obligations accrued prior to the effective date of such termination or non-renewal, including, but not limited to, payment obligations for products delivered or services rendered.

3. Appointment and Scope of Distribution

Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, [Party A] hereby appoints [Distributor Name] (hereinafter referred to as "Distributor") as a non-exclusive distributor of the software product(s) specified in Exhibit A, including all associated documentation, updates, and enhancements (collectively, the "Software Product(s)"), within the defined geographical region of [Territory] (the "Territory"). This appointment grants Distributor the right to market, promote, distribute, and sublicense the Software Product(s) to end-users solely within the Territory, in accordance with the licensing terms provided by [Party A] and as further detailed in Exhibit B (Licensing Terms).

Distributor acknowledges and agrees that this appointment is limited to the distribution of the Software Product(s) as provided by [Party A] and does not convey any right, title, or interest in the intellectual property rights of the Software Product(s) or any derivative works thereof. Distributor shall not, directly or indirectly, modify, reverse engineer, decompile, disassemble, or create derivative works from the Software Product(s). All sales and sublicenses made by Distributor shall strictly adhere to the pricing structures, payment terms, and end-user license agreements (EULAs) established by [Party A], as may be updated from time to time, and Distributor shall ensure that all end-users agree to and are bound by such EULAs prior to obtaining access to the Software Product(s). Distributor further agrees to comply with all support obligations as outlined in Section [X. Support Obligations] of this Agreement.

4. Licensing and Pricing

4.1. Grant of Sublicensing Rights. Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, [Party A] hereby grants to [Party B] a non-exclusive, non-transferable, revocable right to market, promote, distribute, and sublicense the [Software Product] (including all updates, upgrades, and related documentation) to End-Users within the agreed Territory, solely for the purpose of generating revenue for [Party A] and [Party B]. This right does not extend to any other products or services of [Party A] unless explicitly agreed upon in writing.

4.2. End-User License Agreement (EULA). All sublicenses of the [Software Product] to End-Users shall be subject to and governed by [Party A]'s standard End-User License Agreement (EULA), a current copy of which is attached hereto as Exhibit B and may be updated by [Party A] from time to time. [Party B] shall ensure that each End-User explicitly accepts the EULA prior to or upon installation and use of the [Software Product]. [Party B] shall not modify, amend, or supplement the EULA without the prior written consent of [Party A].

4.3. Pricing Structure for [Party B]. [Party B] shall purchase licenses for the [Software Product] directly from [Party A] at a wholesale price calculated as a [Reseller Discount Rate]% discount off [Party A]'s then-current Manufacturer's Suggested Retail Price (MSRP) for the [Software Product], as published by [Party A] from time to time. The current MSRP for the [Software Product] is [MSRP] [Currency] per license, subject to change as per Section 4.5. All prices are exclusive of any applicable taxes, duties, or levies, which shall be the sole responsibility of [Party B].

4.4. Resale Pricing by [Party B]. [Party B] shall have the sole discretion to determine the final retail price at which it resells the [Software Product] to End-Users within the Territory. However, [Party A] may provide recommended retail pricing guidelines, which [Party B] may consider but is not obligated to follow. [Party B] agrees not to engage in any pricing practices that would devalue the [Software Product] or harm [Party A]'s brand reputation.

4.5. Price Changes. [Party A] reserves the right to modify the MSRP and the wholesale pricing for the [Software Product] at any time. [Party A] shall provide [Party B] with at least [Number] days' prior written notice of any such price changes. Any orders placed by [Party B] and accepted by [Party A] prior to the effective date of a price change shall be honored at the prices in effect at the time of order acceptance.

5. Territories

Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, [Party A] hereby grants to [Reseller] the non-exclusive right to market, promote, distribute, and resell the [Software Product(s)] to End-Users solely within the geographic region defined as the "[Territory(ies)]" as set forth in Exhibit A attached hereto and incorporated herein by reference. [Reseller] acknowledges and agrees that this grant is non-exclusive, and [Party A] reserves the right to appoint other resellers, distributors, or agents, or to directly market and sell the [Software Product(s)] within the [Territory(ies)] at its sole discretion.

[Reseller] shall not, directly or indirectly, market, promote, distribute, or sell the [Software Product(s)] outside the [Territory(ies)], nor shall [Reseller] establish any branch offices, subsidiaries, or other fixed places of business outside the [Territory(ies)] for the purpose of distributing the [Software Product(s)]. [Reseller] further agrees not to actively solicit orders from, or target advertising or promotional efforts towards, customers located outside the [Territory(ies)]. Any sales or distribution efforts originating from or directed at locations outside the [Territory(ies)] shall constitute a material breach of this Agreement.

[Reseller] shall comply with all applicable laws, regulations, and governmental policies within the [Territory(ies)] related to the marketing, distribution, and sale of the [Software Product(s)], including but not limited to, import/export controls, data privacy laws, and consumer protection regulations. Any modification to the defined [Territory(ies)] shall only be effective if agreed upon in writing by both [Party A] and [Reseller].

6. Support Obligations

6.1. [Reseller] shall be the primary point of contact for all technical support inquiries from End-Users of the [Software Product] within its designated Territory. [Reseller] shall provide Tier 1 support, which includes, but is not limited to, initial troubleshooting, addressing common user queries, and assisting with basic installation and configuration issues, in accordance with the support guidelines and documentation provided by [Party A]. [Reseller] shall ensure that its support personnel are adequately trained and possess the necessary technical expertise to competently address End-User issues related to the [Software Product].

6.2. For issues that [Reseller] is unable to resolve at Tier 1, [Reseller] shall escalate such issues to [Party A] for Tier 2 or Tier 3 support, following the escalation procedures and protocols outlined in [Party A]'s then-current Support Policy, attached hereto as Exhibit B and incorporated by reference. [Party A] shall provide support to [Reseller] for escalated issues in accordance with the service levels specified in the Service Level Agreement (SLA) set forth in Exhibit C. [Reseller] shall provide [Party A] with all necessary information, including detailed problem descriptions and diagnostic data, to facilitate efficient resolution of escalated issues.

6.3. [Party A] shall provide [Reseller] with necessary training, documentation, and access to knowledge bases to enable [Reseller] to effectively perform its support obligations. [Reseller] acknowledges that [Party A]'s support obligations are limited to providing support to [Reseller] for escalated issues and do not extend directly to End-Users, unless otherwise expressly agreed upon in writing between [Party A] and [Reseller]. Any support provided by [Party A] to [Reseller] or End-Users shall be subject to the terms and conditions of [Party A]'s standard warranty and support policies, and [Party A] reserves the right to modify these policies upon reasonable notice to [Reseller].

7. Payment Terms

All payments due from [Party B] (the "Distributor") to [Party A] (the "Software Provider") under this Agreement shall be made in [Currency] and in accordance with the pricing schedule set forth in Exhibit C, "Pricing Schedule," attached hereto and incorporated by reference. The Distributor shall pay all undisputed invoices within [Payment Due Date] days of the invoice date. Invoices will be generated by [Party A] on a [Monthly/Quarterly] basis, detailing all software licenses distributed by [Party B] during the preceding period, as reconciled through the reporting mechanisms outlined in Section 6.

Any amounts not paid by the Distributor when due shall accrue interest at the rate of [Interest Rate]% per month, or the maximum rate permitted by applicable law, whichever is less, calculated from the due date until paid in full. [Party A] reserves the right to suspend the provision of additional software licenses, technical support, or any other services to [Party B] if any undisputed invoice remains unpaid for more than [Number] days past its due date, without prejudice to any other rights or remedies available to [Party A] at law or in equity.

All payments shall be made via wire transfer to the bank account designated by [Party A] in writing, specifically: [Bank Name], Account Number: [Account Number], SWIFT/BIC: [SWIFT/BIC Code]. The Distributor shall be solely responsible for all taxes, duties, and other governmental charges, including but not limited to sales, use, value-added, and withholding taxes, arising from its distribution activities or payments hereunder, excluding only taxes based on [Party A]'s net income. In the event that any withholding tax is required by law, [Party B] shall provide [Party A] with official tax receipts or other appropriate documentation to support such withholding.

8. Confidentiality

8.1. Definition of Confidential Information. For the purposes of this Agreement, "Confidential Information" shall mean any and all non-public information, whether commercial, financial, technical, operational, or otherwise, disclosed by one party (the "Disclosing Party") to the other party (the "Receiving Party"), directly or indirectly, in writing, orally, or by inspection of tangible objects, including but not limited to, trade secrets, proprietary software, product roadmaps, pricing strategies, marketing plans, customer lists, business methods, financial data, and the terms and conditions of this Agreement. Confidential Information shall not include information that: (a) is or becomes publicly known through no fault of the Receiving Party; (b) was rightfully known to the Receiving Party, without restriction on disclosure, prior to disclosure by the Disclosing Party; (c) is rightfully obtained by the Receiving Party from a third party without breach of any confidentiality obligation; or (d) is independently developed by the Receiving Party without use of or reference to the Disclosing Party's Confidential Information.

8.2. Obligation of Confidentiality. The Receiving Party agrees to maintain the Confidential Information of the Disclosing Party in strict confidence and to use it solely for the purpose of fulfilling its obligations or exercising its rights under this Agreement. The Receiving Party shall protect the Disclosing Party's Confidential Information with at least the same degree of care as it uses to protect its own confidential information of a similar nature, but in no event less than a reasonable degree of care. The Receiving Party shall not disclose, disseminate, or otherwise make available any Confidential Information of the Disclosing Party to any third party without the Disclosing Party's prior written consent, except as expressly permitted herein.

8.3. Permitted Disclosures. The Receiving Party may disclose Confidential Information to its employees, affiliates, agents, and professional advisors who have a legitimate "need to know" such information for the purpose of carrying out the terms of this Agreement, provided that such individuals are bound by confidentiality obligations no less protective than those contained herein. The Receiving Party shall be responsible for any breach of this Section 8 by its employees, affiliates, agents, or professional advisors.

8.4. Compelled Disclosure. If the Receiving Party is compelled by law, regulation, or a valid court order to disclose any Confidential Information, it shall provide the Disclosing Party with prompt prior written notice (unless legally prohibited from doing so) so that the Disclosing Party may seek a protective order or other appropriate remedy. The Receiving Party shall only disclose the minimum portion of the Confidential Information that is legally required and shall cooperate with the Disclosing Party in its efforts to obtain a protective order or other reasonable assurance that confidential treatment will be afforded the Confidential Information.

8.5. Survival. The obligations of confidentiality set forth in this Section 8 shall survive the termination or expiration of this Agreement for a period of five (5) years, except for trade secrets, for which the obligations shall remain in effect indefinitely or until such information ceases to be a trade secret through no fault of the Receiving Party.

9. Intellectual Property

9.1. Acknowledgment of Ownership. [Licensor] expressly retains all right, title, and interest in and to the [Software Product], including all associated intellectual property rights, such as copyrights, patents, trademarks, trade secrets, and any other proprietary rights, whether registered or unregistered, throughout the world. [Reseller] acknowledges and agrees that it acquires no ownership interest in the [Software Product] or any intellectual property rights pertaining thereto, other than the limited rights of distribution expressly granted under this Agreement.

9.2. Limited License Grant. [Licensor] grants [Reseller] a non-exclusive, non-transferable, revocable license, solely for the term of this Agreement, to use and distribute the [Software Product] to End-Users within the agreed-upon Territory, strictly in accordance with the terms and conditions set forth herein and in the End-User License Agreement (EULA) provided by [Licensor]. [Reseller] shall not, and shall ensure that its End-Users do not, reverse engineer, decompile, disassemble, modify, adapt, translate, or create derivative works from the [Software Product] or any accompanying documentation, nor shall [Reseller] remove or alter any proprietary notices, labels, or marks from the [Software Product].

9.3. Protection of Intellectual Property. [Reseller] agrees to take all reasonable steps to protect [Licensor]'s intellectual property rights in the [Software Product] and related materials. [Reseller] shall promptly notify [Licensor] in writing upon becoming aware of any actual or suspected infringement, misappropriation, or unauthorized use of [Licensor]'s intellectual property rights by any third party. [Licensor] shall have the sole right, but not the obligation, to take such action as it deems appropriate to enforce its intellectual property rights, and [Reseller] agrees to cooperate fully with [Licensor] in any such enforcement efforts, at [Licensor]'s expense.

9.4. Trademarks and Branding. [Licensor] grants [Reseller] a limited, non-exclusive, non-transferable, revocable license to use [Licensor]'s trademarks, service marks, and trade names (collectively, "Trademarks") solely for the purpose of marketing and distributing the [Software Product] in accordance with [Licensor]'s branding guidelines, which may be updated from time to time. [Reseller] shall not use the Trademarks in any manner that may disparage [Licensor] or the [Software Product], or that may cause confusion as to the ownership of the Trademarks. All goodwill generated from the use of the Trademarks by [Reseller] shall inure solely to the benefit of [Licensor].

10. Warranties

10.1. Licensor's Limited Warranty. [Licensor] warrants to [Reseller] that, for a period of ninety (90) days from the date of initial delivery to the End User, the [Software Product] will substantially conform to its published specifications and documentation. [Licensor]'s sole obligation and [Reseller]'s exclusive remedy for any breach of this warranty shall be, at [Licensor]'s option, to repair or replace the non-conforming [Software Product], or if neither is commercially practicable, to refund the fees paid by [Reseller] for the specific non-conforming [Software Product]. This limited warranty does not apply to any non-conformance caused by misuse, unauthorized modification, or use of the [Software Product in combination with other products not supplied or approved by [Licensor].

10.2. Disclaimer of Other Warranties. EXCEPT FOR THE EXPRESS LIMITED WARRANTY SET FORTH IN SECTION 10.1, [LICENSOR] AND ITS SUPPLIERS PROVIDE THE [SOFTWARE PRODUCT] AND ALL RELATED SERVICES "AS IS" AND WITHOUT ANY OTHER WARRANTY OF ANY KIND. [LICENSOR] HEREBY DISCLAIMS ALL OTHER WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, NON-INFRINGEMENT, AND THOSE ARISING FROM COURSE OF DEALING OR USAGE OF TRADE. [LICENSOR] DOES NOT WARRANT THAT THE [SOFTWARE PRODUCT] WILL BE ERROR-FREE, UNINTERRUPTED, OR THAT ALL DEFECTS WILL BE CORRECTED.

10.3. Reseller's Warranties. [Reseller] warrants that it has the full power and authority to enter into this Agreement and to perform its obligations hereunder. [Reseller] further warrants that its marketing, sales, and distribution activities related to the [Software Product] will comply with all applicable laws, regulations, and industry standards, and will not make any representations or warranties regarding the [Software Product] to End Users or third parties that are inconsistent with or exceed the warranties provided by [Licensor] herein.

11. Indemnification

Each Party (the "Indemnifying Party") shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless the other Party (the "Indemnified Party"), its affiliates, officers, directors, employees, and agents from and against any and all claims, demands, losses, liabilities, damages, costs, and expenses (including, without limitation, reasonable attorneys' fees and expenses) arising out of or in connection with:

(a) Any material breach by the Indemnifying Party of its representations, warranties, or covenants set forth in this Agreement;

(b) Any gross negligence or willful misconduct of the Indemnifying Party or its employees, agents, or subcontractors in connection with the performance of this Agreement;

(c) For [Licensor] as the Indemnifying Party: Any claim that the [Software Product] or its use by [Distributor] in accordance with the terms of this Agreement infringes, misappropriates, or violates any intellectual property rights of a third party; provided, however, that [Licensor] shall have no obligation to indemnify [Distributor] to the extent such infringement arises from (i) modifications to the [Software Product] made by [Distributor] or any third party not authorized by [Licensor], (ii) use of the [Software Product] in combination with other products, equipment, software, or data not supplied or authorized by [Licensor], or (iii) [Distributor]'s continued use of the [Software Product] after being notified of the alleged infringement and provided with a modified or replacement version by [Licensor].

(d) For [Distributor] as the Indemnifying Party: Any claim arising from [Distributor]'s marketing, advertising, promotion, distribution, sale, or support of the [Software Product], including but not limited to any claims related to false advertising, product liability (to the extent not attributable to the inherent defects of the [Software Product] as supplied by [Licensor]), or non-compliance with applicable laws and regulations by [Distributor] in its conduct of business.

The Indemnified Party shall provide prompt written notice to the Indemnifying Party of any such claim and shall cooperate with the Indemnifying Party, at the Indemnifying Party's expense, in the defense of such claim. The Indemnifying Party shall have sole control over the defense and settlement of any such claim, provided that the Indemnifying Party shall not settle any claim in a manner that imposes any obligation or liability on the Indemnified Party without the Indemnified Party's prior written consent, which shall not be unreasonably withheld or delayed.

12. Limitation of Liability

Except for obligations to indemnify or pay for breaches of confidentiality, neither [Licensor] nor [Distributor] shall be liable to the other party or any third party for any indirect, incidental, special, punitive, exemplary, or consequential damages whatsoever, including, but not limited to, loss of profits, revenue, data, business interruption, or loss of goodwill, arising out of or in connection with this Agreement or the use or performance of the [Software Product], whether based on contract, tort (including negligence), strict liability, or any other legal theory, even if such party has been advised of the possibility of such damages. The total aggregate liability of [Licensor] to [Distributor] for any and all claims arising out of or in connection with this Agreement, whether in contract, tort, or otherwise, shall not exceed the total fees paid by [Distributor] to [Licensor] under this Agreement during the twelve (12) month period immediately preceding the event giving rise to the claim. This limitation of liability is a fundamental element of the basis of the bargain between the parties and reflects an allocation of risk.

13. Termination

This Agreement may be terminated prior to its natural expiration under the following circumstances:

13.1. Termination for Material Breach: Either [Party A] or [Party B] may terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice to the other Party if the other Party commits a material breach of any of its obligations, representations, or warranties under this Agreement, and such breach remains uncured for a period of [Notice Period, e.g., thirty (30)] days following receipt of written notice specifying the nature of the breach. A material breach shall include, but not be limited to, the unauthorized distribution or sublicensing of the [Software Product], failure to make timely payments as per Section [X. Pricing and Payments], or breach of confidentiality obligations as per Section [Y. Confidentiality].

13.2. Termination for Insolvency: Either [Party A] or [Party B] may terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice to the other Party if the other Party (a) becomes insolvent or generally fails to pay its debts as they become due; (b) files a petition for bankruptcy, reorganization, or similar relief, or has such a petition filed against it and not dismissed within [Specific Period, e.g., ninety (90)] days; (c) makes an assignment for the benefit of creditors; or (d) ceases to conduct business in the ordinary course.

13.3. Effect of Termination: Upon any termination or expiration of this Agreement, all rights and licenses granted to [Party B] hereunder shall immediately cease and revert to [Party A]. [Party B] shall immediately cease all distribution, marketing, and sales activities related to the [Software Product] and shall promptly return to [Party A] or, at [Party A]'s option, destroy all Confidential Information, marketing materials, and other property of [Party A] in its possession or control, providing written certification of such destruction upon request. [Party B] shall fulfill all existing obligations to customers for licenses sold prior to the effective date of termination, provided [Party A] agrees to continue providing necessary support for such existing licenses in accordance with Section [X. Support Obligations]. Termination shall not relieve either Party of any obligations accrued prior to the effective date of termination, including payment obligations for sales made.

13.4. Survival: Sections [List of surviving sections, e.g., 7. Intellectual Property, 8. Confidentiality, 10. Indemnification, 12. Limitation of Liability, 14. Governing Law and Dispute Resolution], and any other provisions which by their nature are intended to survive termination or expiration, shall survive the termination or expiration of this Agreement.

14. Governing Law

This Agreement and any dispute or claim arising out of or in connection with it or its subject matter or formation (including non-contractual disputes or claims) shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of [Governing Law State/Country], without regard to its conflict of laws principles. The parties irrevocably agree that the courts located within [Governing Jurisdiction] shall have exclusive jurisdiction to settle any dispute or claim that arises out of or in connection with this Agreement or its subject matter or formation (including non-contractual disputes or claims). Furthermore, the parties expressly agree that the United Nations Convention on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods (CISG) shall not apply to this Agreement or any transactions contemplated hereunder, and is hereby expressly excluded. This clause is intended to be a comprehensive and exclusive statement of the governing law and jurisdiction for all matters related to this Agreement, ensuring predictability and consistency in legal interpretation and enforcement.

15. Dispute Resolution

Any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement, including the breach, termination, or validity thereof, shall first be subject to good faith negotiation between the Parties for a period of not less than thirty (30) days from the date one Party notifies the other in writing of the dispute. If the Parties are unable to resolve the dispute through direct negotiation, they shall endeavor to settle the dispute by mediation administered by [Mediation Service Provider, e.g., JAMS or AAA] under its then-current Mediation Rules, with the mediation to take place in [City, State].

If the dispute is not resolved through negotiation or mediation within sixty (60) days of the initial notification, it shall be finally settled by binding arbitration administered by [Arbitration Service Provider, e.g., American Arbitration Association (AAA)] in accordance with its [Specific Arbitration Rules, e.g., Commercial Arbitration Rules] then in effect. The arbitration shall be conducted by a single arbitrator appointed in accordance with said rules, and the arbitral proceedings shall take place in [Arbitration Location, e.g., New York, New York]. The language of the arbitration shall be English. The decision of the arbitrator shall be final and binding upon both [Party A] and [Party B], and judgment on the award rendered by the arbitrator may be entered in any court having jurisdiction thereof. Each Party shall bear its own costs and attorneys' fees, and the costs of the arbitration shall be shared equally, unless the arbitrator determines otherwise.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, either Party may seek injunctive relief or other equitable remedies in any court of competent jurisdiction to prevent the actual or threatened infringement, misappropriation, or violation of its intellectual property rights or confidential information, without the necessity of posting a bond or other security. The existence or commencement of any dispute resolution proceedings shall not relieve either Party of its obligations under this Agreement.

16. Miscellaneous

This Agreement, including any exhibits, schedules, and addenda attached hereto, constitutes the entire agreement between [Party A] (the "Licensor") and [Party B] (the "Distributor") with respect to the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior and contemporaneous agreements, understandings, negotiations, and discussions, whether oral or written, of the parties. No representations, warranties, or inducements, express or implied, not set forth herein shall bind either party.

If any provision of this Agreement is held to be invalid, illegal, or unenforceable in any respect, such invalidity, illegality, or unenforceability shall not affect any other provision hereof, and this Agreement shall be construed as if such invalid, illegal, or unenforceable provision had never been contained herein. The parties agree to negotiate in good faith to replace any invalid, illegal, or unenforceable provision with a valid, legal, and enforceable provision that achieves, to the greatest extent possible, the economic, legal, and commercial objectives of the original provision.

No waiver of any breach of any provision of this Agreement shall constitute a waiver of any prior, concurrent, or subsequent breach of the same or any other provision hereof, and no waiver shall be effective unless made in writing and signed by an authorized representative of the waiving party.

Neither party may assign or transfer this Agreement, or any rights or obligations hereunder, whether by operation of law or otherwise, without the prior written consent of the other party, which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld or delayed. Any attempted assignment or transfer in violation of this provision shall be null and void. Notwithstanding the foregoing, either party may assign this Agreement in its entirety to an affiliate or in connection with a merger, acquisition, corporate reorganization, or sale of all or substantially all of its assets, provided the assignee agrees in writing to be bound by all terms and conditions of this Agreement.

This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of [Governing Law], without regard to its conflict of laws principles. The parties irrevocably consent to the exclusive jurisdiction and venue of the federal and state courts located in [Jurisdiction] for any action arising out of or relating to this Agreement.

This Agreement may be executed in one or more counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument. Facsimile or electronic signatures shall be deemed original signatures for all purposes.

Signatures

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties hereto have executed this Distribution Agreement as of the Effective Date first written above, each Party acknowledging their full understanding and acceptance of all terms and conditions contained herein. Each signatory warrants that they are duly authorized to execute this Agreement on behalf of the entity for whom they are signing, thereby binding that entity to the terms and obligations set forth herein. This Agreement may be executed in counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument, effective upon the last date of signature by both Parties.

_________________________________________

api2.updated_html:
DISTRIBUTION AGREEMENT

This Distribution Agreement ("Agreement") is made and entered into as of this [Day] day of [Month], [Year] ("Effective Date"), by and between:

[LICENSOR NAME], a [State/Country] corporation, with its principal place of business at [Licensor Address] ("Licensor").

[DISTRIBUTOR NAME], a [State/Country] corporation, with its principal place of business at [Distributor Address] ("Distributor").

WHEREAS, Licensor is the proprietor of certain proprietary software products and related documentation, hereinafter referred to as the "Software," which it desires to market and distribute through qualified third-party channels. Licensor possesses all necessary rights, titles, and interests in and to the Software, including all intellectual property rights, to grant the licenses and rights contemplated herein.

WHEREAS, Distributor possesses expertise and established channels in the distribution of software products within the specified territory and desires to obtain the right to market, distribute, and sublicense the Software to end-users in accordance with the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement. Distributor acknowledges its understanding of the Software's technical specifications and target market.

1. Definitions

1.1. "Software" means all versions of Licensor's proprietary software product known as "[Software Product Name]," including all modules, components, features, updates, upgrades, enhancements, modifications, new versions, and related documentation (whether in print or electronic format) provided by Licensor to Distributor under this Agreement. This definition explicitly includes any application programming interfaces (APIs), development kits, or other tools provided for integration or use with the primary software product.

The Software also encompasses any future products or services that Licensor may designate in writing as falling under the scope of this Agreement, along with any associated intellectual property rights, trade secrets, and confidential information related to its design, functionality, and operation. It is understood that the Software is licensed, not sold, and remains the exclusive property of Licensor.

1.2. "Territory" means the geographic region defined as [Specify Countries/Regions, e.g., "the United States of America and Canada"]. Distributor's rights to market, distribute, and sublicense the Software are strictly limited to End Users located within this specified Territory.

Any sales or marketing activities outside the defined Territory are expressly prohibited without the prior written consent of Licensor, which may be granted or withheld at Licensor's sole discretion. Should the Territory be expanded or modified, such changes must be formalized through a written amendment to this Agreement, duly executed by both parties.

1.3. "End User" means any individual, corporation, or other entity that acquires a license to use the Software directly or indirectly from Distributor for its own internal business purposes and not for further distribution or resale. An End User must agree to Licensor's standard End User License Agreement (EULA) prior to or upon installation and use of the Software.

Distributor shall ensure that all End Users are provided with and accept the EULA, and Distributor shall not make any representations or warranties to End Users that are inconsistent with or exceed those contained in the EULA or this Agreement. Distributor is responsible for the collection of all necessary End User acceptance records.

2. Term

This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall continue for an initial term of [Number] ([Number]) years ("Initial Term"), unless terminated earlier in accordance with the provisions of Section 10. The Initial Term is designed to allow both parties sufficient time to establish and evaluate the distribution relationship.

Upon the expiration of the Initial Term, this Agreement shall automatically renew for successive one (1) year periods ("Renewal Term"), unless either party provides written notice of its intent not to renew at least ninety (90) days prior to the end of the then-current term. Any non-renewal notice must be clear and unambiguous regarding the party's intent to terminate the contractual relationship at the end of the current period.

3. Grant of Rights

Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, Licensor hereby grants to Distributor a non-exclusive, non-transferable, revocable right to market, promote, distribute, and sublicense the Software to End Users within the Territory. This right is strictly limited to the distribution of the Software in its object code form, and Distributor is expressly prohibited from decompiling, reverse engineering, or modifying the Software.

Distributor's right to sublicense is contingent upon each End User agreeing to a valid End User License Agreement (EULA) provided or approved by Licensor, which shall protect Licensor's intellectual property rights and limit Licensor's liability to the fullest extent permitted by law. Distributor shall not create any warranties or obligations on behalf of Licensor beyond those expressly stated in the EULA or this Agreement, and any such unauthorized representations shall be the sole responsibility of Distributor.

4. Pricing and Payment Terms

Distributor shall purchase licenses for the Software from Licensor at the wholesale prices set forth in Licensor's then-current Distributor Price List, attached hereto as Exhibit A and incorporated by reference. Licensor reserves the right to update the Distributor Price List periodically, provided that any price changes shall not apply to orders placed and accepted prior to the effective date of such change, and Licensor shall provide Distributor with at least sixty (60) days' prior written notice of any price adjustments.

Payment for all Software licenses shall be due within thirty (30) days from the date of Licensor's invoice. All payments shall be made in United States Dollars (USD) via wire transfer to an account designated by Licensor. Overdue payments shall accrue interest at the rate of one and one-half percent (1.5%) per month, or the maximum rate permitted by law, whichever is less, calculated from the due date until paid in full. Distributor is solely responsible for all sales, use, value-added, and other taxes (excluding taxes on Licensor's income) arising from the distribution and sublicensing of the Software.

5. Support Obligations

Distributor shall provide first-line technical support to End Users for the Software within the Territory. This includes, but is not limited to, responding to initial inquiries, troubleshooting common issues, and providing basic guidance on Software usage. Distributor's support personnel shall be adequately trained by Licensor to perform these functions effectively, and Distributor shall maintain a reasonable level of staffing to meet End User support demands.

For issues that Distributor cannot resolve, Distributor shall escalate such issues to Licensor's second-line support team in accordance with Licensor's then-current support escalation procedures, which will be provided to Distributor. Licensor shall use commercially reasonable efforts to resolve escalated issues in a timely manner. Licensor shall also provide Distributor with access to its knowledge base, technical documentation, and any relevant training materials to assist Distributor in fulfilling its first-line support obligations.

6. Confidentiality

During the Term of this Agreement and for a period of five (5) years thereafter, each party ("Receiving Party") shall maintain in strict confidence all non-public information disclosed by the other party ("Disclosing Party") that is designated as confidential or that, by its nature, would reasonably be understood to be confidential ("Confidential Information"). Confidential Information includes, without limitation, the Software (including its source code and design), business plans, financial data, customer lists, marketing strategies, and technical specifications.

The Receiving Party shall use the Disclosing Party's Confidential Information solely for the purpose of performing its obligations or exercising its rights under this Agreement and shall not disclose such Confidential Information to any third party without the Disclosing Party's prior written consent, except to its employees, contractors, or agents who have a need to know and are bound by confidentiality obligations at least as protective as those herein. The obligations of confidentiality shall not apply to information that (a) is or becomes publicly available through no fault of the Receiving Party; (b) was known to the Receiving Party prior to disclosure; (c) is independently developed by the Receiving Party without use of the Disclosing Party's Confidential Information; or (d) is rightfully obtained by the Receiving Party from a third party without restriction on disclosure.

7. Intellectual Property

Distributor acknowledges that all intellectual property rights, including copyrights, patents, trademarks, trade secrets, and any other proprietary rights in and to the Software, including all modifications, enhancements, and derivative works thereof, are and shall remain the sole and exclusive property of Licensor. Nothing in this Agreement shall be construed as granting Distributor any ownership interest in the Software or any of Licensor's intellectual property.

Distributor shall not take any action inconsistent with Licensor's ownership of the Software and its intellectual property rights. Distributor agrees to promptly notify Licensor of any actual or suspected infringement of Licensor's intellectual property rights by any third party of which Distributor becomes aware. Distributor shall cooperate fully with Licensor, at Licensor's expense, in any action Licensor deems necessary to protect its intellectual property rights.

8. Warranties

Licensor warrants that it has the full power and authority to enter into this Agreement and to grant the rights herein granted. Licensor further warrants that the Software, when used in accordance with its documentation, will perform substantially in accordance with its specifications. This warranty is contingent upon proper installation and use of the Software and does not cover issues arising from misuse, unauthorized modifications, or use with unapproved third-party products.

EXCEPT AS EXPRESSLY PROVIDED IN THIS SECTION 8, THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS" AND LICENSOR MAKES NO OTHER WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, AND NONINFRINGEMENT. LICENSOR DOES NOT WARRANT THAT THE SOFTWARE WILL BE UNINTERRUPTED OR ERROR-FREE OR THAT ALL DEFECTS WILL BE CORRECTED. DISTRIBUTOR ACKNOWLEDGES THAT IT HAS NOT RELIED ON ANY REPRESENTATION OR WARRANTY MADE BY LICENSOR, EXCEPT AS SPECIFICALLY PROVIDED IN THIS AGREEMENT.

9. Indemnification

Distributor shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Licensor, its affiliates, and their respective officers, directors, employees, and agents from and against any and all claims, damages, losses, liabilities, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees) arising out of or in connection with (a) Distributor's breach of any of its obligations, representations, or warranties under this Agreement; (b) any misrepresentation or unauthorized warranty made by Distributor to an End User regarding the Software; (c) any claims by End Users arising from Distributor's acts or omissions; or (d) Distributor's negligence or willful misconduct.

Licensor shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Distributor from and against any third-party claim that the Software, as provided by Licensor and used in accordance with this Agreement, infringes any valid patent, copyright, or trademark of such third party. Licensor's indemnification obligations are conditioned upon Distributor (a) promptly notifying Licensor in writing of any such claim; (b) granting Licensor sole control of the defense and settlement thereof; and (c) providing reasonable assistance to Licensor at Licensor's expense. Licensor shall have no liability for any infringement claim arising from (i) use of the Software in combination with other products not supplied by Licensor; (ii) modification of the Software by anyone other than Licensor; or (iii) use of an outdated version of the Software if an updated, non-infringing version was provided by Licensor.

10. Limitation of Liability

TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW, IN NO EVENT SHALL LICENSOR BE LIABLE FOR ANY INDIRECT, PUNITIVE, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, CONSEQUENTIAL, OR EXEMPLARY DAMAGES, INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, DAMAGES FOR LOSS OF PROFITS, GOODWILL, USE, DATA, OR OTHER INTANGIBLE LOSSES, ARISING OUT OF OR RELATING TO THIS AGREEMENT OR THE USE OF OR INABILITY TO USE THE SOFTWARE, EVEN IF LICENSOR HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES. THIS LIMITATION APPLIES REGARDLESS OF THE LEGAL THEORY, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE), STRICT LIABILITY, OR OTHERWISE.

LICENSOR'S TOTAL AGGREGATE LIABILITY TO DISTRIBUTOR FOR ANY AND ALL CLAIMS ARISING OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THIS AGREEMENT OR THE SOFTWARE, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, TORT, OR OTHERWISE, SHALL NOT EXCEED THE TOTAL FEES PAID BY DISTRIBUTOR TO LICENSOR UNDER THIS AGREEMENT DURING THE TWELVE (12) MONTHS IMMEDIATELY PRECEDING THE EVENT GIVING RISE TO THE CLAIM. THE FOREGOING LIMITATIONS SHALL APPLY EVEN IF THE ABOVE-STATED REMEDY FAILS OF ITS ESSENTIAL PURPOSE. SOME JURISDICTIONS DO NOT ALLOW THE EXCLUSION OR LIMITATION OF INCIDENTAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES, SO THE ABOVE LIMITATION OR EXCLUSION MAY NOT APPLY TO DISTRIBUTOR.

11. Termination

Either party may terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice if the other party materially breaches any provision of this Agreement and fails to cure such breach within thirty (30) days after receiving written notice thereof. A material breach includes, but is not limited to, failure to make timely payments, unauthorized distribution of the Software, or breach of confidentiality obligations.

Upon termination of this Agreement for any reason, Distributor shall immediately cease all marketing, promotion, distribution, and sublicensing of the Software, and shall return or destroy all copies of the Software and any related documentation and Confidential Information in its possession. All outstanding payment obligations shall become immediately due and payable. Sections 1, 6, 7, 9, 10, 11, 12, and 13 shall survive any termination or expiration of this Agreement.

12. Governing Law

This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of [State, e.g., Delaware], without regard to its conflict of laws principles. This choice of law is intended to be comprehensive and to govern all aspects of the Agreement, including its formation, interpretation, performance, and enforcement.

The parties expressly exclude the application of the United Nations Convention on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods. Any legal action or proceeding arising under this Agreement shall be brought exclusively in the federal or state courts located in [County, State, e.g., New Castle County, Delaware], and the parties hereby consent to the personal jurisdiction and venue therein.

13. Dispute Resolution

Any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement, or the breach, termination, or invalidity thereof, shall first be attempted to be resolved through good faith negotiations between the parties. If the dispute cannot be resolved through negotiation within a period of sixty (60) days from the date one party notifies the other of a dispute, then either party may initiate formal dispute resolution.

All disputes that cannot be resolved amicably shall be submitted to binding arbitration administered by the American Arbitration Association ("AAA") in accordance with its Commercial Arbitration Rules, and judgment on the award rendered by the arbitrator(s) may be entered in any court having jurisdiction thereof. The arbitration shall be conducted in [City, State, e.g., Wilmington, Delaware] by a single arbitrator appointed in accordance with the AAA Rules. The language of the arbitration shall be English.

14. Miscellaneous

14.1. Entire Agreement. This Agreement, including any exhibits attached hereto, constitutes the entire agreement between the parties with respect to the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior and contemporaneous agreements, proposals, negotiations, representations, or communications, whether written or oral. No modification, amendment, or waiver of any provision of this Agreement shall be effective unless in writing and signed by duly authorized representatives of both parties.

14.2. Assignment. Neither party may assign or transfer this Agreement, in whole or in part, without the prior written consent of the other party, which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld, conditioned, or delayed. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Licensor may assign this Agreement without Distributor's consent in connection with a merger, acquisition, corporate reorganization, or sale of all or substantially all of its assets related to the Software.

14.3. Notices. All notices required or permitted under this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be deemed effectively given (a) upon personal delivery; (b) one (1) business day after deposit with a nationally recognized overnight courier, with written confirmation of delivery; or (c) three (3) business days after mailing by certified or registered mail, return receipt requested, postage prepaid, to the addresses first set forth above or to such other address as either party may designate by written notice to the other.

14.4. Severability. If any provision of this Agreement is held to be invalid or unenforceable by a court of competent jurisdiction, the remaining provisions shall remain in full force and effect. The parties agree to negotiate in good faith to replace any invalid or unenforceable provision with a valid and enforceable provision that achieves, to the greatest extent possible, the economic, business, and other purposes of the invalid or unenforceable provision.

14.5. Waiver. No waiver of any breach of any provision of this Agreement shall constitute a waiver of any prior, concurrent, or subsequent breach of the same or any other provisions hereof, and no waiver shall be effective unless made in writing and signed by an authorized representative of the waiving party. The failure of either party to enforce any right or provision in this Agreement shall not constitute a waiver of such right or provision unless acknowledged and agreed to in writing.

query: Draft a Referral Agreement outlining commission rates, lead tracking, branding guidelines, and payment terms for affiliates.

api1.updated_html:
REFERRAL PARTNER AGREEMENT

This Referral Partner Agreement (the "Agreement") is made and entered into as of this [Effective Date], by and between [Company Name], a corporation duly organized and existing under the laws of [State/Country of Company Incorporation], with its principal place of business located at [Company Address] ("Company"), and [Referral Partner Name], a [Legal Entity Type, e.g., individual, corporation, LLC] duly organized and existing under the laws of [State/Country of Referral Partner Incorporation/Residence], with its principal place of business/residence located at [Referral Partner Address] ("Referral Partner").

Company and Referral Partner are hereinafter collectively referred to as the "Parties" and individually as a "Party." This Agreement sets forth the terms and conditions under which the Referral Partner will refer potential clients or customers to the Company in exchange for a commission, as well as outlining the responsibilities, obligations, and rights of both Parties concerning lead generation, tracking, branding, and payment terms.

WHEREAS, Company is engaged in the business of [Brief Description of Company's Business, e.g., providing software solutions, marketing services, financial consulting];

WHEREAS, Referral Partner possesses expertise and a network capable of identifying and referring prospective clients who may benefit from the Company's offerings;

WHEREAS, the Parties desire to establish a mutually beneficial relationship whereby Referral Partner refers qualified leads to Company, and Company compensates Referral Partner for successful conversions resulting from such referrals;

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and promises contained herein, and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the Parties agree as follows:

1. Definitions

For the purposes of this Referral Agreement, the following terms shall have the meanings ascribed to them below:

"Agreement" shall mean this Referral Agreement, including all appendices, schedules, and exhibits attached hereto, as may be amended from time to time by mutual written consent of the Parties.

"Company" shall mean [Company Name], a [State of Incorporation] corporation with its principal place of business at [Company Address], and its successors and assigns, which provides the products or services to be referred under this Agreement.

"Affiliate" or "Referral Partner" shall mean [Affiliate Name], a [State of Organization] [Type of Entity] with its principal place of business at [Affiliate Address], and its successors and assigns, engaged by the Company to refer potential customers.

"Referred Customer" or "Lead" shall mean any individual or entity introduced by the Affiliate to the Company, who has not previously engaged with or been known to the Company, and who meets the criteria for a Qualified Lead as defined herein.

"Qualified Lead" shall mean a Referred Customer who (a) is a new customer to the Company, (b) has provided valid contact information, (c) has expressed genuine interest in the Company's products or services, and (d) meets any additional specific criteria outlined in Section [X.X] (Lead Qualification Criteria) of this Agreement, including but not limited to geographic location, minimum budget, or specific business needs.

"Referral Fee" or "Commission" shall mean the monetary compensation payable by the Company to the Affiliate for each successful conversion of a Qualified Lead into a paying customer, calculated as per the rates and terms specified in Section [X.X] (Commission Rates) of this Agreement, and subject to the payment terms in Section [X.X] (Payment Terms).

"Tracking Mechanism" shall refer to the mutually agreed-upon method, such as unique referral links, coupon codes, or CRM entries, used by the Company to accurately identify and attribute Qualified Leads originating from the Affiliate, as detailed in Section [X.X] (Lead Tracking and Attribution).

2. Term

This Agreement shall commence on the [Effective Date] and shall continue in full force and effect for an initial term of [Initial Term] (the "Initial Term"), unless terminated earlier in accordance with the provisions herein. Following the Initial Term, this Agreement shall automatically renew for successive renewal terms of [Renewal Term] each (each, a "Renewal Term"), unless either Party provides written notice of its intent not to renew to the other Party at least [Termination Notice Period] days prior to the end of the then-current Initial Term or Renewal Term. Such notice shall be delivered in accordance with the notice provisions set forth in this Agreement. The expiration or termination of this Agreement shall not affect any rights or obligations that accrued prior to the effective date of termination or expiration. Provisions which, by their nature, are intended to survive termination or expiration of this Agreement, including but not limited to confidentiality, indemnification, and payment obligations for commissions earned prior to termination, shall so survive.

3. Payment Terms

All commissions earned by [Affiliate Name] (hereinafter "Affiliate") under this Agreement shall be calculated based on the net revenue generated from Qualified Referrals, specifically excluding any taxes, shipping costs, refunds, chargebacks, or fraudulent transactions. The commission rate shall be as stipulated in Section 2 (Commission Rates) of this Agreement.

Payments to the Affiliate shall be processed on a [Payment Cycle, e.g., monthly, quarterly] basis, specifically on or before the [Day of Month, e.g., 15th] day following the end of each payment period. For example, commissions earned in January will be paid by February 15th.

A minimum payout threshold of [Minimum Payout Threshold, e.g., $50.00 USD] must be accumulated in the Affiliate's account before a payment will be issued. If the accumulated commission for a given period falls below this threshold, the balance will roll over to the next payment period until the threshold is met.

Payments will be made via [Payment Method, e.g., direct bank transfer, PayPal] to the account details provided by the Affiliate. It is the Affiliate's sole responsibility to ensure that their payment information is accurate and up-to-date. [Party A] shall not be liable for any delays or failures in payment due to incorrect or outdated information provided by the Affiliate.

The Affiliate acknowledges and agrees that they are solely responsible for all taxes, duties, or other governmental charges associated with the commissions earned under this Agreement. The Affiliate shall provide [Party A] with all necessary tax identification numbers and other relevant tax documentation as required by [Applicable Tax Laws] before any payments are disbursed. [Party A] reserves the right to withhold payments until such documentation is provided.

In the event of any refunds or chargebacks related to a Qualified Referral for which the Affiliate has already received commission, [Party A] reserves the right to deduct such previously paid commissions from future payouts to the Affiliate or to invoice the Affiliate for the overpayment, which shall be due within thirty (30) days of the invoice date.

4. Confidentiality

Each Party acknowledges that in the course of performing its obligations under this Referral Agreement, it may obtain or have access to certain confidential and proprietary information belonging to the other Party (hereinafter, "Confidential Information"). Confidential Information shall include, but not be limited to, the terms of this Agreement, commission rates, lead data, customer lists, business plans, marketing strategies, financial information, technical data, product designs, and any other non-public information designated as confidential or which, by its nature, would reasonably be understood to be confidential. Each Party agrees to keep all Confidential Information of the other Party in strict confidence and not to disclose, disseminate, or use such Confidential Information for any purpose other than the performance of its obligations under this Agreement, without the prior written consent of the disclosing Party.

The receiving Party shall exercise at least the same degree of care to prevent the unauthorized disclosure of Confidential Information as it exercises with respect to its own confidential information of a similar nature, but in no event less than a reasonable degree of care. The obligations of confidentiality hereunder shall not apply to information that: (a) is or becomes publicly available through no fault of the receiving Party; (b) was already in the possession of the receiving Party prior to its disclosure by the disclosing Party, as evidenced by written records; (c) is independently developed by the receiving Party without use of or reference to the disclosing Party's Confidential Information; (d) is rightfully obtained by the receiving Party from a third party without restriction on disclosure; or (e) is required to be disclosed by law, regulation, or court order, provided that the receiving Party provides prompt notice to the disclosing Party to allow an opportunity to seek a protective order or other appropriate remedy.

The confidentiality obligations set forth in this Section 4 shall survive the termination or expiration of this Agreement for a period of five (5) years, or indefinitely for trade secrets. Upon termination or expiration of this Agreement, or at any time upon the disclosing Party's written request, the receiving Party shall promptly return or destroy all Confidential Information of the disclosing Party, including all copies thereof, and certify such return or destruction in writing.

5. Intellectual Property

5.1. **Ownership of Existing Intellectual Property.** Each Party acknowledges and agrees that all intellectual property rights, including but not limited to copyrights, trademarks, trade names, service marks, logos, patents, trade secrets, and proprietary information, owned or licensed by a Party prior to or independent of this Agreement shall remain the sole and exclusive property of that respective Party. Nothing in this Agreement shall be construed as granting, assigning, or transferring any ownership interest in such intellectual property from one Party to the other.

5.2. **Limited License for Branding.** Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, [Company] hereby grants to [Referral Partner] a limited, non-exclusive, non-transferable, revocable, royalty-free license to use [Company]'s designated trademarks, service marks, trade names, and logos (collectively, "Company Marks") solely for the purpose of promoting [Company]'s products and services and fulfilling [Referral Partner]'s obligations under this Referral Agreement. [Referral Partner] agrees to use the Company Marks strictly in accordance with [Company]'s branding guidelines, which may be provided and updated by [Company] from time to time, and only for the duration of this Agreement.

5.3. **Restrictions on Use.** [Referral Partner] shall not alter, modify, or create derivative works from the Company Marks or any other intellectual property of [Company]. [Referral Partner] shall not use the Company Marks in any manner that is likely to cause confusion, disparage [Company], or otherwise damage the goodwill associated with the Company Marks. [Referral Partner] further agrees not to challenge the validity or ownership of the Company Marks or any other intellectual property of [Company] at any time, nor to register any marks or names confusingly similar to the Company Marks.

5.4. **No Implied Rights.** Except for the limited license expressly granted in Section 5.2, no other rights, licenses, or interests in [Company]'s intellectual property are granted or implied by this Agreement. All goodwill generated from the use of the Company Marks by [Referral Partner] shall inure solely to the benefit of [Company].

5.5. **Indemnification for Misuse.** [Referral Partner] shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless [Company] from and against any and all claims, damages, liabilities, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees) arising out of or related to [Referral Partner]'s unauthorized use, misuse, or infringement of [Company]'s intellectual property rights or any third-party intellectual property rights in connection with this Agreement.

6. Warranties

Each Party hereby represents and warrants to the other Party that it has the full power and authority to enter into and perform its obligations under this Agreement, and that the execution and performance of this Agreement will not violate any agreement to which it is a party or by which it is otherwise bound. [Referrer] specifically warrants that all leads, referrals, and information provided to [Company] shall be obtained in a lawful manner, in full compliance with all applicable data protection, privacy, and marketing laws and regulations (including, but not limited to, GDPR, CCPA, and CAN-SPAM Act), and shall not infringe upon the intellectual property rights, privacy rights, or any other rights of any third party. [Referrer] further warrants that it will not engage in any deceptive, misleading, or unethical practices when generating or referring leads. EXCEPT AS EXPRESSLY PROVIDED IN THIS AGREEMENT, NEITHER PARTY MAKES ANY WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, ANY IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, OR NON-INFRINGEMENT. Neither Party warrants that the operation of their respective services or platforms will be uninterrupted or error-free.

7. Indemnification

Each Party (the "Indemnifying Party") shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless the other Party (the "Indemnified Party"), its officers, directors, employees, agents, and affiliates from and against any and all losses, damages, liabilities, deficiencies, claims, actions, judgments, settlements, interest, awards, penalties, fines, costs, or expenses of whatever kind, including reasonable attorneys' fees, arising out of or resulting from any third-party claim, suit, action, or proceeding (a "Claim") alleging: (a) any breach by the Indemnifying Party of any representation, warranty, or covenant contained in this Agreement; (b) any negligent or more culpable act or omission of the Indemnifying Party (including any recklessness or willful misconduct) in connection with the performance of its obligations under this Agreement; or (c) any violation by the Indemnifying Party of any applicable law, regulation, or third-party right, including but not limited to intellectual property rights or privacy rights, in connection with its activities hereunder. The Indemnified Party shall provide prompt written notice of any such Claim and shall cooperate with the Indemnifying Party, at the Indemnifying Party's sole cost and expense, in the defense of any such Claim. This indemnification obligation shall not apply to the extent that a Claim arises from the gross negligence or willful misconduct of the Indemnified Party.

8. Limitation of Liability

NOTWITHSTANDING ANY OTHER PROVISION HEREIN, NEITHER [Company Name] NOR [Referral Partner] SHALL BE LIABLE TO THE OTHER PARTY FOR ANY INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, CONSEQUENTIAL, SPECIAL, PUNITIVE, OR EXEMPLARY DAMAGES, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO, LOSS OF PROFITS, REVENUE, DATA, GOODWILL, OR ANTICIPATED SAVINGS, ARISING OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THIS AGREEMENT, EVEN IF SUCH PARTY HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES. THIS LIMITATION APPLIES REGARDLESS OF THE FORM OF ACTION, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE), STRICT LIABILITY, OR OTHERWISE, AND EVEN IF ANY LIMITED REMEDY PROVIDED HEREIN FAILS OF ITS ESSENTIAL PURPOSE. THE TOTAL AGGREGATE LIABILITY OF EITHER PARTY TO THE OTHER FOR ANY AND ALL CLAIMS ARISING OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THIS AGREEMENT, OR THE PERFORMANCE OR BREACH THEREOF, SHALL IN NO EVENT EXCEED THE TOTAL COMMISSION FEES PAID OR PAYABLE BY [Company Name] TO [Referral Partner] UNDER THIS AGREEMENT DURING THE TWELVE (12) MONTHS IMMEDIATELY PRECEDING THE DATE ON WHICH THE CLAIM AROSE. THIS LIMITATION OF LIABILITY REFLECTS AN AGREED-UPON ALLOCATION OF RISK BETWEEN THE PARTIES AND IS A FUNDAMENTAL ELEMENT OF THE BASIS OF THE BARGAIN BETWEEN [Company Name] AND [Referral Partner].

9. Termination

This Referral Agreement (the "Agreement") may be terminated under the following conditions:

9.1. Termination for Convenience: Either [Party A] or [Party B] may terminate this Agreement for any reason, or no reason, by providing not less than [Notice Period, e.g., thirty (30)] days' prior written notice to the other Party. Such termination shall be effective upon the expiration of the specified notice period.

9.2. Termination for Cause: Either Party may terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice to the other Party if the other Party commits a material breach of any term, condition, or covenant contained in this Agreement and fails to cure such breach within [Cure Period, e.g., fifteen (15)] days after receiving written notice thereof from the non-breaching Party. Material breaches include, but are not limited to, failure to make timely payments, violation of branding guidelines, misrepresentation of services, or engaging in fraudulent or unethical lead generation practices.

9.3. Termination Upon Insolvency: This Agreement shall terminate automatically and immediately without the need for notice upon the filing of a petition for bankruptcy by or against either Party, insolvency, assignment for the benefit of creditors, or the appointment of a receiver for either Party's assets, provided such event is not dismissed or cured within [Number] days.

9.4. Effect of Termination: Upon the effective date of termination of this Agreement for any reason whatsoever:

  • All rights and licenses granted to [Party B] hereunder shall immediately cease and revert to [Party A].
  • [Party B] shall immediately cease all use of [Party A]'s branding, trademarks, confidential information, and any other proprietary materials.
  • [Party B] shall return to [Party A] (or destroy, if so directed by [Party A]) all confidential information and materials belonging to [Party A] within [Number] days of the termination date, certifying such destruction upon request.
  • [Party A] shall pay [Party B] all accrued and undisputed commissions earned for Qualified Leads generated and properly tracked *prior* to the effective date of termination, in accordance with the payment terms set forth in Section 6. No commissions shall be due for leads generated after the termination date.
  • The termination of this Agreement shall not relieve either Party of any obligations or liabilities accrued hereunder prior to such termination, nor shall it affect any provisions of this Agreement which are expressly or by implication intended to survive termination, including but not limited to Sections [e.g., 7. Confidentiality, 8. Indemnification, 10. Governing Law, 11. Dispute Resolution].

10. Governing Law

This Referral Agreement and any disputes or claims arising out of or in connection with it or its subject matter or formation (including non-contractual disputes or claims) shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the internal laws of the State of [State of Governing Law], without giving effect to any choice or conflict of law provision or rule (whether of the State of [State of Governing Law] or any other jurisdiction) that would cause the application of the laws of any jurisdiction other than those of the State of [State of Governing Law]. The Parties hereto irrevocably agree that any legal action or proceeding arising out of or relating to this Agreement shall be instituted exclusively in the federal or state courts located in [County of Governing Law] County, State of [State of Governing Law]. Each Party hereby irrevocably submits to the exclusive jurisdiction of such courts in any such suit, action, or proceeding and waives any objection based on forum non conveniens or any other ground. Each Party further agrees that service of any process, summons, notice, or document by U.S. registered mail to such Party's address set forth herein shall be effective service of process for any action, suit, or proceeding brought in any such court.

11. Dispute Resolution

Any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Referral Agreement, including without limitation the formation, interpretation, breach, or termination thereof, shall first be subject to good-faith negotiation between [Party A] and [Party B]. If the Parties are unable to resolve the dispute through direct negotiation within thirty (30) days of the date one Party notifies the other of the dispute, the Parties agree to engage in non-binding mediation. The mediation shall be conducted in [City, State] by a mutually agreed-upon mediator. If the Parties are unable to agree on a mediator within fifteen (15) days, or if the mediation does not resolve the dispute within sixty (60) days of the initial notice of dispute, then any unresolved dispute shall be submitted to and finally resolved by binding arbitration administered by [Arbitration Association, e.g., American Arbitration Association (AAA)] in accordance with its Commercial Arbitration Rules. The arbitration shall be conducted by a single arbitrator, mutually agreed upon by the Parties, and shall take place in [City, State]. The decision of the arbitrator shall be final and binding upon both Parties, and judgment on the award rendered by the arbitrator may be entered in any court having jurisdiction thereof. Each Party shall bear its own costs and attorneys' fees associated with the arbitration, and the costs of the arbitration, including the arbitrator's fees, shall be shared equally by the Parties, unless the arbitrator determines otherwise. This Section shall not preclude either Party from seeking injunctive relief in a court of competent jurisdiction for the protection of its intellectual property rights or for other equitable remedies where monetary damages would be insufficient. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of [State], without regard to its conflict of laws principles.

12. Signatures

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties hereto have executed this Referral Agreement as of the Effective Date first written above, acknowledging their full understanding and acceptance of all terms and conditions contained herein. Each Party represents and warrants that its respective signatory is duly authorized to execute this Agreement on behalf of the entity for whom they sign, thereby binding such entity to the terms and obligations set forth herein. This Agreement may be executed in counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument. Facsimile or electronic signatures shall be deemed original signatures for all purposes.

[Legal Name of Party A]

By: ___________________________________

Name: [Print Name of Party A Signatory]

Title: [Title of Party A Signatory]

Date: [Date of Signature]

[Legal Name of Party B]

By: ___________________________________

Name: [Print Name of Party B Signatory]

Title: [Title of Party B Signatory]

Date: [Date of Signature]
