api2.updated_html:
REFERRAL AGREEMENT

This Referral Agreement ("Agreement") is made and entered into as of [Date], by and between:

[Company Name], a [State of Incorporation] corporation, with its principal place of business at [Company Address] ("Company").

AND

[Affiliate Name/Entity Name], a [State of Incorporation/Residence] [Type of Entity/Individual], with its principal place of business/residence at [Affiliate Address] ("Affiliate").

WHEREAS, Company is engaged in the business of [Description of Company's business, e.g., providing software solutions, selling consumer goods, offering services];

WHEREAS, Affiliate desires to refer potential customers to Company in exchange for commissions, subject to the terms and conditions set forth herein; and

WHEREAS, Company desires to engage Affiliate for such referral services under the terms and conditions hereinafter appearing.

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and agreements contained herein, and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the parties agree as follows:

1. Definitions

For the purposes of this Agreement, the following terms shall have the meanings ascribed to them below. "Qualified Lead" means a new, unique prospective customer referred by Affiliate to Company who meets specific criteria, including but not limited to, not being an existing customer or prospect in Company's sales database, providing complete and accurate contact information, and demonstrating a genuine interest in Company's products or services as determined by Company's internal qualification process. The specific qualification criteria may be updated by Company from time to time with prior written notice to Affiliate.

"Commission" refers to the monetary compensation payable by Company to Affiliate for each successful conversion of a Qualified Lead into a paying customer, as defined in Section 3. "Referral Period" denotes the specified timeframe, commencing from the initial referral date, during which a Qualified Lead must complete a purchase or subscription for Affiliate to be eligible for a Commission. This period is typically [Number] days, unless otherwise mutually agreed upon in writing by both parties. "Branding Guidelines" refers to the specific rules and requirements set forth by Company for the use of its trademarks, logos, and other intellectual property in Affiliate's marketing and promotional activities.

2. Referral Process and Lead Tracking

Affiliate shall diligently identify and refer potential customers to the Company using the unique tracking links, codes, or designated referral forms provided by the Company. It is the Affiliate's sole responsibility to ensure that all referrals are properly attributed through these mechanisms, and the Company shall not be liable for any unrecorded referrals resulting from the Affiliate's failure to utilize the designated tracking methods. The Affiliate must clearly and conspicuously disclose their affiliate relationship with the Company to all referred parties as legally required by applicable consumer protection laws and regulations.

The Company will provide Affiliate with access to a referral tracking system or dashboard to monitor the status of referred leads and associated commissions. Company reserves the right to validate the qualification of any lead in its sole discretion, and its determination shall be final and binding on the Affiliate. Any manipulation, fraudulent activity, or misrepresentation in lead generation, including but not limited to, self-referrals or referrals of non-existent entities, will result in immediate termination of this Agreement and forfeiture of all unpaid and future commissions, in addition to any other remedies available to Company at law or in equity.

3. Commission Rates and Payment Terms

Company shall pay Affiliate a Commission at the rate of [Percentage]% of the net revenue generated from each Qualified Lead who successfully converts into a paying customer and completes a purchase of [Specific Product/Service, e.g., a subscription for at least three months, a product exceeding $X in value]. Net revenue shall be calculated after deducting any refunds, chargebacks, discounts, or sales taxes. Commission rates are subject to change by Company upon [Number] days' prior written notice to Affiliate, and such changes will apply to referrals made after the effective date of the notice.

Commissions will be calculated on a [Monthly/Quarterly] basis and paid to Affiliate within [Number] days following the end of each calculation period, provided that the total accrued commission balance exceeds a minimum threshold of [Minimum Payout Amount, e.g., $50.00]. Payments will be made via [Payment Method, e.g., bank transfer, PayPal] to the account details provided by Affiliate. Affiliate is solely responsible for all taxes, duties, and other governmental charges associated with the commissions earned under this Agreement, and Company will issue appropriate tax documentation as required by law.

4. Branding Guidelines and Restrictions

Affiliate is granted a limited, non-exclusive, non-transferable, revocable license to use Company's trademarks, logos, and other intellectual property ("Company Marks") solely for the purpose of promoting Company's products and services in accordance with the Branding Guidelines provided by Company. Affiliate agrees to adhere strictly to these guidelines, which may be updated periodically, regarding the size, placement, and appearance of Company Marks. Any use of Company Marks not expressly permitted by the Branding Guidelines or this Agreement is strictly prohibited and constitutes a material breach.

Affiliate shall not modify, distort, or otherwise alter Company Marks, nor use them in any manner that implies endorsement by Company of Affiliate's own products or services, or that could be deemed misleading, derogatory, or detrimental to Company's reputation or goodwill. Affiliate further agrees not to register or use any domain names, social media handles, or business names that are confusingly similar to Company's trademarks. Upon termination of this Agreement, Affiliate shall immediately cease all use of Company Marks and remove all Company-related content from its platforms.

5. Term and Termination

This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and continue for an initial term of [Number] year(s) ("Initial Term"), unless terminated earlier as provided herein. Following the Initial Term, this Agreement shall automatically renew for successive [Number] year(s) periods ("Renewal Term") unless either party provides written notice of non-renewal to the other party at least [Number] days prior to the end of the then-current term. The terms and conditions of this Agreement shall apply to all Renewal Terms.

Either party may terminate this Agreement for convenience upon [Number] days' prior written notice to the other party. Additionally, either party may terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice if the other party commits a material breach of any provision of this Agreement and fails to cure such breach within [Number] days after receiving written notice thereof. Upon termination, Affiliate shall cease all referral activities, and Company shall pay all earned and undisputed commissions accrued up to the effective date of termination, subject to any applicable holdbacks for potential refunds or chargebacks.

6. Confidentiality

During the Term of this Agreement, each party ("Receiving Party") may receive or have access to confidential and proprietary information ("Confidential Information") of the other party ("Disclosing Party"), including but not limited to, business plans, customer lists, financial data, marketing strategies, product designs, and technical specifications. The Receiving Party agrees to hold all Confidential Information in strict confidence and to use it solely for the purpose of fulfilling its obligations under this Agreement. The Receiving Party shall not disclose, disseminate, or otherwise make available Confidential Information to any third party without the Disclosing Party's prior written consent.

The obligations of confidentiality shall survive the termination or expiration of this Agreement for a period of [Number] years. This obligation does not apply to information that (a) is or becomes publicly available through no fault of the Receiving Party; (b) was known to the Receiving Party prior to its disclosure by the Disclosing Party; (c) is independently developed by the Receiving Party without use of or reference to the Disclosing Party's Confidential Information; or (d) is required to be disclosed by law, provided that the Receiving Party gives prompt notice to the Disclosing Party to allow it to seek a protective order or other appropriate remedy.

7. Intellectual Property

All intellectual property rights, including copyrights, trademarks, trade secrets, and patents, related to Company's products, services, website, marketing materials, and any other proprietary information, shall remain the sole and exclusive property of Company. Affiliate acknowledges that it acquires no right, title, or interest in or to Company's intellectual property other than the limited license explicitly granted in Section 4 for the purpose of performing its obligations hereunder. Affiliate agrees not to challenge the validity of Company's intellectual property rights or assist any third party in doing so.

Affiliate shall not create any derivative works based on Company's intellectual property, nor use Company's intellectual property in any manner that would dilute its value or create confusion in the marketplace. Any materials created by Affiliate in connection with this Agreement, excluding the Company Marks, shall be the property of Affiliate, provided that such materials do not infringe on Company's intellectual property rights. Upon termination, Affiliate shall immediately cease all use of Company's intellectual property and, upon Company's request, destroy or return all materials containing Company's intellectual property.

8. Warranties

Each party represents and warrants to the other that it has the full power and authority to enter into and perform its obligations under this Agreement, and that the execution and delivery of this Agreement does not violate any other agreement to which it is a party. Each party further warrants that it will comply with all applicable laws, rules, and regulations in its performance under this Agreement, including but not limited to, consumer protection laws, privacy laws, and anti-spam regulations. Affiliate specifically warrants that its marketing activities will be truthful, not misleading, and will not engage in any unethical or unlawful practices.

Affiliate warrants that it will not use any unsolicited email (spam) or other illegal or unethical methods to promote Company's products or services. Affiliate further warrants that it will not make any representations, warranties, or guarantees regarding Company's products or services beyond those expressly authorized by Company in writing. Company warrants that its products and services will perform substantially in accordance with their published specifications and that it will use commercially reasonable efforts to provide uninterrupted service. EXCEPT AS EXPRESSLY PROVIDED IN THIS SECTION, NEITHER PARTY MAKES ANY OTHER WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO, ANY IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, OR NON-INFRINGEMENT.

9. Indemnification

Affiliate agrees to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Company, its officers, directors, employees, and agents from and against any and all claims, liabilities, damages, losses, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees) arising out of or in connection with (a) any breach by Affiliate of its representations, warranties, or obligations under this Agreement; (b) any negligent or willful act or omission of Affiliate; or (c) any claim that Affiliate's marketing activities or content infringe upon the intellectual property rights or other rights of any third party. This indemnification obligation shall survive the termination of this Agreement.

Company agrees to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Affiliate, its officers, directors, employees, and agents from and against any and all claims, liabilities, damages, losses, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees) arising out of or in connection with (a) any breach by Company of its representations, warranties, or obligations under this Agreement; or (b) any claim that Company's products or services, as provided by Company, infringe upon the intellectual property rights of any third party. The indemnified party shall provide prompt written notice of any claim for which indemnification is sought and shall cooperate with the indemnifying party in the defense of such claim.

10. Limitation of Liability

TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW, IN NO EVENT SHALL EITHER PARTY BE LIABLE TO THE OTHER PARTY FOR ANY INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, CONSEQUENTIAL, SPECIAL, PUNITIVE, OR EXEMPLARY DAMAGES (INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, DAMAGES FOR LOSS OF BUSINESS, PROFITS, GOODWILL, OR DATA), ARISING OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THIS AGREEMENT, REGARDLESS OF THE FORM OF ACTION, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE), STRICT LIABILITY, OR OTHERWISE, EVEN IF SUCH PARTY HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES.

NOTWITHSTANDING ANYTHING TO THE CONTRARY CONTAINED HEREIN, EACH PARTY'S TOTAL CUMULATIVE LIABILITY TO THE OTHER PARTY FOR ANY AND ALL CLAIMS ARISING OUT OF OR RELATING TO THIS AGREEMENT, REGARDLESS OF THE FORM OF ACTION, SHALL NOT EXCEED THE TOTAL COMMISSIONS PAID OR PAYABLE BY COMPANY TO AFFILIATE UNDER THIS AGREEMENT DURING THE TWELVE (12) MONTHS IMMEDIATELY PRECEDING THE DATE ON WHICH THE CLAIM AROSE. THE FOREGOING LIMITATIONS SHALL APPLY EVEN IF THE ABOVE-STATED REMEDY FAILS OF ITS ESSENTIAL PURPOSE.

11. Governing Law and Dispute Resolution

This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of [State, e.g., Delaware], without regard to its conflict of laws principles. Any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement, or the breach, termination, or invalidity thereof, shall first be subjected to good faith negotiations between the parties for a period of at least thirty (30) days from the date one party provides written notice of the dispute to the other. During this period, authorized representatives of both parties will meet to attempt to resolve the dispute.

If the dispute cannot be resolved through negotiation, the parties agree to submit the dispute to binding arbitration administered by the American Arbitration Association ("AAA") in accordance with its Commercial Arbitration Rules, and judgment on the award rendered by the arbitrator(s) may be entered in any court having jurisdiction thereof. The arbitration shall take place in [City, State], and shall be conducted by a single arbitrator appointed in accordance with the AAA rules. The prevailing party in any arbitration or litigation arising from this Agreement shall be entitled to recover its reasonable attorneys' fees and costs.

12. Miscellaneous

This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between the parties with respect to the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior and contemporaneous agreements, understandings, negotiations, and discussions, whether oral or written, of the parties. No amendment, modification, or waiver of any provision of this Agreement shall be effective unless in writing and signed by duly authorized representatives of both parties. The failure of either party to enforce any right or provision of this Agreement shall not be deemed a waiver of such right or provision.

If any provision of this Agreement is held to be invalid or unenforceable, the remaining provisions shall remain in full force and effect. Neither party may assign or transfer its rights or obligations under this Agreement, in whole or in part, without the prior written consent of the other party, except that Company may assign this Agreement without consent in connection with a merger, acquisition, or sale of all or substantially all of its assets. This Agreement may be executed in counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument.

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have executed this Referral Agreement as of the date first written above.

[Company Name]

By: ______________________________

Name: [Authorized Signatory Name]

Title: [Authorized Signatory Title]

Date: ______________________________

[Affiliate Name/Entity Name]

By: ______________________________

Name: [Authorized Signatory Name]

Title: [Authorized Signatory Title]

Date: ______________________________

query: Draft a Joint Venture Agreement between [Company A] and [Company B] to collaborate on [project], including roles, IP ownership, and revenue split.

api1.updated_html:
JOINT VENTURE AGREEMENT

This Joint Venture Agreement ("Agreement") is made and entered into as of [Effective Date] (the "Effective Date"), by and between [Company A], a corporation duly organized and existing under the laws of [State/Country of Company A], with its principal place of business located at [Address of Company A] ("Company A"), and [Company B], a corporation duly organized and existing under the laws of [State/Country of Company B], with its principal place of business located at [Address of Company B] ("Company B"). Company A and Company B are hereinafter collectively referred to as the "Parties" and individually as a "Party."

WHEREAS, the Parties desire to form a joint venture to collaborate on the development, execution, and commercialization of [project] (the "Project"), leveraging their respective expertise, resources, and market presence;

WHEREAS, the Parties intend to define their respective roles, responsibilities, contributions, intellectual property ownership, and the methodology for revenue sharing and profit distribution arising from the Project;

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and agreements contained herein, and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the Parties agree as follows:

1. Definitions

For the purposes of this Joint Venture Agreement, the following terms shall have the meanings ascribed to them below, unless the context clearly indicates otherwise:

"Agreement" means this Joint Venture Agreement, including all schedules, exhibits, and appendices attached hereto, as may be amended, restated, or supplemented from time to time in accordance with its terms.

"Company A" refers to [Company A], a corporation duly organized and existing under the laws of [Jurisdiction of Company A], with its principal place of business located at [Address of Company A].

"Company B" refers to [Company B], a corporation duly organized and existing under the laws of [Jurisdiction of Company B], with its principal place of business located at [Address of Company B].

"Effective Date" means [Effective Date], the date upon which this Agreement becomes legally binding upon the Parties.

"Intellectual Property" or "IP" means all intellectual property rights, including, but not limited to, patents, copyrights, trademarks, service marks, trade names, trade secrets, know-how, designs, inventions, discoveries, improvements, data, software, algorithms, and all other proprietary rights, whether registered or unregistered, and all applications for the foregoing, arising from or developed in connection with the Project.

"Joint Venture" or "JV" means the collaborative undertaking established by Company A and Company B pursuant to this Agreement for the sole purpose of executing the Project.

"Project" means the specific collaborative endeavor described in detail in Section 3 of this Agreement, focusing on [brief description of project, e.g., "the development, marketing, and distribution of a new software application for financial planning"].

2. Term

This Joint Venture Agreement (the "Agreement") shall become effective on the [Effective Date] (the "Effective Date") and shall continue in full force and effect for an initial term of [Initial Term Period] ([e.g., five (5)]) years from the Effective Date (the "Initial Term"), unless terminated earlier in accordance with the provisions of Section 10 ("Termination") herein. Following the Initial Term, this Agreement shall automatically renew for successive renewal terms of [Renewal Term Period] ([e.g., one (1)]) year each (each, a "Renewal Term"), unless either [Company A] or [Company B] provides written notice of its intent not to renew to the other party at least [Notice Period for Non-Renewal] ([e.g., ninety (90)]) days prior to the expiration of the then-current Initial Term or Renewal Term, as applicable. Such notice of non-renewal shall be delivered in accordance with the notice provisions set forth in Section 15 ("Notices"). Notwithstanding any termination or expiration of this Agreement, the provisions relating to intellectual property ownership, confidentiality, indemnification, dispute resolution, and any other provisions which by their nature are intended to survive, shall remain in full force and effect.

3. Payment Terms

All net revenues generated from the Joint Venture's activities pertaining to the [Project Name] shall be distributed between [Company A] and [Company B] in accordance with the revenue split percentages stipulated in Section [X. Revenue Split] of this Agreement. "Net revenues" shall be defined as gross revenues less all agreed-upon and documented project expenses, operational costs, and taxes directly attributable to the [Project Name].

Distributions of net revenues shall be made on a [Payment Frequency] basis, specifically within [Number] days following the end of each [Payment Frequency] period, commencing from the [Effective Date]. Each Party shall provide the other with a detailed financial statement, certified by an authorized financial officer, no later than [Number] days prior to the distribution date, outlining all revenues and expenses for the preceding period.

All payments due hereunder shall be made by electronic funds transfer to the designated bank accounts provided by each Party. Each Party shall provide the other with their respective bank account details in writing, and any changes thereto shall require [Notice Period] prior written notice. All payments and financial calculations under this Agreement shall be denominated and settled in [Currency].

Any amounts not paid when due shall accrue interest at the rate of [Interest Rate]% per annum, compounded monthly, from the due date until the date of actual payment. Such interest shall be calculated on a daily basis. This provision shall not limit any other remedies available to the non-defaulting Party under this Agreement or at law.

Approved and documented joint venture expenses incurred by either Party on behalf of the [Project Name] shall be reimbursed or offset against future distributions, as mutually agreed upon in writing by both Parties. All expenses must be pre-approved or fall within the agreed-upon budget outlined in Exhibit [Y. Budget] attached hereto.

4. Confidentiality

Each party, being [Company A] and [Company B] (collectively, the "Parties" and individually a "Party"), acknowledges that during the course of this Joint Venture Agreement and the collaboration on the [Project], they may be exposed to or gain access to confidential and proprietary information belonging to the other Party. "Confidential Information" shall mean any and all non-public information, whether commercial, financial, technical, operational, or otherwise, disclosed by one Party (the "Disclosing Party") to the other Party (the "Receiving Party"), directly or indirectly, in writing, orally, or by inspection of tangible objects, including, but not limited to, trade secrets, business plans, product specifications, customer lists, financial data, marketing strategies, intellectual property, and any information explicitly designated as confidential.

The Receiving Party agrees to maintain the strictest confidence regarding all Confidential Information received from the Disclosing Party and shall not, without the prior written consent of the Disclosing Party, disclose, publish, or disseminate such Confidential Information to any third party, nor use such Confidential Information for any purpose other than for the performance of its obligations and exercise of its rights under this Agreement and in furtherance of the [Project]. The Receiving Party shall take all reasonable measures to protect the secrecy of and avoid disclosure or unauthorized use of the Confidential Information, exercising at least the same degree of care as it uses to protect its own confidential information of a similar nature, but in no event less than reasonable care.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, Confidential Information shall not include information that: (a) is or becomes publicly available through no fault of the Receiving Party; (b) was in the Receiving Party's possession prior to receipt from the Disclosing Party, as evidenced by written records; (c) is rightfully obtained by the Receiving Party from a third party without restriction on disclosure and without breach of this Agreement; (d) is independently developed by the Receiving Party without use of or reference to the Disclosing Party's Confidential Information; or (e) is required to be disclosed by law, regulation, or court order, provided that the Receiving Party gives prompt written notice to the Disclosing Party to allow the Disclosing Party to seek a protective order or other appropriate remedy.

The obligations of confidentiality and non-use set forth herein shall survive the termination or expiration of this Agreement for a period of five (5) years from the date of such termination or expiration, except for trade secrets, which shall remain confidential indefinitely or for as long as they qualify as trade secrets under applicable law. Each Party acknowledges that a breach of this Section 4 would cause irreparable harm to the Disclosing Party, for which monetary damages would not be an adequate remedy, and therefore, in the event of such a breach or threatened breach, the Disclosing Party shall be entitled to seek injunctive relief in addition to any other remedies available at law or in equity.

5. Intellectual Property

All intellectual property rights, including but not limited to patents, copyrights, trademarks, trade secrets, designs, know-how, and any other proprietary rights, whether registered or unregistered, arising from or created in connection with the Joint Venture and the execution of the [Project] (hereinafter, "Joint IP"), shall be jointly owned by [Company A] and [Company B] in equal, undivided shares. Each Party shall have the right to use, license, exploit, and commercialize the Joint IP independently, without the consent of, or accounting to, the other Party, provided such use does not derogate from the other Party's rights or the objectives of this Agreement.

Each Party shall retain sole ownership of all intellectual property rights developed, owned, or licensed by it prior to the [Effective Date] or independently of the Joint Venture (hereinafter, "Pre-existing IP"). However, each Party hereby grants to the other Party, and to the Joint Venture, a non-exclusive, worldwide, royalty-free, sublicensable license to use, reproduce, modify, and distribute its Pre-existing IP solely for the purpose of carrying out the [Project] and fulfilling the objectives of this Joint Venture Agreement. This license shall terminate upon the termination of this Agreement, subject to any ongoing rights necessary for the continued exploitation of Joint IP.

The Parties agree to cooperate fully in the protection, registration, maintenance, and enforcement of all Joint IP. Decisions regarding the filing of patent applications, copyright registrations, trademark registrations, or any other intellectual property protection measures for Joint IP shall be made jointly by the Parties. The costs associated with such protection and enforcement shall be shared equally by [Company A] and [Company B]. In the event of any infringement or misappropriation of Joint IP, the Parties shall consult and agree upon a joint course of action, including litigation, with costs and any recoveries to be shared equally.

6. Warranties

Each Party, being [Company A] and [Company B] (each a "Warranting Party"), hereby represents and warrants to the other Party that, as of the Effective Date of this Agreement and throughout its term:

(a) **Due Organization and Good Standing**: The Warranting Party is duly organized, validly existing, and in good standing under the laws of the jurisdiction of its incorporation or formation, and has the full corporate power and authority to own its properties and to conduct its business as it is now being conducted.

(b) **Authority and Due Execution**: The Warranting Party has the full corporate power and authority to enter into this Agreement and to perform its obligations hereunder. The execution and delivery of this Agreement by the Warranting Party and the performance by the Warranting Party of its obligations hereunder have been duly authorized by all necessary corporate or other organizational action on the part of the Warranting Party. This Agreement constitutes a legal, valid, and binding obligation of the Warranting Party, enforceable against it in accordance with its terms.

(c) **No Conflict**: The execution, delivery, and performance by the Warranting Party of this Agreement do not and will not (i) violate any provision of its organizational documents, (ii) conflict with or result in a breach of any agreement, instrument, or understanding to which the Warranting Party is a party or by which it is bound, or (iii) violate any applicable law, rule, regulation, judgment, injunction, order, or decree of any governmental authority having jurisdiction over the Warranting Party.

(d) **No Litigation**: There is no action, suit, proceeding, claim, or investigation pending or, to the Warranting Party's knowledge, threatened against the Warranting Party that would materially impair its ability to perform its obligations under this Agreement or that would materially and adversely affect the Joint Venture or the [project].

(e) **Intellectual Property**: Any intellectual property, technology, information, or materials contributed by the Warranting Party to the Joint Venture for the [project] are owned by the Warranting Party or the Warranting Party has all necessary rights, licenses, and permissions to use and grant the rights granted herein to the Joint Venture and the other Party, and the use of such intellectual property, technology, information, or materials as contemplated by this Agreement does not infringe upon, misappropriate, or violate the intellectual property rights of any third party.

7. Indemnification

Each Party (the "Indemnifying Party") shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless the other Party (the "Indemnified Party"), its respective affiliates, directors, officers, employees, agents, and successors from and against any and all claims, demands, liabilities, losses, damages, costs, and expenses (including, without limitation, reasonable attorneys' fees, court costs, and settlement amounts) arising out of or in connection with: (a) any breach by the Indemnifying Party of any representation, warranty, covenant, or obligation contained in this Joint Venture Agreement; (b) any gross negligence or willful misconduct of the Indemnifying Party or its personnel in the performance of its obligations hereunder or in connection with the [project]; or (c) any violation by the Indemnifying Party of any applicable law, regulation, or the rights of any third party. The Indemnified Party shall provide prompt written notice of any such claim and shall cooperate with the Indemnifying Party, at the Indemnifying Party's expense, in the defense thereof. The Indemnifying Party shall have sole control over the defense and settlement of any such claim, provided that no settlement shall be entered into without the Indemnified Party's prior written consent, which shall not be unreasonably withheld. This indemnification obligation shall not apply to the extent that any loss or damage is caused by the gross negligence or willful misconduct of the Indemnified Party. This Section 7 shall survive the termination or expiration of this Agreement.

8. Limitation of Liability

Except for liabilities arising from gross negligence, willful misconduct, fraud, breach of confidentiality obligations as set forth in Section [X. Confidentiality] of this Agreement, or infringement/misappropriation of Intellectual Property Rights as set forth in Section [Y. Intellectual Property Ownership], neither [Company A] nor [Company B], nor their respective officers, directors, employees, agents, or affiliates, shall be liable to the other party for any indirect, incidental, consequential, special, punitive, or exemplary damages, including, but not limited to, loss of profits, loss of revenue, loss of data, loss of business opportunity, or loss of goodwill, arising out of or in connection with this Agreement or the Joint Venture, regardless of the form of action, whether in contract, tort (including negligence), strict liability, or otherwise, even if advised of the possibility of such damages. Furthermore, the total aggregate liability of either [Company A] or [Company B] to the other party for any and all claims arising out of or in connection with this Agreement, regardless of the cause of action, shall not exceed the total amount of direct financial contributions made by the claiming party to the Joint Venture as of the date the claim arose, or a maximum sum of [Specific Monetary Cap, e.g., $500,000.00 USD], whichever is less. This limitation of liability shall apply to the fullest extent permitted by applicable law and shall survive the termination or expiration of this Agreement.

9. Termination

This Joint Venture Agreement may be terminated prior to its natural expiration under the following circumstances:

(a) **Mutual Agreement:** This Agreement may be terminated at any time by the mutual written agreement of [Company A] and [Company B]. Such termination shall be effective on the date specified in the written agreement.

(b) **Material Breach:** Either Party (the "Non-Breaching Party") may terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice to the other Party (the "Breaching Party") if the Breaching Party commits a material breach of any of its obligations, covenants, or representations under this Agreement and fails to cure such breach within [Cure Period] days after receiving written notice from the Non-Breaching Party specifying the breach in reasonable detail. If the breach is not capable of being cured within [Cure Period] days, but the Breaching Party has commenced and is diligently pursuing a cure, the cure period may be extended for a reasonable period, not to exceed an additional [Extended Cure Period] days, provided the Breaching Party provides a written plan for cure to the Non-Breaching Party.

(c) **Insolvency or Bankruptcy:** This Agreement shall automatically terminate, without the necessity of any notice or action by either Party, upon the filing of a petition in bankruptcy by or against either [Company A] or [Company B], the insolvency of either Party, the appointment of a receiver or trustee for either Party, or the assignment for the benefit of creditors by either Party.

(d) **Force Majeure:** If an event of Force Majeure as defined in Section [Relevant Force Majeure Section Number] continues for a period exceeding [Force Majeure Termination Period] consecutive days, either Party may terminate this Agreement by providing written notice to the other Party.

(e) **Consequences of Termination:** Upon termination of this Agreement for any reason, the Parties shall cooperate in good faith to wind up the affairs of the Joint Venture in an orderly and equitable manner, including, but not limited to, the disposition of assets, settlement of liabilities, and cessation of all joint activities related to the [project]. Notwithstanding any termination, the provisions of Sections [e.g., 6. IP Ownership], [e.g., 7. Confidentiality], [e.g., 8. Indemnification], and [e.g., 10. Governing Law] shall survive and continue in full force and effect indefinitely or for the period expressly stated therein.

10. Governing Law

This Joint Venture Agreement and all rights and obligations arising hereunder, including, without limitation, any claims sounding in contract, tort, or statute, shall be governed by, construed, and enforced in accordance with the laws of the State of [State], [Country], without giving effect to any conflict of laws principles that would result in the application of the laws of a different jurisdiction. The parties expressly agree that the United Nations Convention on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods shall not apply to this Agreement. This choice of law provision is a fundamental and material term of this Agreement, and the parties intend that it be enforced to the fullest extent permitted by law, ensuring predictability and consistency in the interpretation and enforcement of their contractual relationship.

11. Dispute Resolution

Any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Joint Venture Agreement, including the breach, termination, or validity thereof, shall first be subject to good faith negotiations between senior management representatives of [Company A] and [Company B]. These representatives shall meet within thirty (30) days of a written request by either Party to resolve the dispute amicably.

If the Parties are unable to resolve the dispute through negotiation within sixty (60) days of the initial request, the dispute shall be submitted to binding arbitration in accordance with the rules of the [Arbitration Rules, e.g., American Arbitration Association (AAA) International Dispute Resolution Procedures] then in effect. The arbitration shall be conducted by a single arbitrator mutually agreed upon by the Parties, or, failing agreement within fifteen (15) days, appointed by the [Arbitration Rules Body].

The seat of the arbitration shall be [Arbitration Location], and the language of the arbitration shall be English. The decision of the arbitrator shall be final and binding upon both Parties, and judgment upon the award rendered by the arbitrator may be entered in any court having jurisdiction thereof. Each Party shall bear its own costs and expenses, including attorney fees, related to the arbitration, unless otherwise determined by the arbitrator.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, either Party may seek injunctive relief or specific performance in a court of competent jurisdiction without resorting to arbitration, where such relief is necessary to protect its intellectual property rights or to prevent irreparable harm.

12. Signatures

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties, [Company A] and [Company B], have caused this Joint Venture Agreement to be executed by their duly authorized representatives as of the Effective Date, thereby signifying their complete understanding, acceptance, and agreement to all terms, covenants, and conditions set forth herein. This Agreement may be executed in any number of counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument, effective upon the date of the last signature.

[Company A]

By: ____________________________________

Name: [Authorized Signatory A Name]

Title: [Authorized Signatory A Title]

Date: ____________________________________

[Company B]

By: ____________________________________

Name: [Authorized Signatory B Name]

Title: [Authorized Signatory B Title]

Date: ____________________________________

Witnessed By:

____________________________________

Name: [Witness Name]

Title: [Witness Title]

Date: ____________________________________
api1.summary: The Joint Venture Agreement between Company A and Company B for the collaboration on the specified project has been successfully drafted, detailing roles, intellectual property ownership, and revenue sharing terms.

api2.updated_html:
JOINT VENTURE AGREEMENT

This Joint Venture Agreement ("Agreement") is made and entered into as of this [Day] day of [Month], [Year] (the "Effective Date"), by and between:

[Company A], a corporation duly organized and existing under the laws of [State/Country of Incorporation], with its principal place of business located at [Company A Address] ("Party A").

[Company B], a corporation duly organized and existing under the laws of [State/Country of Incorporation], with its principal place of business located at [Company B Address] ("Party B").

Party A and Party B are hereinafter collectively referred to as the "Parties" and individually as a "Party."

RECITALS

WHEREAS, Party A possesses specialized expertise and resources in [Party A's relevant field, e.g., software development and artificial intelligence research], which are critical for the successful execution of the contemplated project.

WHEREAS, Party B possesses specialized expertise and resources in [Party B's relevant field, e.g., market distribution, hardware manufacturing, or specific industry knowledge], which are complementary to Party A's capabilities and essential for bringing the project to market and ensuring its commercial viability.

WHEREAS, the Parties desire to collaborate and form a joint venture to jointly develop, market, and commercialize a [brief description of project, e.g., "next-generation AI-powered diagnostic tool for healthcare"] (the "Project"), leveraging their respective strengths and resources to achieve mutual strategic and financial objectives.

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and agreements contained herein, and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the Parties agree as follows:

1. DEFINITIONS

1.1. "Joint Venture" shall mean the collaborative undertaking established by this Agreement between Party A and Party B for the specific purpose of developing, marketing, and commercializing the Project as defined herein. This Joint Venture shall operate as a contractual arrangement and shall not constitute a separate legal entity, partnership, or corporation unless explicitly agreed upon in writing by both Parties at a later date. The Joint Venture's activities shall be limited strictly to the scope and objectives outlined in this Agreement.

1.2. "Project" shall mean the specific undertaking of [detailed description of project, e.g., "research, development, manufacturing, marketing, distribution, and commercialization of an integrated hardware and software solution designed to provide real-time predictive analytics for industrial machinery maintenance"]. This includes all phases from initial conceptualization and design through to final product launch, ongoing support, and potential future iterations or enhancements directly related to the initial scope. The precise specifications, milestones, and deliverables for the Project are further detailed in Schedule A attached hereto and incorporated by reference.

1.3. "Joint Venture Intellectual Property" or "JV IP" shall mean all intellectual property rights, including but not limited to patents, copyrights, trademarks, trade secrets, designs, algorithms, software, data, know-how, and any other proprietary information, whether patentable or unpatentable, registrable or unregistrable, that are conceived, developed, reduced to practice, or otherwise created by either Party, solely or jointly, in the course of performing activities under this Agreement and directly related to the Project. This definition explicitly excludes any pre-existing intellectual property owned by either Party prior to the Effective Date, which shall remain the sole property of the respective Party, subject to any licenses granted herein.

2. TERM

2.1. Initial Term. This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall continue in full force and effect for an initial term of [Number] ([e.g., five (5)]) years, unless earlier terminated in accordance with the provisions of Section 10 hereof. During this initial term, both Parties commit to dedicating the necessary resources and efforts to achieve the Project's objectives as outlined in this Agreement and its schedules. The Parties acknowledge that the success of the Project is contingent upon sustained commitment throughout this period.

2.2. Renewal. Upon the expiration of the initial term, this Agreement shall automatically renew for successive periods of [Number] ([e.g., one (1)]) year each, unless either Party provides written notice of its intent not to renew to the other Party at least [Number] ([e.g., ninety (90)]) days prior to the end of the then-current term. Any such non-renewal notice must clearly state the Party's intention and the effective date of termination. The Parties shall, during the notice period, cooperate in good faith to wind down the Joint Venture's activities in an orderly manner, including addressing any outstanding obligations, intellectual property rights, and revenue distribution.

3. PURPOSE OF JOINT VENTURE

The primary purpose of this Joint Venture is to collaboratively engage in the [detailed description of project, e.g., "research, development, commercialization, and global distribution of the 'Quantum Leap' AI-powered diagnostic platform"]. This encompasses all stages from initial conceptualization, design, prototyping, testing, regulatory approval processes, manufacturing oversight, marketing strategy development, sales execution, and post-sales support. The Parties agree to work cooperatively to achieve the technical and commercial success of this specific Project, leveraging their combined expertise and resources.

The scope of the Joint Venture is strictly limited to the Project as defined in Section 1.2 and any activities directly incidental thereto. Neither Party shall be obligated to contribute resources or expertise to any other projects or ventures of the other Party outside the defined scope of this Agreement. Any expansion or modification of the Project's scope or purpose shall require the prior written consent of both Parties, formalized through an amendment to this Agreement, ensuring clear delineation of responsibilities and resource allocation for any new undertakings.

4. ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

4.1. Party A's Responsibilities. Party A shall be primarily responsible for [specific responsibilities, e.g., "all aspects of software development, including algorithm design, coding, testing, and integration of the AI components, as well as providing technical support for the software aspects of the Project"]. This includes allocating dedicated personnel with the requisite skills and experience, providing access to necessary development tools and infrastructure, and ensuring timely delivery of software modules in accordance with the Project's development schedule. Party A shall also be responsible for maintaining the confidentiality and security of all software source code and related technical documentation.

4.2. Party B's Responsibilities. Party B shall be primarily responsible for [specific responsibilities, e.g., "hardware design and manufacturing, supply chain management, regulatory compliance for hardware components, and the global marketing and distribution strategy for the final product"]. This entails securing necessary manufacturing facilities, managing supplier relationships, overseeing quality control for physical components, and developing and executing comprehensive marketing campaigns. Party B shall also be responsible for establishing and managing sales channels and providing customer service for the hardware aspects of the Project, ensuring broad market penetration and customer satisfaction.

5. CAPITAL CONTRIBUTIONS AND FUNDING

5.1. Initial Capital Contributions. Each Party shall make an initial capital contribution to the Joint Venture as follows: Party A shall contribute [Amount, e.g., $X] in cash and [Description of in-kind contribution, e.g., "the exclusive use of its proprietary AI development platform valued at $Y"]. Party B shall contribute [Amount, e.g., $Z] in cash and [Description of in-kind contribution, e.g., "access to its global distribution network and existing sales infrastructure valued at $W"]. These initial contributions are deemed essential for the commencement of the Project and shall be made within [Number] days of the Effective Date.

5.2. Operational Funding and Capital Calls. Any additional funding required for the operation of the Joint Venture beyond the initial capital contributions shall be mutually agreed upon by the Parties. In the event of a capital call, each Party shall contribute its pro-rata share of the required funds, based on their respective ownership percentages in the Joint Venture, as determined by the Steering Committee. Failure of a Party to meet a capital call within [Number] days of written notice may result in dilution of its ownership interest, forfeiture of certain rights, or other remedies as mutually agreed upon or as provided by law, to ensure the continued viability and progress of the Project.

6. REVENUE SPLIT

6.1. Revenue Definition and Calculation. For the purposes of this Agreement, "Gross Revenue" shall mean all revenues actually received by the Joint Venture from the sale, licensing, or other commercialization of the Project, before any deductions. "Net Revenue" shall mean Gross Revenue less direct costs demonstrably and solely attributable to the Project, including but not limited to manufacturing costs, direct marketing expenses, sales commissions, shipping costs, and applicable taxes directly imposed on sales, as mutually agreed upon by the Parties and verifiable through audited financial statements. A detailed list of allowable deductions shall be maintained and updated by the Steering Committee.

6.2. Distribution of Net Revenue. Subject to the terms of this Agreement, Net Revenue generated by the Joint Venture shall be distributed to the Parties on a [Percentage, e.g., 50/50] basis, with Party A receiving [Percentage]% and Party B receiving [Percentage]%. Distributions shall be made on a [Frequency, e.g., quarterly] basis, within [Number] days following the end of each [e.g., calendar quarter], provided that the Joint Venture has sufficient cash flow and has met its operational obligations and reserves. Each Party shall have the right, at its own expense, to audit the financial records of the Joint Venture related to revenue calculation and distribution, upon reasonable notice, to ensure compliance with this Section.

7. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY OWNERSHIP

7.1. Ownership of Joint Venture IP. All Joint Venture Intellectual Property (JV IP) developed, conceived, or reduced to practice by either Party, solely or jointly, during the term of this Agreement and within the scope of the Project, shall be jointly owned by Party A and Party B. Joint ownership shall mean that each Party shall have an undivided one-half (1/2) interest in and to all such JV IP, with the right to independently use, license, assign, and exploit such JV IP without the consent of, or accounting to, the other Party, provided that such independent exploitation does not directly compete with the Project's commercialization efforts during the term of this Agreement or infringe upon the other Party's pre-existing intellectual property. Both Parties shall cooperate in good faith to secure, maintain, and enforce all intellectual property rights pertaining to JV IP.

7.2. Pre-existing Intellectual Property and Licenses. Each Party shall retain sole ownership of all intellectual property rights owned by it prior to the Effective Date of this Agreement ("Pre-existing IP"). To the extent necessary for the development, commercialization, and exploitation of the Project, each Party hereby grants to the other Party, and to the Joint Venture, a non-exclusive, royalty-free, worldwide, sublicensable (solely for the purpose of the Project), non-transferable license to use its Pre-existing IP solely for the purposes of carrying out the Project and fulfilling its obligations under this Agreement. This license shall terminate automatically upon the termination or expiration of this Agreement, provided that any sublicenses granted for the purpose of the Project's commercialization may continue in accordance with their terms, subject to the provisions of Section 10.3.

8. CONFIDENTIALITY

8.1. Definition of Confidential Information. "Confidential Information" means any and all non-public information, whether commercial, financial, technical, operational, or otherwise, disclosed by one Party (the "Disclosing Party") to the other Party (the "Receiving Party") in connection with this Agreement or the Project, whether disclosed orally, visually, in writing, or by any other means, and whether or not marked as confidential. This includes, without limitation, trade secrets, business plans, product specifications, financial data, customer lists, marketing strategies, and any information related to the JV IP. Confidential Information does not include information that (a) is or becomes publicly known through no fault of the Receiving Party; (b) was known to the Receiving Party prior to disclosure by the Disclosing Party; (c) is rightfully obtained by the Receiving Party from a third party without breach of any confidentiality obligation; or (d) is independently developed by the Receiving Party without reference to the Disclosing Party's Confidential Information.

8.2. Obligations. The Receiving Party agrees to use the Disclosing Party's Confidential Information solely for the purpose of fulfilling its obligations under this Agreement and for the benefit of the Joint Venture. The Receiving Party shall exercise at least the same degree of care to prevent the unauthorized disclosure of Confidential Information as it exercises with respect to its own confidential information of a similar nature, but in no event less than a reasonable degree of care. The Receiving Party shall not disclose, disseminate, or otherwise make available Confidential Information to any third party without the prior written consent of the Disclosing Party, except to its employees, agents, or contractors who have a legitimate need to know such information for the Project and who are bound by confidentiality obligations at least as stringent as those contained herein. These confidentiality obligations shall survive the termination or expiration of this Agreement for a period of [Number] ([e.g., five (5)]) years.

9. WARRANTIES AND REPRESENTATIONS

9.1. Mutual Warranties. Each Party hereby represents and warrants to the other Party that: (a) it is duly organized, validly existing, and in good standing under the laws of its jurisdiction of incorporation; (b) it has the full corporate power and authority to enter into this Agreement and to perform its obligations hereunder; (c) the execution and delivery of this Agreement and the performance of its obligations hereunder have been duly authorized by all necessary corporate actions and do not conflict with its organizational documents or any other agreement to which it is a party; and (d) this Agreement constitutes a valid and binding obligation enforceable against it in accordance with its terms. These representations are fundamental to the Parties' decision to enter into this collaborative undertaking and shall be true and correct as of the Effective Date and throughout the Term of this Agreement.

9.2. Specific Warranties. Party A specifically warrants that any software, algorithms, or technical contributions it provides to the Joint Venture will be free from material defects and will not infringe upon the intellectual property rights of any third party, to the best of its knowledge after reasonable inquiry. Party B specifically warrants that any hardware components, manufacturing processes, or distribution methods it provides or employs for the Joint Venture will comply with all applicable laws and regulations, including quality and safety standards, and will not infringe upon the intellectual property rights of any third party, to the best of its knowledge after reasonable inquiry. These specific warranties are critical for the successful development and commercialization of the Project and shall remain in effect throughout the Project's lifecycle.

10. INDEMNIFICATION

10.1. General Indemnification. Each Party (the "Indemnifying Party") shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless the other Party, its affiliates, and their respective directors, officers, employees, and agents (collectively, the "Indemnified Parties") from and against any and all claims, demands, losses, damages, liabilities, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees) arising out of or in connection with: (a) any breach by the Indemnifying Party of its representations, warranties, or covenants under this Agreement; (b) any gross negligence or willful misconduct of the Indemnifying Party or its personnel in performing its obligations under this Agreement; or (c) any third-party claim alleging that the Indemnifying Party's Pre-existing IP, as used in the Project, infringes upon the intellectual property rights of such third party. This indemnification obligation is a material term of this Agreement and is intended to ensure that each Party bears responsibility for its own actions and omissions.

10.2. Indemnification Procedure. In the event an Indemnified Party seeks indemnification under this Section, it shall provide prompt written notice to the Indemnifying Party of any claim for which indemnification is sought. The Indemnifying Party shall have the sole right to control the defense and settlement of any such claim, using counsel of its own choosing, provided that the Indemnifying Party keeps the Indemnified Party reasonably informed of the status of the defense and settlement negotiations. The Indemnified Party shall cooperate fully with the Indemnifying Party in the defense of any such claim and may, at its own expense, participate in the defense with its own counsel. The Indemnifying Party shall not settle any claim in a manner that admits liability on the part of the Indemnified Party or imposes any obligation on the Indemnified Party without the Indemnified Party's prior written consent, which shall not be unreasonably withheld or delayed. This Section shall survive the termination or expiration of this Agreement.

11. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY

11.1. Exclusion of Certain Damages. EXCEPT FOR CLAIMS ARISING FROM BREACH OF CONFIDENTIALITY OBLIGATIONS (SECTION 8), INDEMNIFICATION OBLIGATIONS (SECTION 10), OR WILLFUL MISCONDUCT OR GROSS NEGLIGENCE, NEITHER PARTY SHALL BE LIABLE TO THE OTHER PARTY FOR ANY INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, CONSEQUENTIAL, SPECIAL, PUNITIVE, OR EXEMPLARY DAMAGES, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO, LOSS OF PROFITS, REVENUE, DATA, OR BUSINESS OPPORTUNITIES, EVEN IF SUCH PARTY HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES. This exclusion applies regardless of the form of action, whether in contract, tort (including negligence), strict liability, or otherwise, and is a fundamental part of the basis of the bargain between the Parties, reflecting their agreement on the allocation of risk.

11.2. Cap on Liability. NOTWITHSTANDING ANYTHING TO THE CONTRARY IN THIS AGREEMENT, AND EXCEPT FOR CLAIMS ARISING FROM BREACH OF CONFIDENTIALITY OBLIGATIONS (SECTION 8), INDEMNIFICATION OBLIGATIONS (SECTION 10), OR WILLFUL MISCONDUCT OR GROSS NEGLIGENCE, EACH PARTY'S TOTAL AGGREGATE LIABILITY TO THE OTHER PARTY UNDER OR IN CONNECTION WITH THIS AGREEMENT, REGARDLESS OF THE FORM OF ACTION, SHALL NOT EXCEED THE TOTAL CAPITAL CONTRIBUTIONS MADE BY THE CLAIMING PARTY TO THE JOINT VENTURE AS OF THE DATE THE CLAIM AROSE. This limitation of liability is intended to limit the financial exposure of each Party to a reasonable and foreseeable amount, allowing for predictable risk assessment in the context of the Joint Venture's operations. The Parties acknowledge that this limitation is reasonable given the nature of the Project and the mutual benefits anticipated.

12. TERMINATION

12.1. Termination for Cause. Either Party may terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice to the other Party if: (a) the other Party commits a material breach of any of its obligations, representations, or warranties under this Agreement and fails to cure such breach within [Number] ([e.g., thirty (30)]) days after receiving written notice thereof; (b) the other Party becomes insolvent, makes an assignment for the benefit of creditors, files for bankruptcy, or has a receiver or trustee appointed for its assets; or (c) there is a change of control of the other Party that is reasonably deemed detrimental to the Project or the interests of the terminating Party, provided such change of control was not approved in advance. A material breach includes, but is not limited to, failure to make required capital contributions, unauthorized disclosure of Confidential Information, or significant deviation from the Project plan without mutual consent.

12.2. Effect of Termination. Upon any termination of this Agreement, the Parties shall cooperate in good faith to wind down the Joint Venture's activities in an orderly and expeditious manner. All licenses granted under Section 7.2 for Pre-existing IP shall terminate, except for any sublicenses granted to third parties for the commercialization of the Project, which may continue subject to mutually agreed-upon terms, including royalty payments to the owner of the Pre-existing IP. The Parties shall jointly determine the disposition of all assets of the Joint Venture, including inventory, equipment, and any remaining funds, and shall equitably distribute any net proceeds or liabilities in accordance with their respective ownership percentages. Sections 1 (Definitions), 7 (Intellectual Property Ownership), 8 (Confidentiality), 10 (Indemnification), 11 (Limitation of Liability), 12.2 (Effect of Termination), 13 (Governing Law), and 14 (Dispute Resolution) shall survive any termination or expiration of this Agreement.

13. GOVERNING LAW

This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of [State/Country, e.g., the State of Delaware, USA], without regard to its conflict of laws principles. The Parties expressly agree that the United Nations Convention on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods shall not apply to this Agreement. This choice of law is intended to provide certainty and predictability in the interpretation and enforcement of the Agreement, ensuring that a consistent legal framework applies to all aspects of the Joint Venture's operations and the resolution of any potential disputes.

The Parties acknowledge and agree that the courts located in [City, State/Country, e.g., Wilmington, Delaware, USA] shall have exclusive jurisdiction over any action or proceeding arising out of or relating to this Agreement, except as provided in Section 14 (Dispute Resolution). Each Party irrevocably submits to the personal jurisdiction of such courts and waives any objection to the laying of venue in such courts, including any objection on the grounds of forum non conveniens. This provision ensures that any judicial intervention, if necessary, occurs within a mutually agreed and convenient jurisdiction.

14. DISPUTE RESOLUTION

14.1. Negotiation. In the event of any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement, or the breach, termination, or validity thereof (a "Dispute"), the Parties shall first attempt to resolve the Dispute through good faith negotiations. Either Party may initiate such negotiations by providing written notice of the Dispute to the other Party. Within [Number] ([e.g., thirty (30)]) days of such notice, senior executives from each Party, with authority to settle the Dispute, shall meet at a mutually agreed location or via teleconference to attempt to resolve the Dispute. All discussions, offers, and statements made during these negotiations shall be confidential and inadmissible in any subsequent arbitration or judicial proceeding.

14.2. Arbitration. If the Dispute cannot be resolved through negotiation within [Number] ([e.g., sixty (60)]) days of the initial notice, the Dispute shall be submitted to binding arbitration administered by [Arbitration Institution, e.g., the American Arbitration Association (AAA)] in accordance with its [Specific Rules, e.g., Commercial Arbitration Rules] then in effect. The arbitration shall be conducted by [Number] ([e.g., one (1)]) arbitrator mutually agreed upon by the Parties, or failing agreement, appointed by the AAA. The seat of the arbitration shall be [City, State/Country, e.g., Wilmington, Delaware, USA], and the language of the arbitration shall be English. The arbitrator's award shall be final and binding upon the Parties, and judgment upon the award rendered by the arbitrator may be entered in any court having jurisdiction thereof. The costs of arbitration, including the arbitrator's fees, shall be borne equally by the Parties, unless the arbitrator determines otherwise.

15. MISCELLANEOUS PROVISIONS

15.1. Entire Agreement. This Agreement, including all schedules and exhibits attached hereto, constitutes the entire agreement between the Parties with respect to the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior and contemporaneous agreements, understandings, negotiations, and discussions, whether oral or written, between the Parties relating to such subject matter. No representations, warranties, covenants, or conditions, other than those expressly set forth herein, have been made or relied upon by either Party. This clause ensures that the written document is the complete and final expression of the Parties' intent, preventing reliance on extrinsic statements.

15.2. Amendments. No amendment, modification, or waiver of any provision of this Agreement shall be effective unless it is in writing and signed by duly authorized representatives of both Parties. Any waiver of a breach of any provision of this Agreement shall not be construed as a waiver of any subsequent breach or of any other provision of this Agreement. This requirement for written amendments ensures clarity and mutual consent for any changes to the contractual terms, preventing informal or implied modifications that could lead to future disputes.

15.3. Notices. All notices, requests, demands, and other communications required or permitted under this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be deemed to have been duly given when: (a) delivered personally; (b) sent by certified or registered mail, return receipt requested, postage prepaid; (c) sent by nationally recognized overnight courier service (e.g., FedEx, UPS); or (d) sent by email with confirmation of receipt, to the addresses set forth below or to such other address as either Party may designate by written notice to the other Party. Proper notice is critical for formal communications and the commencement of various contractual processes, including termination or dispute resolution.

15.4. Assignment. Neither Party may assign or transfer any of its rights or obligations under this Agreement, whether by operation of law or otherwise, without the prior written consent of the other Party, which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld, conditioned, or delayed. Any attempted assignment or transfer in violation of this Section shall be null and void. Notwithstanding the foregoing, either Party may assign this Agreement in its entirety to an affiliate or in connection with a merger, acquisition, or sale of all or substantially all of its assets, provided that the assignee agrees in writing to be bound by all terms and conditions of this Agreement. This clause protects the Parties' interests by ensuring that the Joint Venture relationship is maintained with the original contracting entities or approved successors.

15.5. Severability. If any provision of this Agreement is found by a court of competent jurisdiction to be invalid, illegal, or unenforceable, the validity, legality, and enforceability of the remaining provisions shall not in any way be affected or impaired thereby. The Parties shall endeavor to replace the invalid, illegal, or unenforceable provision with a valid, legal, and enforceable provision that most closely reflects the original intent of the Parties. This ensures that the bulk of the agreement remains enforceable even if a specific clause is deemed problematic, preserving the overall contractual relationship.

15.6. Force Majeure. Neither Party shall be liable for any delay or failure to perform its obligations under this Agreement if such delay or failure is caused by an event beyond its reasonable control, including but not limited to, acts of God, war, terrorism, riots, embargoes, acts of civil or military authorities, fire, floods, accidents, epidemics, pandemics, or strikes ("Force Majeure Event"). The Party affected by a Force Majeure Event shall promptly notify the other Party of the occurrence and the anticipated duration of such event and shall use commercially reasonable efforts to mitigate the effects of the Force Majeure Event. If a Force Majeure Event continues for a period exceeding [Number] ([e.g., ninety (90)]) days, either Party may terminate this Agreement upon written notice to the other Party, without further liability, except for obligations accrued prior to the Force Majeure Event.

SIGNATURES

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties have executed this Joint Venture Agreement as of the Effective Date first written above.

[Company A]

By: ______________________________

Name: [Printed Name of Signatory]

Title: [Title of Signatory]

Date: ______________________________

[Company B]

By: ______________________________

Name: [Printed Name of Signatory]

Title: [Title of Signatory]

Date: ______________________________
