query: Draft a Loan Agreement between a private lender and our business for a loan amount of [$X], including interest rate, repayment terms, and security.

api1.updated_html:
LOAN AGREEMENT

This Loan Agreement (the "Agreement") is made and entered into as of this [Effective Date], by and between [Lender's Full Legal Name], a private individual/entity residing at/with its principal place of business at [Lender's Address] (hereinafter referred to as "Lender"), and [Borrower's Full Legal Business Name], a [State of Incorporation/Organization] [Type of Entity, e.g., Corporation, LLC] with its principal place of business located at [Borrower's Business Address] (hereinafter referred to as "Borrower").

WHEREAS, Borrower desires to obtain a loan from Lender, and Lender is willing to provide such a loan to Borrower, subject to the terms and conditions set forth herein; and

WHEREAS, this Agreement sets forth the principal amount of the loan, the interest rate applicable thereto, the repayment schedule, the security provided by Borrower, and other covenants and conditions governing the relationship between the Lender and the Borrower with respect to the aforementioned loan.

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and promises contained herein, and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the parties hereto agree as follows:

1. Definitions

For the purposes of this Loan Agreement, the following terms shall have the meanings ascribed to them below, unless the context clearly indicates otherwise:

"Agreement" means this Loan Agreement, including all schedules, exhibits, and amendments thereto, as may be executed from time to time.

"Borrower" means [Your Business Name], a [State of Incorporation] [Type of Entity, e.g., corporation, LLC] with its principal place of business located at [Borrower's Address], and its successors and permitted assigns.

"Lender" means [Private Lender's Full Legal Name or Entity Name], a [State of Incorporation/Residence] [Type of Entity, e.g., individual, corporation, LLC] with its principal place of business/residence located at [Lender's Address], and its successors and permitted assigns.

"Loan" means the principal amount of [Loan Amount in Words] Dollars ($[Loan Amount in Figures]) advanced by the Lender to the Borrower under the terms and conditions of this Agreement.

"Interest Rate" means the annual interest rate of [Interest Rate]% per annum, calculated on a [e.g., 360-day or 365-day] year basis, applied to the outstanding principal balance of the Loan, as specified in Section [X.X] (Interest).

"Maturity Date" means [Date], or such earlier date upon which the Loan becomes due and payable in full, whether by acceleration or otherwise, in accordance with the terms of this Agreement.

"Collateral" means all assets, properties, and rights of the Borrower, whether now owned or hereafter acquired, upon which a security interest is granted to the Lender pursuant to Section [X.X] (Security) of this Agreement, to secure the Borrower's obligations hereunder.

"Event of Default" means any of the events described in Section [X.X] (Events of Default) of this Agreement, which, if uncured, entitles the Lender to exercise its remedies as provided herein.

2. Term

This Loan Agreement shall become effective on the [Effective Date] (the "Effective Date") and shall continue in full force and effect until the earlier of (i) [Maturity Date] (the "Maturity Date"), or (ii) the date upon which the entire principal amount of the Loan, together with all accrued and unpaid interest thereon, and all other sums due hereunder, have been paid in full by the Borrower to the Lender in accordance with the terms of this Agreement. The parties acknowledge and agree that the obligations of the Borrower to repay the Loan and all associated charges shall survive the Maturity Date or any earlier termination of this Agreement until such time as all such obligations are completely fulfilled. Furthermore, any provisions of this Agreement which by their nature are intended to survive the termination or expiration of this Agreement, including but not limited to, provisions relating to indemnification, confidentiality, and the payment of outstanding obligations, shall remain in full force and effect until such obligations are fully satisfied or for the period expressly stated therein.

3. Payment Terms

The Borrower, [Borrower's Full Legal Name], hereby covenants and agrees to repay the Principal Sum of [Loan Amount in Words] ([Loan Amount in Figures]) to the Lender, [Lender's Full Legal Name], together with interest thereon, calculated at an annual rate of [Interest Rate]% ([Interest Rate] percent) per annum, compounded [e.g., annually/monthly/daily]. Interest shall commence accruing on the Effective Date of this Agreement.

Repayment of the Principal Sum and accrued interest shall be made in [Number] equal consecutive [e.g., monthly/quarterly] installments of [Installment Amount] each, commencing on [First Payment Due Date] and continuing on the [e.g., same day of each subsequent month/quarter] thereafter until the entire Principal Sum and all accrued interest are fully paid. Each payment shall be due on or before the [e.g., 1st/15th/last] day of each [e.g., month/quarter]. All payments shall be made by [e.g., wire transfer/ACH/direct deposit] to the Lender's designated bank account: [Lender's Bank Name], Account Number: [Lender's Bank Account Number], SWIFT/BIC: [Lender's Bank SWIFT/BIC Code], or such other account as the Lender may designate in writing to the Borrower.

Payments received by the Lender shall be applied first to the payment of any accrued and unpaid interest, then to the outstanding principal balance of the Loan, and thereafter to any other charges or fees due under this Agreement. Any payment not received by the Lender within [Number] days after its due date shall be subject to a late payment fee equal to [Late Payment Fee Percentage]% of the overdue amount or [Fixed Late Payment Fee Amount], whichever is greater, in addition to any other remedies available to the Lender under this Agreement or applicable law.

4. Warranties

[Borrower] hereby represents and warrants to [Lender] as of the [Effective Date] and continuously throughout the term of this Loan Agreement, that: (a) [Borrower] is a duly organized, validly existing, and in good standing entity under the laws of its jurisdiction of incorporation, and has the full power and authority to own its properties and to carry on its business as now conducted; (b) [Borrower] has the corporate power and authority to execute, deliver, and perform its obligations under this Loan Agreement and the related Loan Documents, and the execution, delivery, and performance by [Borrower] of this Loan Agreement and the related Loan Documents have been duly authorized by all necessary corporate action; (c) this Loan Agreement constitutes a legal, valid, and binding obligation of [Borrower], enforceable against [Borrower] in accordance with its terms, except as enforceability may be limited by applicable bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization, moratorium, or similar laws affecting the enforcement of creditors' rights generally and by equitable principles (regardless of whether enforcement is sought in a proceeding in equity or at law); (d) the execution, delivery, and performance by [Borrower] of this Loan Agreement and the related Loan Documents do not and will not violate any provision of its organizational documents, any agreement or instrument to which it is a party or by which it is bound, or any law, rule, regulation, order, judgment, or decree applicable to it; (e) there is no action, suit, proceeding, or investigation pending or, to the best of [Borrower]'s knowledge, threatened against [Borrower] before any court or governmental authority that could reasonably be expected to have a material adverse effect on [Borrower]'s financial condition, operations, or ability to perform its obligations hereunder; and (f) all financial statements and other information heretofore furnished by [Borrower] to [Lender] are true, complete, and accurate in all material respects as of the dates stated therein and do not omit any material fact necessary to make the statements contained therein not misleading.

5. Indemnification

The Borrower, [Borrower Name], shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless the Lender, [Lender Name], and its officers, directors, employees, agents, successors, and assigns (collectively, the "Indemnified Parties") from and against any and all losses, damages, liabilities, deficiencies, claims, actions, judgments, settlements, interest, awards, penalties, fines, costs, or expenses of whatever kind, including reasonable attorneys' fees, expert witness fees, and the costs of enforcing any right to indemnification under this Loan Agreement, arising out of or resulting from any third-party claim, suit, action, or proceeding arising out of or relating to: (a) any breach by the Borrower of any representation, warranty, covenant, or obligation contained in this Loan Agreement or any other Loan Document; (b) any failure by the Borrower to comply with any applicable law, rule, or regulation in connection with the Loan or the operation of its business; (c) any enforcement action taken by the Lender to collect the Loan or enforce its rights under this Loan Agreement or any other Loan Document; or (d) any other act or omission by the Borrower in connection with the Loan or the transactions contemplated hereby, except to the extent such losses, damages, liabilities, or expenses are determined by a court of competent jurisdiction to have resulted solely from the gross negligence or willful misconduct of an Indemnified Party. This indemnification obligation shall survive the repayment of the Loan and the termination of this Loan Agreement.

6. Confidentiality

Each Party (the "Receiving Party") acknowledges that in connection with this Loan Agreement, it may obtain or have access to confidential and proprietary information concerning the other Party (the "Disclosing Party"), including but not limited to financial data, business plans, operational details, trade secrets, customer lists, and the specific terms and conditions of this Agreement (collectively, "Confidential Information"). The Receiving Party agrees to keep all such Confidential Information strictly confidential and to use it solely for the purpose of fulfilling its obligations and exercising its rights under this Agreement.

The Receiving Party shall not, without the prior written consent of the Disclosing Party, disclose, publish, or disseminate any Confidential Information to any third party, nor shall it use any Confidential Information for any purpose other than as expressly permitted herein. The Receiving Party shall exercise at least the same degree of care to protect the Confidential Information as it uses to protect its own confidential or proprietary information of a similar nature, but in no event less than a reasonable degree of care.

The obligations of confidentiality set forth herein shall not apply to any information that: (a) is or becomes publicly available through no fault of the Receiving Party; (b) was rightfully in the possession of the Receiving Party prior to its disclosure by the Disclosing Party; (c) is independently developed by the Receiving Party without use of or reference to the Disclosing Party's Confidential Information; (d) is rightfully obtained by the Receiving Party from a third party without restriction on disclosure; or (e) is required to be disclosed by law, regulation, or court order, provided that the Receiving Party shall, to the extent legally permissible, provide prompt written notice to the Disclosing Party so that the Disclosing Party may seek a protective order or other appropriate remedy.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, a Party may disclose Confidential Information to its professional advisors (e.g., attorneys, accountants, financial advisors) who have a need to know such information in connection with this Agreement and who are bound by confidentiality obligations no less stringent than those contained herein. The obligations of confidentiality hereunder shall survive the termination or expiration of this Agreement for a period of [Number] years from the date of such termination or expiration, or indefinitely for any information constituting a trade secret under applicable law.

7. Termination

This Loan Agreement may be terminated under the following circumstances: (a) by the [Lender] immediately upon the occurrence of an uncured Event of Default by the [Borrower], as defined in Section [X. Events of Default] of this Agreement. The [Lender] shall provide written notice to the [Borrower] specifying the nature of the default. Unless otherwise expressly provided herein, if such Event of Default is capable of being cured, the [Borrower] shall have a period of [Number] ([Number]) days from the date of receipt of such notice to cure the default to the satisfaction of the [Lender]. Should the [Borrower] fail to cure the default within the stipulated [Cure Period], the [Lender] shall have the right, without prejudice to any other rights or remedies available at law or in equity, to declare all outstanding principal, accrued interest, and any other amounts due under this Loan Agreement immediately due and payable, and to terminate this Loan Agreement forthwith.

(b) This Loan Agreement may be terminated at any time prior to its stated maturity date by the mutual written agreement of both the [Lender] and the [Borrower], duly executed by authorized representatives of each party.

(c) This Loan Agreement shall automatically terminate upon the full and final repayment by the [Borrower] of all principal, accrued interest, fees, and any other amounts owing to the [Lender] hereunder, at which point all obligations of the [Lender] shall cease, save for those provisions expressly stated to survive termination.

Notwithstanding any termination of this Loan Agreement, the obligations of the [Borrower] to repay all outstanding amounts, together with any provisions relating to indemnification, confidentiality, governing law, jurisdiction, and dispute resolution, shall survive such termination and remain in full force and effect until fully satisfied or until their express expiration, whichever is later.

8. Governing Law

This Loan Agreement and all matters arising out of or relating to this Loan Agreement, including, without limitation, its validity, interpretation, construction, performance, and enforcement, shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the internal laws of the State of [State], [Country], without giving effect to any choice or conflict of law provision or rule (whether of the State of [State] or any other jurisdiction) that would cause the application of the laws of any jurisdiction other than the State of [State]. The parties hereto irrevocably and unconditionally submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the state and federal courts located in [County, State] for any action, suit, or proceeding arising out of or relating to this Agreement, and agree that all claims in respect of any such action, suit, or proceeding may be heard and determined in such courts. Each Party waives any objection to the laying of venue of any such action, suit, or proceeding in such courts and irrevocably waives any right to plead or claim that any such action, suit, or proceeding brought in any such court has been brought in an inconvenient forum. This choice of law is a fundamental term of this Agreement.

9. Dispute Resolution

Any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Loan Agreement, including but not limited to its formation, interpretation, performance, breach, termination, or validity, shall first be subject to good faith negotiation between the Parties for a period of not less than thirty (30) days from the date one Party notifies the other in writing of such dispute. If the Parties are unable to resolve the dispute through negotiation within the specified period, the dispute shall be exclusively and finally settled by binding arbitration administered by [Arbitration Institution Name, e.g., American Arbitration Association (AAA)] in accordance with its [Specific Arbitration Rules, e.g., Commercial Arbitration Rules] then in effect.

The arbitration shall be conducted by a single arbitrator appointed in accordance with the aforementioned rules. The seat of the arbitration shall be [Arbitration Location, e.g., New York, New York], and the language of the arbitration shall be English. The decision of the arbitrator shall be final and binding upon both [Party A] (the "Lender") and [Party B] (the "Borrower"), and judgment on the award rendered by the arbitrator may be entered in any court having jurisdiction thereof. The Parties expressly waive any right to bring any action or proceeding in any court of law or equity to resolve any dispute arising under this Agreement, except for the enforcement of an arbitration award.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, either Party may seek injunctive relief or other equitable remedies in a court of competent jurisdiction to prevent irreparable harm or to protect its intellectual property rights, pending the outcome of arbitration. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of [Governing Law State/Country], without regard to its conflict of laws principles.

10. Signatures

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties hereto have executed this Loan Agreement as of the Effective Date first above written, acknowledging their full understanding and acceptance of all terms and conditions contained herein. Each signatory below represents and warrants that they have the full legal authority to bind the respective Party to the terms and conditions of this Agreement.

LENDER:

[LENDER NAME]

By: _________________________

Name: [Printed Name of Lender/Authorized Signatory]

Title: [Title, if applicable, e.g., Individual Lender]

Date: _________________________

Witnessed By:

_________________________

Name: [Printed Name of Witness for Lender]

BORROWER:

[BORROWER BUSINESS NAME]

By: _________________________

Name: [Printed Name of Authorized Signatory]

Title: [Title, e.g., CEO/President/Authorized Signatory]

Date: _________________________

Witnessed By:

_________________________

Name: [Printed Name of Witness for Borrower]

api2.updated_html:
LOAN AGREEMENT

This Loan Agreement ("Agreement") is made and entered into as of this [Day] day of [Month], [Year] (the "Effective Date"),

BY AND BETWEEN:

[Lender Name], a private individual/entity, with a principal address at [Lender Address] ("Lender").

AND

[Borrower Business Name], a [State of Incorporation] [Type of Entity, e.g., Corporation, LLC] with its principal place of business located at [Borrower Business Address] ("Borrower").

Lender and Borrower are hereinafter collectively referred to as the "Parties" and individually as a "Party."

1. DEFINITIONS

For the purposes of this Agreement, the following terms shall have the meanings ascribed to them below: "Loan" refers to the principal amount of [$X] extended by the Lender to the Borrower under the terms and conditions set forth herein. This includes all accrued interest, fees, costs, and expenses chargeable to the Borrower in connection with this Agreement. The Loan shall be evidenced by a promissory note and secured by the Collateral as further described in this Agreement.

"Event of Default" means any of the events specified in Section 9 of this Agreement, which, if uncured within any applicable grace period, shall entitle the Lender to exercise all rights and remedies available at law or in equity, including the acceleration of the entire outstanding balance of the Loan. "Collateral" refers to the specific assets of the Borrower, detailed in Section 6, pledged to secure the repayment of the Loan, which may include tangible and intangible property.

2. LOAN AMOUNT AND DISBURSEMENT

Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, the Lender agrees to lend to the Borrower, and the Borrower agrees to borrow from the Lender, a principal amount of [$X] (the "Principal Amount"). The full Principal Amount shall be disbursed by the Lender to the Borrower in a single lump sum payment on or before [Date of Disbursement], provided that all conditions precedent to disbursement, as outlined in this Agreement, have been fully satisfied by the Borrower.

Disbursement shall be made via [Method of Disbursement, e.g., wire transfer to Borrower's designated bank account, check]. The Borrower acknowledges that no portion of the Loan shall be disbursed until the Lender has received and approved all required documentation, including but not limited to, the executed promissory note, security agreement, and evidence of perfection of the security interest in the Collateral. Any costs associated with the disbursement, such as wire transfer fees, shall be borne by the Borrower.

3. INTEREST RATE

The outstanding Principal Amount of the Loan shall bear interest at a fixed rate of [Interest Rate]% per annum, calculated on a [e.g., 365-day year, actual days elapsed] basis and compounded [e.g., annually, monthly]. Interest shall begin to accrue from the date of disbursement of the Loan and shall continue to accrue on the outstanding principal balance until the Loan, including all accrued interest, is repaid in full.

In the event of any Event of Default, as defined in Section 9, the interest rate on the outstanding Principal Amount and any accrued but unpaid interest shall automatically increase to the default rate of [Default Interest Rate]% per annum, effective from the date of such Event of Default until such Event of Default is cured or the Loan is repaid in full. This default interest rate shall apply without prejudice to any other rights or remedies available to the Lender under this Agreement or applicable law.

4. REPAYMENT TERMS

The Borrower shall repay the Loan, including the Principal Amount and all accrued interest, in accordance with the following schedule: [Specify Repayment Schedule, e.g., "equal monthly installments of principal and interest, commencing on [First Payment Date] and continuing on the [Day] of each month thereafter until [Maturity Date], at which point any remaining unpaid principal and accrued interest shall be due and payable in full"]. Each payment shall be applied first to accrued interest and then to the outstanding principal balance.

All payments shall be made in U.S. Dollars and delivered to the Lender at [Lender's Payment Address or Bank Account Details] or such other address or account as the Lender may designate in writing. The Borrower shall have the right to prepay the Loan in whole or in part at any time without penalty, provided that any partial prepayment shall not relieve the Borrower of its obligation to make scheduled payments until the Loan is fully repaid.

5. SECURITY

As security for the full and punctual payment and performance of all of the Borrower's obligations under this Agreement, the Borrower hereby grants to the Lender a first-priority security interest in and to all of the Borrower's right, title, and interest in and to the following assets (the "Collateral"): [Detailed Description of Collateral, e.g., "all accounts, chattel paper, commercial tort claims, deposit accounts, documents, general intangibles, goods, instruments, inventory, equipment, investment property, letter-of-credit rights, and all proceeds thereof, whether now owned or hereafter acquired"].

The Borrower shall execute and deliver to the Lender a separate Security Agreement and any other documents, including UCC-1 financing statements, reasonably requested by the Lender to perfect and maintain the Lender's security interest in the Collateral. The Borrower covenants to keep the Collateral free and clear of all other liens, encumbrances, and security interests, except for the lien granted to the Lender hereunder. Borrower shall maintain adequate insurance on the Collateral, naming Lender as an additional insured and loss payee.

6. REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES

The Borrower represents and warrants to the Lender as of the Effective Date and the date of each disbursement that: (a) it is duly organized, validly existing, and in good standing under the laws of its jurisdiction of formation; (b) it has the full corporate power and authority to enter into and perform its obligations under this Agreement; (c) the execution, delivery, and performance of this Agreement have been duly authorized by all necessary corporate action; and (d) this Agreement constitutes a legal, valid, and binding obligation of the Borrower, enforceable against it in accordance with its terms.

Furthermore, the Borrower represents and warrants that: (e) there are no actions, suits, proceedings, or investigations pending or, to its knowledge, threatened against it that could reasonably be expected to have a material adverse effect on its financial condition or its ability to perform its obligations hereunder; (f) all financial statements provided to the Lender fairly present the financial condition of the Borrower as of their respective dates; and (g) the Collateral is free and clear of any liens, encumbrances, or security interests other than those in favor of the Lender.

7. COVENANTS

Until the Loan and all other obligations hereunder are fully repaid, the Borrower covenants and agrees to: (a) maintain its corporate existence and good standing in its jurisdiction of formation; (b) provide the Lender with its annual audited financial statements within [Number] days after the end of each fiscal year and such other financial information as the Lender may reasonably request; (c) pay all taxes, assessments, and governmental charges when due; and (d) maintain adequate insurance coverage on its assets and operations.

The Borrower further covenants not to: (e) incur any additional indebtedness that would materially impair its ability to repay the Loan without the Lender's prior written consent; (f) sell, transfer, or otherwise dispose of any material portion of the Collateral, except in the ordinary course of business, without the Lender's prior written consent; (g) merge or consolidate with any other entity, or undergo a change of control, without the Lender's prior written consent; or (h) use the Loan proceeds for any purpose other than [Stated Purpose of Loan].

8. EVENTS OF DEFAULT

Each of the following shall constitute an "Event of Default" under this Agreement: (a) failure by the Borrower to pay any principal, interest, or other amount due under this Agreement when due, and such failure continues for a period of [Number] days after written notice thereof from the Lender; (b) any representation or warranty made by the Borrower herein proves to be false or misleading in any material respect when made; (c) breach by the Borrower of any covenant or other term or condition of this Agreement (other than payment defaults), and such breach is not cured within [Number] days after written notice thereof from the Lender.

Further Events of Default include: (d) the Borrower becomes insolvent, files for bankruptcy, makes an assignment for the benefit of creditors, or if a receiver or trustee is appointed for any substantial part of the Borrower's assets; (e) any material adverse change occurs in the financial condition or business operations of the Borrower that, in the Lender's reasonable opinion, materially impairs the Borrower's ability to repay the Loan; or (f) any material portion of the Collateral is seized, attached, or levied upon, and such seizure is not released within [Number] days.

9. INDEMNIFICATION

The Borrower agrees to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless the Lender, its officers, directors, employees, agents, and affiliates from and against any and all losses, damages, liabilities, claims, demands, actions, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees and legal expenses) arising out of or in connection with: (a) any breach by the Borrower of its representations, warranties, or covenants under this Agreement; (b) the enforcement of this Agreement or the exercise of any rights or remedies hereunder; or (c) any third-party claims related to the Collateral or the Loan.

This indemnification obligation shall survive the termination of this Agreement and the repayment of the Loan. The Borrower's obligation to indemnify shall not apply to any losses, damages, or expenses to the extent caused by the Lender's gross negligence or willful misconduct. In the event of any claim for indemnification, the Lender shall provide prompt written notice to the Borrower, and the Borrower shall assume the defense thereof with counsel reasonably acceptable to the Lender.

10. CONFIDENTIALITY

Each Party acknowledges that, in the course of performing its obligations under this Agreement, it may have access to or acquire confidential or proprietary information concerning the other Party's business operations, financial condition, or trade secrets ("Confidential Information"). Each Party agrees to maintain the confidentiality of the other Party's Confidential Information and not to disclose it to any third party without the prior written consent of the disclosing Party, except as required by law or to its professional advisors who are bound by similar confidentiality obligations.

The obligations of confidentiality shall not apply to information that: (a) is or becomes publicly available through no fault of the receiving Party; (b) was already in the receiving Party's possession prior to disclosure by the disclosing Party; (c) is independently developed by the receiving Party without use of the disclosing Party's Confidential Information; or (d) is rightfully obtained by the receiving Party from a third party without restriction on disclosure. This Section shall survive the termination of this Agreement.

11. GOVERNING LAW

This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of [Governing Jurisdiction], without regard to its conflict of laws principles. The Parties expressly agree that the United Nations Convention on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods shall not apply to this Agreement. This choice of law is intended to be absolute and shall apply to all aspects of the Agreement, including its validity, interpretation, performance, and enforcement.

The Parties acknowledge and agree that the substantive laws of the chosen jurisdiction shall apply, and any procedural matters not explicitly addressed herein shall be governed by the procedural rules of the forum where any dispute is heard. This provision is a material term of this Agreement, and the Parties have relied upon this choice of law in entering into this commercial transaction.

12. DISPUTE RESOLUTION

Any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement, or the breach, termination, or validity thereof, shall be resolved exclusively by [Choose one: binding arbitration administered by the American Arbitration Association in accordance with its Commercial Arbitration Rules / litigation in the state and federal courts located in [Arbitration/Court Venue], [State]]. The Parties irrevocably consent to the exclusive jurisdiction and venue of such courts/arbitration body.

If arbitration is chosen, the arbitration shall be conducted by a single arbitrator appointed in accordance with the rules, and the language of the arbitration shall be English. The award rendered by the arbitrator shall be final and binding upon the Parties, and judgment thereon may be entered in any court having jurisdiction thereof. Each Party shall bear its own costs and attorneys' fees in connection with any dispute, unless otherwise determined by the court or arbitrator.

13. MISCELLANEOUS PROVISIONS

13.1. Entire Agreement. This Agreement, together with the Promissory Note and Security Agreement, constitutes the entire agreement between the Parties with respect to the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior and contemporaneous agreements, understandings, negotiations, and discussions, whether oral or written, of the Parties. No modification or amendment of this Agreement shall be effective unless in writing and signed by both Parties.

13.2. Severability. If any provision of this Agreement is held to be invalid, illegal, or unenforceable by a court of competent jurisdiction, such provision shall be severed from this Agreement, and the remaining provisions shall remain in full force and effect. The Parties agree to replace any invalid or unenforceable provision with a valid and enforceable provision that most closely approximates the intent and economic effect of the invalid or unenforceable provision.

13.3. Notices. All notices, requests, demands, and other communications under this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be deemed to have been duly given when delivered personally, sent by certified or registered mail (return receipt requested, postage prepaid), or sent by reputable overnight courier service, to the addresses set forth in the preamble of this Agreement, or to such other address as either Party may designate by written notice to the other.

13.4. Assignment. Neither Party may assign its rights or delegate its obligations under this Agreement without the prior written consent of the other Party, which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld. Any attempted assignment or delegation in violation of this provision shall be null and void. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Lender may assign its rights hereunder to an affiliate or successor in interest without the Borrower's consent.

13.5. Waiver. No waiver of any provision of this Agreement shall be effective unless in writing and signed by the Party against whom the waiver is sought to be enforced. The failure of either Party to enforce any provision of this Agreement shall not be construed as a waiver or relinquishment of such provision or of the right to enforce such provision at a later time. All rights and remedies provided herein are cumulative and not exclusive of any rights or remedies provided by law.

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties have executed this Loan Agreement as of the Effective Date first written above.

LENDER:

[Lender Name]

By: ___________________________

Name: [Printed Name of Lender]

Title: [Title, if applicable]

Date: ___________________________

BORROWER:

[Borrower Business Name]

By: ___________________________

Name: [Printed Name of Authorized Signatory]

query: Draft a non-binding Investor Term Sheet for a seed investment of [$X] in a [industry] startup, outlining valuation, equity offered, and key terms.

api1.updated_html:
NON-BINDING INVESTOR TERM SHEET

This Non-Binding Investor Term Sheet (the "Term Sheet") outlines the principal terms and conditions for a proposed seed investment by [Investor Name] (the "Investor") into [Startup Name], a [Legal Entity Type, e.g., Delaware C-Corporation] (the "Company"). This document serves solely as a basis for discussion and is not intended to create any legally binding obligations on any party, except for the provisions explicitly stated as binding herein, such as confidentiality and exclusivity, if any. The definitive terms and conditions of the proposed investment will be set forth in a separate, comprehensive, and legally binding definitive agreement (the "Definitive Agreement") to be negotiated and executed by all parties involved, subject to satisfactory due diligence and the approval of the respective boards of directors and/or investment committees. This Term Sheet reflects the mutual understanding as of [Effective Date] regarding a potential equity investment of up to [$X] into the Company for the purpose of funding its continued development and expansion within the [Industry] sector.

1. Definitions

For the purposes of this Non-Binding Investor Term Sheet, the following capitalized terms shall have the meanings ascribed to them below, unless the context clearly indicates otherwise:

"Company" shall mean [Company Name], a [State of Incorporation] corporation, with its principal place of business located at [Company Address], which is seeking the investment described herein.

"Investor" shall mean [Investor Name], a [Legal Entity Type, e.g., Delaware Limited Partnership], or its designated affiliate(s), providing the investment capital as outlined in this Term Sheet.

"Investment" shall mean the total capital commitment of [$X] to be provided by the Investor to the Company, subject to the terms and conditions set forth in this Term Sheet.

"Shares" shall mean the [Type of Shares, e.g., Preferred Stock or Convertible Notes] to be issued by the Company to the Investor in consideration for the Investment, carrying the rights, preferences, and privileges detailed in the definitive agreements.

"Pre-Money Valuation" shall mean the valuation of the Company immediately prior to the Investment, which is agreed to be [$Y], implying a post-money valuation of [$Y + $X].

"Term Sheet" shall mean this Non-Binding Investor Term Sheet, which outlines the principal terms and conditions of a potential investment by the Investor in the Company, serving as a basis for negotiating definitive legal agreements.

"Closing" shall mean the date upon which the definitive investment agreements are executed by all parties, and the Investment funds are transferred to the Company in exchange for the Shares.

2. Term

This Non-Binding Term Sheet (the "Term Sheet") shall become effective on the [Effective Date] and shall remain open for acceptance and negotiation for a period of [Number] ([Number] days/weeks) from the Effective Date, unless extended by mutual written agreement of all parties or earlier terminated as provided herein. During this period, [Party A] (the "Investor") and [Party B] (the "Company") shall endeavor to negotiate in good faith and execute definitive legal documentation consistent with the terms and conditions set forth in this Term Sheet. It is expressly understood that, notwithstanding the non-binding nature of the majority of this Term Sheet, the provisions related to confidentiality, exclusivity (if any), governing law, and expenses shall be legally binding and survive any expiration or termination of this Term Sheet. Should definitive agreements not be executed within the specified term, this Term Sheet shall automatically expire, and neither party shall have any further obligations or liabilities hereunder, save for those provisions explicitly designated as binding.

3. Confidentiality

Except as otherwise provided herein, the existence and the terms of this Term Sheet, including any discussions, negotiations, or proposals related thereto, shall be considered confidential information. Each party, including [Investor Name] (the "Investor") and [Company Name] (the "Company"), agrees to keep such information strictly confidential and not to disclose it to any third party without the prior written consent of the other party, except to its legal, financial, and other professional advisors who are bound by similar confidentiality obligations, or as may be required by law, regulation, or court order. The parties further agree to use any information exchanged during the course of these negotiations solely for the purpose of evaluating the potential investment opportunity outlined herein and for no other purpose whatsoever. This confidentiality obligation shall survive the termination of discussions and remain in full force and effect for a period of [Number] years from the Effective Date of this Term Sheet, or indefinitely for trade secrets and proprietary information. Notwithstanding the non-binding nature of the other provisions of this Term Sheet, this Section 3 shall be legally binding and enforceable between the parties.

4. Intellectual Property

The Company represents and warrants that it owns or possesses valid and enforceable licenses or other rights to use all Intellectual Property (including, but not limited to, patents, trademarks, copyrights, trade secrets, and proprietary information) that are material to the conduct of its business as currently conducted and as proposed to be conducted. The Company further represents that its operations, products, and services do not infringe upon, misappropriate, or otherwise violate the Intellectual Property rights of any third party. All employees, consultants, and contractors involved in the creation of material Intellectual Property for the Company have executed valid and enforceable agreements assigning all such Intellectual Property to the Company, or the Company otherwise owns all such Intellectual Property by operation of law. There are no outstanding or threatened claims, litigation, or proceedings alleging infringement, misappropriation, or violation by the Company of any third-party Intellectual Property rights, nor are there any claims challenging the Company's ownership or rights in its own Intellectual Property. The Company has taken commercially reasonable steps to protect its confidential information and trade secrets, and no material Intellectual Property of the Company is subject to any lien, encumbrance, or license that would materially impair the Company's ability to operate its business as contemplated.

5. Warranties

The Company represents and warrants to the Investor that, as of the [Effective Date] and for the purpose of facilitating the discussions and due diligence contemplated by this non-binding Term Sheet, all material information provided to the Investor concerning the Company, its operations, financial condition, and prospects, including but not limited to the capitalization table, financial projections, and business plan, is true, accurate, and complete in all material respects and does not contain any material misstatement or omit any material fact necessary to make the statements contained herein not misleading. The Company further warrants that it has the full corporate power and authority to enter into this Term Sheet and to carry out its obligations as contemplated herein, and that the execution and delivery of this Term Sheet does not violate its organizational documents or any agreement to which it is a party or by which it is bound. These warranties are made solely for the preliminary evaluation by the Investor and shall not be construed as the comprehensive representations and warranties that will be required and negotiated in any definitive investment agreement, which will be subject to extensive legal, financial, and business due diligence by the Investor.

6. Indemnification

The Company shall, to the fullest extent permitted by law, indemnify, defend, and hold harmless [The Investor(s)] and their respective affiliates, directors, officers, employees, agents, representatives, successors, and assigns (collectively, the "Indemnified Parties") from and against any and all losses, liabilities, damages, costs, and expenses, including reasonable attorneys' fees and disbursements, incurred by the Indemnified Parties arising out of or in connection with:

(a) Any breach or inaccuracy of any representation or warranty made by the Company in the definitive investment agreements (including, without limitation, the Stock Purchase Agreement, Shareholders' Agreement, and Articles of Association) to be executed pursuant to this Term Sheet;

(b) Any non-fulfillment or breach of any covenant, agreement, or obligation on the part of the Company contained in such definitive investment agreements;

(c) Any action, suit, proceeding, claim, or demand brought by a third party against any Indemnified Party arising from the Company's operations, business, or assets, including, without limitation, any claims related to intellectual property infringement, product liability, regulatory non-compliance, or employee-related matters;

provided, however, that the Company shall not be liable to any Indemnified Party for any indemnification hereunder to the extent that such losses, liabilities, damages, costs, or expenses are caused by the gross negligence, willful misconduct, or fraud of such Indemnified Party. The provisions of this Section 6 shall survive the closing of the investment and the termination of this Term Sheet, to the extent applicable to the definitive agreements, and shall be fully enforceable upon the execution of the definitive agreements.

7. Termination

This Term Sheet, with the exception of the provisions contained in Sections [e.g., 8. Confidentiality], [e.g., 9. Governing Law], and [e.g., 10. Non-Binding Nature], which shall be legally binding and survive any expiration or termination of this Term Sheet, is intended solely as a non-binding outline of the principal terms and conditions for a potential investment. This non-binding offer shall automatically expire and be of no further force or effect if definitive investment agreements, including but not limited to a Share Subscription Agreement, Shareholders' Agreement, and amended Articles of Association, are not executed by [Date, e.g., 30 days from Effective Date] or such other date as mutually agreed upon in writing by [Party A] (the "Company") and [Party B] (the "Investor"). Prior to the execution of such definitive agreements, either the Company or the Investor may, at its sole discretion and without liability to the other party (except for breaches of the binding provisions), terminate discussions regarding the proposed investment at any time and for any reason, or no reason. Upon such termination of discussions or expiration of this Term Sheet, neither party shall have any obligation to the other with respect to the proposed investment, except for obligations arising under the aforementioned binding provisions.

8. Governing Law

This Term Sheet, while largely non-binding in its entirety, and any non-contractual obligations arising out of or in connection with it, shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of [State of Governing Law], United States of America, without giving effect to any choice of law or conflict of law provision or rule (whether of the State of [State of Governing Law] or any other jurisdiction) that would cause the application of the laws of any jurisdiction other than the State of [State of Governing Law]. The parties hereto irrevocably and unconditionally submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the state and federal courts located in [County, State of Governing Law] for any action, suit, or proceeding arising out of or relating to this Term Sheet, including, without limitation, any disputes regarding the enforceability of any binding provisions herein. Each party irrevocably waives, to the fullest extent permitted by law, any objection that it may now or hereafter have to the laying of venue of any such action, suit, or proceeding in any such court and any claim that any such action, suit, or proceeding brought in any such court has been brought in an inconvenient forum.

9. Dispute Resolution

This Term Sheet is non-binding, except for the provisions of this Section 9 (Dispute Resolution), Section 10 (Confidentiality), Section 11 (Expenses), and Section 12 (Governing Law), which shall be legally binding upon the parties. Any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to these binding provisions, or the breach, termination, or invalidity thereof, shall first be subject to good faith negotiation between [Party A] and the Investors for a period of thirty (30) days from the date one party notifies the other of a dispute. If the dispute cannot be resolved through negotiation, the parties agree to engage in non-binding mediation with a mutually agreed-upon mediator. Should mediation fail to resolve the dispute within sixty (60) days of the initial notification, the dispute shall be finally resolved by binding arbitration administered by the [Arbitration Rules] in accordance with its rules. The arbitration shall be conducted by a single arbitrator appointed in accordance with said rules. The seat of arbitration shall be [Arbitration Location], and the language of the arbitration shall be English. The decision of the arbitrator shall be final and binding upon the parties, and judgment on the award rendered by the arbitrator may be entered in any court having jurisdiction thereof.

10. Signatures

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties hereto have executed this Non-Binding Investor Term Sheet as of the Effective Date set forth below, acknowledging their understanding of and agreement to the terms outlined herein. It is expressly understood and agreed by all parties that this Term Sheet is intended solely as a summary of the principal terms of a potential investment and is not a legally binding agreement, commitment, or offer to invest, except for any provisions explicitly stated as binding (if any, which are not present in this section). A binding agreement will only arise upon the execution of definitive investment documents by all parties.

FOR THE COMPANY:

_________________________________________

By: [Authorized Signatory Name]

Title: [Title, e.g., CEO]

Date: [Date of Signature]

FOR THE INVESTOR:

_________________________________________

By: [Authorized Signatory Name]

Title: [Title, e.g., Managing Partner]

Date: [Date of Signature]
api1.summary: The non-binding Investor Term Sheet has been successfully drafted, detailing the seed investment amount, industry focus, valuation, equity offered, and key terms.

api2.updated_html:
NON-BINDING INVESTOR TERM SHEET

This Non-Binding Investor Term Sheet ("Term Sheet") outlines the principal terms and conditions for a proposed seed investment by the Investor in the Company. This Term Sheet is intended solely to facilitate further discussion and is not a legally binding agreement, except for the provisions set forth in Section 10 (Confidentiality), Section 11 (Expenses), Section 12 (Governing Law), Section 13 (Non-Binding Nature), and Section 14 (Expiration), which shall be legally binding upon the parties.

The parties acknowledge that this Term Sheet represents a framework for a potential future transaction and that a definitive agreement will be subject to satisfactory due diligence, negotiation, and execution of comprehensive legal documentation, including but not limited to a Convertible Note Purchase Agreement, a Note, and any other ancillary agreements deemed necessary by the parties.

Parties

Investor: [Investor Name/Entity Name]
[Investor Address]
[Investor Contact Person]
[Investor Email]

Company: [Company Legal Name], a [State of Incorporation] corporation
[Company Address]
[Company Contact Person]
[Company Email]
Industry: [Industry e.g., Artificial Intelligence, Biotechnology, Fintech]

1. Key Investment Terms

Investment Amount: The Investor proposes to invest [$X] (e.g., One Hundred Thousand US Dollars) in the Company. This amount represents the total principal sum to be provided by the Investor to the Company in exchange for the convertible instruments outlined herein, subject to the terms and conditions of the definitive agreements.

This investment is intended to provide critical seed capital for the Company's initial operational phases, product development, and market entry strategies. The final disbursement of funds will be contingent upon the satisfaction of customary closing conditions, including the execution of all definitive legal documentation and any other conditions precedent mutually agreed upon by both parties.

Form of Investment: Convertible Note. The investment will be structured as a convertible promissory note ("Note") issued by the Company to the Investor. This Note will automatically convert into equity of the Company upon the occurrence of certain predefined events, primarily a Qualified Equity Financing or a Change of Control event, as further detailed in the definitive Note Purchase Agreement.

The use of a convertible note structure is designed to defer a precise valuation of the Company until a later equity financing round, providing flexibility for both the Company and the Investor during this early stage. The specific terms of conversion, including any applicable discount rates or valuation caps, will be meticulously detailed in the final Note and the associated Convertible Note Purchase Agreement.

Interest Rate: [X]% per annum, compounded annually. Interest shall accrue on the outstanding principal balance of the Note from the date of issuance until the Note is converted into equity, repaid, or otherwise satisfied. This interest will be capitalized and convert along with the principal amount.

The accrued interest will not be paid in cash but will instead increase the principal amount of the Note, thereby increasing the number of equity securities the Investor will receive upon conversion. This capitalization mechanism ensures that the Investor receives a return on their investment even before a liquidity event or equity financing occurs, aligning the interests of both parties.

Maturity Date: [X] months from the issuance date (e.g., 24 months). On the Maturity Date, if the Note has not yet converted into equity, the outstanding principal amount plus all accrued and unpaid interest shall become due and payable by the Company to the Investor, unless otherwise agreed by the Investor.

In the event the Company is unable to repay the Note on the Maturity Date, the parties may mutually agree to extend the Maturity Date, convert the Note into equity at a pre-determined valuation, or explore other mutually agreeable solutions. This provision provides a clear timeline for the investment and a mechanism for resolution if a conversion event does not occur within the anticipated timeframe.

Discount Rate: [X]% (e.g., 20%) on the price per share of the Qualified Equity Financing. Upon conversion in a Qualified Equity Financing, the Investor's Note will convert at a discount to the price paid by new investors in that financing round. This discount rewards the early-stage Investor for the higher risk taken.

The application of this discount rate ensures that the Investor receives a more favorable conversion price compared to later-stage investors, reflecting their early commitment and the inherent risks associated with seed-stage investments. The calculation of the conversion price will be explicitly defined in the definitive convertible note agreement to avoid any ambiguity.

Valuation Cap: $[Y] (e.g., $5,000,000) pre-money. The conversion of the Note into equity will occur at the lower of the price resulting from the Discount Rate or the price implied by the Valuation Cap. This cap sets an upper limit on the pre-money valuation at which the Note can convert, protecting the Investor from excessive dilution if the Company's valuation increases significantly before conversion.

The Valuation Cap provides the Investor with a guaranteed maximum valuation for their conversion, ensuring a minimum ownership percentage irrespective of how high the Company's valuation climbs in a subsequent financing round. This mechanism is crucial for early-stage investors seeking to mitigate the risk of high valuations in later rounds that could significantly dilute their initial investment.

2. Governance & Rights

Information Rights: The Company shall provide the Investor with customary information rights, including but not limited to, annual audited financial statements, quarterly unaudited financial statements, and annual operating budgets. These reports shall be provided within a reasonable timeframe following the end of the respective periods.

The Investor shall also have the right to reasonable access to the Company's management and facilities during normal business hours upon reasonable prior notice, provided such access does not unduly interfere with the Company's operations. These rights are granted to ensure transparency and allow the Investor to monitor the Company's financial performance and strategic progress effectively.

3. Confidentiality

Each party agrees to keep confidential all non-public information disclosed by the other party in connection with this Term Sheet and the proposed transaction, whether written or oral, and to use such information solely for the purpose of evaluating and negotiating the proposed transaction. This obligation shall survive the expiration or termination of this Term Sheet.

This confidentiality obligation does not apply to information that is publicly available, independently developed, or required to be disclosed by law. The parties further agree to take all reasonable measures to protect the confidentiality of such information, including ensuring that their respective representatives, employees, and advisors are bound by similar confidentiality obligations.

4. Expenses

Each party shall bear its own legal, accounting, and other expenses incurred in connection with the negotiation, preparation, and execution of this Term Sheet and the definitive agreements. No party shall be liable to the other for any such expenses, regardless of whether the proposed transaction is consummated.

This provision clarifies that there will be no reimbursement of expenses between the parties for the costs associated with due diligence or legal drafting related to this potential investment. It ensures that both parties are responsible for their own internal and external costs incurred during the exploratory and negotiation phases of this non-binding arrangement.

5. Governing Law

This Term Sheet shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of [State, e.g., Delaware], without regard to its conflict of laws principles. Any disputes arising out of or in connection with this Term Sheet shall be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the state and federal courts located in [County, State, e.g., Santa Clara County, California].

The parties hereby irrevocably submit to the personal jurisdiction of such courts and waive any objection to venue in such courts. This choice of law and jurisdiction ensures clarity and predictability in the event of any legal interpretation or dispute concerning the binding provisions of this Term Sheet, providing a consistent legal framework for engagement.

6. Non-Binding Nature

Except for Sections 3 (Confidentiality), 4 (Expenses), 5 (Governing Law), 6 (Non-Binding Nature), and 7 (Expiration), this Term Sheet is non-binding and does not create any legal obligation on the part of either the Investor or the Company to enter into the proposed transaction or any definitive agreement. A binding agreement will only exist upon the execution of definitive legal documents.

This explicit statement is crucial to ensure that neither party can claim a binding commitment based solely on the terms outlined herein. The parties acknowledge that the proposed transaction is subject to, among other things, satisfactory due diligence, corporate approvals, and the negotiation and execution of comprehensive definitive agreements that fully detail all terms and conditions.

7. Expiration

This Term Sheet shall expire and be of no further force or effect if definitive agreements are not executed by [Date, e.g., 30 days from signing] unless extended by mutual written agreement of the parties. Upon expiration, the non-binding provisions of this Term Sheet shall cease to have any effect, while the binding provisions shall continue in full force and effect as specified.

This expiration clause provides a clear timeframe for the negotiation and execution of the definitive investment documents. It encourages timely progression of discussions and due diligence, while also providing a mechanism for either party to disengage if the process extends beyond a reasonable period without reaching a conclusive agreement.

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have executed this Non-Binding Investor Term Sheet as of the date first written above.

INVESTOR:

_______________________________
[Investor Name/Entity Name]
By: _____________________________
Name: [Authorized Signatory Name]
Title: [Authorized Signatory Title]
Date: ___________________________

COMPANY:

_______________________________
[Company Legal Name]
By: _____________________________
Name: [Authorized Signatory Name]
Title: [Authorized Signatory Title]
Date: ___________________________

query: Draft a Subscription Agreement for equity investment by multiple investors, including share class, purchase price, and representations.

api1.updated_html:
SUBSCRIPTION AGREEMENT

This Subscription Agreement (this "Agreement") is made and entered into as of [Effective Date] (the "Effective Date"), by and between [Issuer Name], a [Jurisdiction of Incorporation] corporation (the "Company"), and each investor whose name appears on the signature pages hereto (each, an "Investor" and collectively, the "Investors").

WHEREAS, the Company desires to issue and sell, and the Investors desire to subscribe for and purchase, certain equity securities of the Company, specifically [Share Class] shares (the "Shares"), in exchange for the aggregate purchase price set forth herein, subject to the terms and conditions hereinafter set forth.

WHEREAS, the Investors acknowledge and agree that their subscription for the Shares is made in reliance upon the representations, warranties, and covenants of the Company contained herein and in any related offering documents, and the Company acknowledges and agrees that the sale of the Shares is made in reliance upon the representations, warranties, and covenants of each Investor contained herein.

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and agreements contained herein, and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the parties hereto agree as follows:

1. Definitions

For the purposes of this Subscription Agreement (this "Agreement"), unless the context otherwise requires, the following terms shall have the meanings ascribed to them below:

"Agreement" means this Subscription Agreement, including all schedules and exhibits attached hereto, as may be amended, restated, supplemented, or otherwise modified from time to time in accordance with its terms.

"Company" means [Full Legal Name of Company], a [State/Jurisdiction of Incorporation] corporation, with its principal place of business located at [Company's Address], which is offering the Shares for subscription hereunder.

"Investor" or "Subscriber" means each individual or entity executing this Agreement as a subscriber for Shares, as identified in Schedule A, who is subscribing for the Shares in accordance with the terms and conditions set forth herein.

"Shares" means the [Specify Class of Shares, e.g., Series A Preferred Shares] of the Company, having the rights, preferences, and privileges as set forth in the Company's Amended and Restated Certificate of Incorporation (or equivalent governing document), as may be amended from time to time.

"Purchase Price" means the aggregate amount payable by an Investor for the Shares subscribed for by such Investor, calculated at the rate of [Currency and Amount] ([e.g., $X.XX]) per Share, as specified opposite such Investor's name in Schedule A.

"Closing Date" means the date on which the subscription for Shares is completed and the Purchase Price is paid by the Investor to the Company, which shall be [Specific Date] or such other date as mutually agreed upon in writing by the Company and the Investor.

"Effective Date" means the date first written above, which is [Effective Date], from which date this Agreement shall be deemed to be in full force and effect.

2. Payment Terms

The Investor, [Investor Name], hereby irrevocably agrees to pay the full aggregate purchase price for the subscribed shares (the "Purchase Price") as explicitly set forth in Section 1 of this Agreement, which amounts to [Purchase Price] [Currency]. This Purchase Price shall be due and payable in full by the Investor to the Company, [Company Name], on or before the [Effective Date] (the "Payment Due Date").

Payment shall be made exclusively by wire transfer of immediately available funds, in [Currency], to the Company's designated bank account. The Company shall provide the Investor with the specific bank details, including but not limited to the Bank Name: [Bank Name], Account Name: [Account Name], Account Number: [Account Number], and ABA Routing Number: [ABA Routing Number] (or SWIFT/BIC Code: [SWIFT/BIC Code] for international transfers), no later than [Number] business days prior to the Payment Due Date.

The Investor acknowledges and agrees that no shares shall be issued, allotted, or delivered, nor shall any rights or benefits associated with such shares accrue to the Investor, until the Company has received the full Purchase Price in cleared and immediately available funds. Any bank charges, transfer fees, or other costs associated with the payment of the Purchase Price shall be borne solely by the Investor and shall not be deducted from the Purchase Price.

In the event that the full Purchase Price is not received by the Company in cleared funds on or before the Payment Due Date, the Company reserves the right, at its sole discretion and without prejudice to any other rights or remedies available at law or in equity, to (a) delay the closing of the subscription until such payment is received, (b) terminate this Agreement immediately without further obligation to the Investor, or (c) pursue any and all available legal remedies for the collection of the Purchase Price.

3. Warranties

Each Investor, severally and not jointly, hereby represents and warrants to [Company Name] (the "Company") as of the date hereof and as of the Closing Date, that:

a. **Authority; Enforceability.** Such Investor has full power and authority to execute and deliver this Agreement and any other documents required to be executed by such Investor in connection herewith, and to perform its obligations hereunder. This Agreement constitutes a valid and legally binding obligation of such Investor, enforceable against such Investor in accordance with its terms, except as enforceability may be limited by bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization, moratorium or similar laws affecting creditors’ rights generally, or by general principles of equity.

b. **No Conflicts.** The execution, delivery, and performance by such Investor of this Agreement and the consummation by such Investor of the transactions contemplated hereby do not and will not (i) violate any provision of the organizational documents of such Investor, (ii) conflict with or result in a breach of any agreement or instrument to which such Investor is a party or by which it is bound, or (iii) violate any law, rule, regulation, order, judgment, or decree applicable to such Investor.

c. **Accredited Investor Status.** Such Investor is an "accredited investor" as defined in Rule 501(a) of Regulation D promulgated under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended (the "Securities Act"), and has accurately completed and signed the Investor Questionnaire attached hereto as Exhibit A. Such Investor understands that the Shares are being offered and sold in reliance on exemptions from registration under the Securities Act and applicable state securities laws, and that the Company is relying upon the truth and accuracy of the representations and warranties contained herein and in the Investor Questionnaire to establish the availability of such exemptions.

d. **Investment Purpose.** Such Investor is acquiring the Shares for its own account, for investment purposes only, and not with a view to, or for resale in connection with, any distribution thereof, nor with any present intention of selling or otherwise disposing of the Shares. Such Investor understands that the Shares have not been registered under the Securities Act or any state securities laws, and therefore cannot be sold or transferred unless they are registered under the Securities Act and applicable state securities laws or an exemption from such registration is available.

e. **Sophistication; Risk Acknowledgment.** Such Investor has sufficient knowledge and experience in financial and business matters to be capable of evaluating the merits and risks of an investment in the Company, and is able to bear the economic risk of such investment, including the complete loss of its investment. Such Investor has had the opportunity to ask questions of and receive answers from the Company concerning the terms and conditions of this investment and to obtain any additional information necessary to verify the accuracy of any information furnished to it, to the extent the Company possesses such information or can acquire it without unreasonable effort or expense.

f. **Financial Condition.** Such Investor has adequate means of providing for its current needs and contingencies and has no need for liquidity with respect to its investment in the Company. The financial condition of such Investor is such that it can afford to bear the entire loss of its investment in the Company.

4. Confidentiality

The Investor acknowledges that in connection with its evaluation of the Company and the execution of this Subscription Agreement, it has received and will continue to receive certain confidential, proprietary, and non-public information concerning the Company, its business, operations, financial condition, products, services, and strategies (collectively, "Confidential Information"). The Investor agrees to keep all such Confidential Information strictly confidential and shall not, directly or indirectly, disclose, publish, or disseminate any Confidential Information to any third party, nor use any Confidential Information for any purpose other than for the evaluation of the investment contemplated by this Agreement and the exercise of its rights as an investor in the Company.

The foregoing confidentiality obligations shall not apply to information that (a) is or becomes generally available to the public other than as a result of a disclosure by the Investor or its representatives; (b) was available to the Investor on a non-confidential basis prior to its disclosure by the Company; (c) becomes available to the Investor on a non-confidential basis from a source other than the Company, provided that such source is not, to the best of the Investor's knowledge, bound by a confidentiality agreement with the Company; or (d) is required to be disclosed by law, regulation, or court order, provided that the Investor provides prompt written notice to the Company prior to such disclosure, if legally permissible, to allow the Company to seek a protective order or other appropriate remedy. The Investor may disclose Confidential Information to its legal, financial, and accounting advisors who need to know such information for the purpose of advising the Investor regarding this investment, provided such advisors are informed of the confidential nature of the information and agree to be bound by confidentiality obligations substantially similar to those contained herein.

5. Indemnification

Each Investor (the "Indemnifying Party") hereby agrees to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless the Company, its officers, directors, employees, agents, affiliates, successors, and assigns (collectively, the "Indemnified Parties") from and against any and all losses, damages, liabilities, deficiencies, claims, actions, judgments, settlements, interest, awards, penalties, fines, costs, or expenses of whatever kind, including reasonable attorneys' fees, and the cost of enforcing any right to indemnification hereunder, and the cost of pursuing any insurance providers, arising out of or in connection with any breach or inaccuracy of any representation or warranty made by such Indemnifying Party in this Agreement or any exhibit or schedule hereto, or any failure by such Indemnifying Party to perform any covenant or agreement to be performed by such Indemnifying Party hereunder. This indemnification obligation shall survive the Closing of the purchase of the Shares and the termination of this Agreement. The Indemnified Parties shall provide prompt written notice to the Indemnifying Party of any claim for which indemnification is sought; provided, however, that the failure to provide such notice shall not relieve the Indemnifying Party of its obligations hereunder except to the extent that such failure materially prejudices the Indemnifying Party's ability to defend such claim.

6. Limitation of Liability

Except for liabilities arising from fraud, willful misconduct, gross negligence, or a material breach of the representations, warranties, or covenants expressly set forth in this Subscription Agreement, neither [Company Name] nor its officers, directors, employees, agents, affiliates, or advisors shall be liable to the Subscriber(s) for any indirect, incidental, consequential, special, punitive, or exemplary damages, including but not limited to, loss of profits, loss of revenue, loss of data, or loss of business opportunity, arising out of or in connection with this Subscription Agreement, the purchase of the Shares, or the investment contemplated hereby. This limitation of liability shall apply regardless of the form of action, whether in contract, tort (including negligence), strict liability, or otherwise, even if [Company Name] or its representatives have been advised of the possibility of such damages. In no event shall the aggregate liability of [Company Name] and its affiliates to any Subscriber(s) under this Agreement exceed the actual amount of the Purchase Price paid by such Subscriber(s) for the Shares subscribed hereunder. The Subscriber acknowledges and agrees that the limitations set forth in this Section 6 are a fundamental basis of the bargain between the parties and reflect an allocation of risk between the parties.

7. Governing Law

This Subscription Agreement and all matters arising out of or relating to this Agreement, including, without limitation, its validity, interpretation, construction, performance, and enforcement, shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the internal laws of the State of [Governing State], United States of America, without giving effect to any choice or conflict of law provision or rule (whether of the State of [Governing State] or any other jurisdiction) that would cause the application of the laws of any jurisdiction other than the State of [Governing State]. The parties hereto irrevocably and unconditionally consent to the exclusive jurisdiction of the state and federal courts located within [Governing County], [Governing State] for any actions, suits, or proceedings arising out of or relating to this Agreement, and agree not to commence any such action, suit, or proceeding except in such courts. Each party hereby irrevocably waives any objection which it may now or hereafter have to the laying of venue of any such action, suit, or proceeding in such courts and further irrevocably waives any claim that any such action, suit, or proceeding brought in any such court has been brought in an inconvenient forum.

8. Dispute Resolution

Any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Subscription Agreement, or the breach, termination, or invalidity thereof, shall first be subject to good faith negotiations between the Parties for a period of not less than thirty (30) days from the date one Party provides written notice of a dispute to the other. If the dispute cannot be resolved through negotiation, the Parties agree to attempt to resolve the dispute through non-binding mediation administered by [Mediation Service Provider or Organization] in accordance with its then-current rules, with the costs of mediation to be shared equally by the Parties.

If the dispute remains unresolved after sixty (60) days from the commencement of mediation, or if mediation is not pursued, such dispute shall be finally settled by binding arbitration in accordance with the [Arbitration Rules, e.g., AAA Commercial Arbitration Rules] then in effect, by one (1) arbitrator appointed in accordance with said Rules. The arbitration shall be conducted in [Arbitration Location], and the language of the arbitration shall be English. The decision of the arbitrator shall be final and binding upon all Parties and may be entered as a judgment in any court of competent jurisdiction. Notwithstanding the foregoing, either Party may seek interim or injunctive relief in any court of competent jurisdiction to protect its rights or property pending the outcome of the arbitration.

The prevailing Party in any arbitration or other legal proceeding arising out of this Agreement shall be entitled to recover its reasonable attorneys' fees and costs incurred in connection with such proceeding. This Section 8 shall survive the termination or expiration of this Subscription Agreement.

9. Signatures

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties hereto have executed this Subscription Agreement as of the Effective Date first written above, each intending to be legally bound by its terms and conditions. Each signatory represents and warrants that they are duly authorized to execute this Agreement on behalf of the party for whom they are signing, and that this Agreement constitutes a valid and binding obligation of such party, enforceable in accordance with its terms.
