api2.updated_html:
SUBSCRIPTION AGREEMENT

This Subscription Agreement (this "Agreement") is made and entered into as of this [Day] day of [Month], [Year] (the "Effective Date"), by and between:

[COMPANY NAME], a corporation duly organized and existing under the laws of the State of [State of Incorporation], with its principal place of business located at [Company Address] (the "Company");

AND

EACH INVESTOR listed on Schedule A attached hereto, each a "Subscriber" and collectively, the "Subscribers."

WHEREAS, the Company desires to issue and sell, and each Subscriber desires to subscribe for and purchase, certain equity securities of the Company as set forth herein, subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement and the Company’s governing documents. The parties acknowledge that this transaction is being conducted in reliance upon exemptions from the registration requirements of applicable securities laws, and the Subscribers understand the implications of such reliance.

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants contained in this Agreement, and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the Company and each Subscriber hereby agree as follows:

ARTICLE I. DEFINITIONS

1.1 "Shares" means the [Number] shares of [Share Class, e.g., Series A Preferred Stock] of the Company, par value $[Par Value] per share, to be issued and sold to each Subscriber pursuant to this Agreement. These Shares shall carry all rights, preferences, and privileges as set forth in the Company's Amended and Restated Certificate of Incorporation (or equivalent governing document), including but not limited to liquidation preferences, dividend rights, voting rights, and conversion rights, as may be amended from time to time.

The term "Shares" explicitly encompasses any stock dividends, stock splits, recapitalizations, or other distributions of equity securities made in respect thereof, or any securities into which such Shares may be converted or for which they may be exchanged. The precise characteristics and limitations of these Shares are fully described in the Company’s organizational documents, which the Subscriber acknowledges having received and reviewed in their entirety prior to the execution of this Agreement, understanding that the investment is subject to these specific terms.

1.2 "Purchase Price" means the aggregate amount of consideration, in cash, that each Subscriber shall pay to the Company for the Shares subscribed for by such Subscriber, as specified in Schedule A. This price per share has been determined by the Company’s board of directors, taking into account various factors including, but not limited to, the Company’s valuation, financial projections, and market conditions, and represents the full and final consideration for the issuance of the Shares.

The Purchase Price is non-refundable, except as expressly provided in this Agreement, and is exclusive of any taxes, fees, or other charges that may be imposed by governmental authorities in connection with the subscription and issuance of the Shares. Each Subscriber acknowledges that the Purchase Price reflects the agreed-upon valuation of the Company at the time of this Agreement and understands that future valuations may differ.

1.3 "Closing Date" means the date upon which the subscription for and purchase of the Shares by the Subscribers and the issuance of the Shares by the Company shall be consummated, as mutually agreed upon by the Company and the Subscribers. This date may be adjusted by mutual written agreement of the parties to accommodate any unforeseen administrative or legal requirements that may arise prior to the completion of the transaction.

The Closing Date shall be specified in a separate written notice provided by the Company to each Subscriber, which notice shall be delivered at least [Number] business days prior to the proposed Closing Date. All conditions precedent to closing, as set forth in this Agreement, must be satisfied or waived by the Closing Date for the transaction to proceed as planned.

ARTICLE II. SUBSCRIPTION AND PURCHASE

2.1 Subscription for Shares. Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, each Subscriber hereby irrevocably subscribes for and agrees to purchase from the Company, and the Company agrees to issue and sell to each Subscriber, the number of Shares set forth opposite such Subscriber's name on Schedule A. This subscription constitutes a binding offer by the Subscriber to purchase the Shares, which offer shall become effective upon acceptance by the Company.

The Company reserves the right, in its sole discretion, to accept or reject any subscription in whole or in part, notwithstanding prior discussions or indications of interest. Any rejection of a subscription shall be communicated to the relevant Subscriber in writing, and any funds remitted by such Subscriber shall be promptly returned without interest or deduction.

2.2 Purchase Price and Payment. The aggregate Purchase Price for the Shares subscribed for by each Subscriber shall be the amount set forth opposite such Subscriber's name on Schedule A. Each Subscriber shall pay the Purchase Price to the Company by wire transfer of immediately available funds to an account designated by the Company, or by such other method as mutually agreed upon, on or before the Closing Date.

Failure by a Subscriber to remit the full Purchase Price by the Closing Date may, at the Company’s sole discretion, result in the termination of this Agreement with respect to such Subscriber, without prejudice to any other rights or remedies the Company may have. The Company shall provide detailed wiring instructions to each Subscriber at least [Number] business days prior to the Closing Date.

2.3 Closing. The closing of the subscription and purchase of the Shares hereunder shall take place on the Closing Date at [Time] [Time Zone] at the offices of [Company Address or Legal Counsel's Address], or at such other time, date, or place as the Company and the Subscribers may mutually agree. At the Closing, the Company shall deliver to each Subscriber a duly executed stock certificate or equivalent electronic entry representing the Shares, free and clear of all liens, claims, and encumbrances other than those arising under applicable securities laws or the Company’s governing documents.

Concurrently with the delivery of the Shares, each Subscriber shall deliver the full Purchase Price to the Company. The parties shall also execute and deliver any other documents or instruments reasonably necessary or appropriate to consummate the transactions contemplated by this Agreement, including, but not limited to, any investor rights agreements, voting agreements, or rights of first refusal agreements as may be required by the Company or agreed upon by the parties.

ARTICLE III. REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES OF THE SUBSCRIBER

Each Subscriber hereby represents and warrants to the Company, as of the Effective Date and as of the Closing Date, as follows:

3.1 Authority; Enforceability. If the Subscriber is an entity, it is duly organized, validly existing, and in good standing under the laws of its jurisdiction of organization, and has all requisite corporate or other organizational power and authority to enter into this Agreement and to carry out its obligations hereunder. If the Subscriber is an individual, such Subscriber has the legal capacity to enter into this Agreement.

The execution and delivery of this Agreement by the Subscriber and the performance by the Subscriber of its obligations hereunder have been duly authorized by all necessary corporate or other action on the part of the Subscriber. This Agreement constitutes a legal, valid, and binding obligation of the Subscriber, enforceable against the Subscriber in accordance with its terms, except as enforceability may be limited by bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization, moratorium, or similar laws affecting creditors' rights generally and by general principles of equity.

3.2 Investment Purpose. The Shares are being acquired by the Subscriber for its own account, for investment purposes only, and not with a view to, or for resale in connection with, any distribution thereof within the meaning of the Securities Act of 1933, as amended (the "Securities Act"). The Subscriber understands that the Shares have not been registered under the Securities Act or any state securities laws, and therefore cannot be sold or transferred unless they are subsequently registered or an exemption from registration is available.

The Subscriber acknowledges that the Company has no obligation to register the Shares for resale or to assist the Subscriber in complying with any exemption from registration. The Subscriber further understands that any disposition of the Shares must be made in compliance with applicable securities laws, which may include holding period requirements, volume limitations, and other restrictions, and that the Shares will bear a restrictive legend to that effect.

3.3 Accredited Investor Status. Each Subscriber is an "accredited investor" as defined in Rule 501(a) of Regulation D promulgated under the Securities Act, or is otherwise qualified to purchase the Shares in reliance on an exemption from registration under the Securities Act and applicable state securities laws. The Subscriber has provided the Company with true, accurate, and complete information regarding its accredited investor status or other qualification.

The Subscriber understands that the Company is relying on this representation to qualify for an exemption from the registration requirements of the Securities Act and applicable state securities laws. The Subscriber agrees to furnish any additional information that the Company may reasonably request to verify the Subscriber’s accredited investor status or other qualification.

3.4 Sophistication; Access to Information. The Subscriber has such knowledge and experience in financial and business matters that it is capable of evaluating the merits and risks of an investment in the Shares. The Subscriber has been afforded the opportunity to ask questions of and receive answers from the Company concerning the terms and conditions of the offering and to obtain any additional information necessary to verify the accuracy of information provided.

The Subscriber has received and carefully reviewed all information it deems necessary or appropriate concerning the Company and the Shares, including, but not limited to, financial statements, business plans, and legal documents. The Subscriber confirms that it has conducted its own independent due diligence and has relied solely on its own investigation and the representations and warranties of the Company contained herein in making its investment decision.

ARTICLE IV. REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES OF THE COMPANY

The Company hereby represents and warrants to each Subscriber, as of the Effective Date and as of the Closing Date, as follows:

4.1 Organization; Good Standing. The Company is a corporation duly organized, validly existing, and in good standing under the laws of the State of [State of Incorporation], and has all requisite corporate power and authority to own its properties and to carry on its business as now conducted and as proposed to be conducted. The Company is duly qualified to do business and is in good standing in every jurisdiction in which the nature of the business conducted by it or the character of the properties owned or leased by it requires such qualification, except where the failure to be so qualified would not have a Material Adverse Effect on the Company.

The Company has delivered to the Subscribers true and complete copies of its Certificate of Incorporation, Bylaws, and any other organizational documents, as currently in effect. All corporate actions taken by the Company in connection with the transactions contemplated by this Agreement, including the authorization and issuance of the Shares, have been duly and validly taken in accordance with its organizational documents and applicable law.

4.2 Authority; Enforceability. The Company has all requisite corporate power and authority to execute and deliver this Agreement, to issue and sell the Shares, and to carry out and perform its obligations hereunder. The execution and delivery of this Agreement by the Company, the issuance and sale of the Shares, and the performance by the Company of its obligations hereunder have been duly authorized by all necessary corporate action on the part of the Company.

This Agreement constitutes a legal, valid, and binding obligation of the Company, enforceable against the Company in accordance with its terms, except as enforceability may be limited by bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization, moratorium, or similar laws affecting creditors' rights generally and by general principles of equity. The Shares, when issued and delivered in accordance with the terms of this Agreement, will be duly authorized, validly issued, fully paid, and non-assessable.

4.3 Capitalization. The authorized capital stock of the Company consists of [Number] shares of Common Stock, of which [Number] shares are issued and outstanding, and [Number] shares of Preferred Stock, of which [Number] shares of [Share Class, e.g., Series A Preferred Stock] are authorized and [Number] shares are issued and outstanding (excluding the Shares to be issued hereunder). All outstanding shares of capital stock of the Company are duly authorized, validly issued, fully paid, and non-assessable.

Except for the rights granted to the Subscribers hereunder and as set forth in the Company's organizational documents or disclosed in writing to the Subscribers, there are no outstanding options, warrants, convertible securities, or other rights, agreements, or commitments obligating the Company to issue or sell any shares of its capital stock or any securities convertible into or exchangeable for shares of its capital stock. The issuance of the Shares will not result in any violation of any pre-emptive rights or similar rights of any existing shareholder.

ARTICLE V. COVENANTS

5.1 Confidentiality. Each Subscriber acknowledges that in connection with its investment in the Company, it may obtain access to confidential and proprietary information of the Company, including but not limited to business plans, financial data, technology, and customer lists ("Confidential Information"). Each Subscriber agrees to keep all such Confidential Information strictly confidential and not to disclose, disseminate, or use such Confidential Information for any purpose other than evaluating and managing its investment in the Company, without the prior written consent of the Company.

This confidentiality obligation shall not apply to information that (a) is or becomes publicly available through no fault of the Subscriber, (b) is independently developed by the Subscriber without use of the Company's Confidential Information, (c) is rightfully received by the Subscriber from a third party without restriction on disclosure, or (d) is required to be disclosed by law or by order of a court or governmental agency, provided that the Subscriber gives prompt written notice to the Company prior to such disclosure to allow the Company to seek a protective order or other appropriate remedy.

ARTICLE VI. INDEMNIFICATION

6.1 Indemnification by Subscriber. Each Subscriber agrees to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless the Company and its officers, directors, employees, and agents from and against any and all losses, damages, liabilities, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees) arising out of or in connection with any breach by such Subscriber of any representation, warranty, covenant, or agreement contained in this Agreement. This indemnification obligation shall survive the Closing and the termination of this Agreement.

The indemnification provided herein shall be limited to the direct damages incurred by the Company and shall not extend to consequential, indirect, incidental, special, exemplary, or punitive damages, except to the extent such damages are awarded to a third party in connection with a claim for which indemnification is sought. The Company shall provide prompt written notice to the Subscriber of any claim for which indemnification is sought, and the Subscriber shall have the right to assume the defense thereof with counsel of its choice.

6.2 Indemnification by Company. The Company agrees to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless each Subscriber and its officers, directors, employees, and agents from and against any and all losses, damages, liabilities, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees) arising out of or in connection with any breach by the Company of any representation, warranty, covenant, or agreement contained in this Agreement. This indemnification obligation shall survive the Closing and the termination of this Agreement.

The indemnification provided herein shall be limited to the direct damages incurred by the Subscriber and shall not extend to consequential, indirect, incidental, special, exemplary, or punitive damages, except to the extent such damages are awarded to a third party in connection with a claim for which indemnification is sought. Each Subscriber shall provide prompt written notice to the Company of any claim for which indemnification is sought, and the Company shall have the right to assume the defense thereof with counsel of its choice.

ARTICLE VII. MISCELLANEOUS PROVISIONS

7.1 Governing Law. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the internal laws of the State of [State of Governing Law], without regard to its principles of conflicts of law. The parties expressly waive any right to object to the jurisdiction or venue of such courts.

Any legal action or proceeding arising out of or relating to this Agreement shall be brought exclusively in the state or federal courts located in [City, State of Governing Law]. Each party irrevocably submits to the exclusive jurisdiction of such courts in any such action or proceeding and waives any objection to venue in such courts.

7.2 Dispute Resolution. Any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement, or the breach, termination, or validity thereof, shall be finally settled by arbitration administered by [Arbitration Association, e.g., American Arbitration Association] in accordance with its Commercial Arbitration Rules, and judgment on the award rendered by the arbitrator(s) may be entered in any court having jurisdiction thereof. The place of arbitration shall be [City, State].

The arbitration shall be conducted by [Number] arbitrator(s) appointed in accordance with said Rules. The language of the arbitration shall be English. The parties agree that the arbitration proceedings and any award shall be kept confidential, except to the extent necessary to enforce the award or as otherwise required by law.

7.3 Entire Agreement. This Agreement, including the attached Schedule A, constitutes the entire agreement between the parties with respect to the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior agreements, understandings, negotiations, and discussions, whether oral or written, of the parties. No representations, warranties, covenants, or agreements, other than those expressly set forth herein, have been made by the Company or any Subscriber.

The parties acknowledge that they have not relied upon any statement, representation, or warranty, whether express or implied, made by any other party or any other person, except as expressly set forth in this Agreement. Any modification or amendment to this Agreement must be in writing and signed by all parties hereto to be effective.

7.4 Amendments; Waivers. No amendment, modification, or waiver of any provision of this Agreement shall be effective unless it is in writing and signed by all parties to this Agreement. No waiver of any breach of any provision of this Agreement shall be deemed a waiver of any other subsequent breach of that provision or any other provision.

The failure of any party to insist upon strict performance of any provision of this Agreement shall not be construed as a waiver or relinquishment of that party's right to insist upon strict performance of such provision or any other provision in the future. Any waiver must be explicit and in writing to be effective.

7.5 Assignment. This Agreement and the rights and obligations hereunder may not be assigned by any party without the prior written consent of the other parties. Any attempted assignment in violation of this Section shall be null and void and of no effect.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Company may assign its rights and obligations under this Agreement in connection with a merger, consolidation, sale of all or substantially all of its assets, or other corporate reorganization, provided that the assignee agrees in writing to be bound by the terms of this Agreement.

7.6 Notices. All notices, requests, consents, claims, demands, waivers, and other communications hereunder shall be in writing and shall be deemed to have been given (a) when delivered by hand (with written confirmation of receipt); (b) when received by the addressee if sent by a nationally recognized overnight courier (receipt requested); (c) on the date sent by email (with confirmation of transmission) if sent during normal business hours of the recipient, and on the next business day if sent after normal business hours of the recipient; or (d) on the [Number] day after the date mailed, by certified or registered mail, return receipt requested, postage prepaid.

Such communications must be sent to the respective parties at the addresses set forth below (or to such other address or email address as may be designated by a party from time to time in accordance with this Section):
If to the Company: [Company Address], Email: [Company Email]
If to a Subscriber: To the address and email specified in Schedule A.

7.7 Counterparts. This Agreement may be executed in counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which together shall be deemed to be one and the same agreement. A signed copy of this Agreement delivered by facsimile, email, or other means of electronic transmission shall be deemed to have the same legal effect as delivery of an original signed copy of this Agreement.

The parties agree that the electronic signatures, whether digital or scanned, of the parties included in this Agreement are intended to authenticate this writing and to have the same force and effect as manual signatures. The exchange of copies of this Agreement and of signature pages by facsimile or other electronic transmission shall constitute effective execution and delivery of this Agreement.

7.8 Severability. If any term or provision of this Agreement is invalid, illegal, or unenforceable in any jurisdiction, such invalidity, illegality, or unenforceability shall not affect any other term or provision of this Agreement or invalidate or render unenforceable such term or provision in any other jurisdiction.

Upon such determination that any term or other provision is invalid, illegal, or unenforceable, the parties hereto shall negotiate in good faith to modify this Agreement so as to effect the original intent of the parties as closely as possible in a mutually acceptable manner in order that the transactions contemplated hereby be consummated as originally contemplated to the greatest extent possible.

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties hereto have executed this Subscription Agreement as of the Effective Date first written above.

query: Draft a Convertible Note (or SAFE) agreement for an early-stage startup raising [$X], including discount, valuation cap, and maturity terms.

api1.updated_html:
CONVERTIBLE NOTE AGREEMENT

This Convertible Note Agreement (this "Agreement") is made and entered into as of [Effective Date] (the "Effective Date"), by and between [Company Legal Name], a [State of Incorporation] corporation, with its principal place of business located at [Company Address] (the "Company"), and [Investor Legal Name], a [State/Country of Organization] [Entity Type], with its principal place of business located at [Investor Address] (the "Investor").

WHEREAS, the Company is an early-stage startup engaged in [brief description of Company's business];

WHEREAS, the Company desires to raise capital to finance its operations, growth, and development; and

WHEREAS, the Investor desires to provide financing to the Company in the aggregate principal amount of [$X] (the "Principal Amount") in exchange for a convertible promissory note, subject to the terms and conditions set forth herein, which note shall be convertible into equity securities of the Company upon the occurrence of certain events as more fully described below.

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and agreements contained herein, and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the parties hereto agree as follows:

1. Definitions

For the purposes of this Convertible Note Agreement (the "Agreement"), the following terms shall have the meanings ascribed to them below:

"Company" means [Legal Name of Startup], a [State of Incorporation] corporation, with its principal place of business located at [Company Address], which is the issuer of this Convertible Note.

"Investor" means [Investor Name], a [State of Organization/Residence] [Type of Entity/Individual], with its principal address at [Investor Address], who is the purchaser of this Convertible Note and provider of the Principal Amount to the Company.

"Principal Amount" means the sum of [$X] Dollars ($X.00), representing the total cash consideration paid by the Investor to the Company in exchange for this Convertible Note, exclusive of any accrued interest.

"Qualified Financing" means a bona fide equity financing round of the Company occurring after the Effective Date and prior to the Maturity Date, in which the Company sells and issues shares of its Preferred Stock for aggregate gross proceeds to the Company of at least [$Y] (excluding the conversion of this Note and any other convertible securities), or such lesser amount as the Company and the holders of a majority in aggregate Principal Amount of all Convertible Notes then outstanding may agree.

"Valuation Cap" means the pre-money valuation of the Company set at [$Z] Dollars ($Z.00), which shall be the maximum valuation used to determine the Conversion Price per share of Preferred Stock upon a Qualified Financing, irrespective of a higher actual pre-money valuation in such financing.

"Discount Rate" means [Percentage]% ([Percentage]%) which shall be applied as a reduction to the price per share of Preferred Stock sold in a Qualified Financing for purposes of calculating the Conversion Price of this Note, provided that such discounted price is not lower than the price determined by the Valuation Cap.

"Maturity Date" means [Date, e.g., the date that is twenty-four (24) months from the Effective Date], upon which date the outstanding Principal Amount of this Note, together with all accrued and unpaid interest thereon, shall become due and payable if not previously converted into equity or repaid in accordance with the terms of this Agreement.

2. Issuance and Principal Terms of the Note/SAFE

The Company hereby issues to [Investor Name] (the "Holder") a Convertible Promissory Note (the "Note") or a Simple Agreement for Future Equity (the "SAFE"), as applicable, in the principal amount of [$X] (the "Principal Amount"). This instrument is issued on [Effective Date] in consideration for the cash investment made by the Holder to the Company.

Discount: In the event of a Qualified Equity Financing (as defined herein) occurring prior to the Maturity Date (if applicable), the Principal Amount (and any accrued interest, if applicable) shall convert into Conversion Shares at a price per share equal to the lesser of (a) the price per share paid by investors in the Qualified Equity Financing, or (b) such price discounted by [Discount Rate]% (the "Discount Rate").

Valuation Cap: Alternatively, in the event of a Qualified Equity Financing, the Principal Amount (and any accrued interest, if applicable) shall convert into Conversion Shares at a price per share derived from a pre-money valuation of the Company equal to the Valuation Cap of [$Y] (the "Valuation Cap"), divided by the fully-diluted capitalization of the Company immediately prior to the Qualified Equity Financing. The Holder shall receive the benefit of either the Discount Rate or the Valuation Cap, whichever results in a lower effective conversion price per share for the Holder.

Maturity Date (Applicable to Convertible Note only): If this instrument is a Convertible Promissory Note, the entire unpaid Principal Amount and all accrued and unpaid interest thereon shall become due and payable on [Maturity Date] (the "Maturity Date"), unless earlier converted or repaid in accordance with the terms herein. This maturity provision is not applicable if this instrument is a Simple Agreement for Future Equity (SAFE), as SAFEs do not have a maturity date.

Interest (Applicable to Convertible Note only): If this instrument is a Convertible Promissory Note, the Principal Amount shall bear simple interest at a rate of [Interest Rate]% per annum, computed on the basis of a 365-day year and the actual number of days elapsed, commencing on the Effective Date. Interest shall be payable only upon conversion or repayment of the Note. This interest provision is not applicable if this instrument is a Simple Agreement for Future Equity (SAFE), as SAFEs do not accrue interest.

3. Conversion Provisions

Upon the closing of a Qualified Financing (as defined below), the outstanding principal amount of this Note, together with any accrued and unpaid interest thereon (the "Conversion Amount"), shall automatically convert into that number of shares of the Company's capital stock issued in such Qualified Financing (the "Conversion Shares"). The conversion shall occur without any further action by the Investor or the Company, and the Investor shall be deemed to be the holder of record of the Conversion Shares as of the closing of the Qualified Financing.

A "Qualified Financing" shall mean the Company's next equity financing round in which the Company sells and issues shares of its Preferred Stock for aggregate gross proceeds to the Company of at least [$X] (excluding the conversion of this Note and any other convertible securities). The "Conversion Price" shall be the lower of (a) the price per share of the Preferred Stock sold in the Qualified Financing multiplied by one minus the [Discount Rate]% discount (the "Discount Price"), or (b) the price per share derived from the [Valuation Cap] (the "Cap Price"). The Cap Price shall be calculated as the [Valuation Cap] divided by the Company's fully-diluted capitalization immediately prior to the Qualified Financing, which capitalization shall include all outstanding shares of capital stock, all outstanding options and warrants, and all other convertible securities on an as-converted basis, but excluding the Conversion Shares issuable upon conversion of this Note.

The number of Conversion Shares shall be determined by dividing the Conversion Amount by the applicable Conversion Price. In connection with the conversion of this Note, the Investor agrees to execute and deliver to the Company all transaction documents related to such Qualified Financing, including, without limitation, any investor rights agreement, voting agreement, or other ancillary agreements, provided that such documents do not impose obligations on the Investor that are materially more burdensome than those imposed on other investors in the Qualified Financing, or that are inconsistent with the terms of this Note.

No fractional shares shall be issued upon conversion of this Note. If the Conversion Amount would result in the issuance of a fractional share, the number of Conversion Shares shall be rounded down to the nearest whole share, and the Company shall pay the Investor cash in an amount equal to the value of such fractional share based on the Conversion Price.

4. Maturity and Repayment (for Convertible Note) / Liquidation Event (for SAFE)

In the event this instrument is structured as a Convertible Note, the entire outstanding Principal Amount of this Note, together with all accrued and unpaid interest thereon, shall become immediately due and payable by the Company to the Holder on the Maturity Date, which shall be [Maturity Date]. Should the Company fail to repay the Note on the Maturity Date, the outstanding Principal Amount and accrued interest shall accrue interest at a default rate of [Default Interest Rate]% per annum, compounded annually, until fully repaid or converted as per the terms herein. The Company may, at its sole discretion, elect to convert the outstanding Principal and accrued interest into equity securities of the Company at the then-applicable conversion price, provided such conversion is explicitly permitted by other provisions of this Agreement and agreed upon by the Holder.

In the event this instrument is structured as a Simple Agreement for Future Equity (SAFE), this instrument does not have a maturity date and does not accrue interest. However, upon a Liquidation Event occurring prior to the conversion of this SAFE, the Holder shall be entitled to receive, at the Holder’s option, either (a) a payment equal to the Purchase Amount, or (b) convert the Purchase Amount into shares of Common Stock at the Liquidation Price, which shall be calculated based on the lower of the Valuation Cap or the Discount Rate applied to the pre-money valuation of the Company immediately prior to such Liquidation Event. A "Liquidation Event" shall mean any liquidation, dissolution, or winding up of the Company, whether voluntary or involuntary, or any Change of Control transaction, including without limitation, a merger, consolidation, or sale of all or substantially all of the Company’s assets. In such an event, the Holder’s rights to payment or conversion shall be pari passu with all other holders of SAFE instruments of the Company and senior to holders of Common Stock, but junior to any indebtedness of the Company.

5. Representations and Warranties

Each party hereto, as of the Effective Date, hereby represents and warrants to the other party as follows:

5.1. Representations and Warranties of the Issuer: The Issuer represents and warrants to the Investor that:

(a) The Issuer is a corporation duly organized, validly existing, and in good standing under the laws of the State of [State of Incorporation], and has the requisite corporate power and authority to own its properties and to carry on its business as now being conducted.

(b) The Issuer has the corporate power and authority to execute and deliver this Convertible Note Agreement (or SAFE Agreement), to issue the Note (or SAFE) contemplated hereunder, and to perform its obligations hereunder. The execution, delivery, and performance by the Issuer of this Agreement and the issuance of the Note (or SAFE) have been duly authorized by all necessary corporate action on the part of the Issuer.

(c) This Agreement constitutes a valid and binding obligation of the Issuer, enforceable against the Issuer in accordance with its terms, except as enforceability may be limited by applicable bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization, moratorium, or similar laws affecting creditors’ rights generally and by general principles of equity.

(d) The execution and delivery of this Agreement and the issuance of the Note (or SAFE) will not (i) violate any provision of the Issuer's certificate of incorporation or bylaws, (ii) violate any statute, rule, regulation, order, judgment, or decree of any governmental authority, or (iii) conflict with, or result in a breach or default under, any material agreement or instrument to which the Issuer is a party.

5.2. Representations and Warranties of the Investor: The Investor represents and warrants to the Issuer that:

(a) The Investor has the full power and authority to enter into this Agreement and to perform its obligations hereunder. This Agreement constitutes a valid and binding obligation of the Investor, enforceable against the Investor in accordance with its terms.

(b) The Investor is an "accredited investor" as defined in Rule 501(a) of Regulation D promulgated under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, and has such knowledge and experience in financial and business matters that it is capable of evaluating the merits and risks of the prospective investment and is able to bear the economic risk of such investment.

(c) The Investor is acquiring the Note (or SAFE) for its own account, for investment purposes only, and not with a view to or for sale in connection with any distribution thereof, nor with any present intention of distributing or selling the same.

6. Covenants

During the period commencing on the [Effective Date] and continuing until the conversion, repayment, or termination in full of this Note, [Issuer] hereby covenants and agrees with [Investor] as follows:

(a) Affirmative Covenants. [Issuer] shall (i) maintain its corporate existence, good standing, and all material licenses and permits necessary for the conduct of its business in all jurisdictions where its failure to do so would have a material adverse effect; (ii) comply in all material respects with all applicable laws, rules, and regulations; (iii) keep proper books and records in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles consistently applied, and furnish to [Investor] annual financial statements (audited, if available) within [Number] days after the end of each fiscal year, and unaudited quarterly financial statements within [Number] days after the end of each fiscal quarter; and (iv) use the proceeds from the issuance of this Note solely for general corporate purposes consistent with its business plan and not for any purpose prohibited by law or this Note.

(b) Negative Covenants. [Issuer] shall not, without the prior written consent of the holders of a majority in aggregate principal amount of the outstanding Notes (or, if applicable, a majority of the outstanding SAFE agreements by value), directly or indirectly: (i) declare or pay any dividends or make any distributions on its capital stock; (ii) incur any indebtedness for borrowed money other than permitted indebtedness as defined herein or in any other financing agreement; (iii) amend its certificate of incorporation, bylaws, or other organizational documents in a manner that adversely affects the rights or preferences of the Note; (iv) sell, lease, or otherwise dispose of all or substantially all of its assets outside the ordinary course of business; (v) merge or consolidate with any other entity, or engage in any reorganization, unless the surviving entity assumes all obligations under the Note; or (vi) create, incur, assume, or suffer to exist any lien upon any of its property or assets, whether now owned or hereafter acquired, except for Permitted Liens as defined herein.

7. Confidentiality

Each party hereto acknowledges that in connection with the negotiation, execution, and performance of this Convertible Note, it may have access to or acquire confidential or proprietary information concerning the business, operations, and financial affairs of the other party. The [Issuer] and the [Investor] (each, a “Receiving Party” when receiving information, and a “Disclosing Party” when disclosing information) agree to keep confidential and not to disclose or use for any purpose other than the performance of their respective obligations under this Convertible Note, any such confidential information, including but not limited to, financial data, business plans, intellectual property, customer lists, and technical information of the Disclosing Party. This obligation of confidentiality shall not apply to information that (a) is or becomes generally available to the public other than as a result of a disclosure by the Receiving Party; (b) was available to the Receiving Party on a non-confidential basis prior to its disclosure by the Disclosing Party; (c) becomes available to the Receiving Party on a non-confidential basis from a source other than the Disclosing Party, provided that such source is not, to the best of the Receiving Party’s knowledge, bound by a confidentiality agreement with the Disclosing Party; or (d) is required to be disclosed by law, regulation, or court order, provided that the Receiving Party provides prompt notice to the Disclosing Party to enable it to seek a protective order or other appropriate remedy. The obligations under this Section 7 shall survive the repayment or conversion of this Convertible Note for a period of [X] years from the [Effective Date].

8. Intellectual Property

The Company represents and warrants to the Investor that it owns or possesses valid licenses or other rights to use all Intellectual Property (including, without limitation, patents, patent applications, trademarks, trademark applications, service marks, copyrights, trade secrets, know-how, and confidential information) that is necessary for the conduct of its business as currently conducted and as proposed to be conducted. All such Intellectual Property is free and clear of any liens, claims, charges, security interests, encumbrances, or other restrictions, except for those of a de minimis nature or as otherwise disclosed in writing to the Investor prior to the Effective Date.

Furthermore, the Company represents and warrants that it is not infringing, misappropriating, or otherwise violating the Intellectual Property rights of any third party. To the best of the Company's knowledge, no third party is infringing, misappropriating, or otherwise violating any Intellectual Property rights owned by the Company. The Company has taken all commercially reasonable steps to protect its proprietary Intellectual Property, including maintaining the confidentiality of its trade secrets and confidential information, and all necessary assignments from employees and contractors of Intellectual Property developed within the scope of their engagement with the Company have been duly executed and are in full force and effect.

9. Indemnification

The Issuer, [Startup Name], shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless the Holder, [Investor Name], and its affiliates, officers, directors, employees, agents, successors, and assigns (collectively, "Indemnified Parties") from and against any and all losses, damages, liabilities, deficiencies, claims, actions, judgments, settlements, interest, awards, penalties, fines, costs, or expenses of whatever kind, including reasonable attorneys' fees, the cost of enforcing any right to indemnification hereunder, and the cost of pursuing any insurance providers, arising out of or resulting from any breach by the Issuer of any representation, warranty, covenant, or agreement contained in this Convertible Note Agreement, any gross negligence or willful misconduct of the Issuer, or any action or proceeding brought by a third party against an Indemnified Party related to the Issuer's business operations or the issuance of this Note. This indemnification obligation shall survive the repayment, conversion, or termination of this Convertible Note and shall be in addition to any other rights or remedies that the Indemnified Parties may have at law or in equity.

10. Limitation of Liability

Except for obligations to repay the Principal Amount and any accrued interest (if applicable) as explicitly set forth in this Convertible Note, neither the Issuer nor the Holder shall be liable to the other party for any indirect, incidental, consequential, special, exemplary, or punitive damages, including, but not limited to, loss of profits, revenue, data, or business interruption, arising out of or relating to this Convertible Note, regardless of the form of action, whether in contract, tort (including negligence), strict liability, or otherwise, even if such party has been advised of the possibility of such damages. This limitation of liability shall apply to the fullest extent permitted by applicable law.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, nothing in this Section shall limit the Issuer's obligation to convert the Note or repay the Principal Amount and any accrued interest (if applicable) as set forth in this Convertible Note, nor shall it limit liability for damages arising from a party's gross negligence, fraud, or willful misconduct. The total aggregate liability of either party for any and all claims arising out of or in connection with this Convertible Note, other than the specific repayment or conversion obligations hereunder, shall not exceed the Principal Amount of this Convertible Note.

11. Events of Default (for Convertible Note)

The occurrence of any of the following events shall constitute an "Event of Default" under this Convertible Note:

(a) **Payment Default:** The [Maker] fails to pay any principal, accrued interest (if any), or other amounts due under this Convertible Note when such amounts become due and payable, whether at stated maturity, upon acceleration, or otherwise, and such failure continues for a period of [Number] business days after written notice thereof from the [Holder] to the [Maker].

(b) **Breach of Covenants:** The [Maker] breaches any material covenant, agreement, or obligation contained in this Convertible Note or any other agreement executed in connection herewith, and such breach, if curable, continues for a period of [Number] business days after written notice thereof from the [Holder] to the [Maker].

(c) **Insolvency Proceedings:** The [Maker] (i) commences a voluntary case under any applicable bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization, or other similar law, (ii) consents to the entry of an order for relief in an involuntary case under any such law, (iii) consents to the appointment of a receiver, trustee, assignee, liquidator, or similar official for itself or for any substantial part of its property, (iv) makes a general assignment for the benefit of creditors, or (v) generally is not paying its debts as they become due.

(d) **Involuntary Insolvency Proceedings:** An involuntary case is commenced against the [Maker] under any applicable bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization, or other similar law, or a receiver, trustee, assignee, liquidator, or similar official is appointed for the [Maker] or for any substantial part of its property, and such case or appointment is not dismissed or discharged within [Number] days.

(e) **Misrepresentation:** Any representation or warranty made by the [Maker] in this Convertible Note or any other agreement executed in connection herewith proves to have been materially incorrect or misleading in any respect when made.

(f) **Dissolution:** The [Maker] takes any action to dissolve or liquidate its business, or any order for its dissolution or liquidation is entered.

12. Termination

This Convertible Note (the "Note") shall terminate, and all obligations of the Company hereunder shall cease, upon the earliest to occur of the following events:

(a) **Conversion into Equity:** The automatic conversion of the outstanding principal amount of this Note, together with any accrued but unpaid interest thereon, into Equity Securities of the Company in accordance with the terms set forth in Section [X. Conversion] upon the closing of a Qualified Financing as defined herein. Upon such conversion, this Note shall be deemed cancelled and surrendered, and the Holder shall have no further rights or obligations hereunder, other than those rights associated with the Equity Securities received pursuant to such conversion.

(b) **Repayment in Full:** The full repayment of all outstanding principal and accrued interest under this Note to the Holder, whether at the Maturity Date as defined in Section [Y. Maturity], or upon an Acquisition Event as defined in Section [Z. Acquisition], or otherwise in accordance with the express terms of this Note. Upon such full repayment, this Note shall be deemed cancelled and surrendered, and the Company's obligations shall be fully discharged.

(c) **Dissolution Event:** The winding up or dissolution of the Company prior to the conversion or repayment of this Note, in which case the rights and obligations of the Holder and the Company shall be governed by the provisions of Section [W. Dissolution] regarding the distribution of assets and liabilities.

For clarity, this Note is not subject to early termination by the Company prior to the occurrence of one of the events described above, except as may be mutually agreed upon in writing by the Company and the Holder, and no such termination shall relieve the Company of its obligations to repay or convert the Note as specified herein.

13. Governing Law

This Convertible Note Agreement, and all matters arising out of or relating to this Agreement, including, without limitation, its validity, interpretation, construction, performance, and enforcement, shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the internal laws of the State of [Governing Jurisdiction], without giving effect to any choice or conflict of law provision or rule (whether of the State of [Governing Jurisdiction] or any other jurisdiction) that would cause the application of the laws of any jurisdiction other than those of the State of [Governing Jurisdiction].

The parties hereto irrevocably and unconditionally consent to the exclusive jurisdiction of the state and federal courts located in [GoverGoverning Jurisdiction] for any action, suit, or proceeding arising out of or relating to this Agreement, and agree not to commence any action, suit, or proceeding except in such courts. Each party hereby irrevocably waives any objection which it may now or hereafter have to the laying of venue of any such action, suit, or proceeding in any such court and further irrevocably waives any claim that any such action, suit, or proceeding brought in any such court has been brought in an inconvenient forum.

14. Dispute Resolution

Any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Convertible Note (or SAFE) Agreement, including without limitation the formation, interpretation, breach, termination, or validity thereof, shall first be subject to good faith negotiation between [Issuer Name] and the Holder(s) for a period of not less than thirty (30) days from the date one party provides written notice of the dispute to the other. If the dispute cannot be resolved through negotiation within such thirty (30) day period, then, except as otherwise provided herein, the dispute shall be submitted to and finally resolved by binding arbitration administered by [Arbitration Rules Provider, e.g., the American Arbitration Association ("AAA")] in accordance with its [Specific Arbitration Rules, e.g., Commercial Arbitration Rules] then in effect.

The arbitration shall be conducted by a single arbitrator appointed in accordance with the aforementioned rules. The seat of the arbitration shall be [Arbitration Location, e.g., San Francisco, California], and the language of the arbitration shall be English. The decision of the arbitrator shall be final and binding upon the parties, and judgment on the award rendered by the arbitrator may be entered in any court having jurisdiction thereof. The parties shall bear their own costs and attorneys' fees in connection with the arbitration, unless otherwise determined by the arbitrator.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, either party may seek injunctive or other equitable relief in any court of competent jurisdiction to prevent the actual or threatened infringement, misappropriation, or violation of its copyrights, trademarks, trade secrets, patents, or other intellectual property rights, or for other urgent matters where monetary damages would be an insufficient remedy. Such action shall not be deemed a waiver of the right to arbitrate any other dispute.

This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the internal laws of the State of [Governing Law State], without regard to its conflict of laws principles. The parties irrevocably submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the state and federal courts located in [Governing Law Jurisdiction, e.g., County of San Francisco, California] for any action seeking injunctive or other equitable relief as permitted above, or for the enforcement of any arbitration award.

15. Miscellaneous Provisions

This Agreement shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the internal laws of the State of [State of Governing Law], without regard to its conflict of laws principles. This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between the parties with respect to the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior agreements, understandings, and negotiations, both written and oral, between the parties with respect to the subject matter contained herein. No amendment, modification, or waiver of any provision of this Agreement shall be effective unless in writing and signed by all parties hereto. No waiver of any breach of any provision of this Agreement shall constitute a waiver of any prior, concurrent, or subsequent breach of the same or any other provision hereof, and no waiver shall be effective unless made in writing and signed by an authorized representative of the waiving party. This Agreement shall be binding upon and inure to the benefit of the parties hereto and their respective successors and permitted assigns. The Investor may not assign its rights or obligations under this Agreement without the prior written consent of the Company, which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld, conditioned, or delayed; provided, however, that the Investor may assign this Note to an affiliate without the Company's consent. The Company may not assign its rights or obligations under this Agreement without the prior written consent of the Investor. If any provision of this Agreement is held to be invalid, illegal, or unenforceable in any respect, such invalidity, illegality, or unenforceability shall not affect any other provision hereof, and the parties shall endeavor to replace the invalid, illegal, or unenforceable provision with a valid, legal, and enforceable provision that most closely approximates the economic effect of the invalid, illegal, or unenforceable provision.

16. Signatures

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties hereto have executed this Convertible Note Agreement, intending to be legally bound, as of the Effective Date first written above. Each signatory represents and warrants that they have the full power and authority to enter into this Agreement on behalf of the entity or individual for whom they are signing, and that their signature constitutes a binding obligation of that entity or individual. This Agreement may be executed in counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument. Facsimile or electronic signatures, including those transmitted via PDF or other electronic means, shall be deemed original signatures for all purposes hereunder.

api2.updated_html:
CONVERTIBLE PROMISSORY NOTE

 

This Convertible Promissory Note (this "Note") is issued by the undersigned Issuer to the undersigned Holder on the Effective Date set forth below. This Note is made in consideration of the mutual covenants and agreements contained herein and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged.

 

ISSUER:

[Startup Name], a [State] corporation

[Startup Address]

 

HOLDER:

[Investor Name]

[Investor Address]

 

EFFECTIVE DATE: [Date]

 

PRINCIPAL AMOUNT: The principal amount of this Note is [$X] (the "Principal Amount").

 

INTEREST RATE: This Note shall bear simple interest at the rate of [Y]% per annum, calculated on the basis of a 365-day year for the actual number of days elapsed. Interest shall commence accruing on the Effective Date and shall continue to accrue on the outstanding Principal Amount until the Note is paid in full or converted in accordance with its terms.

 

1. Definitions

As used in this Note, the following terms shall have the meanings set forth below:

"Conversion Event" means a Qualified Financing or a Change of Control, as defined herein, or the Maturity Date.

 

"Discount Rate" means [Z]%. This percentage shall be applied to the price per share of the Conversion Shares issued in a Qualified Financing, effectively allowing the Holder to convert at a reduced price compared to new investors in such financing. The application of this discount is intended to compensate the Holder for the early investment risk taken.

 

"Maturity Date" means [Date], or such earlier date as the Note becomes due and payable in accordance with its terms. Upon the Maturity Date, if the Note has not previously been converted or repaid, the outstanding Principal Amount and all accrued and unpaid interest shall become immediately due and payable, subject to the Issuer's option to convert as specified in Section 3.

 

"Qualified Financing" means the next bona fide equity financing round of the Issuer in which the Issuer issues and sells its equity securities for aggregate gross proceeds of at least [$B] (excluding the conversion of this Note and other convertible securities) to one or more third-party investors. This threshold ensures that the financing event is substantial enough to warrant a conversion of the Note into equity, reflecting a significant valuation milestone for the Issuer.

 

"Valuation Cap" means [$A]. This cap sets a maximum pre-money valuation at which the Note will convert into equity in a Qualified Financing, regardless of the actual valuation achieved in that financing. The Valuation Cap provides the Holder with downside protection and ensures a minimum ownership percentage in the event of a highly successful financing round at a much higher valuation.

 

2. Payment Terms

The Principal Amount and all accrued and unpaid interest shall be due and payable upon the earliest of (a) the Maturity Date, (b) the occurrence of a Qualified Financing, or (c) a Change of Control, unless earlier converted or repaid as provided herein. All payments hereunder shall be made in lawful money of the United States of America.

The Issuer acknowledges its primary obligation to repay this Note in full, including all accrued interest, unless a conversion event occurs. The Holder is not obligated to accept any form of payment other than cash unless explicitly agreed upon in writing or mandated by a conversion event as detailed in this Note. This ensures clarity on the Issuer's financial commitment and the Holder's right to repayment.

 

3. Maturity

Unless earlier converted or repaid in accordance with the terms of this Note, the entire outstanding Principal Amount and all accrued and unpaid interest shall become due and payable on the Maturity Date. The Issuer shall provide written notice to the Holder at least thirty (30) days prior to the Maturity Date, informing the Holder of the impending maturity and the total amount due.

Upon the Maturity Date, the Issuer shall have the option, exercisable in its sole discretion, to convert the outstanding Principal Amount and all accrued and unpaid interest into shares of the Issuer’s common stock at a conversion price equal to the Valuation Cap divided by the fully diluted capitalization of the Issuer immediately prior to such conversion. This option provides the Issuer with flexibility in managing its financial obligations, potentially avoiding a cash repayment if a Qualified Financing has not occurred.

 

4. Conversion

4.1. Conversion Upon Qualified Financing

Upon the closing of a Qualified Financing, the entire outstanding Principal Amount and all accrued and unpaid interest under this Note shall automatically convert into shares of the same class and series of equity securities issued to investors in such Qualified Financing (the "Conversion Shares"). The conversion price per share shall be the lower of (a) the price per share paid by the new investors in the Qualified Financing multiplied by the Discount Rate, or (b) the price per share calculated by dividing the Valuation Cap by the Issuer’s fully diluted capitalization immediately prior to the Qualified Financing.

The Issuer shall provide the Holder with written notice of a Qualified Financing at least ten (10) business days prior to its anticipated closing, specifying the terms of the financing and the calculation of the conversion price. Upon conversion, the Holder shall be issued a certificate or equivalent electronic record representing the Conversion Shares, and this Note shall be deemed cancelled. No fractional shares shall be issued; any fractional shares shall be rounded down to the nearest whole share, and the Issuer shall pay the Holder cash for such fractional share based on the conversion price.

 

4.2. Conversion Upon Change of Control

In the event of a Change of Control prior to the conversion of this Note pursuant to a Qualified Financing or the Maturity Date, the Holder shall have the option, exercisable by written notice to the Issuer, to either (a) convert the outstanding Principal Amount and all accrued and unpaid interest into shares of common stock of the Issuer at a conversion price equal to the Valuation Cap divided by the fully diluted capitalization of the Issuer immediately prior to the Change of Control, or (b) require the Issuer to pay to the Holder, concurrently with the closing of such Change of Control, an amount equal to [1.5x to 2x] times the outstanding Principal Amount plus all accrued and unpaid interest.

A "Change of Control" shall mean (i) a consolidation or merger of the Issuer with or into any other corporation or entity, or (ii) any transaction or series of related transactions in which the Issuer’s stockholders immediately prior to such transaction own less than fifty percent (50%) of the voting power of the surviving entity immediately after such transaction, or (iii) the sale, lease, transfer, exclusive license or other disposition of all or substantially all of the assets of the Issuer. The Issuer shall provide prompt written notice to the Holder of any proposed Change of Control, including all material terms thereof, allowing the Holder sufficient time to exercise its option.

 

5. Representations and Warranties of Issuer

The Issuer hereby represents and warrants to the Holder that: (a) the Issuer is a corporation duly organized, validly existing, and in good standing under the laws of the State of [State], and has all requisite corporate power and authority to own its properties and to carry on its business as now conducted; (b) the execution, delivery, and performance of this Note have been duly authorized by all necessary corporate action on the part of the Issuer; and (c) this Note constitutes a valid and binding obligation of the Issuer, enforceable against the Issuer in accordance with its terms.

Furthermore, the Issuer represents that there are no outstanding agreements, options, warrants, or other rights or commitments obligating the Issuer to issue any capital stock or other equity interests, except as disclosed to the Holder in writing. The Issuer also warrants that it is not in violation of any applicable law, rule, or regulation, and that there are no legal actions, suits, or proceedings pending or, to its knowledge, threatened against the Issuer that would materially adversely affect its ability to perform its obligations under this Note.

 

6. Covenants of Issuer

Until this Note is fully repaid or converted, the Issuer covenants and agrees to: (a) maintain its corporate existence in good standing and comply with all applicable laws and regulations; (b) provide the Holder with copies of its annual audited financial statements and quarterly unaudited financial statements within a reasonable time after their preparation; and (c) provide the Holder with reasonable access to its books and records upon reasonable notice during normal business hours, provided such access does not unreasonably interfere with the Issuer’s operations.

The Issuer further covenants that it shall not, without the prior written consent of the Holder, (i) incur any indebtedness for borrowed money ranking senior to or pari passu with this Note, (ii) declare or pay any dividends or make any distributions on its capital stock, or (iii) enter into any transaction that would constitute a Change of Control without providing the Holder the rights set forth in Section 4.2. These covenants are designed to protect the Holder's investment and ensure the Issuer's financial stability and transparency.

 

7. Events of Default

The occurrence of any of the following shall constitute an "Event of Default" under this Note: (a) the Issuer fails to pay any principal or interest when due under this Note and such failure continues for five (5) business days after written notice from the Holder; (b) the Issuer breaches any material covenant or agreement contained in this Note, and such breach is not cured within thirty (30) days after written notice from the Holder; (c) the Issuer makes an assignment for the benefit of creditors, or a receiver, trustee, or liquidator is appointed for the Issuer or any substantial part of its property; or (d) the Issuer files a petition in bankruptcy or is adjudicated insolvent or bankrupt.

Upon the occurrence of any Event of Default, the Holder, at its option, may declare the entire outstanding Principal Amount of this Note, together with all accrued and unpaid interest thereon, to be immediately due and payable without presentment, demand, protest, or further notice of any kind, all of which are hereby expressly waived by the Issuer. The Holder shall also have all other rights and remedies available at law or in equity, including the right to enforce this Note through legal proceedings. The Holder's failure to exercise any right or remedy upon an Event of Default shall not constitute a waiver of such right or remedy or any other right or remedy.

 

8. Miscellaneous

8.1. Governing Law

This Note shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the internal laws of the State of [State], without regard to its principles of conflicts of law. This choice of law ensures consistency and predictability in the interpretation and enforcement of the Note's terms, providing a clear legal framework for all parties involved.

The parties acknowledge and agree that the courts located in [County, State] shall have exclusive jurisdiction over any dispute arising out of or relating to this Note. By executing this Note, the Issuer and Holder irrevocably submit to the personal jurisdiction of such courts for the purpose of any such action or proceeding and waive any objection to the laying of venue in such courts.

 

8.2. Dispute Resolution

Any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Note, or the breach, termination, or validity thereof, shall be resolved by binding arbitration administered by [Arbitration Association, e.g., JAMS] in accordance with its then-current Commercial Arbitration Rules. The arbitration shall take place in [City, State], and the language of the arbitration shall be English.

The arbitration shall be conducted by a single arbitrator mutually agreed upon by the parties. If the parties cannot agree on an arbitrator within thirty (30) days of the request for arbitration, the arbitrator shall be appointed by [Arbitration Association]. The arbitrator's decision shall be final and binding upon the parties, and judgment on the award rendered by the arbitrator may be entered in any court having jurisdiction thereof. The prevailing party in any arbitration or litigation arising hereunder shall be entitled to recover its reasonable attorneys' fees and costs.

 

8.3. Assignment

Neither this Note nor any of the rights or obligations hereunder may be assigned or transferred by the Issuer without the prior written consent of the Holder. Any attempted assignment or transfer in violation of this provision shall be null and void and of no force or effect. This restriction is intended to ensure that the Issuer's obligations remain with the original entity and are not transferred to an unknown or financially unstable third party without the Holder's explicit approval.

The Holder may assign or transfer this Note, in whole or in part, to any person or entity, provided that the Holder provides prompt written notice of such assignment to the Issuer. Upon any such permitted assignment, the assignee shall succeed to all the rights and obligations of the Holder hereunder. This flexibility for the Holder allows for liquidity and transferability of the investment, which can be crucial for early-stage investors.

 

8.4. Notices

All notices, requests, consents, claims, demands, waivers, and other communications hereunder shall be in writing and shall be deemed to have been given (a) when delivered by hand (with written confirmation of receipt); (b) when received by the addressee if sent by a nationally recognized overnight courier (receipt requested); (c) on the date sent by email (with confirmation of transmission) if sent during normal business hours of the recipient, and on the next business day if sent after normal business hours of the recipient; or (d) on the third day after the date mailed, by certified or registered mail, return receipt requested, postage prepaid.

Notices must be sent to the respective parties at the addresses set forth at the beginning of this Note (or to such other address or email address as may be designated by a party from time to time in accordance with this Section). This detailed notice provision ensures that all formal communications are delivered and acknowledged effectively, minimizing disputes over whether a party received important information.

 

8.5. Entire Agreement

This Note constitutes the sole and entire agreement of the parties with respect to the subject matter contained herein, and supersedes all prior and contemporaneous understandings, agreements, representations, and warranties, both written and oral, with respect to such subject matter. This clause is critical for ensuring that all prior discussions or informal agreements are superseded by the formal, written terms of this Note, thereby preventing future disputes based on unwritten understandings.

No oral statements or representations made by any party shall be binding or enforceable unless expressly incorporated into this Note. The parties acknowledge that they have not relied on any statement, representation, or warranty other than those expressly set forth in this Note. This reinforces the principle that the written document is the complete and final expression of their agreement.

 

8.6. Amendments

This Note may only be amended, modified, or supplemented by an agreement in writing signed by both the Issuer and the Holder. No waiver of any provision of this Note shall be effective unless it is in writing and signed by the party against whom the waiver is asserted. A waiver of any default shall not be a waiver of any subsequent default.

The requirement for written amendments ensures that any changes to the terms of the Note are formally documented and agreed upon by all parties, preventing informal or disputed alterations. This also applies to waivers, ensuring that a party's forbearance in one instance does not prejudice its rights in future instances of non-compliance.

 

8.7. Severability

If any term or provision of this Note is invalid, illegal, or unenforceable in any jurisdiction, such invalidity, illegality, or unenforceability shall not affect any other term or provision of this Note or invalidate or render unenforceable such term or provision in any other jurisdiction. This clause ensures that the remainder of the Note remains in full force and effect even if a specific part is found to be legally problematic.

Upon such determination that any term or other provision is invalid, illegal, or unenforceable, the parties shall negotiate in good faith to modify this Note so as to effect the original intent of the parties as closely as possible in a mutually acceptable manner in order that the transactions contemplated hereby be consummated as originally contemplated to the greatest extent possible. This commitment to renegotiate demonstrates the parties' intent to uphold the spirit of the agreement despite unforeseen legal challenges.

 

8.8. Counterparts

This Note may be executed in counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which together shall be deemed to be one and the same agreement. A signed copy of this Note delivered by facsimile, email, or other means of electronic transmission shall be deemed to have the same legal effect as delivery of an original signed copy of this Note.

This provision facilitates the execution of the Note when parties are not in the same physical location, allowing for efficient and legally binding agreement through electronic means. It ensures that all separately signed copies collectively form a single, enforceable contract.

 

9. Signatures

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have executed this Convertible Promissory Note as of the Effective Date first written above.

ISSUER:

[Startup Name]

 

By:                                                                       

Name: [Authorized Signatory Name]

Title: [Authorized Signatory Title]

 

HOLDER:

[Investor Name]

 

By:                                                                       

Name: [Investor Signatory Name]

Title: [Investor Signatory Title, if applicable]
