query: Draft an IP Assignment Agreement transferring rights from an employee or contractor to the company for all work created during employment.

api1.updated_html:
INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY ASSIGNMENT AGREEMENT

This Intellectual Property Assignment Agreement (this "Agreement") is made and entered into as of [Effective Date] (the "Effective Date"), by and between [Company Name], a [State of Incorporation/Organization] corporation/entity, with its principal place of business located at [Company Address] ("Company"), and [Employee/Contractor Name], an individual residing at [Employee/Contractor Address] ("Assignor").

WHEREAS, Assignor has been, or is currently, employed by or engaged as an independent contractor for Company, and in connection therewith, has conceived, developed, reduced to practice, or otherwise created certain inventions, works of authorship, designs, and other intellectual property (collectively, "Work Product") during the course and scope of such employment or engagement;

WHEREAS, Company desires to acquire, and Assignor desires to assign, all rights, title, and interest in and to such Work Product, including all intellectual property rights therein, to Company, in accordance with the terms and conditions set forth herein;

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and agreements contained herein, and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the parties hereto agree as follows:

1. Definitions

For the purposes of this Intellectual Property Assignment Agreement (the "Agreement"), the following capitalized terms shall have the meanings ascribed to them below:

"Company" means [Company Name], a [State of Incorporation] corporation, with its principal place of business located at [Company Address], and its successors and assigns.

"Assignor" means [Assignor Name], an individual residing at [Assignor Address], or a legal entity with its principal place of business at [Assignor Address], who is either an employee or independent contractor of the Company, and their heirs, executors, administrators, and permitted assigns.

"Intellectual Property" or "IP" means any and all inventions, discoveries, designs, developments, improvements, trade secrets, know-how, works of authorship, copyrights, mask works, trademarks, service marks, trade names, domain names, patents, patent applications, and all other proprietary rights, whether or not patentable or registrable, and whether or not reduced to practice, and all applications, registrations, renewals, reissues, continuations, continuations-in-part, divisions, and extensions thereof, throughout the world.

"Assigned IP" means all Intellectual Property, including but not limited to "Work Product" (as defined below), that the Assignor conceived, developed, created, or reduced to practice, either solely or jointly with others, during the period of their employment or engagement with the Company, regardless of whether such IP was created during working hours or using Company resources, and which relates to the Company's actual or anticipated business, research, or development.

"Work Product" means all tangible and intangible results, deliverables, materials, and documentation, including but not limited to software, code, designs, specifications, reports, data, analyses, prototypes, models, drawings, and other works of authorship, generated by the Assignor in the course of performing services for the Company, or which relate to the Company's business.

"Effective Date" means the date first written above or [Effective Date], upon which this Agreement becomes legally binding and effective between the Company and the Assignor.

2. Effective Date and Parties

This Intellectual Property Assignment Agreement (the "Agreement") is entered into and effective as of [Effective Date] (the "Effective Date"), by and between [Assignor's Full Legal Name], an individual residing at [Assignor's Address] (hereinafter referred to as the "Assignor"), and [Assignee's Full Legal Name], a [State of Incorporation/Registration] corporation/limited liability company/entity, duly organized and existing under the laws of [State of Incorporation/Registration], with its principal place of business located at [Assignee's Address] (hereinafter referred to as the "Assignee"). The Assignor and Assignee may hereinafter be referred to individually as a "Party" and collectively as the "Parties." This Agreement legally binds the Parties from the Effective Date, governing the comprehensive assignment of intellectual property rights as detailed in the subsequent sections.

3. Assignment of Intellectual Property

[Assignor] (the "Assignor") hereby irrevocably and perpetually assigns, transfers, and conveys to [Company Name] (the "Company"), its successors and assigns, all worldwide right, title, and interest in and to any and all inventions, discoveries, improvements, designs, works of authorship, patents, patent applications, trademarks, trademark applications, copyrights, copyrightable works, trade secrets, know-how, moral rights (to the maximum extent assignable), and all other intellectual property rights (collectively, "Intellectual Property") that have been or are hereafter conceived, created, developed, reduced to practice, or otherwise made or acquired by the Assignor, either alone or jointly with others, during the period of the Assignor's employment or engagement with the Company, whether or not during working hours or using Company facilities, and which relate to the Company's actual or anticipated business, research, or development, or which result from or are suggested by any work performed by the Assignor for the Company. This assignment includes, without limitation, all rights to sue for past, present, and future infringements.

The Assignor further agrees that all such Intellectual Property shall be the sole and exclusive property of the Company, and the Assignor shall have no rights, title, or interest therein. The Assignor acknowledges that this assignment is made for good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, including but not limited to the Assignor's employment or engagement with the Company and the compensation received or to be received therefrom.

4. Consideration

In consideration of [Employee/Contractor Name]'s employment or engagement as a contractor by [Company Name], including the salary, wages, benefits, access to confidential information, company resources, and other valuable compensation received or to be received by [Employee/Contractor Name] from [Company Name] during the period of employment or engagement, the sufficiency of which is hereby acknowledged by [Employee/Contractor Name], and in further consideration of the mutual covenants and promises contained herein, [Employee/Contractor Name] agrees to the assignment of all Intellectual Property (as defined herein) created, conceived, reduced to practice, or developed by [Employee/Contractor Name] within the scope of their employment or engagement with [Company Name]. This consideration is deemed full, adequate, and complete for the assignment of all rights, title, and interest in and to such Intellectual Property to [Company Name] as set forth in this Agreement, effective as of [Effective Date]. For the avoidance of doubt, this Agreement does not create any additional compensation obligations beyond those already established or agreed upon in [Employee/Contractor Name]'s employment agreement or contractor agreement with [Company Name], unless explicitly stated otherwise in a separate, written agreement executed by both parties subsequent to the date hereof.

5. Confidentiality

The [Assignor] acknowledges that in the course of their engagement with the [Company], they have had and will continue to have access to confidential and proprietary information belonging to the [Company], including but not limited to trade secrets, business plans, financial data, customer lists, technical data, product designs, software code, marketing strategies, and any information related to the development, research, or commercialization of the Assigned IP (collectively, "Confidential Information").

The [Assignor] agrees to maintain the strictest confidence regarding all Confidential Information, both during and after the term of their engagement with the [Company]. The [Assignor] shall not, directly or indirectly, disclose, disseminate, publish, or use any Confidential Information for any purpose other than for the sole benefit of the [Company] in the performance of their duties, nor shall they permit any third party to do so.

This confidentiality obligation shall not apply to information that: (a) is or becomes publicly available through no fault of the [Assignor]; (b) was rightfully in the [Assignor]'s possession prior to disclosure by the [Company]; (c) is independently developed by the [Assignor] without use of or reference to the [Company]'s Confidential Information; or (d) is required to be disclosed by law, provided that the [Assignor] gives prompt written notice to the [Company] of such requirement and cooperates with the [Company] in any effort to obtain a protective order or other appropriate remedy.

Upon termination of the [Assignor]'s engagement with the [Company] for any reason, or at any time upon the [Company]'s request, the [Assignor] shall immediately return to the [Company] all documents, records, data, notes, prototypes, equipment, and any other tangible or intangible property, including all copies thereof, containing or embodying Confidential Information or Assigned IP.

6. Representations and Warranties

[Assignor Name] hereby represents and warrants to [Company Name] as follows:

(a) Sole Ownership and Originality. [Assignor Name] is the sole and exclusive owner of all right, title, and interest in and to the Intellectual Property (as defined herein, including all Assigned IP), and all such Intellectual Property is original to [Assignor Name] and was created solely by [Assignor Name] during the course of [his/her/their] employment or engagement with [Company Name].

(b) No Encumbrances or Infringement. The Intellectual Property is free and clear of any liens, encumbrances, security interests, or other third-party claims or rights. The use, development, and exploitation of the Intellectual Property by [Company Name] as contemplated by this Agreement will not infringe upon or misappropriate the intellectual property rights or any other proprietary rights of any third party.

(c) Right to Assign. [Assignor Name] has the full power and authority to enter into this Agreement and to assign all rights, title, and interest in and to the Intellectual Property to [Company Name] as provided herein, without the consent of any other person or entity.

(d) No Prior Assignments. [Assignor Name] has not previously assigned, transferred, licensed, or otherwise encumbered any rights in the Intellectual Property to any third party, nor is [Assignor Name] under any obligation or restriction that would prevent or limit the full assignment of the Intellectual Property to [Company Name] as contemplated by this Agreement.

(e) No Conflicting Agreements. [Assignor Name] is not a party to any agreement, contract, or understanding that would conflict with or be violated by the terms of this Agreement or the assignment of the Intellectual Property contemplated herein.

(f) Full Disclosure. [Assignor Name] has disclosed to [Company Name] all information known to [Assignor Name] regarding the Intellectual Property that is material to [Company Name]'s ownership or use of the Intellectual Property.

7. Indemnification

[Assignor] shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless [Assignee], its affiliates, directors, officers, employees, agents, successors, and assigns from and against any and all claims, demands, liabilities, losses, damages, costs, and expenses (including, without limitation, reasonable attorneys' fees and costs of litigation) arising out of or in connection with: (a) any breach by [Assignor] of any representation, warranty, or covenant contained in this [Agreement]; (b) any claim that the [Assigned IP Rights], as created by [Assignor] and assigned hereunder, infringe, misappropriate, or otherwise violate any intellectual property rights or other proprietary rights of any third party existing prior to or at the time of assignment; or (c) any claim that [Assignor] did not have the full right, power, and authority to assign the [Assigned IP Rights] to [Assignee] as contemplated herein. [Assignee] shall provide [Assignor] with prompt written notice of any such claim and shall cooperate with [Assignor], at [Assignor]'s expense, in the defense of such claim. [Assignor] shall have sole control over the defense and settlement of any such claim, provided that [Assignor] shall not settle any claim in a manner that imposes any obligation or liability on [Assignee] without [Assignee]'s prior written consent. This indemnification obligation shall not apply to any claim arising from modifications made by [Assignee] to the [Assigned IP Rights] or from the use of the [Assigned IP Rights] by [Assignee] in a manner not contemplated by this [Agreement] or applicable law.

8. Governing Law

This Intellectual Property Assignment Agreement and any disputes or claims arising out of or in connection with it or its subject matter or formation (including non-contractual disputes or claims) shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the internal laws of the State of [Governing Law State], United States of America, without giving effect to any choice or conflict of law provision or rule (whether of the State of [Governing Law State] or any other jurisdiction) that would cause the application of the laws of any jurisdiction other than those of the State of [Governing Law State]. The Parties irrevocably agree that the federal and state courts located in [Governing Jurisdiction] shall have exclusive jurisdiction to settle any dispute or claim that arises out of or in connection with this Agreement or its subject matter or formation (including non-contractual disputes or claims), and each Party hereby irrevocably submits to the exclusive jurisdiction of such courts in any such suit, action, or proceeding. This choice of law and jurisdiction is intended to be a comprehensive and exclusive selection of the governing law and forum for any and all disputes arising from or relating to this Agreement, including but not limited to, matters concerning the validity, interpretation, performance, or breach of this Agreement, and any intellectual property rights transferred hereunder.

9. Dispute Resolution

Any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement, or the breach, termination, or invalidity thereof, shall first be attempted to be resolved through good-faith negotiation between [Party A] and [Party B]. If the Parties are unable to resolve the dispute within thirty (30) days of the first written notice of the dispute, then the dispute shall be submitted to binding arbitration. The arbitration shall be conducted in accordance with the [Arbitration Rules, e.g., Commercial Arbitration Rules of the American Arbitration Association] of the [Arbitration Body] by a single arbitrator mutually agreed upon by the Parties, or failing agreement within ten (10) days, appointed by the [Arbitration Body]. The seat of arbitration shall be [Arbitration Location], and the language of the arbitration shall be English. The award rendered by the arbitrator shall be final and binding upon both Parties, and judgment thereon may be entered in any court having jurisdiction thereof. The costs of the arbitration, including the arbitrator's fees, shall be borne equally by the Parties, unless the arbitrator determines otherwise. Notwithstanding the foregoing, nothing in this Section shall prevent either Party from seeking injunctive or other equitable relief in a court of competent jurisdiction located in [Governing Law State], [Governing Law Country] to prevent the actual or threatened infringement, misappropriation, or violation of its intellectual property rights or to enforce the terms of this Agreement where monetary damages would be an inadequate remedy.
api1.summary: The IP Assignment Agreement has been successfully drafted, transferring all intellectual property rights from the employee or contractor to the company for any work created during their employment.

api2.updated_html:
INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY ASSIGNMENT AGREEMENT

This Intellectual Property Assignment Agreement (this "Agreement") is made and entered into as of this [Day] day of [Month], [Year] (the "Effective Date"),

BY AND BETWEEN:

[Assignor Name], an individual residing at [Assignor Address] ("Assignor").

AND:

[Assignee Company Name], a [State of Incorporation] corporation with its principal place of business at [Assignee Company Address] ("Assignee").

RECITALS

WHEREAS, Assignor has been engaged by Assignee as an [employee/independent contractor] (the "Engagement") to perform services, develop products, or create materials related to Assignee's business operations and objectives. During the course of this Engagement, Assignor has developed, conceived, or reduced to practice certain intellectual property, including but not limited to inventions, works of authorship, and proprietary information, which are directly related to the scope of the Engagement and Assignee's business.

WHEREAS, it is a fundamental condition of the Engagement that all intellectual property created or developed by Assignor in the course of or arising out of the Engagement shall be the sole and exclusive property of Assignee. Assignor desires to irrevocably assign, and Assignee desires to irrevocably accept, all rights, title, and interest in and to such intellectual property, including all associated proprietary rights, to Assignee as set forth herein, in consideration of the mutual covenants and agreements contained in this Agreement and the compensation or other benefits provided under the Engagement.

1. DEFINITIONS

1.1. "Intellectual Property" or "IP" means any and all inventions, discoveries, designs, methods, processes, formulae, works of authorship, software, algorithms, data, databases, mask works, trademarks, trade names, service marks, trade dress, logos, slogans, trade secrets, know-how, confidential information, moral rights, and all other intellectual property rights, whether or not patentable or registrable, and whether existing now or hereafter arising, including all applications, registrations, renewals, extensions, continuations, divisions, reissues, and re-examinations thereof, throughout the world.

This definition explicitly includes all rights of publicity, personality rights, and any similar rights, and all physical embodiments thereof, relating to or arising from the Work Product. It is understood that "Intellectual Property" encompasses all forms of intangible assets that are legally protectable and are created, conceived, or reduced to practice by Assignor in connection with the Engagement, regardless of whether such creation occurred during working hours or using Assignee's equipment, unless specifically excluded by applicable law.

1.2. "Work Product" means any and all Intellectual Property, materials, documents, discoveries, inventions, improvements, designs, works of authorship, computer programs, processes, methods, data, analyses, reports, specifications, and other deliverables or creations, whether patentable or unpatentable, copyrightable or uncopyrightable, that are made, conceived, reduced to practice, or developed by Assignor, either individually or jointly with others, during the term of the Engagement and that (a) relate to Assignee's actual or anticipated business, research, or development; (b) result from any work performed by Assignor for Assignee; or (c) are developed using Assignee's equipment, supplies, facilities, or confidential information.

The term "Work Product" is to be interpreted broadly to ensure that Assignee obtains full ownership of all intellectual output generated by Assignor in the context of their relationship, including any modifications, enhancements, or derivative works based on Assignee's existing Intellectual Property or arising directly from Assignor's assigned duties. This includes all forms of tangible or intangible expression, regardless of the medium in which they are recorded or stored.

2. ASSIGNMENT OF INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY

Assignor hereby irrevocably and absolutely assigns, transfers, and conveys to Assignee, and its successors and assigns, all of Assignor's worldwide right, title, and interest in and to all Work Product, including all Intellectual Property rights therein, whether now existing or hereafter created, without further consideration, effective immediately upon the creation or conception of such Work Product. This assignment is perpetual and extends to all territories and jurisdictions globally, ensuring Assignee's complete and unencumbered ownership of the Work Product and all associated rights.

This assignment includes, but is not limited to, all copyrights, patent rights, trade secret rights, trademark rights, and all other proprietary rights of any kind or nature whatsoever, including all moral rights to the maximum extent permitted by law. To the extent that any moral rights cannot be assigned under applicable law, Assignor hereby waives and agrees never to assert such moral rights against Assignee or its successors, licensees, or assigns. Assignee shall be the sole and exclusive owner of all Work Product and shall have the exclusive right to obtain, hold, and renew, in its own name, all patents, copyrights, registrations, and other protections and proprietary rights that may be available for the Work Product.

3. FURTHER ASSURANCES

Assignor agrees to execute and deliver any and all documents, including applications for patents, copyrights, or other intellectual property registrations, and to take any other actions that Assignee may reasonably request, at Assignee's expense, to perfect, register, confirm, or defend Assignee's sole and exclusive right, title, and interest in and to the Work Product and the Intellectual Property assigned hereunder. This obligation includes, but is not limited to, providing testimony in any legal proceeding, assisting in the prosecution of any intellectual property applications, and signing all necessary assignments or other instruments.

Assignor's obligations under this Section 3 shall survive the termination or expiration of the Engagement and this Agreement for any reason whatsoever. Should Assignee be unable to secure Assignor's signature on any document necessary to apply for, prosecute, obtain, or enforce any patent, copyright, or other intellectual property right relating to the Work Product for any reason whatsoever, Assignor hereby irrevocably designates and appoints Assignee and its duly authorized officers and agents as Assignor's agent and attorney-in-fact, to act for and on Assignor's behalf to execute and file any such document and to do all other lawfully permitted acts to further the prosecution, issuance, and enforcement of such intellectual property rights with the same legal force and effect as if executed by Assignor.

4. CONFIDENTIALITY

Assignor acknowledges that during the Engagement, Assignor may have access to and become acquainted with confidential and proprietary information belonging to Assignee, including but not limited to trade secrets, business plans, financial data, customer lists, technical data, product designs, marketing strategies, and other non-public information (collectively, "Confidential Information"). Assignor agrees to keep all Confidential Information strictly confidential and not to disclose, use, or exploit such information for any purpose other than for the benefit of Assignee during the Engagement, or as required by law.

Assignor further agrees that the obligation of confidentiality shall survive the termination of the Engagement and this Agreement indefinitely. Assignor shall not, directly or indirectly, disclose, publish, or disseminate any Confidential Information to any third party without the prior written consent of Assignee. This obligation does not apply to information that (a) is or becomes publicly available through no fault of Assignor; (b) was known to Assignor prior to the Engagement without restriction; or (c) is required to be disclosed by law, provided Assignor gives Assignee prompt written notice of such requirement and cooperates with Assignee in seeking a protective order or other appropriate remedy.

5. REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES

Assignor represents and warrants to Assignee that: (a) Assignor is the sole author and creator of the Work Product and has not assigned, transferred, or encumbered any rights in the Work Product to any third party prior to the Effective Date; (b) Assignor has the full right, power, and authority to enter into this Agreement and to assign the Work Product and Intellectual Property rights hereunder without the consent of any other person or entity; (c) the Work Product is original and does not infringe upon, misappropriate, or violate any patent, copyright, trademark, trade secret, or other proprietary rights of any third party; and (d) Assignor has not incorporated into the Work Product any materials from any third party without the express written consent of Assignee and the third party, or any materials that would require Assignee to license or make public any of its Intellectual Property.

Assignor further represents and warrants that there are no existing or threatened claims, demands, or litigation that would in any way impair Assignee's full enjoyment of the rights assigned hereunder. Assignor has not entered into any agreements, whether written or oral, that would conflict with the provisions of this Agreement or that would prevent Assignor from performing its obligations hereunder. Assignor will promptly notify Assignee if Assignor becomes aware of any actual or potential claim or infringement related to the Work Product or the rights assigned herein.

6. INDEMNIFICATION

Assignor agrees to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Assignee, its officers, directors, employees, agents, successors, and assigns from and against any and all claims, liabilities, damages, losses, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees) arising out of or in connection with: (a) any breach by Assignor of any representation, warranty, or covenant contained in this Agreement; (b) any claim that the Work Product or Assignee's use thereof infringes upon, misappropriates, or violates the intellectual property or proprietary rights of any third party, to the extent such infringement, misappropriation, or violation arises from Assignor's actions or omissions; or (c) any claim arising from Assignor's gross negligence or willful misconduct in the performance of the Engagement.

Assignee shall provide Assignor with prompt written notice of any claim for which indemnification is sought. Assignor shall have the right to assume the defense of any such claim with counsel of its own choosing, subject to Assignee's reasonable approval, provided that Assignor acknowledges its obligation to indemnify Assignee. Assignee shall cooperate fully with Assignor in the defense of any such claim, at Assignor's expense. Assignor shall not settle any claim without Assignee's prior written consent, which shall not be unreasonably withheld, conditioned, or delayed, if such settlement would impose any obligation or liability on Assignee or prejudice Assignee's rights.

7. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY

IN NO EVENT SHALL ASSIGNEE BE LIABLE TO ASSIGNOR FOR ANY INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, CONSEQUENTIAL, PUNITIVE, OR EXEMPLARY DAMAGES, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO, DAMAGES FOR LOSS OF PROFITS, GOODWILL, USE, DATA, OR OTHER INTANGIBLE LOSSES (EVEN IF ASSIGNEE HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES), ARISING OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THIS AGREEMENT OR THE ENGAGEMENT, WHETHER BASED ON CONTRACT, TORT, NEGLIGENCE, STRICT LIABILITY, OR OTHERWISE.

NOTWITHSTANDING ANYTHING TO THE CONTRARY CONTAINED HEREIN, ASSIGNEE'S TOTAL CUMULATIVE LIABILITY TO ASSIGNOR FOR ANY AND ALL CLAIMS ARISING OUT OF OR RELATING TO THIS AGREEMENT SHALL NOT EXCEED THE TOTAL COMPENSATION PAID BY ASSIGNEE TO ASSIGNOR UNDER THE ENGAGEMENT DURING THE TWELVE (12) MONTHS IMMEDIATELY PRECEDING THE EVENT GIVING RISE TO THE CLAIM. THIS LIMITATION OF LIABILITY IS INTENDED TO APPLY WITHOUT REGARD TO WHETHER OTHER PROVISIONS OF THIS AGREEMENT HAVE BEEN BREACHED OR HAVE PROVEN INEFFECTIVE.

8. GOVERNING LAW

This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the internal laws of the State of [State of Governing Law], without regard to its conflict of laws principles. The parties expressly agree that the United Nations Convention on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods shall not apply to this Agreement.

The parties acknowledge that this choice of law is a material term of this Agreement and that the laws of the chosen jurisdiction are sufficient to protect the rights and obligations of both parties. Any legal action or proceeding arising under this Agreement shall be brought exclusively in the federal or state courts located in [County, State of Governing Law], and the parties hereby irrevocably consent to the personal jurisdiction and venue of such courts.

9. DISPUTE RESOLUTION

Any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement, including the breach, termination, or validity thereof, shall first be subject to good faith negotiations between the parties for a period of at least thirty (30) days from the date one party notifies the other of a dispute. If the dispute cannot be resolved through negotiation, the parties agree to submit the dispute to binding arbitration administered by the American Arbitration Association ("AAA") in accordance with its Commercial Arbitration Rules, and judgment on the award rendered by the arbitrator(s) may be entered in any court having jurisdiction thereof.

The arbitration shall be conducted by a single arbitrator appointed in accordance with the AAA rules, and the arbitration shall take place in [County, State of Governing Law]. The language of the arbitration shall be English. The arbitrator's decision shall be final and binding upon the parties, and the costs of the arbitration, including the arbitrator's fees and reasonable attorneys' fees of the prevailing party, shall be borne by the non-prevailing party as determined by the arbitrator. Nothing in this Section shall prevent either party from seeking injunctive relief in a court of competent jurisdiction to protect its Intellectual Property rights or Confidential Information.

10. MISCELLANEOUS PROVISIONS

10.1. Entire Agreement. This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between Assignor and Assignee with respect to the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior and contemporaneous agreements, understandings, negotiations, and discussions, whether oral or written, between the parties relating to such subject matter. There are no promises, conditions, understandings, inducements, representations, or warranties, express or implied, oral or written, other than those expressly set forth or referred to herein.

Assignor acknowledges that it has not relied upon any representation or statement made by Assignee or its representatives not set forth in this Agreement. Any terms or conditions in any purchase order, invoice, or other document issued by either party that are inconsistent with or in addition to the terms of this Agreement shall be null and void and of no force or effect.

10.2. Amendments. No amendment, modification, or waiver of any provision of this Agreement shall be effective unless it is in writing and signed by both Assignor and Assignee. No waiver of any breach of any provision of this Agreement shall constitute a waiver of any subsequent breach of the same or any other provision hereof.

The failure of either party to enforce any right or provision in this Agreement shall not constitute a waiver of such right or provision unless acknowledged and agreed to in writing by the party alleged to have waived the right or provision. Any waiver shall be effective only in the specific instance and for the specific purpose for which it was given.

10.3. Severability. If any provision of this Agreement is held to be invalid, illegal, or unenforceable by a court of competent jurisdiction, such provision shall be modified to the minimum extent necessary to make it valid, legal, and enforceable, or, if such modification is not possible, the provision shall be severed from this Agreement, and the remaining provisions shall remain in full force and effect. The invalidity or unenforceability of any provision shall not affect the validity or enforceability of any other provision of this Agreement.

The parties agree to negotiate in good faith to replace any invalid or unenforceable provision with a valid and enforceable provision that achieves, to the greatest extent possible, the original commercial intent of the invalid or unenforceable provision. 11. Termination

This Agreement may be terminated: (a) by either party upon written notice if the other party materially breaches any provision of this Agreement and fails to cure such breach within [NUMBER] days after receiving written notice thereof, provided such breach is curable; (b) by either party immediately upon written notice if the other party becomes insolvent, files for bankruptcy, makes an assignment for the benefit of creditors, or ceases to conduct business in the ordinary course; or (c) as otherwise provided in Section 4 (Term).

api2.summary: The Software License Agreement has been successfully drafted, detailing the non-exclusive license for the customer to use the proprietary software, along with specified usage limits and restrictions.

query: Draft a GDPR-compliant Data Processing Agreement between a data controller and processor, covering data handling, breach notification, and subprocessors.

api1.updated_html:
DATA PROCESSING AGREEMENT

This Data Processing Agreement ("Agreement") is entered into and effective as of [Effective Date] (the "Effective Date"), by and between:

[Data Controller Legal Name], a [Type of Entity, e.g., corporation, limited liability company] organized and existing under the laws of [Jurisdiction of Data Controller], with its principal place of business at [Address of Data Controller] ("Controller"); and

[Data Processor Legal Name], a [Type of Entity, e.g., corporation, limited liability company] organized and existing under the laws of [Jurisdiction of Data Processor], with its principal place of business at [Address of Data Processor] ("Processor").

WHEREAS, Controller and Processor have entered into a [Main Agreement Name, e.g., Services Agreement, Master Services Agreement] dated [Date of Main Agreement] (the "Main Agreement"), pursuant to which Processor provides certain services to Controller;

WHEREAS, in the course of providing the services under the Main Agreement, Processor may process personal data on behalf of Controller, and the parties intend for this Agreement to govern such processing in compliance with the requirements of applicable data protection laws, including but not limited to Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation, "GDPR");

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants contained herein, and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the parties agree as follows:

1. Definitions

For the purposes of this Data Processing Agreement (the "Agreement"), the following terms shall have the meanings set forth below:

"Agreement" means this Data Processing Agreement, including all appendices and schedules attached hereto, which forms an integral part of the principal agreement between [Party A] (the "Controller") and [Party B] (the "Processor") for the provision of services, effective as of [Effective Date].

"Controller" means the natural or legal person, public authority, agency, or other body which, alone or jointly with others, determines the purposes and means of the processing of Personal Data, as defined in Article 4(7) of the GDPR. In this Agreement, the Controller is [Party A].

"Processor" means a natural or legal person, public authority, agency, or other body which processes Personal Data on behalf of the Controller, as defined in Article 4(8) of the GDPR. In this Agreement, the Processor is [Party B].

"Data Subject" means an identified or identifiable natural person to whom Personal Data relates, as defined in Article 4(1) of the GDPR. This includes, but is not limited to, customers, employees, or other individuals whose Personal Data is processed under this Agreement.

"Personal Data" means any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person ("Data Subject"), as defined in Article 4(1) of the GDPR. This includes, without limitation, names, identification numbers, location data, online identifiers, or one or more factors specific to the physical, physiological, genetic, mental, economic, cultural, or social identity of that natural person, which is processed by the Processor on behalf of the Controller pursuant to this Agreement.

"Processing" means any operation or set of operations which is performed on Personal Data or on sets of Personal Data, whether or not by automated means, such as collection, recording, organisation, structuring, storage, adaptation or alteration, retrieval, consultation, use, disclosure by transmission, dissemination or otherwise making available, alignment or combination, restriction, erasure, or destruction, as defined in Article 4(2) of the GDPR.

"GDPR" means the General Data Protection Regulation (Regulation (EU) 2016/679) of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (Data Protection Directive).

"Personal Data Breach" means a breach of security leading to the accidental or unlawful destruction, loss, alteration, unauthorised disclosure of, or access to, Personal Data transmitted, stored, or otherwise processed, as defined in Article 4(12) of the GDPR.

"Sub-processor" means any third party appointed by the Processor, or by another Sub-processor of the Processor, to process Personal Data on behalf of the Controller in connection with this Agreement.

2. Term and Termination

This Data Processing Agreement shall commence on the [Effective Date] and remain in full force and effect for the duration of the underlying service agreement (the "Main Agreement") between [Controller] and [Processor], or until such time as [Processor] no longer processes Personal Data on behalf of [Controller], whichever is later. This Agreement shall automatically terminate upon the termination or expiration of the Main Agreement, or earlier if mutually agreed upon by both parties in writing, provided that all obligations related to the processing of Personal Data have been fulfilled.

Notwithstanding any termination, the provisions relating to data protection, confidentiality, and the obligations concerning the return or deletion of Personal Data shall survive the termination of this Agreement for as long as required by applicable law or until all such data has been securely deleted or returned in accordance with the terms herein. Upon termination of this Agreement for any reason, or upon [Controller]'s written request, [Processor] shall, at [Controller]'s option, either delete or return to [Controller] all Personal Data processed on behalf of [Controller], including all copies thereof, unless applicable law requires storage of the Personal Data.

[Processor] shall, within a reasonable timeframe (not exceeding ninety (90) days) following such request or termination, provide written certification to [Controller] that all Personal Data has been deleted or returned as required by this Section. The costs associated with the return or deletion of Personal Data shall be borne by [Processor], unless otherwise specified in the Main Agreement or mutually agreed upon in writing.

3. Confidentiality

The Processor undertakes to keep confidential all Personal Data, as defined in Article 4(1) of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), processed on behalf of the Controller, and all information related to the Controller's business operations, systems, and security measures that the Processor may access or become aware of during the performance of the Services under the Main Agreement and this Data Processing Agreement (DPA). This obligation extends to the terms and conditions of this DPA itself.

The Processor shall ensure that all persons authorized to process the Personal Data, including but not limited to its employees, agents, and subprocessors, have committed themselves to confidentiality or are under an appropriate statutory obligation of confidentiality. The Processor shall provide adequate training to its personnel regarding their obligations to protect Personal Data and maintain confidentiality, and shall implement internal policies and procedures to enforce these obligations.

The Processor shall not disclose or permit the disclosure of any Personal Data to any third party, nor use any Personal Data for any purpose other than for the performance of the Services as explicitly instructed by the Controller, unless expressly required by applicable law. In such a case, the Processor shall, to the extent legally permissible, inform the Controller of that legal requirement before processing, unless the law prohibits such information on important grounds of public interest.

The confidentiality obligations set forth in this Section 3 shall survive the termination or expiration of this DPA and the Main Agreement for as long as the Personal Data remains in the Processor's possession or control, or otherwise remains confidential in nature.

4. Warranties

Each Party warrants to the other that it has the full power and authority to enter into and perform its obligations under this Agreement. The [Data Processor] warrants that it shall process Personal Data strictly in accordance with the terms of this Agreement, the documented instructions of the [Data Controller], and all applicable data protection laws, including the General Data Protection Regulation (EU) 2016/679 ("GDPR"). The [Data Processor] further warrants that it has implemented and will maintain appropriate technical and organizational measures to ensure a level of security appropriate to the risk of the processing, taking into account the state of the art, the costs of implementation, and the nature, scope, context, and purposes of processing as well as the risk of varying likelihood and severity for the rights and freedoms of natural persons. The [Data Controller] warrants that it has all necessary rights, consents, and lawful bases to enable the [Data Processor] to lawfully process the Personal Data in accordance with this Agreement for the purposes contemplated herein, and that its instructions to the [Data Processor] comply with all applicable laws, including the GDPR. Both Parties warrant that they will comply with all applicable laws and regulations in the performance of their respective obligations under this Agreement, effective as of [Effective Date].

5. Indemnification

Each Party (the "Indemnifying Party") shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless the other Party (the "Indemnified Party"), its affiliates, directors, officers, employees, and agents from and against any and all claims, losses, damages, liabilities, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees) arising out of or in connection with any breach by the Indemnifying Party of its obligations under this Data Processing Agreement, the General Data Protection Regulation (EU) 2016/679 ("GDPR"), or any other applicable data protection laws. Specifically, [Processor] shall indemnify [Controller] for claims arising from [Processor]'s failure to comply with its obligations herein, including but not limited to unauthorized processing, data breaches attributable to [Processor]'s negligence or willful misconduct, or non-compliance with [Controller]'s lawful instructions. Conversely, [Controller] shall indemnify [Processor] for claims arising from [Controller]'s failure to comply with its obligations herein, including but not limited to unlawful instructions provided to [Processor] or failure to ensure the legality of the initial collection and processing of Personal Data. The indemnification obligations are contingent upon the Indemnified Party providing prompt written notice of any claim and reasonable cooperation in the defense thereof.

6. Limitation of Liability

6.1. Subject to the provisions of Section 6.2, neither Party shall be liable to the other Party for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages, including but not limited to, loss of profits, loss of anticipated savings, loss of goodwill, or loss of data, arising out of or in connection with this Data Processing Agreement (the "DPA") or the services provided hereunder, regardless of the form of action, whether in contract, tort (including negligence), strict liability, or otherwise, even if such Party has been advised of the possibility of such damages.

6.2. The limitations set forth in Section 6.1 shall not apply to damages arising from a Party's gross negligence, willful misconduct, fraud, breach of confidentiality obligations, or any breach of its obligations under Articles 82 (Right to Compensation and Liability) or 83 (Administrative Fines) of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) that directly results in administrative fines or penalties imposed by a competent Supervisory Authority. For the avoidance of doubt, the monetary cap specified in Section 6.3 shall not apply to any fines or penalties imposed by a Supervisory Authority under the GDPR for which a Party is solely or jointly liable, where such liability arises directly from that Party's material breach of its obligations under this DPA or the GDPR.

6.3. Subject to Section 6.2, each Party's total aggregate liability under or in connection with this DPA, whether in contract, tort (including negligence), or otherwise, shall in no event exceed the greater of: (a) the total fees paid or payable by [Controller Name] to [Processor Name] under the Principal Agreement in the twelve (12) months immediately preceding the event giving rise to the claim; or (b) [Specific Monetary Cap Amount, e.g., EUR 1,000,000].

6.4. Nothing in this Section 6 shall limit the Controller's duty to mitigate its damages, nor shall it relieve either Party of its statutory obligations under applicable data protection laws, including the GDPR.

7. Governing Law

This Data Processing Agreement, and any non-contractual obligations arising out of or in connection with it, shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of [Jurisdiction, e.g., Ireland or Germany], without regard to its conflict of law principles. The parties irrevocably agree that the courts of [Jurisdiction, e.g., Ireland or Germany] shall have exclusive jurisdiction to settle any dispute or claim that arises out of or in connection with this Agreement or its subject matter or formation (including non-contractual disputes or claims). This choice of law and jurisdiction is made to ensure full compliance with the requirements of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (General Data Protection Regulation or "GDPR") and other applicable data protection laws within the European Union. The parties acknowledge that this choice of law provides a robust and predictable legal framework for the processing of personal data under this Agreement, ensuring clarity and enforceability of data protection obligations.

8. Dispute Resolution

In the event of any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement, including its existence, validity, interpretation, or termination, the Parties shall first attempt to resolve such dispute amicably through good faith negotiations. Either [Party A] or [Party B] may initiate such negotiations by providing written notice to the other Party, clearly outlining the nature of the dispute and the proposed resolution.

If the Parties are unable to resolve the dispute through negotiation within thirty (30) days of the initial notice, the dispute shall be escalated to senior management representatives of both Parties who shall meet within an additional fifteen (15) days to seek a resolution. Should the dispute remain unresolved after such senior management discussions, the Parties agree to consider non-binding mediation conducted by a mutually agreed-upon mediator, with the costs shared equally between the Parties.

Any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or in connection with this Agreement, including any question regarding its existence, validity, or termination, which cannot be resolved amicably or through mediation, shall be finally settled by litigation. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of [Governing Law], without regard to its conflict of laws principles. The Parties irrevocably submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts located in [Jurisdiction] for the purpose of any suit, action, or other proceeding arising out of this Agreement or the subject matter hereof, and waive any objection to the laying of venue in such courts.

9. Signatures

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties hereto have executed this Data Processing Agreement as of the Effective Date, acknowledging their full understanding and acceptance of its terms and conditions. This Agreement may be executed in counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument. Electronic signatures, including those transmitted by facsimile or email, shall be deemed original for all purposes and shall have the same legal effect as original signatures.

FOR THE DATA CONTROLLER:

____________________________________

By: ________________________________

Name: [Printed Name of Authorized Representative]

Title: [Title of Authorized Representative]

Date: ________________________________

FOR THE DATA PROCESSOR:

____________________________________

By: ________________________________

Name: [Printed Name of Authorized Representative]

Title: [Title of Authorized Representative]

Date: ________________________________

api2.updated_html:
DATA PROCESSING AGREEMENT

This Data Processing Agreement ("DPA") is entered into as of [Effective Date of DPA], by and between:

[Controller Full Legal Name], a company duly organized and existing under the laws of [Controller Jurisdiction], with its principal place of business located at [Controller Full Address], and registered under company number [Controller Company Registration Number] (hereinafter referred to as the "Controller").

[Processor Full Legal Name], a company duly organized and existing under the laws of [Processor Jurisdiction], with its principal place of business located at [Processor Full Address], and registered under company number [Processor Company Registration Number] (hereinafter referred to as the "Processor").

WHEREAS, the Controller and the Processor have entered into a [Name of Main Agreement, e.g., Service Agreement, Software License Agreement] dated [Date of Main Agreement] (the "Main Agreement"), pursuant to which the Processor provides certain services to the Controller; and

WHEREAS, in the course of providing the services under the Main Agreement, the Processor may process Personal Data on behalf of the Controller; and

WHEREAS, the parties intend to comply with their obligations under applicable data protection laws, including the General Data Protection Regulation (Regulation (EU) 2016/679) ("GDPR"), with respect to the processing of Personal Data;

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and agreements contained herein, the parties agree as follows:

1. Definitions

For the purposes of this Data Processing Agreement ("DPA"), the following terms shall have the meanings ascribed to them herein. Terms not otherwise defined shall have the meaning given to them in the General Data Protection Regulation (Regulation (EU) 2016/679) ("GDPR"). "Personal Data" means any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person ("Data Subject"); an identifiable natural person is one who can be identified, directly or indirectly, in particular by reference to an identifier such as a name, an identification number, location data, an online identifier or to one or more factors specific to the physical, physiological, genetic, mental, economic, cultural or social identity of that natural person.

"Processing" means any operation or set of operations which is performed on Personal Data or on sets of Personal Data, whether or not by automated means, such as collection, recording, organisation, structuring, storage, adaptation or alteration, retrieval, consultation, use, disclosure by transmission, dissemination or otherwise making available, alignment or combination, restriction, erasure or destruction. "Controller" means the natural or legal person, public authority, agency or other body which, alone or jointly with others, determines the purposes and means of the processing of Personal Data; "Processor" means a natural or legal person, public authority, agency or other body which processes Personal Data on behalf of the Controller.

2. Details of Data Processing

The parties acknowledge and agree that the Processor will process Personal Data on behalf of the Controller in connection with the provision of services as outlined in the Main Agreement. The subject matter of the processing is the Personal Data provided by the Controller to the Processor for the purpose of [Specific Purpose of Processing, e.g., CRM management, cloud hosting, email marketing, analytics]. The duration of the processing shall be for the term of the Main Agreement, unless otherwise agreed in writing or required by law, ensuring that data is only retained as long as necessary for the specified purposes.

The types of Personal Data processed include, but are not limited to, [Specific Categories of Personal Data, e.g., names, email addresses, phone numbers, IP addresses, financial data, health data, employee data]. The categories of Data Subjects whose Personal Data is processed include, but are not limited to, [Specific Categories of Data Subjects, e.g., Controller's customers, employees, website visitors, service users]. The nature of the processing involves [Specific Nature of Processing, e.g., collection, storage, analysis, transmission, deletion, backup] of such Personal Data as required to fulfill the Processor's obligations under the Main Agreement.

3. Obligations of the Processor

The Processor shall process Personal Data only on documented instructions from the Controller, including with regard to transfers of Personal Data to a third country or an international organisation, unless required to do so by Union or Member State law to which the Processor is subject; in such a case, the Processor shall inform the Controller of that legal requirement before processing, unless that law prohibits such information on important grounds of public interest. The Processor shall immediately inform the Controller if, in its opinion, an instruction infringes the GDPR or other Union or Member State data protection provisions.

The Processor shall ensure that persons authorised to process the Personal Data have committed themselves to confidentiality or are under an appropriate statutory obligation of confidentiality. The Processor shall implement appropriate technical and organisational measures to ensure a level of security appropriate to the risk, including inter alia as appropriate: the pseudonymisation and encryption of Personal Data; the ability to ensure the ongoing confidentiality, integrity, availability and resilience of processing systems and services; the ability to restore the availability and access to Personal Data in a timely manner in the event of a physical or technical incident; a process for regularly testing, assessing and evaluating the effectiveness of technical and organisational measures for ensuring the security of the processing.

4. Obligations of the Controller

The Controller warrants that it has all necessary rights, consents, and permissions required to transfer the Personal Data to the Processor for processing in accordance with this DPA and the Main Agreement. The Controller shall be responsible for ensuring the lawfulness of the processing instructions provided to the Processor and for ensuring that the Personal Data has been collected and processed in accordance with applicable data protection laws, including obtaining any necessary consents from Data Subjects.

The Controller shall provide the Processor with all necessary information and assistance to enable the Processor to comply with its obligations under this DPA and applicable data protection laws. This includes, but is not limited to, providing clear and unambiguous instructions regarding the processing of Personal Data and promptly responding to any requests for information from the Processor that are reasonably necessary for the Processor to perform its duties hereunder.

5. Subprocessors

The Processor shall not engage another processor ("Subprocessor") without prior specific or general written authorisation of the Controller. In the case of general written authorisation, the Processor shall inform the Controller of any intended changes concerning the addition or replacement of other processors, thereby giving the Controller the opportunity to object to such changes. Where the Processor engages a Subprocessor for carrying out specific processing activities on behalf of the Controller, the same data protection obligations as set out in this DPA shall be imposed on that Subprocessor by way of a contract or other legal act under Union or Member State law, in particular providing sufficient guarantees to implement appropriate technical and organisational measures in such a manner that the processing will meet the requirements of the GDPR.

The Processor shall remain fully liable to the Controller for the performance of the Subprocessor's obligations. The Processor shall ensure that any Subprocessor it engages complies with the terms of this DPA and the GDPR, including implementing appropriate security measures and providing assistance with Data Subject rights requests. The Processor shall maintain an up-to-date list of its Subprocessors and provide it to the Controller upon request, ensuring transparency regarding all entities involved in the processing chain.

6. Security Measures

The Processor shall implement and maintain appropriate technical and organisational measures to ensure a level of security appropriate to the risk, taking into account the state of the art, the costs of implementation and the nature, scope, context and purposes of processing as well as the risk of varying likelihood and severity for the rights and freedoms of natural persons. These measures shall include, at a minimum, those specified in [Reference to an Appendix or specific security policy, e.g., Annex A to this DPA], which may be updated from time to time by mutual agreement of the parties.

These measures are designed to protect Personal Data against accidental or unlawful destruction, loss, alteration, unauthorised disclosure of, or access to, Personal Data transmitted, stored or otherwise processed. The Processor shall regularly test, assess and evaluate the effectiveness of the technical and organisational measures for ensuring the security of the processing, and shall adjust these measures as necessary to maintain an appropriate level of security in light of evolving threats and technological advancements.

7. Data Subject Rights

Taking into account the nature of the processing, the Processor shall assist the Controller by appropriate technical and organisational measures, insofar as this is possible, for the fulfilment of the Controller's obligation to respond to requests for exercising the Data Subject's rights laid down in Chapter III of the GDPR (e.g., right of access, rectification, erasure, restriction of processing, data portability, objection). The Processor shall promptly notify the Controller if it receives a request from a Data Subject concerning their Personal Data, and shall not respond to such request unless expressly authorised by the Controller.

The Processor shall provide the Controller with all necessary information and cooperation to enable the Controller to respond to Data Subject requests within the prescribed timescales. This assistance may include, but is not limited to, providing access to the relevant Personal Data, facilitating corrections or deletions, and providing information about the processing activities. The costs associated with such assistance shall be borne by the Controller, unless the request arises from a breach of this DPA by the Processor.

8. Personal Data Breach Notification

In the event of a Personal Data Breach, the Processor shall notify the Controller without undue delay and, where feasible, not later than 48 hours after becoming aware of it. The notification shall at least: (a) describe the nature of the Personal Data Breach including where possible, the categories and approximate number of Data Subjects concerned and the categories and approximate number of Personal Data records concerned; (b) communicate the name and contact details of the data protection officer or other contact point where more information can be obtained; (c) describe the likely consequences of the Personal Data Breach; (d) describe the measures taken or proposed to be taken by the Processor to address the Personal Data Breach, including, where appropriate, measures to mitigate its possible adverse effects.

The Processor shall cooperate fully with the Controller in investigating, mitigating, and remedying any Personal Data Breach. This includes providing the Controller with all reasonable assistance, information, and documentation necessary to enable the Controller to comply with its notification obligations to the competent supervisory authority and to the affected Data Subjects under Articles 33 and 34 of the GDPR. The Processor shall also take all reasonable steps to prevent future Personal Data Breaches and shall document any Personal Data Breaches, including the facts relating to the Personal Data Breach, its effects and the remedial action taken.

9. Data Transfers

The Processor shall not transfer Personal Data to a country outside of the European Economic Area ("EEA") or to an international organisation without the prior written consent of the Controller. Any such transfer, if consented to by the Controller, shall only occur if adequate safeguards are in place as required by Chapter V of the GDPR, such as standard contractual clauses approved by the European Commission, binding corporate rules, or an adequacy decision.

The Processor shall ensure that any Subprocessor involved in the transfer of Personal Data outside the EEA also adheres to the same strict transfer mechanisms and safeguards. The Processor shall provide evidence of such safeguards to the Controller upon request, ensuring that all international data transfers comply fully with GDPR requirements and that Data Subjects' rights are adequately protected throughout the data lifecycle, regardless of geographic location.

10. Audit Rights

The Processor shall make available to the Controller all information necessary to demonstrate compliance with the obligations laid down in this DPA and Article 28 of the GDPR, and allow for and contribute to audits, including inspections, conducted by the Controller or another auditor mandated by the Controller. Such audits shall be conducted at the Controller's expense, during normal business hours, with reasonable prior written notice (not less than [e.g., thirty (30)] days), and shall not unreasonably interfere with the Processor's business operations.

The scope of any audit shall be limited to assessing the Processor's compliance with this DPA and the GDPR in relation to the processing of Personal Data on behalf of the Controller. The Processor shall cooperate fully with any audit, providing access to relevant personnel, data, and documentation as reasonably required. The parties shall agree on the scope and methodology of any audit in advance, and any findings shall be treated as confidential information.

11. Return and Deletion of Data

Upon termination of the Main Agreement or cessation of the processing services, or upon the Controller's written request, the Processor shall, at the Controller's option, either delete all Personal Data processed on behalf of the Controller and delete existing copies, or return all Personal Data to the Controller and delete existing copies, unless Union or Member State law requires storage of the Personal Data. The Processor shall ensure that all copies of the Personal Data are irrevocably deleted from its systems, including backups, within a reasonable timeframe, typically no later than [e.g., ninety (90)] days following the Controller's instruction or termination of services.

The Processor shall provide the Controller with written certification that all Personal Data has been deleted or returned as instructed. This certification shall confirm that the Processor has taken all reasonable steps to erase or return the data and that no further copies are retained, except where legally mandated. The Processor acknowledges that failure to comply with this clause may result in significant legal and financial consequences, and therefore commits to a thorough and verifiable process for data handling at the end of the processing term.

12. Term and Termination

This DPA shall come into effect on the Effective Date of DPA and shall remain in force for the duration of the Main Agreement, including any extensions or renewals thereof, or until the Processor ceases to process Personal Data on behalf of the Controller, whichever is later. The termination or expiration of the Main Agreement shall automatically terminate this DPA, subject to the Processor's obligations regarding the return or deletion of Personal Data as set forth in Clause 11.

Clauses that by their nature should survive the termination of this DPA, including but not limited to clauses relating to confidentiality, indemnification, and the return or deletion of data, shall remain in full force and effect. Termination of this DPA shall not relieve either party of any liabilities or obligations incurred prior to the effective date of termination.

13. Limitation of Liability

The liability of each party under this DPA shall be subject to the limitations of liability set forth in the Main Agreement. In the event of any conflict between the limitation of liability provisions in this DPA and the Main Agreement, the provisions of the Main Agreement shall prevail, except where such provisions would limit a party's liability for a breach of its obligations under the GDPR to an extent not permitted by applicable law.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, neither party shall be liable for indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages arising out of or relating to this DPA, even if advised of the possibility of such damages. The parties acknowledge that the allocation of risk and liability in this DPA and the Main Agreement reflects the commercial agreement between them and is a material consideration for entering into this DPA.

14. Indemnification

The Processor shall indemnify and hold harmless the Controller from and against any and all claims, demands, liabilities, costs, damages, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees) arising out of or in connection with any breach by the Processor of its obligations under this DPA or the GDPR, to the extent such breach causes a Personal Data Breach or other violation of data protection law. This indemnification obligation shall not apply to the extent that the claim arises from the Controller's unlawful instructions or breach of its obligations under this DPA.

The Controller shall indemnify and hold harmless the Processor from and against any and all claims, demands, liabilities, costs, damages, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees) arising out of or in connection with any unlawful instructions provided by the Controller to the Processor or any breach by the Controller of its obligations under this DPA or the GDPR. Both parties agree to cooperate in good faith in the defense of any such claims and to mitigate any damages.

15. Governing Law and Jurisdiction

This DPA shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of [Governing Law Jurisdiction, e.g., Ireland or Germany, or a specific EU Member State law, ensuring it aligns with GDPR]. This choice of law is made without regard to its conflict of laws principles.

The parties irrevocably agree that the courts of [Jurisdiction for Dispute Resolution, e.g., Dublin, Ireland or Berlin, Germany] shall have exclusive jurisdiction to settle any dispute or claim arising out of or in connection with this DPA or its subject matter or formation (including non-contractual disputes or claims). The parties waive any objection to the laying of venue in such courts and agree not to plead or claim that any such action or proceeding brought in any such court has been brought in an inconvenient forum.

16. Miscellaneous

This DPA constitutes the entire agreement between the parties with respect to the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior and contemporaneous agreements, proposals, or representations, written or oral, concerning its subject matter. No modification, amendment, or waiver of any provision of this DPA shall be effective unless in writing and signed by both parties.

If any provision of this DPA is held by a court of competent jurisdiction to be invalid or unenforceable, the remaining provisions shall remain in full force and effect. No failure or delay by either party in exercising any right under this DPA shall constitute a waiver of that right. This DPA may be executed in counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument.

FOR THE CONTROLLER:

 

___________________________________

Name: [Controller Signatory Name]

Title: [Controller Signatory Title]

Date: [Date of Signature]

FOR THE PROCESSOR:

 

___________________________________

Name: [Processor Signatory Name]

Title: [Processor Signatory Title]

Date: [Date of Signature]
